text: A comfortable, no-frills coffee shop right in the Everton Park HDB. It&#39;s a bit hard to find among the buildings, but it&#39;s worth looking for.<br><br>Nylon Coffee Roasters is better defined by saying what they don&#39;t have: No chairs, no sofa, no frapuccinos, no syrup, no whipped cream, no fancy oversized mugs, no merchandise, no bossa n&#39; whatever music, no paper cups with your name misspelled on them. They are very clear on what they offer: excellent quality coffee. The menu is quite simple: three different brews, either hot or iced. They will let you choose which coffee you want, and they have amazing Central or South American beans to choose from. At the centre, there is a big table for people to stand around while enjoying a quick cup.<br><br>The staff are very efficient and friendly. One of them took time to ask me how my coffee was (it was fantastic! Perfect taste). I challenge anyone to tell me if they have seen that happen on a franchise coffee shop. And this is the main virtue of this place. They are obsessed with quality. They use scales, thermometers and timers in order to brew the perfect cup of coffee every time. Even the stuff they sell is useful stuff: filters, cups, brewing tools instead of merchandise. They are on a mission to raise the bar on Singapore&#39;s coffee culture and, judging by the crowd of customers, they are succeeding.<br><br>There are two basic philosophies when it comes to coffee bars. There are those that focus on their atmosphere, furniture, and general feel, sacrificing the coffee. On the other hand, there are those that focus on the quality of the coffee they serve. Nylon Coffee Roasters are clearly of the second kind, and that is always welcome.

text: A hard to find coffee place tucked away in the heart of a HDB complex. This place takes its coffee seriously. The staff is great and will give you recommendations as to what blend and preparation to select. I got the beans from Guatamala with a dash of milk. Wonderful aroma from the coffee and the place in general. Cash or nets only...and not a lot of seating but the coffee is top notch!

text: Great little coffee shop that&#39;s in the middle of a twisted maze of a building complex! Not a lot of seating, but very kind baristas and some really great coffee. The standing table in the middle is definitely a great spot if you&#39;re on the taller side. Having air con is also a big plus!

text: This place came highly recommended by a friend. She wasn&#39;t kidding when she said it was hard to find - it&#39;s kind of hidden in an apartment complex .<br><br>It has an American hipster coffee shop feel. There are maybe only 3-4 chairs inside, but there&#39;s  some outdoor seating and also a tall long table with standing room inside. Inside is definitely preferred for the air conditioning. <br><br>The menu is simple and focused on coffee. The flat white was solid.  Pricing wasn&#39;t bad for coffee, but beans are a bit more expensive. <br><br>Service was friendly. <br>Cash only. <br><br>If you&#39;re nearby, it&#39;s worth stopping in for coffee.

My great auntie has lived at Everton Park for decades, and once upon a time I even lived here too, and I remember the days before when there was nothing remotely hipster about this housing block.  It is really cool to see cute new cafes and coffee shops moving in, and I&#39;ve been to Nylon every time I&#39;m back in town.  <br><br>That said, there is no doubt that the coffee at Nylon is great (and I hail from a place where awesome coffee is the norm), there is still something about Nylon that strikes me as utterly pretentious.  It caught me by surprise to be told (albeit, politely) that their coffee is sweet enough on its own that no sugar is needed or provided, and I should try it and see for myself.  It was odd being schooled on how coffee should be taken, and if even the most hipsterish Mission coffee shop in San Francisco tried this, the ridiculousness of it would be blogged about endlessly.  <br><br>So yeah, mixed feelings about this place.  Good coffee.  Just don&#39;t bother asking for sugar.

Hello, stranger', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Hello, stranger'}]
text: This coffee shop&#39;s so hipster it hurts. But I loved it. <br><br>I&#39;ve been to Nylon quite a number of times and the coffee (I dare say) is one if not the best in Singapore. The bunch of us know the owner of the shop (he&#39;s also an alumni of the papa palheta coffee movement here in Singapore) and he&#39;ll always there to share with us any specialty beans they have and would recommend some. Or else, it&#39;s just a casual chat. Coming to Nylon is like going to a friend&#39;s place where, if you&#39;re a regular, you sort of know the crowd here. <br><br>This coffee roasters serves only coffee but if you fancy a bite, you can always walk over next door (merely 5 steps) for some cakes or shepherd pie. They&#39;re pretty good too. <br><br>If there&#39;s one thing I would nick-pick about this place is the lack of chairs. There are less than 5 chairs in the shop and plenty of standing space. There&#39;s a long communal table where everyone would just stand around it while enjoying their cuppa joe. I guess they want everyone to &#34;feel young&#34; and hip  like how we would enjoy our beer in a bar - standing and chatting. <br><br>Located on the ground floor of a HDB flat at Everton Park, you have to navigate yourself around but it&#39;s easy to find. <br><br>We paid $12 for a 5oz latte and two iced coffee. <br><br>I would come back again and again and again and again...

Iced coffee white', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Iced coffee white'}]
text: My first reaction when checked in here, &#34;OMG SO MANY REVIEWS!&#34;<br><br>Deserve it, truly deserves this much reviews. I will describe coffee here as honest, sincere, decent, strong, smart.<br>I love honest people who runs a cafe/eatery with all their heart and bringing things they love to share with others. The owners definitely knows their stuff, coffee. It&#39;s my first visit and I was overwhelmed by how great coffee in Singapore could taste with just beans and milk.<br><br>During my first visit, I was told that their standing space is temporarily shut due to shortage of manpower. It&#39;s running on a small space now, but everything is still running in an orderly manner where the staff remembers customers faces and &#34;labeled their customers according to their face&#34;. Despite the space constrain and crowd, orders were not mixed up, and still served in an orderly manner. Anyway just buy and go la huh, there&#39;s no space for you to sit and chill to enjoy your coffee. I think it&#39;s more like a take away stall for now.<br><br>The menu is very simple. Hot or iced, black or white coffee. The price tag is the best, a real good decent iced coffee cost $5! This is so much better than what you can get elsewhere. I see notices that the owners source coffee beans direct from Columbia. See what I mean by sharing their passion and love to others?

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/MmQ_eEeUKTqNt6k8gDkwYQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/nylon-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=177x6SAhd65amnBzekHuiA&select=MmQ_eEeUKTqNt6k8gDkwYQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Nylon Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: So much has already been said about Nylon and there&#39;s no doubt that they have been and are key to Singapore&#39;s rise as one of the great coffee cities in the world. With that in mind I have been inclined to give them five stars but I still end up at four. <br><br>The main reason is that while the coffee is roasted with great skill and the filter coffees are made very well I still see some room for improvement. The main things that have annoyed me a bit is that often the coffees are out so perhaps only one of three coffees on the menu can be ordered and there has happened more than once that there are no beans at all for purchase. The execution of the filters is often good but I do also believe that they could fine tube it a bit ti make it world class as I often have their coffee made better at other places and at home. <br><br>The place is however great for coffee and the location in Everton Park does feel more real and like a local experience, at least to a visitor like me. The space is considerably larger now then when they opened so there are actually seats outside for around 6 people and the high table inside can easily hold around 10 people. The atmosphere is always nice and friendly and it seems like a lot of people living in the area go here as well. Do however not come in search of food as there is nothing really. Still this is one of the best places for a cup of coffee in Singapore and it should be visited by anyone remotely interested in good coffee.
One of the best coffee we&#39;ve had and wonderful pricing.  Only downside is seating else it be a 5 star for sure.

text: Don&#39;t ever come here!!  I mean it!  Stay away!<br><br>I would like to keep this place to myself.  Yes, I will end up killing the thing that I love most, but I don&#39;t care. I&#39;ve  reviewed this place on Tripadvisor, and I&#39;m beginning to think I should stop saying good things about this place on the Internet, but I can&#39;t help myself. <br><br>This is a no-nonsense coffee joint run by people who really care about coffee and know their product. Absolutely unpretentious and sincerely dedicated to putting the best cup of coffee they know how in front of you. Dennis and Jiamin maintain control over the entire process from sourcing to roasting to brewing, all just to be able to say with absolute honesty and sincerity that they&#39;ve given you the very best cup of coffee likely in all of Singapore. <br><br>If you love coffee or think you love coffee Dennis &amp;  Jiamin will take good care of you at Nylon coffee roasters.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/VJ_a_lP0fDgxfdCdSSrDrw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/nylon-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=FcVAaw12fxArZWQXgt7SfQ&select=VJ_a_lP0fDgxfdCdSSrDrw', 'altText': 'Photo of Nylon Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: I love filter coffee. And would grab any opportunities that I come across to try any cafe serving filtered coffee.<br><br>Nylon Coffee Roaster is a cozy little corner for customers to chill out for a break. There is little seating here, literally less than 10 chairs. However, standing tables are provided. <br><br>If you are looking for a quick coffee break after lunch with 3-4 friends. This is a nice recommendation. Not recommended for big group gathering.

The Everton Park HDB estate houses a number of nice small joints and Nylon Coffee Roasters is located on the quieter side off Cantonment Road.<br><br>The small place was packed once we found it, with a line building outside, and I was surprised to see that there really is no seating, but standing only at a &#34;community&#34; high table, with no space left, and the very small counter where you order and pay, with the coffee grinders and machine at the back. And if you&#39;re thinking of downing a muffin with your coffee: wrong place. This is coffee only.<br><br>It was a very hot day and we ordered iced coffee, white, and a ristretto with milk. The lady serving us had a very &#34;organised&#34; tone about her, and I was not sure if I liked the military style in which she asked what we wanted but I guess she wanted to keep the line moving and I forgot about it when she spoke to my hubby about how he wanted his coffee exactly as he is very particular. <br><br>They settled on a kind of &#34;ristretto&#34; plus a shot (yes, my husband cannot deal with weak coffee), with milk - so basically so strong that it nearly kills you, and then back it up a little. She did just that. And he was amazed at how smooth the coffee still tasted, as strong coffee is often just bitter and nasty.<br><br>My iced white coffee tasted great, also, very smooth and whatever beans they used: I liked the full bodied flavour that did not let the milk overpower them.<br><br>Speaking about the beans: I really would&#39;ve purchased coffee to take home but &#34;they do not recommend grinding at the shop&#34;. You&#39;re supposed to do that at home. Not feasible for us as I did not pack all of my kitchen equipment from Germany, and don&#39;t see the need to purchase another grinder here. So no coffee for me :-/<br><br>I thought long and hard on how to rate them, and settled on three stars for the excellent product but the - in my point of view - lacking practicality in the dealing with customer requirements. I might be back for their coffee though ;-)

text: This is my favorite coffee shop in Singapore. I try to visit whenever I am in town and bring their beans home with me

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/a4KbqCqpt-obzUvF2airmg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/nylon-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=QzVZV9RiBzvU_WD4eUvyZw&select=a4KbqCqpt-obzUvF2airmg', 'altText': 'Photo of Nylon Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: The treasure hunt is part of the joy of finding this spot buried under an apartment block. Keep your eyes peeled because it would be easy to miss this tiny nook of a store. There&#39;s barely room for a coffee machine and a few people, so it&#39;s hardly the place to hang around for a long time but if you do the staff won&#39;t make you feel bad about it. Grab a chair (if you&#39;re lucky!) and a magazine and drink as many coffees as you can before your heart gives up. Or prop yourself outside and watch the coming and goings of the neighbours.<br><br>These guys totally know what they&#39;re doing and the coffee is some of the best I&#39;ve had in Singapore.

text: A true, third wave micro roaster, Nylon Coffee Roasters, located in Everton Park is a hidden gem on the ground floor of a large residential/business complex located just a short walk from the Outram Park MRT station.<br><br>The small shop, designed in the reclaimed/exposed metal style that is typical of this style of business offers straight up coffee with no &#34;flavored&#34; offerings, such as mocha&#39;s.  A small area is dedicated to coffee preparation items, such as drip containers, filters and cups.  Bulk bean purchases can also be made and a fair assortment, at reasonable prices is available.
Solid coffee in the Outram Park neighborhood. Location is hidden in a HDB block so you definitely need to search for it. Minus one star for limited seating options

Daily brew $4', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Daily brew $4'}]
text: Great spot to hang out with a cup of coffee in hand. I get a kick out of watching the coffee orders being made. Nylon takes their coffee really seriously from weighing the grinds precisely to ensure that perfect grind to water ratio for a hand-poured cup.<br><br>The vibe at Nylon is great - a gathering place for the neighborhood and familiar faces. It seems like everyone knows each other or bumps into each other by happen chance here regularly.<br><br>Nylon is on the ground floor of an HDB complex called the Everton. This whole area is really unique with a ton of great boutique shops, cafes, dessert places, even a Korean rice cake joint! So random but so fun to visit and explore the area and feel the really unique Singaporean vibe here... do drop by.

text: Coffee is good, but you have to take it exactly as given. Asking for sugar is like requesting illegal substances to be added! They argue the coffee is designed perfectly and needs nothing else. Even a request to take away is met with a frown, as the cup affects the flavor.

text: There is a real charm at Nylon..I was telling my friend that everytime I&#39;m halfway through a cup there, I&#39;m wishing for the next one.<br><br>It&#39;s tiny. There&#39;s often only 3 seats inside..and 1 bar stool if you&#39;re lucky. But it&#39;s up close, it&#39;s personal, I feel like I&#39;m catching up with pals..whether I bring a pal of my own or not but it&#39;s the kind of place you want to bring your mates too.<br><br>I was very touched recently when Jiamin brought out a little container of Chinese new year sugee cookies she had been gifted with to share with us. Mmm<br><br>I think sometimes at the popular indie places, as they get more and more different staff manning the machines so they can let the experienced ones have more flexible hours off or man a new shop..you sometimes get the odd cup that is lukewarm (and it&#39;s always at a busy crowded time when there&#39;s pressure to get through the orders) and you almost feel bad to comment that it&#39;s not warm enough and it&#39;s on the side of bland (you can also see the crema is limited and the latte art indistinct).<br><br>Coz you know they&#39;ll be saying..oh it can&#39;t be too high a temperature otherwise it&#39;ll be burnt. We served it to you this temperature on purpose..I mean we can make it for you again but it IS meant to be this cold.<br><br>Excuses aside (and that&#39;s what they are because they imply that you don&#39;t know what substandard coffee you&#39;ve been drinking before..and a few times I encountered this, I actually had been drinking weekly at the same joint or their sister joint!!), I find that nylon is consistent.<br><br>Consistent not as in boring but as in quality control, folks! In this case, it&#39;s consistently exciting coz each sip there is flavourful..beautifully balanced, tasty..warm..and warmly served.<br><br>Please, if you see me there and you have 1 of the few seats, offer it to me as I am very flatfooted and my feet sometimes ache. Haha, having said that I don&#39;t mind at all standing there and have even offered my seat up before. It&#39;s what the friendly regulars do here ;)<br><br>It may not be for everyone. I think my friend did describe it accurately where she said if she wanted a quiet one-on-one catchup she wouldn&#39;t pick here coz it&#39;s so close everyone can hear your conversation but if you&#39;re open and wouldn&#39;t mind a chat with whoever (and some pretty chill and nice regulars turn up, sometimes behind the counter), it&#39;s a cool place and the coffee made for a fantastic afternoon.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=UIJOUAY8hYY8QYzup6QtQg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/v7C14MmAE3fAiin3OYgwug/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/v7C14MmAE3fAiin3OYgwug/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/v7C14MmAE3fAiin3OYgwug/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/v7C14MmAE3fAiin3OYgwug/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/v7C14MmAE3fAiin3OYgwug/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/v7C14MmAE3fAiin3OYgwug/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'May L.', 'displayLocation': 'Tiong Bahru, Singapore', 'altText': 'May L.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=UIJOUAY8hYY8QYzup6QtQg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 49, 'photoCount': 183, 'reviewCount': 118, 'eliteYear': None}
text: You know these people are serious about their coffee and their coffee alone hwen you see that (a) options are limited w/ simple names (it&#39;s either coffee with or without milk, hot or cold, filter or expresso) (b) no latte art (c) no food items (d) no sugar offered.  I can see they really want you to focus on your cuppa.  It&#39;s also such a hipster thing that third wave coffee is to be found in the void deck of one of the oldest HDB neighborhood in singapore, oh how so badass.<br><br>The first time I visited was a weekend and the place was jam packed with people standing with cup in hand.  Yes, standing, there are no seats.  But you can take your coffee with you and sit on the benches in the community space. So to respect their dedication, I always go for black coffee, hoping that one day I can master the skill of identifying all those fruity notes. Somehow without the distraction of food I do find myself focused on tasting the cup in hand.  The staff are eager to help and knowledgeable.  I also detect a strong sense of pride and ownership since they invariably ask me how I find the coffee, every time without fail. <br><br>They have closed off their usual standing space last I visited since some of their staff were off sourcing beans.  I remember this happened a couple of times so you should check online before visiting to avoid disappointment.  The other thing I found out last time is a new HK Cafe opening next door and they are ok with you bringing your cup of coffee from Nylon into their space as long as you order something.  So another option if you want to sit.

This place had amazing coffee. Likely the best I have had in Singapore.<br><br>Don&#39;t expect to sit down and relax here it it is a quick order, drink, go type place, with a few wooden benches outside. Just skull it like an Italian! <br><br>There was one thing I really didn&#39;t like about Nylon Coffee Roasters. Upon my partner ordering her coffee she asked for half a teaspoon of sugar. The barista politely asked her to try it without sugar. No matter how good coffee is I don&#39;t think someone should be told/politely asked to try their coffee a different way. Particularly if they have been drinking it for the last 10 years. <br><br>As I said other then that superb coffee and I do see the team here love what they do!!!

text: Nylon is one my favourite boutique specialty coffee roaster in Singapore. Located among HDB flats, Nylon attracts coffee drinkers from surrounding small businesses during weekdays. You&#39;ll also find weekend cafe hunters to find the next best tasting flat white. If you are also serious with brewing your own coffee, do order a bag of specially selected hand drip beans in advance for pickup on the day. Seriously, they run out fast.

text: Decided that we need to go local so I went on a Sunday morning quest for coffee beans while Aga studied. We&#39;ve been bringing them back from trips to Australia. Would never ever have stumbled across this place without the recommendation. They roast their own beans and serve nothing but coffee. <br>Super happy with the Four Chairs espresso blend and 2 iced coffees I&#39;ve had there. On both visits the staff were friendly and knowledgeable. Last night I snuck in just before closing and the whole team were cupping different roasts that someone had brought back from Scandinavia.

text: Just brilliant--expertly-prepared single-origin coffees and warm hospitality in a highly unexpected, refreshingly ungentrified location.

The white&#39;s a clear favourite', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': "The white's a clear favourite"}]
text: Coffee as it should be. Straight-up, sans the fluff. With only 3 variations (milk, black, filter), you can be pretty assured these guys know what they&#39;re doing. I don&#39;t typically enjoy my coffee with milk but Nylon does an impressive white with perfect consistency. Having said that, I&#39;ve enjoyed all 3 on the list and it doesn&#39;t hurt to alternate your options with each visit.

text: Excellent coffee! A bit difficult to find this place but it is totally worth it. And it&#39;s not expensive - we paid 7.50SGD for a cup of cortado and a double shot of espresso. The service is also exceptional - very friendly staff.

Cappuccino @ Nylon Coffee Roasters', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Cappuccino @ Nylon Coffee Roasters'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/zHVk47my5Rq4uG0pAncIlw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/nylon-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=_MXVUXWOugyxpMLkxQ_ySA&select=zHVk47my5Rq4uG0pAncIlw', 'altText': 'Photo of Nylon Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore. Single Espresso @ Nylon - a well crafted shot', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Single Espresso @ Nylon - a well crafted shot'}]
text: Some beautifully complex and well crafted shots and being served in a quiet residential corner of Outram Park.<br><br>Good things happen when a cafe is set up for the right reasons - for example, when the owners are passionate about coffee. This is certainly the case at Nylon. Single origin beans (as well as blended varieties) sourced from South America are roasted in Nylon each week. Nylon&#39;s signature blend - El Primero - gives a medium bodied espresso with distinct citrus notes. The citrus notes never overwhelm the espresso - this is clearly the product of experimentation, and time spent perfecting the blend. It&#39;s a nicely balanced shot, not too astringent, which also lends itself to smooth and subtly flavoured cappuccinos and lattes. <br><br>There is an interesting approach to the menu also. Rather than having conventional lattes and cappuccinos, there are 3oz, 5oz and 7oz sizes available. This is a clever idea - while some franchise chains serve what are essentially bowls of caffeinated warm milk, the owners of Nylon have ensured that a broad variety of preferences are catered for, while never losing the underlying coffee taste - coffee is always the most fundamental component of each drink. Furthermore, as milk is steamed, lactose becomes more soluble. Coffee which has been prepared correctly should not need sugar - this is one of the many things that are not merely done correctly at Nylon, but are done very well. <br><br>There is a retail section also, with a good selection of beans on sale, as well as a smaller variety of accessories, such as coffee filters. The seating area itself is small, but there are a number of benches directly outside as an alternative. <br><br>Overall, this is certainly a place that anyone who loves coffee should visit.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/JDuYFFJ898JtiS8T2KKU-A/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/nylon-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=59zHAi2F_I2u5NVqHUcr0w&select=JDuYFFJ898JtiS8T2KKU-A', 'altText': 'Photo of Nylon Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore. The outdoor seats', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'The outdoor seats'}]
text: A tiny spot by any means, but they do tell you they&#39;re not set up as a café, instead as a coffee roaster, with a little space to let you taste their wares. Nylon is only two months old, and serve only coffee, but owners Dennis and Jiamin have quite the following, perhaps from their time as partners and baristas at artisan roasters Papa Palheta and Loysel&#39;s Toy.<br><br>The menu is straightforward - start with espressos, black or white, made with their signature El Primero blend. Whites are denoted by volume and not type, so cappuccinos, café lattes and flat whites cost the same, if you&#39;re after the same one size. Get a 3oz, 5oz or 7oz, and taste how the espresso works with various amounts of milk; I like the 3oz best - its most like a piccolo latte, but get a 5oz if you&#39;re after a regular sized café latte.<br><br>If you&#39;re a bit of a coffee nut, I think you&#39;ll really like the brew offerings.  I&#39;ve had great pour-overs made with the Kalita filter. Their single origins really sing, and I&#39;ve had some super juicy flavours. Yeah okay, I&#39;m a bit of a nut. If you get a chance, say hi and talk to them about how you&#39;d like your coffee. They&#39;re nuts for the stuff, and its great to talk to people who love what they do. After conversations like that, I usually end up drinking a couple more than I mean to. Thankfully, coffee&#39;s not bad for you. At least that&#39;s what I keep telling myself.

Nylon is a stalwart among the 3rd wave cafes. Their  coffee doesn&#39;t hide behind meaningless names and labels like &#34;latte&#34; or &#34;flat white&#34; - pfft. Coffee here is either served black or with milk. Although they do make a slight concession to hipster fashion by marking their milk coffees with lovely milk hearts. But i digress. <br><br>Espresso based coffee here is very consistent. Their house blend - called &#34;Four Chairs&#34; - is a lovely mix of earthy, vegetal, chocolatey flavours, balanced with a hit of floral, acidic citrus. Pairs fantastically with food - which they don&#39;t have. Another thing they lack is seats - the coffee bar is standing space only, with just a scattering of chairs is the corners. <br><br>They also do drip coffee - for which they use the Kalita Wave filter. The drip lineup is constantly rotating, based on whatever seasonal single-origin beans that they personally source, import, and roast in-house. <br><br>Its not the most comfortable coffee place, but its always cosy. Despite their adherence to the purity of the brew, staff are never snooty and always ready to offer assistance and chat up customers. <br><br>If you can&#39;t tell already, I&#39;m a huge fan. And i hope you&#39;ll be one too.

text: I was quite impressed with the coffee of Nylon Coffee Roasters! It&#39;s a cute and quaint shop with a very intimate set-up. Would&#39;ve been nice if there were more seating accommodations--it was inconvenient to stand around. I guess that&#39;s how hipster places are though. But I can definitely see myself dropping by here again and bringing along a friend or two!

You&#39;ll love the vintage furniture but that&#39;s already half the seats in the shop', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': "You'll love the vintage furniture but that's already half the seats in the shop"}]
text: This charming hole in the wall serves up caffeine in copious amounts, if that&#39;s what you need! <br><br>I had just returned from NYC in May and was on the lookout for places that were both accessible and did drip coffee really well and Nylon was it. They&#39;re a short walk from Outram (NEL Exit G). <br><br>I came for the coffee but stayed for the conversations. Once you let the owners infect you with their love for coffee, I guarantee you&#39;ll be coming back for more. <br><br>For starters, pick up a 5oz single shot and if you can, I encourage you not to add any sugar to it to appreciate how the milk and espresso complement each other. <br><br>If you&#39;re looking to start brewing drip coffee at home, they also carry a couple options: the disposable  &#34;kantan drip&#34; or the &#34;kalita wave&#34;.

Believe it or not, there is a coffee culture in Singapore. That, or I have a strange ability to befriend people and find a job where people are obsessed about their coffee... And it&#39;s creeping up on me too, damnit!<br><br>I&#39;ve heard so many things about this place and I was always curious to try it out. One day, after a nice lunch around Keong Saik Road, my colleagues asked if I wanted some coffee. They probably mentioned where we were going, but I pulled a Barney Stinson and kind of zoned out. Once we approached this HDB flat, I was thinking, &#34;Where the hell are we going??&#34; And then we landed at Nylon. And I was like, OH.<br><br>If I recall correctly, Nylon&#39;s story goes a little something like this: they started out as a roaster and distributed coffee to different shops. Then they decided to open their shop to people and start serving coffee. And every now and then they&#39;ll shut the shop down for an uncertain amount of time to travel to places, find and buy coffee beans, then roast them in Singapore.<br><br>So when you come in, order, and see them do cool things like weigh grinds for each drink, you know that your cuppa&#39;s gonna be a good one. And most recently, they bought the space next door to them, so now they opened it up and added a long table for you to enjoy your that cuppa even more! The prices put Starbucks to shame. Welcome to the new age!

When my favorite cafe shut down last year, I went into a deep, dark spiral until I found Nylon. On doctor&#39;s orders I&#39;m temporarily cut off from coffee and alcohol so I haven&#39;t been by since the renovations and expansion, but god I love their espresso. Ah, and Dennis &amp; Jiamin are great. Except I find watching Dennis foam milk depressing: he makes it look too damn easy to get such good, sweet microfoam. I seriously don&#39;t order flat whites from Nylon because then I just can&#39;t enjoy the flat whites I make at home.<br><br>What I find so impressive is that besides their (excellent) Four Chairs espresso blend, they manage to regularly rotate through single origins and still serve consistently good espressos (at home, I&#39;m terrible at dialing in new coffees and there&#39;s another cafe near me that switches up their coffee quite often and I think they&#39;re terrible with their consistency).<br><br>While I can occasionally appreciate the mouth-puckering, super-acidic, lighter roasts that seems favored by many third-wave roasters, I&#39;m grateful that Nylon (so far) hasn&#39;t gone there with any of the coffees I&#39;ve tried.<br><br>A tip: if you&#39;re buying beans, order in advance online (in store stock is pretty limited).

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/kNIdMrlUHvAQR7RQWjbGbw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/nylon-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=172cwOXFF3Cd0Txis_LV1Q&select=kNIdMrlUHvAQR7RQWjbGbw', 'altText': 'Photo of Nylon Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: I&#39;ve read many good reviews on Nylon Coffee Roasters and I finally got the chance to try it today. All the praises awarded to the coffee by Nylon Coffee Roasters are not exaggerated and definitely not misplaced. <br><br>It is a tiny stall, hidden in a corner of Everton Park estate. It&#39;s around a 10-15minute walk from Outram MRT station but that short walk is definitely worth the coffee you get at Nylon Coffee Roasters. I had a 7 Oz flat white and have to say that it is by far my favourite cup of coffee on this island. <br><br>The main focus of Nylon Coffee Roasters is their coffee, and the owner&#39;s passion for brewing it right, so do not expect fancy cafe styled cakes or a variety of flavours in their coffee. Their coffee are just THAT GOOD on its own. The owners who serve up the coffee on their own are warm and full of enthusiasm when you talk to them about their brew. I&#39;m definitely heading back there some time soon!

text: I am amazed and impressed with coffee shop in Singapore! The two coffee places we have been so far are so good!<br>The menu here is simple and I ordered the 7 oz since I generally prefer latte.<br>I think the coffee is a bit more sour than the other one I had yesterday at another nearby shop.<br>Cute place and with friendly service. I will definitely come back again...

You know they mean business when there&#39;s a $12k La Marzocco in the front and a Probat at the back.<br><br>Simply stated, they roast their beans right. My current crush is the Baroida single origin, warm, chocolatey and fruity aftertaste. Can coffee descriptions rival that of wine? Possibly.<br><br>I was looking for a replacement for my usual San Diego micro-roaster, and I first wandered in here when the storefront was open for under a year and they only occupied a single unit. Things were more quiet then. They have since expanded to occupy the unit next door and there&#39;s a larger table, standing room only. Weekends are crowded.<br><br>To put things in perspective, if you&#39;re used to Starbucks/Coffee Bean type sugary concoctions, there&#39;s none of that here. You&#39;re not going to get sugar to go with your 5oz coffee. <br><br>Coffee like this is a bit of an acquired taste. It&#39;s a little like buying expensive headphones, if you can&#39;t hear the difference between the Sennheisers and the $20 Sonys, perhaps it&#39;s not worth dropping the dollars on the former.<br><br>I can&#39;t tell the difference for wine, but I can for the coffee (and the headphones). I look forward to buy more beans by the bagful. Dennis, Jiamin, keep doing your thing.<br><br>P.S. I saw Dr Leslie Tay (of ieatishootipost fame) in the store one weekend, and I was told it was his first visit there and he doesn&#39;t really drink coffee...

text: I remember when I first stepped foot here, I asked my colleague, &#34;Are you sure this is a café? Where&#39;re the seats?&#34;<br><br>But that&#39;s just the concept of the place. No seats. You just need to stand around one high and long table. The staffs here are evidently experienced baristas. They&#39;re very quick and seemingly experts in their crafts.<br><br>They sell coffee beans and all. Although I&#39;ve never stayed for coffee here before. Always just takeaways. Probably the idea of standing around a crowded table just does not appeal to me.

Located at the bottom of a HDB block, Nylon Coffee is the epitome of no frills. Dennis and Jiamin are champion coffee roasters who venture out into the wild to bring the best beans home to roast for you lucky people. <br><br>Loved the pour overs here, mostly made with the Kalita wave. When I went, they had a guest bean in the hopper from the Coffee Collective in Denmark. <br><br>Probably the best coffee in Singapore, some say JB. Can&#39;t reiterate how much I love this quaint little spot.

As one of the earliest coffee joints to surface, Nylon Coffee Roasters is also one of the earliest cafes to set up within Everton Park. With limited seating space when they started out, they have since expanded to include a big communal table and a few more seats.<br><br>Their research laboratory where they experiment with different coffee beans!<br><br>The 6oz White Coffee ($4.50) is made using their own Four Chairs blend, that provides a creamy and balanced taste. The coffee tasted milky, while still maintaining the strong taste.<br><br>Being a roaster, their coffee beans and blends can be found in other cafes as well. If you are around the CBD / Everton Park / Tanjong Pagar area, why not visit their main shop instead?

An adorable hole-in-the-wall coffee spot that proves my theory that the world&#39;s best coffee is always hidden. <br><br>Singapore&#39;s friendly resident community manager, Marcus, introduced us to this charmer (thank you!!!!) and it did an excellent job of impressing two Melbournian coffee fiends. <br><br>We were really blown away by the warm community feel of this place. Despite it&#39;s size, happy punters crammed in for as long as possible to talk all things coffee with locals and visitors alike. Wonderful.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/gcG8v4G6a7yy7uXobEcw2A/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/nylon-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=q9AHicWOWW_rOuHs0fqFGw&select=gcG8v4G6a7yy7uXobEcw2A', 'altText': 'Photo of Nylon Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore. Cappuccino and a long black', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Cappuccino and a long black'}]
text: this place is small. and by small, there&#39;s a counter and space to seat perhaps 5 people comfortably inside. there&#39;s also a bit more space to accommodate the invariably long line of people waiting for their fix (doubt their existence is much of a secret). i think there&#39;s a wooden block outside, but seems a bit unseemly to drink gourmet coffee on a wooden block (hey, different strokes...). anyway, be prepared to get your coffee to-go when you come here. <br><br>having said that, the coffee ($4) is delicious. i drink my coffee black so even the smallest nuances in make a significant difference. and these guys really know what they&#39;re doing. i hear they travel frequently to hand-pick the beans. they also roast their beans in this giant monstrosity of a machine you&#39;ll see inside. my beans were from Michiti, a co-op located in Kaffa, West Ethiopia. so damn good. man, just thinking about it is bringing back my unassuaged craving.  <br><br>brb getting coffee.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=zL4rxAfcfo_ngI4G6yPwDA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wOP9W2bG0mreG2RCI4VjDA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wOP9W2bG0mreG2RCI4VjDA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wOP9W2bG0mreG2RCI4VjDA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wOP9W2bG0mreG2RCI4VjDA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wOP9W2bG0mreG2RCI4VjDA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wOP9W2bG0mreG2RCI4VjDA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Vanessa A.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Vanessa A.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=zL4rxAfcfo_ngI4G6yPwDA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 1, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 5, 'eliteYear': None}
text: After reading the consistently great reviews about Nylon, this place was bookmarked for quite a while in my yelp list. The first time i went there the roaster was closed. Today was attempt number 2. You can imagine the anticipation (and great expectation) when I finally got to try out their coffee this afternoon.<br><br> It was a tiny place with less than 5 seats indoors, and filled with regulars overflowing onto the outdoor benches. Mostly young upper middle class Singaporeans, the guys were fit and the women were pretty. Hey not a bad place if you want to view local beautiful people having their Saturday afternoon kopi. <br><br>We ordered a double shot macchiato each, which while decent isnt quite the best I&#39;ve had in Singapore. It was very creamy (great if your personal preference) and the flavor was strong and smooth. But instead of being bitter, the taste of the macchiato was literally sour. I&#39;m not a coffee connoisseur, yet I&#39;ve never come across great coffee being described as sour. <br><br>The best macchiato I&#39;ve had here is at liberty coffee, a roaster that sporadically opens during seemingly random weekends. Comparing nylon and liberty, the latter offers bitter expresso with a light dash of milk that also goes down smoothly with a strong nutty roast aftertaste. For coffee, I know which place I prefer. For the view, nylon is imcomparable ;)

So having actually been IN Nylon twice now, I have to say, dropping by really is such an big part of its charm.<br><br>You meet people that are happy to talk to you about absolutely anything and everything, willing to share the joke that has you walking in mid-laugh, and often, perfectly happy to offer up the seat if you&#39;re stuck holding your coffee and looking awkward.<br><br>It&#39;s the kind of place you wish you could drop by every day to become a regular yourself just so you can be part of the &#39;in&#39; group. <br><br>Also, I don&#39;t think the lack of seating space is a big deal. There&#39;re actually benches outside, and if you don&#39;t mind the heat, then win!<br><br>So yes. I&#39;m bumping this up to five stars. It&#39;s really hard to not love the charm, warmth, and inclusiveness of a place like Nylon.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=A3rFBjiIT8oCeIDkz8pJ1Q', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/gWZhGUIAJ1C-MQ7wdO8POA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/gWZhGUIAJ1C-MQ7wdO8POA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/gWZhGUIAJ1C-MQ7wdO8POA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/gWZhGUIAJ1C-MQ7wdO8POA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/gWZhGUIAJ1C-MQ7wdO8POA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/gWZhGUIAJ1C-MQ7wdO8POA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Sal G.', 'displayLocation': 'Redwood City, CA', 'altText': 'Sal G.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=A3rFBjiIT8oCeIDkz8pJ1Q', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 34, 'photoCount': 1, 'reviewCount': 37, 'eliteYear': None}
text: First coffee shop that I&#39;ve been to here that smells right.  Mmmm roastery.  <br><br>The place is cozy and moderrn, the coffee is fantastic - pour overs are (apparently) hard to find here and this place is legit. I&#39;ve been jonesing for some good coffee and I found it here. Proper; check it out!

You know how there are some places you just want to keep secret from the crowds? this coffee place is one of them. Then the fear, if no one knows or goes then it would go out of biz. It turns out (from my IG) that Nylon is so popular. That&#39;s cos their coffee is soooo awesome. I hate burnt beans. Love a strong cuppa too. Their cold white coffee is just great. Not diluted by the ice, just fab.

Complete focus on coffee, and it shows! They don&#39;t have food, or even much in the way of seating, but their absolute focus on coffee makes it all worth it. I had a single espresso, and it was absolutely brilliant. Sweet and well rounded, with loads of flavour coming through. Nice people too, who have clearly spent some time around coffee, and know all the world&#39;s best spots.

Excellent coffeshop: tasty beans roasted to perfection (&amp; interesting variety), extremely good service, friendly, professional, delicious coffee to drink. I love the standing table and the setting under an HDB can&#39;t be beat. Great place all around.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=WaTgo7z0bIn6cdmiDW976w', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/mVjSVrFS93VRVIXwCfvEkw/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/mVjSVrFS93VRVIXwCfvEkw/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/mVjSVrFS93VRVIXwCfvEkw/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/mVjSVrFS93VRVIXwCfvEkw/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/mVjSVrFS93VRVIXwCfvEkw/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/mVjSVrFS93VRVIXwCfvEkw/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Shawn P.', 'displayLocation': 'West Coast, Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Shawn P.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=WaTgo7z0bIn6cdmiDW976w', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 15, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 17, 'eliteYear': None}
text: A great place to have coffee - personable service , small area and two incredibly passionate individuals who have travelled the world over to experience the wonders of coffee all over and have come to share it with us. The coffees are of a very high quality - loads of flavour , fruity and complex and always a surprise or two here and there. Their El Primero blend is the house blend and is seasonal - only way to find out what the flavours are for that day is to hop down for a tasting! <br>Nylon however is relatively small -  not much of a spot for sitting down over a table the entire day - there are no tables in fact! Hence it would not be ideal for that purpose - but for the coffee purist , is paradise: No food here either.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=RhM7uTY_KwlQyq9tzP7GFA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/XzcpTS3zoM0ocUt2tEsZ7Q/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/XzcpTS3zoM0ocUt2tEsZ7Q/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/XzcpTS3zoM0ocUt2tEsZ7Q/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/XzcpTS3zoM0ocUt2tEsZ7Q/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/XzcpTS3zoM0ocUt2tEsZ7Q/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/XzcpTS3zoM0ocUt2tEsZ7Q/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Sean M.', 'displayLocation': 'Flushing, Queens, NY', 'altText': 'Sean M.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=RhM7uTY_KwlQyq9tzP7GFA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 428, 'photoCount': 97, 'reviewCount': 311, 'eliteYear': None}
text: This place is coffee geek heaven!<br><br>These guys know their coffee and it shows. I had a perfect cup of coffee - and pleasing me when it comes to my coffee is no small feat. If you&#39;re into grande soy pumpkin spiced half caff blah blah blah then this is probably not the place for you; but if you truly appreciate your coffee in it&#39;s purist form then you belong here.<br><br>Lack of seating is a huge bummer, especially when you consider how long it can take for your drink to be prepared. Hopefully they find a larger space in the future.

I had the iced pour over coffee and it was perfect. The place is tiny, with only a few seats available - but it&#39;s a lovely place to get your quick caffeine fix. The service was attentive, friendly &amp; swift. <br><br>I&#39;d definitely recommend this place to any coffee lovers - especially if you&#39;re a local. For those visiting Singapore, this place could be a tad difficult to find (It&#39;s well-hidden in one of the housing areas/HDB) - but I&#39;d say it&#39;s worth the trip, even when it was pouring rain.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=DhLkzLT23zK7uFUP5MtP3Q', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/f2wBbiATEVq1T28oOoJhiQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/f2wBbiATEVq1T28oOoJhiQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/f2wBbiATEVq1T28oOoJhiQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/f2wBbiATEVq1T28oOoJhiQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/f2wBbiATEVq1T28oOoJhiQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/f2wBbiATEVq1T28oOoJhiQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Pamela Y.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Pamela Y.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=DhLkzLT23zK7uFUP5MtP3Q', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 4, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Another one of your typical pretentious coffee joints. I much prefer Just Want Coffee couple meters away. Since when did schooling your customers on coffee become a thing? Thanks but no thanks.

Here is where you know you will always get a great cup of specialty coffee whether brewed or as an espresso drink. I always start my coffee rounds with a cold brew that is a small dose of intense flavour, approximately 2 ounces. If you head down there anytime soon, you might just taste the same juicy, berry flavour profile of this current single origin bean that leaves you craving for more on any given day in this sweltering heat of Singa. <br>I thoroughly enjoy interacting with the couple behind the machine, a friendly duo who are very serious about their java. Ask them about their shop name if you have the chance, they have quite a sweet story behind it. Oh and don&#39;t forget to check out the little touches around the pigeon hole. Tiny as it may be, many interesting accessories are lying around!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=kWpV8BiFGNRhpeHYXl_q6g', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Azira A.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Azira A.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=kWpV8BiFGNRhpeHYXl_q6g', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 6, 'photoCount': 140, 'reviewCount': 119, 'eliteYear': None}
photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/ukBc8ELFFQeSTKtoDQRWPw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/nylon-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=8u51YG8UY6-FQx_kmCbblA&select=ukBc8ELFFQeSTKtoDQRWPw', 'altText': 'Photo of Nylon Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore. perfect cup of coffee, nylon', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'perfect cup of coffee, nylon'}]
text: I wish my HDB block had a Nylon Coffee Roaster at the void deck! I&#39;d be greeted by wafts of dizzying coffee smell everyday, i&#39;d even get my daily dose of coffee here everyday if I could!<br><br>Went to check out this tiny space with a friend of mine and we both ordered the piccolo, if I&#39;m not wrong, they were brewing Peruvian beans for the coffee that day. It was so good and so smooth, we didn&#39;t add a grain of sugar, the coffee is gentle enough that the milk&#39;s sweetness cuts through and you get to enjoy a REAL cup of coffee!<br><br>Was so in love with it that I wanted to get the beans so I can make a cup with my french press at home every day. But their shelf of freshly roasted beans (which they do in-house, you can see the machine behind the counter) had only the brazillian blend, so I got that and they ground it for me. Just tell them how you make your coffee at home, whether its espresso machine, french press or drips and they can grind the coffee accordingly for you. While the beans were grinding, oh my, the beautiful bittersweet aroma that suddenly enveloped the room got us all so excited!<br><br>It was nice talking to the owners too because they really do love their coffee and are happy to share their expertise. Don&#39;t expect a cafe though, this is strictly a coffee lab/joint/space, it&#39;s all coffee and nothing else!<br><br>Final verdict: Worth hunting for, not just for the freshly ground coffee but also to meet the genuine and passionate owners.

Nylon is a rather tiny place with essentially no tables/sitting, so don&#39;t expect to really hang out comfortably here.<br><br>I know close to zero about coffee-making, but I think that Probat machine they have in the back room looks pretty cool. Like it&#39;s the heart &amp; core of their operations.<br><br>One of the very few coffee places that are open on Mondays, along with Stranger&#39;s Reunion and Toby&#39;s Estate.<br><br>Parking: You&#39;ll see many cars parked illegally around the back of the blocks. Not sure how &#34;safe&#34; it is, so I usually park at the multi-storey behind which anyway has a linkway (level 2B I think) straight to Nylon .

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=Jw-9PFc9VaXojcMadzjgig', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/LoR5b6pWyhhKGPRPFB2PhA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/LoR5b6pWyhhKGPRPFB2PhA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/LoR5b6pWyhhKGPRPFB2PhA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/LoR5b6pWyhhKGPRPFB2PhA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/LoR5b6pWyhhKGPRPFB2PhA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/LoR5b6pWyhhKGPRPFB2PhA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Matt B.', 'displayLocation': 'Midtown West, Manhattan, NY', 'altText': 'Matt B.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=Jw-9PFc9VaXojcMadzjgig', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 8, 'photoCount': 6, 'reviewCount': 21, 'eliteYear': None}
text: A MacBook hooked up to a roaster to profile the temp and a bunch of other stuff to make sure your coffee is right. Can&#39;t go wrong!

Nylon Coffee Roasters is situated in Everton Park which is a mere 10 minute walk from Outram MRT, and is hidden by a row of retro and old, slighly rundown HDB shophouses. The coffee shop is partitioned into two - with one end occupied by a professional looking coffee maker, and the other end, with only four seats. <br><br>The coffee (flat white - 7oz for $4) tastes extremely unique and different from the usual coffee joints perhaps because their unique blend is hand roasted indoors. You can also buy the beans they have handroasted for your own personal consumption. It is definitely worth travelling to this slightly out of the way place to try their unique roast.

What can I say about this place? You put lovely co-owners with mean coffee-making skills, a good machine (I love vintage), a quaint location and you&#39;ll get the quirks of a good coffee spot. <br><br>We didn&#39;t get to catch much because there was a sudden wave of people coming in - that&#39;s quite scary considering how small the place is but everyone seemed to find their space. But we managed to get ourselves each a cup of capp. Well-pulled, none of the bitter aftertaste and a good creaminess to it. <br><br>I&#39;ll head back on days when there are desserts!

So first thing first.<br>This is NOT a cafe.<br><br>So after our stint at Strangers&#39; Reunion, we decided to explore a little since Nylon Coffee Roasters is relatively near by foot from Kampong Bahru. Well, it is not relatively THAT near, but we made it under the hot sun over to the charming little HDB estate of Everton Park. <br><br>We were quite confused as to which block it was, but managed to find it after a bit of wandering. You will never expect anything in here if you don&#39;t know where to look!<br><br>That is the most important thing you need to know about Nylon Coffee Roasters. They sell coffee, but they don&#39;t sell a space with couches, comfortable chairs and tables. If you want that, go to Starbucks.<br><br>It is, as it&#39;s name suggests, a coffee roaster place. What they do is to transform their love for coffee into a shop front for other like-minded people to enjoy some &#39;indie&#39; beans. <br><br>If you see the window in the photo that has something behind, it is actually the other half of the shop with a giant roasting machine inside.<br><br>You can buy the beans they roasted - which all comes with very exotic names which I cannot pronounce or recall. Or you can grab a cuppa to go, or have it at the storefront. Which only has 4 chairs. So really, just grab a to-go. The owners are really friendly though and ready to share their knowledge for coffee if you are interested!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=WmjyCs4PlzMpVOt9CkQEYA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Vivian W.', 'displayLocation': 'Dallas, TX', 'altText': 'Vivian W.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=WmjyCs4PlzMpVOt9CkQEYA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 32, 'eliteYear': None}
text: We participated in a Third Wave roasted coffee exchange last year. Nylon Coffee Roasters sent beautifully roasted coffee. We enjoyed it here at Rösthaus Coffee in Texas.  Thanks for your sharing you talent with us.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=Om7EbK-guFJ-XwcNc78Z6Q', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/k6O-gCZx_DhePlLM5J7Uww/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/k6O-gCZx_DhePlLM5J7Uww/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/k6O-gCZx_DhePlLM5J7Uww/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/k6O-gCZx_DhePlLM5J7Uww/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/k6O-gCZx_DhePlLM5J7Uww/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/k6O-gCZx_DhePlLM5J7Uww/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Dean M.', 'displayLocation': 'Milpitas, CA', 'altText': 'Dean M.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=Om7EbK-guFJ-XwcNc78Z6Q', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 90, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 11, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Good people who love and know coffee. One of the best in Singapore. The space is small but very inviting to enjoy your coffee.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=AMexPsUO1CRpLm9g4qbojg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wzNBJNJGqqOBShRacPSLQw/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wzNBJNJGqqOBShRacPSLQw/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wzNBJNJGqqOBShRacPSLQw/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wzNBJNJGqqOBShRacPSLQw/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wzNBJNJGqqOBShRacPSLQw/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wzNBJNJGqqOBShRacPSLQw/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Danny S.', 'displayLocation': 'Bukit Timah, Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Danny S.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=AMexPsUO1CRpLm9g4qbojg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 13, 'photoCount': 146, 'reviewCount': 52, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Tiny place but high in quality.  Great taste.  These guys love their coffee.  They weigh every shot!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=OC2FLtUu7DwBg1MSCPoYBA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/79BkkpTCMbtyzVHL-x44ag/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/79BkkpTCMbtyzVHL-x44ag/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/79BkkpTCMbtyzVHL-x44ag/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/79BkkpTCMbtyzVHL-x44ag/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/79BkkpTCMbtyzVHL-x44ag/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/79BkkpTCMbtyzVHL-x44ag/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Huiwen L.', 'displayLocation': 'Dempsey Hill, Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Huiwen L.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=OC2FLtUu7DwBg1MSCPoYBA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 11, 'photoCount': 47, 'reviewCount': 3, 'eliteYear': None}
text: So, im not an expert in coffee and i&#39;ve zero experience in it - im a starbucks toffee nut latte kinda girl - but i love this place because i love how the place is such a homely and non-pretentious area unlike new f&amp;b spots that ride on new trends. There&#39;s what, 4 chairs there?! And everyone just stands around and have talks about anything under the sun and dennis/jiamin (owners) entertain my incessant questions about coffee and brewing which i&#39;m really thankful for. So if you feel like you need to come home to some coffee and just chill, come talk to the people at nylon, you wouldn&#39;t regret it.

The good:  Quaint space, happy customers, reasonable prices and good coffee.<br><br>The bad:  I know I&#39;m going to get roasted for this (pun intended!), but the above is the list of all the good things about Nylon.  Nothing more, nothing less.  Feels like you&#39;re walking into someone&#39;s kitchen, so depending on whether you like that feel, it could be good or bad.  Took me awhile to locate the shop as it&#39;s buried beneath a HDB block.   By the time I got there, the LAST thing I wanted was something hot (because Singapore is hot!).  I came with a friend and we both ordered the recommended coffee, iced.  Drinks came out in a timely manner and we both intently sipped them outside (because there were already 3 people inside...i.e. packed house).  My friend thought her drink was a bit bitter, so she flagged down one of the staff for some sugar.  Their response, &#34;Have you tasted it?&#34;.  God bless that pretentious barista I thought to myself as I nearly spat out a mouthful of my iced bean-from-somewhere-interesting coffee.  For the first time in awhile, I was transported straight to Williamsburg, Brooklyn (if you don&#39;t know, google it).<br><br>The ugly:  They deal strictly with coffee, so right there I have a cap of 4 stars.  I&#39;m not a huge coffee fan, and by that I mean I drink 1-2 cups a day from various local spots and chains.  Is Nylon coffee good?  Yes.  Is it better than the rest?  Maybe.  Can anyone really tell?  Probably not.  Therefore, unless this place was on my way to work, I wouldn&#39;t make it a destination.  With nothing to eat and nowhere to sit I would prefer any other cafe around the way.  I&#39;m so annoyed at Bean Snobs/Coffee Cults (I just made those up) that I&#39;m borderline close to organizing a blind taste test just to prove that coffee is as much about climate, sensation and temper as it is about taste.  To put it another way, the best tasting meals are when you&#39;re hungry.  So, in short, people crave the experience.  Plus caffeine...can&#39;t forget about the spectacular drug caffeine.
Fave cuppa . But the sad thing in here is you cant just sit down n enjoy the coffee as the plc is really really small.
Great coffee. Period. The atmosphere was friendly and everyone just ended up chatting together, so rare these days! The prices are reasonable, so what more can you wish for?!

Lovely hole-in-the-wall coffee place which has a nice ambience and indie feel to it. Yes, the seats are limited inside but who&#39;s stopping you from buying a cuppa coffee and sitting on some of the benches outside. Grab pastries from the nearby bakery whilst you&#39;re at it.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=4Imxj8nYyM2Vw56l2y1noQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Yasmar V.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Yasmar V.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=4Imxj8nYyM2Vw56l2y1noQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 7, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 55, 'eliteYear': None}
text: To be honest, I find this place a little pretentious. The coffee is good but not exceptional. They&#39;re not the only serious guys making good coffee these days. One can quite easily find legitimate coffee elsewhere these days. However,  I think what sets this cafe apart is the strong community of coffee connoisseurs and lovers. If you like sipping and discussing your coffee with other like-minded folks, or enjoy feeling indie and ironic with your cup of coffee in the HDB heartlands, this might be the place for you.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=nJrDafm2YOdVeD7LddjnRA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Jzin T.', 'displayLocation': 'Outram, Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Jzin T.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=nJrDafm2YOdVeD7LddjnRA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 38, 'photoCount': 2, 'reviewCount': 2, 'eliteYear': None}
text: great coffee! friendly owners and nice cafe hidden gem kinda vibe. the prices are low too compared to many other indie coffee places and esp against the big coffee chains! One of the best in Singapore! I go there at least once a fortnight. (there are other good coffee places ard my work area too!)

text: I dig the coffee at Five Oars Coffee Roasters.  It&#39;s quite aromatic and bold.  The flavors remind me alot of Blue Bottle in SF.  Our latte and cappuccino were perfect.  I did not have any food, but my partner&#39;s avocado toast looked rather amazing.<br><br>The shop is gorgeous with all the decorative plants.   The staff were quite friendly.  <br><br>I would definitely return for brunch next time.

Fish and chips ($22 + $2 for sweet potato fries) - 3.75 stars<br>Solid.<br><br>Ambience - 3.5 stars<br>Nice big space but too noisy and the tables are close together so you can hear your neighbour&#39;s conversation perhaps a little too clearly...

text: I travel all over the world for business and go out of my way to find small local restaurants that serve amazing food. I had one of the most amazing breakfast at Five Oars during my recent trip to Singapore. The food is absolutely incredible. It&#39;s rare to find such a flawless gem. If I could have given them more than five stars I would have.

They have a big menu with many choices, everything is fresh. If you want to have a breakfast of champions this is the place, would def be back.

text: Went for lunch with about 8 friends on - Tuesday. Expectedly not crowded but it has big space and it filled up quickly during peak lunch time.  The ambience is simple and open. The overall food and presentation was good for the price. The service was prompt and nice. Overall 4/5. No real complaints. We averaged about 25$ per person which included main items , coffee and desert.

text: this one ape show is just what the doctor ordered!<br><br>come get wired by haslee, the alpha ape!<br>super friendly, knowledgable and serves up an excellent shot or two of caffeine that he personally blends and roasts at tiong hoe&#39;s premises, with a perfectly balanced infusion of moo moo, if that&#39;s how you take your coffee.<br><br>nice ambience with free wifi, charging points, edgy arty walls and the right amount of a/c to keep you as cool as this place is.<br><br>parking can be a challenge but mayo street, perak road and dickson road are good scouting routes for street parking lots before heading down dunlop street as a last resort.<br><br>else take the downtown line to either rochor or jalan besar station and it&#39;s a short walk from either.<br><br>it&#39;s definitely well off the beaten caffeine track but also well worth your effort should you so choose to accept this mission.<br><br>this review will self destruct in.................

text: Best coffee i found in Singapore <br>Im from Brooklyn ny and i know fancy hipster coffee drinks and this wonderful little spot in Singapore stacks up against the very best i have had in brooklyn and manhattan. <br><br>Its in a strange neighborhood right on the edge of little India but if you find yourself around here get in and get a great coffee and enjoy all the monkey related art and chockies.  <br><br>I would have bought a tshirt too but the shirt quality looked low and the shirts were very thick.

The insane wall art', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'The insane wall art'}]
text: The place is a little slice of perfection in the big cake of Singapore. The atmosphere is great, and quiet, and awesome jazzy music plays in the background. There is a huge piece of wall art that looks flipping AMAZING!!! The service was super quick, despite only having one staff. The coffee quality is great, and the hot chocolate is perfect, bittersweet and delicious. Despite its small size, it&#39;s perfect for meetings, meals and drinks. The staff are well trained in the art of coffee art, and created Picasso-worthy coffee art on top of any hot drink. It&#39;s worth what it costs. The place can be easy to walk by if you&#39;re not watching carefully. This place has my full recommendations, and is a 5-star place. I only rated it 5 stars because there is no 6 stars.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=nf_NpRfabt-enpO6pWfbJA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Marc R.', 'displayLocation': 'Pacific Grove, CA', 'altText': 'Marc R.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=nf_NpRfabt-enpO6pWfbJA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 1, 'eliteYear': None}
text: In a city that&#39;s only starting to develop a coffee culture, Wired Monkey stands out like an oasis in a desert. Great coffee (wonderful Flat White, and even better iced lattes) but also a cool clean place to recharge. Clean restrooms, friendly staff, and an all around great vibe. Highly recommended. Worth going out of your way for.

Found this gem wondering around the City. The coffee shop seems to be a hipster mecca, and I&#39;m ok with that! <br><br>As its name implies, Glasshouse is surrounded by floor to ceiling windows with a sliding glass door to enter. Once inside you can choose from different espresso based drinks and pour overs. <br><br>I went on two separate days and got a pour over one day an an espresso the other.  Both were expertly prepared using great beans.<br><br>In addition to coffee they also had some pastries available, I didn&#39;t try anything but everything looked delicious.

We had just arrived at our hotel in Singapore (the Fairmont) and were looking for a quick caffeine hit nearby. Despite there being no reviews on Yelp (I guess my wife solicited other sources!), she found that Glasshouse was well-reviewed, as well as apparently being a very Instagram-able location. It is located within what looks like an old colonial structure that has been converted into a shop/restaurant complex (very similar to how the Dutch Colonial Hospital has been transformed in Colombo, Sri Lanka). Glasshouse was at the end of the complex, furthest away from the Fairmont, and with floor-to-ceiling windows, it does indeed look like a glass house of sorts. The door is a sliding door (we were confused when we did not see a regular door right off), and once inside, you are in a coffee shop that also sells local wares, terrariums, and other non-food-related items - a nice way to let you pass the time while you sip on coffee. The folks at the bar are quite friendly, and we had our coffee (not chocolate for me) brought out shortly thereafter. My wife&#39;s iced mocha was quite good; even for someone who stays away from coffee like myself, it was roasted just the right amount. As for the hot chocolate, there are varying types you can get, based on location and percentage of cacao. I went with the darkest chocolate possible (85%) and really enjoyed it. It had a bit of a sandy texture - not surprising, since dark chocolate tends to have less moisture in it - but the warmth of the beverage brought out some of the subtleties of the chocolate that might be otherwise lost from eating it instead.<br><br>Overall, Glasshouse is a nice, simple place to get a good brew, or it&#39;s not a bad spot to hang out and do a little work as well (there were plenty  of folks typing away on laptops). The Wi-Fi password was not conspicuously displayed, but given there was a network, I assume you can probably get it easily enough by asking the folks at the register. Definitely a good spot to visit, particularly if you are just getting off of a long flight and need a pick-me-up as we did!

text: Great spot, love the decor and their coffee blend is great! They don&#39;t differentiate whites and black coffee. Also don&#39;t have low fat milk but I don&#39;t use that.

I was chatting with a friend about Geisha, my other top roaster in Singapore. &#34;Oh, that guy? Apparently he had a major fallout with Mr. Tan&#34; &#34;Mr. Tan?&#34; &#34;Yes, he&#39;s the top master in Singapore, he&#39;s been around for 40 years&#34;. <br><br>How did I not know this? Because I&#39;m an ignorant expat that&#39;s how. Time to resolve this glaring omission in my Singapore coffee map. <br><br>All good things have a cost. In Tiong Hoe&#39;s case, it is not financial. He still sells some coffees for $13 a bag, when Nylon has recently hiked theirs up to $22. No, the cost is walking up the damn hill to the HDB estate where it is located. <br><br>The smell of nutty cut grass (slightly like horse manure) that indicates a batch being roasted was a hint, you could smell it from the gate. 100m down the road, the famous green sign which to my non-Chinese-reading self looks exactly like Tiong Bahru Bakery (perhaps the latter copied Tiong Hoe, given the timeline). <br><br>&#34;We roast Tuesdays and Thursdays&#34;, they said. Well, it is Tuesday. About 2/3 of the selection had been roasted today or yesterday, which was heartening. It is exhausting to be told by yet another dishonest salesperson that it is fine, coffee roasted 3 weeks ago is still delicious. Not here. Not only did they agree on the importance of freshness, they bagged me some fresh off the roaster after I complained that no Africa origin had been in the morning&#39;s batch. Wonderful!<br><br>The Tanzania pourover was good. If I may nitpick, I prefer to warm the beaker before pouring; this is something Geisha does systematically. But the pouring technique was adequately slow with the right amount of water and waiting at the beginning to release the gases. A few degrees will not stop me from giving this place 5 stars.<br><br>I did not try the food but it looked appetising. 3 bags of single origin freshly roasted and a pourover and I walk away paying just a hint over $50, instead of $70 with Nylon (without the pourover). My only regret was not meeting the famous Mr. Tan, but his staff is very competent and pleasant to deal with. I will update this review with my impressions on the various beans as I try them.

text: Tiong Hoe Specialty Coffee is as good as Nylon if you ask me. The coffee is delicious and robust, and I always do take-away (beans) whenever I visit. <br><br>But then the location is a bit obscure and difficult to reach by public transport. Do plan ahead before your visit.

text: Great coffee at very reasonable prices. It&#39;s lovely to find a cafe in my hood that does coffee as well as it does cosy. I especially enjoy their pour overs. A quality establishment that will be around for a long time.

text: Quaint little coffee shop based in one of the oldest public housing estates in Singapore. A little nondescript, but unmistakably hip decor - newish designer touches mixed in with just enough vintage Singaporean coffee shop furniture to feel homey without being pretentious. A good mix of residents, young and old, make this less of a hip hangout and more of a local coffee spot. <br><br>Ostensibly a re-do of an existing traditional local coffee roaster, this place does a selection of espresso and pourover brews (v60 and kalita), as well as some cold brew. Single origin beans from the usual places - Kenya, Brazil, etc. Had me a Nicaragua pourover - tasted a tad over roasted but still a well executed brew. Prices are very reasonable too - $5.50 for a pourover that would cost me $7 in a hipper joint. $15.50 for a 250g bag of whole beans, compared to $18-$20 elsewhere. <br><br>Some dessert in the fridge - cakes and chocolate, plus what appears to be flavoured sodas. Didn&#39;t try &#39;em but good to know they have some sweets in case you&#39;re a bit famished. <br><br>Definitely a decent and cosy venue for a quick cuppa, and a quiet place for a brief respite from the day&#39;s exertions. Will be back.

Brews for the day', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Brews for the day'}]
text: After only 2 visits, tiong hoe has commandeered a place in my heart and quickly taken the top spot for a cuppa. <br><br>On my first visit, we went during a weekday and was relatively quiet. It allowed us to peruse the descriptions of the different single origin beans. <br><br>The cappuccinos are excellent as is the brew. I can&#39;t remember which beans I chose but the flavours were bright and robust. Payment is on a tip basis, it&#39;s so refreshing to see businesses place trust in their customers and not purely for profit. <br><br>The owner was present at the store and you could see his passion just bubbling over. He was regaling the customers with tales of his experiences purchasing beans and being in the coffee business. You just can&#39;t help but want to sit down for that bit longer to learn from such a knowledge uncle! The neighborhood feel has been fantastic and won the top spot in my books.

text: My first barista experience here in SG, the pour over is pretty good as well as their cake. Specially recommend the rose tea cake. The price here is decent while the ambiance is quiet and cozy

text: Interesting coffee shop at Bugis. Great espresso and some gimmicky drinks like deconstructed Americanos (test tubes of espresso served with a glass of hot water). The real triumph is the &#34;sweet little rain&#34; coffee which comes with a cotton candy cloud to drop sugar into your cup! <br><br>Coffee quality is very good. I am picky about my espresso and this place was 100% up to my standards! They also serve some lovely looking desserts for those who come hungry.

text: Mellower Coffee has become a recent favourite spot to get some work done or to have a chat with a friend. It&#39;s conveniently located which is very nice but can definitely get crowded during peak hours so you may have to be a little strategic with the timing of your visits if you&#39;d like to avoid the crowd.<br><br>Definitely a plus that their coffee is nothing less than enjoyable as well. Would definitely recommend to anyone in the area!

Hipster cafe w abundant seating near Bugis+ mall (about 7 min walk from MRT station). Interior is spacious with both downstairs and upstairs seating. I had the Baileys Coffee Cocktail which was a unique item to experience at this location.

text: Mellower coffee is a morning surprise for me, while walking toward Bugis, I happened to run into this cozy coffee shop. Order a cup of their signature drink- Sweet Little Rain, I&#39;m amazed by how creative a cup of typical American coffee can be. The cotton candy on top of the coffee adds in just the right amount of sweetness to the black coffee, pretty much creates a good balance between bitter and sweet. Overall I&#39;m satisfied with my experiences here at Mellower.

text: Higher-end coffee joint where coffees will cost $6+ from to begin with, Mellower is still well executed. The interior is well decorated with beautiful furnishings and plenty of seating. Vibe is relaxed but upscale. It&#39;s a nice place to work or relax.
