text: I was looking for a nice cappuccino on Saturday afternoon and just started walking. My walk led me to Mellower Coffee. I had passed the place many times before but had never gone in. I wish I had gone earlier! The place has an awesome coffee concept and pairings, even with alcohol! I opted for a regular cappuccino and ordered the galaxy rainbow cake. The presentation was very unexpected! The cake was beautiful, delicious, moist, and not overly sweet. The cappuccino was nice and hot and not lukewarm. The Evans weren&#39;t overly strong, but it was still tasty. The vibe was very relaxing even though it was packed. I will definitely be back when I&#39;m in the area again.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/FJVA1Kps2U_b19GPHAN7nA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/mellower-coffee-singapore-188967?reviewid=-7lSXCSRJJtwDhHaIFv9Qg&select=FJVA1Kps2U_b19GPHAN7nA', 'altText': 'Photo of Mellower Coffee - Singapore 188967, Singapore, Singapore. The inside of the coffee shop.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'The inside of the coffee shop.'}]
text: Drinks are amazing!! The coffee is great quality, and the staff are extremely polite, and happy to cater for health and diet deficiencies and requirements . My mate is gluten and fructose free, and like their coffee a certain way (using skim milk). The staff were more than happy to use skin instead of normal milk, and made sure that the coffee met the dietary requirements of anyone. They even add nice coffee art work in the coffee froth. Inside, there is always a table free, and isn&#39;t always packed, but filled with enough people for there to be a small buzz or talking, but it&#39;s really quiet, and perfect for sitting down with a coffee and planning out something. Jazzy music plays in the background, and the pendant lights look amazing. Be careful if you&#39;re tall, like me, because if you&#39;re not careful, you might hit your head on one. Upstairs is a small shop, which at the time of writing this, is themed for the TV show &#34;We Bare Bears&#34; (reason being that they are having a contest right now involving the specific show, where you photograph a hidden bear and post it to their social media&#39;s with a # to have a chance to win). Overall great atmosphere, warm and inviting, and a great place to stop for a snack or your morning coffee.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=5FsVDCH2j2pSGMvF9bob5Q', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/5ORYHfiicMoCTjkb4HSvPA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/5ORYHfiicMoCTjkb4HSvPA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/5ORYHfiicMoCTjkb4HSvPA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/5ORYHfiicMoCTjkb4HSvPA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/5ORYHfiicMoCTjkb4HSvPA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/5ORYHfiicMoCTjkb4HSvPA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Meg G.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'altText': 'Meg G.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=5FsVDCH2j2pSGMvF9bob5Q', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 161, 'photoCount': 73, 'reviewCount': 56, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Genuinely loved every single bite! The coffee was also as usual delicious. Service was also great! Even though there was a line outside (went Sunday brunch) it went by quick and service was very prompt throughout. Menu is definitely a bit overpriced though.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/GPdjazuoDfqXWvZFfnRRKQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=LMUj9Tzh7I12g7SFJcFYeA&select=GPdjazuoDfqXWvZFfnRRKQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: Came for a coffee catch up with a colleague but also decided to have some light food. This outlet closes early though so we were barely there an hour and all in all felt rushed throughout as we were one of 2 tables left. Coffee was good. And location is great with parking in the building and ample seating for a cafe in a prime location near Robertson Quay

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/E7YaPTpnxnULiySgZFPDNw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=W2okZgexaw9Zmw-v98HReQ&select=E7YaPTpnxnULiySgZFPDNw', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore. ethiopian slow brew', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'ethiopian slow brew'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/BozNK44LP8lqypolBmew2w/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=W2okZgexaw9Zmw-v98HReQ&select=BozNK44LP8lqypolBmew2w', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore. common man full breakfast', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'common man full breakfast'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/DstfWbG3p8WqjcU2lBE89A/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=W2okZgexaw9Zmw-v98HReQ&select=DstfWbG3p8WqjcU2lBE89A', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore. menu (left half)', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'menu (left half)'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/-NdycKrjp_EFnn8mcSj2Xg/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=W2okZgexaw9Zmw-v98HReQ&select=-NdycKrjp_EFnn8mcSj2Xg', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore. menu (right half)', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'menu (right half)'}]
text: This isn&#39;t just a third-wave coffee house, but it&#39;s also a proper dining establishment.<br><br>Not only did I enjoy a rich, bold Ethiopian &#34;slow brew,&#34; but I also enjoyed the Common Man full breakfast. It looked a tad pricey from the menu, but the plate itself didn&#39;t disappoint. It came with two free-range organic eggs, a large serving of bacon, plenty of sausage, a good amount of tomatoes, an entire portobello mushroom, a serving of chorizo baked beans, as well as a large slab of toast.<br><br>While the coffee and the food might take a while to prepare, staff members are friendly and engaging, and the contemporary, light-filled venue hosts a mostly expat crowd. There&#39;s a variety of seating for groups large and small, whether at tables or at communal benches. Perfect for conversation, reading, or even some laptop work. A nice find!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/5Mv3GxRPxxv5kEN4tiRN_A/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=ppnIF27ZC3gMRxY_I0Oj5Q&select=5Mv3GxRPxxv5kEN4tiRN_A', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore. Fluffy Pancakes: $21.00 SGD', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Fluffy Pancakes: $21.00 SGD'}]
text: To my surprise, I chowed down on a lot of different breakfast breads while in Singapore be they pancakes or french toast, and while the pancakes at Common Man weren&#39;t quite up to the bar set by Clinton Street, they were very good. <br><br>Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?<br><br>Common Man really knocks it out of the park when it comes to both their service and atmosphere. You&#39;ve got a big open space that doesn&#39;t get  too packed even during peak days and times, and it&#39;s comfortable enough to either relax with a group or get some work done. Our dishes came out quickly upon being ordered. Star. <br><br>Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?<br><br>$21.00 for pancakes is... well, it&#39;s expensive, and was actually even more expensive than high brow foreigner Clinton Street Baking Company for a comparable portion. Even so, this is roughly what you expect from a high end breakfast spot in Singapore. Star. <br><br>Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?<br><br>These were very good pancakes. Were they the fluffy symphony that you can find at Clinton Street? No, but they had good texture, good taste, and some great peripherals in the nuts, berry sauce, and bananas. Presentation was top notch as well. Two Stars. <br><br>Star 5: Would you be excited to go back?<br><br>It&#39;s only the fact that Clinton Street exists that I can&#39;t give a fifth star here. No Star.

Comman Man Veggie Wonderland', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Comman Man Veggie Wonderland'}]
text: Common Man Coffee Roasters serves outstanding coffee paired with fresh food. Be forewarned that the restaurant is often packed, the wait can be long, up to 30 minutes.<br><br>In addition, the prices are on the higher end, but the ingredients and food quality are superb. The flavor concoction makes the long wait and high price: worth it.<br><br>The coffee is just amazing. They have several varieties of coffee options-- all freshly brewed. You can also buy their roasted beans to bring home to brew yourself. Drink some coffee, eat good food, and relax!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/R9Lf9RqT7KQWlyyEzjkjgA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=fbL5WKoIN5Ib_3T25fDbPQ&select=R9Lf9RqT7KQWlyyEzjkjgA', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/m88G9KlY9Wiq4ByY9lVX8A/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=fbL5WKoIN5Ib_3T25fDbPQ&select=m88G9KlY9Wiq4ByY9lVX8A', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: Needed a &#39;normal&#39; breakfast as I&#39;ve been traveling through Asia for quite some time. Found this place with good reviews gave it a try. It was so good that I went two days in a row! <br><br>Queue wasn&#39;t bad at all but I was rolling solo so if you have a group, it might be different. I love the space and the communal tables. Very inviting and casual which is always a plus to me. Service is fine considering how busy they were. <br><br>Their &#39;uncommon&#39; coffee was unbelievably good and I highly recommend it. I was blown away by the flavors of the coffee bean and tried to buy some to take back but unfortunately they were sold out. Next time! <br><br>First day I was here I ordered the pancakes with a berry compote and walnuts. Great texture and a mix of sweet and salty. Pretty filling for two thick pieces! If you love sweet breakfasts, that&#39;s definitely worth a try. <br><br>Second day I got the common man breakfast with poached eggs. Everything was fresh and it all married well together. Huge portions but not heavy which I liked. <br><br>If I lived in the area, this would be my go to. Reminds me of brunch here in San Francisco.  Getting together with friends over good food and chatting away. Loved it!

text: My friend took me here after we went to the Sea Aquarium. I&#39;ll just review the drinks here I guess.<br>The coffee (latte art) was really pretty. I still remember how they made the latte in front of you. I guess I was kinda new to latte art at that time. Besides, I remember the barista making pour over in the back of the counter. Love the whole atmosphere of this place too!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/XGDeb47tY9GlxTAUe8yjmg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=cLJyLIZYTcMJq_kHQXPM7w&select=XGDeb47tY9GlxTAUe8yjmg', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore. Interior', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Interior'}]
text: I was looking for an early morning breakfast place to help me deal with the jet lag when I first saw Common Man Coffee Roasters and read all the good comments they had. They also have a yoga place upstairs where you can take classes. So if you are an early bird (or suffering from jet lag) you can start the day with some yoga and come downstairs for a great breakfast. I went with the eggs benedict and fast brew coffee. Eggs come with ox meat and they are delicious, coffee is pretty good too. They do breakfast and lunch and have some good looking desserts. All in all this is a great place that I would absolutely recommend. One small caveat though. It seems to be a favorite for expats, so if you are looking for some place where locals eat, I do not know if Common Man should be your go to. But hey, you wont regret coming here! :)

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/hEjSJV8qEHTDIMRZ99odwg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=qqeNDqJqvTTGtU0zqkB5Ig&select=hEjSJV8qEHTDIMRZ99odwg', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: Normally come here for the coffee and brunch food. However, ordered a takeaway latte today and after waiting for 20 minutes, I enquired about my order. They could not find my order but apologised for it. I really like their blends but 20 minutes is way too long to wait for a to-go latte.

text: I have been obsessed with places like this for such a long time now. Is that kind of place that you really feel to work out before coming having your breakfast coffee juice or lunch and you will feel healthy after being there. I went there together with my mom before walking around in Singapore.<br><br>Actually we went there 2 times. First  time was before walking around in the city we had two salad and one green kale juice. <br><br>Second time I went for the  egg Benedict it came with some kind of meat which I have never tried before and my mom was having a granola. Of course we both went for a cappuccino. Great place to come before work out I&#39;ll before walking long because you know you&#39;ll get some good ingredients and healthy food and also is so

text: Brunch here on a Sunday morning.  Good was solid, but incredibly disappointed with poor service.  After waiving down 2 servers to see if my wife&#39;s food was coming, and being promised that it was, our original server came back and said she never even placed the order.<br><br>When I spoke to the manager about this, she said she wasn&#39;t even aware that we had been waiting for half an hour.  <br><br>Not sure we would come back.

text: Stayed at a nearby hotel and went twice to this little gem for breakfast. They have amazing coffee, and the menu is delicious! The Turkish Common Man is a really great vegetarian option. The house-baked Cornbread is like a avocado toast on steroids and Brioche French Toast is huge! Great service and great atmosphere!

text: If you&#39;re yelping from Singapore you&#39;re probably American and pretty basic. Luckily so am I, and this place is effing delicious. Do yourself a favor and order the Turkish breakfast. But then please get some laksa later - you&#39;re in SINGAPORE.

text: We left the UK last year and haven&#39;t had an &#39;English&#39; breakfast since. Nor have we had real bacon or sausages. So this was amazing. Probably one of the best full breakfasts we&#39;ve ever had. Anywhere. I will certainly be back. Well done!

text: First time here. The baristas were obviously not experienced - or were swamped. One cappuccino was over extracted and one under - just wasn&#39;t pleasant. The bean selection was in an awkward location where seated patrons were getting frustrated with potential buyers looking at roast dates lol. It&#39;s a tight busy spot. <br><br>Food wasn&#39;t bad - a bit on the pricey end but the quality of the ingredients was good.

text: Delicious coffee and fresh, quality meals, but be prepared to queue up if you come during peak periods. Due to its open concept layout and tiled surfaces, this venue can become quite noisy when many patrons are present. Not ideal for working on your laptop - perhaps bring headphones if you plan to get anything done.

Small, expensive latte', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Small, expensive latte'}]
text: Came here based on the positive reviews and, based on how busy it was, it is obviously a popular location. The staff was very friendly and helpful but I was shocked at the prices for what was provided. S$5 purchased me a tiny take away latte with an &#34;okay&#34; pulled shot of espresso. I forgot to order a croissant so I went back and ordered one which also shocked me at S$5. Like the espresso, the croissant was nothing to write home about. <br><br>Overall, for a few dollars less, this would have been a 4 star review.

text: Not impressed. A bit overhypped, the coffee was weak, the Fluffy pancakes were dense inside, the vegetable rosti is not really a rosti...<br>Maybe I was just unlucky, but for my first experience the food did not impress me. <br>The service was great though.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=KEIzksmYRGhGyk6-IZmwYg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/kdKQwKTLYRK63b8RB9O7uA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/kdKQwKTLYRK63b8RB9O7uA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/kdKQwKTLYRK63b8RB9O7uA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/kdKQwKTLYRK63b8RB9O7uA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/kdKQwKTLYRK63b8RB9O7uA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/kdKQwKTLYRK63b8RB9O7uA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Akshata R.', 'displayLocation': 'Portland, OR', 'altText': 'Akshata R.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=KEIzksmYRGhGyk6-IZmwYg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 1, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 73, 'eliteYear': None}
text: I was quite impressed by the variety on the menu - eggs in all different kinds and flavours, to start with. I just stuck to that :)  My kale and scrambled eggs was super yummy and heartier than I expected it to be. The house filter coffee to top this off with was excellent, creamy and full of zing. I&#39;d definitely go back there for more. BUT, the prices are on the high side for sure, makes the &#34;coming back&#34; a little harder. It was superr crowded for a Sunday lunch too. The communal tables aren&#39;t the best bet if you&#39;re meeting friends, it is hard to talk over the ambient chatter to someone sitting 3 people away!

I liked the decor, but it was on the noisy side. It was packed, but we only waited for about 10 minutes around 11.30am on a Sunday. The queue was a bit longer when we left around 1. The running theme with the dishes seemed to be that everything was dry unfortunately. The service was quick.<br><br>Veggie Wonderland ($24) - 3 stars<br>Sauce please. Or get your eggs soft boiled.<br><br>Pancakes ($21) - 2.5 stars<br>Good flavor but very dry, and not many ingredients to go along with it. I had to ask for butter to go along with it, but it would probably have been better with yogurt or some sort of compote.<br><br>Eggs Benedict ($21)<br>Tried a bit of this - the eggs were excellent. The ox cheek was a little chewy.<br><br>Soy latte ($5) - 4 stars<br>No extra charge for soy! There&#39;re two shots in one glass, and no decaf option just a heads up.<br><br>The carpark right next door/under, off Arnasalam Chetty Road was expensive - $3/hour on weekends, and small! Tight corners.

Veggie Wonderland', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Veggie Wonderland'}]
text: The Veggie Wonderland was delicious. I adore grilled haloumi!  I&#39;m very happy to have found a healthy breakfast spot in my hood. <br><br>But...regardless of how popular a restaurant is, you should never have to wait 35 minutes for food. They should reconsider how many covers they can serve at once without hurting the diners overall impression.

Veggie Wonderland', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Veggie Wonderland'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/TUf74hyRhqhaSjWw6Af2NQ/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=96D_Vo8A7S_d9mofk6wtIQ&select=TUf74hyRhqhaSjWw6Af2NQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/xNw20AERot942p6BGFiKgw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=96D_Vo8A7S_d9mofk6wtIQ&select=xNw20AERot942p6BGFiKgw', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}]
text: I&#39;m here so much, it&#39;s a wonder I haven&#39;t reviewed yet. <br><br>Coffee - I was never a huge fan of the flavour of their house blend but it&#39;s not for lack of freshness or lack of skill in the barista. I&#39;ve had it several times and I get a bit tired of it but it&#39;s a consistently respectable cup. It&#39;s kinda dark and heavy and bold and seems more so than any of the house blends of the many 3rd wave coffee places I frequent. I enjoy the brighter, fruitier flavours with a bit more subtlety. Regardless, it&#39;s a decent cup consistently served. The steaming technique is good here so you get velvety layers in your flat whites and lattes etc. <br><br>Happily and recently, I found out that for no extra charge, you can request one of the other beans in the other grinders. Usually there are 2 others on &#34;tap&#34;. I&#39;ve had a single origin Tanzania and Lucky Bastard (which they recommend for flat whites) and enjoyed both. I also tried a single origin India one this week and it was good. Yay as this coffee joint is a really convenient location for me.<br><br>Food - They have really yummy bread here, my family and friends have remarked on this several times. I like the pepita (softer with some texture from nuts) and the sourdough (crusty and chewier crust). I enjoy that with an order of avocado - you get half, sprinkled with chilli flakes and served with lemon. <br><br>The pancakes also are unusually fluffy moist and tasty like they&#39;ve been made <br>with brown sugar. <br><br>The scrambled eggs here are perfectly done if you like the fluffy texture type with a touch of creaminess. Free range eggs used and the serving size is good.<br><br>A range of big mixed plates available - I&#39;ve tried the vegetarian one with haloumi cheese and the one with the beef cheeks, both were good if a touch greasy.<br><br>When I don&#39;t feel like having coffee, the fresh kale (mixed with apple and mint) juice is very popular and tastes good while making you feel virtuous. <br><br>Service is all smiles - friendly and professional. I heard from the staff that they are going to change the menu soon, I do think it&#39;s about time although please keep the bread, avocado and add some scones!<br><br>They also sell beans and coffee stuff. It&#39;s styled after Melbourne coffee places, and that&#39;s not surprising since the co-owner hails from there.

text: I had the Eggs Benedict. Was quite unique with the braised Ox Cheek. Loved it. Also had fresh squeezed orange juice and their cappuccino. Only knock on the place was the service. They forgot about us a few times and double ordered some items. Could be improved but food was yummy

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/W9JOy69s1DZ8iAdPmlI_gg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=V4TVZuh48t5v87PNVcSl5g&select=W9JOy69s1DZ8iAdPmlI_gg', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore. Mocha madness', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Mocha madness'}]
text: Hmmm.... This place has lots of potential. It&#39;s got a large enough space, so it doesn&#39;t feel cramped. The wait staff are suitable friendly and perky. And personable (yay). The vibe is too-cool-for-school, trendy, hip. Then why does it feel like something is off? <br><br>The prices. <br><br>The food is overpriced. For what I&#39;m paying, it should be better than its competitors who are selling the same things for less. The pancakes were...nice...not wow. The organic eggs Benedict with ox cheeks were nice, but at SGD25, it&#39;s not worth so much. I&#39;d pay less. The croissant Croque Monsieur (or was it Madame?) was dry and of course not cheap either. <br><br>I&#39;m overpaying for food that doesn&#39;t wow. The food doesn&#39;t suck, but it&#39;s not outstanding. At those prices. <br><br>Therein lies the crux of this place - are you willing to pay SGD35 for a brunch item with average coffee? If you just want the ambience, then by all means. Real foodies wouldn&#39;t visit this place often. Just sayin&#39;.

Comman man coffee but uncommon service and food!!  Fortunately we came early on Sunday morning.  Had the pancake, toast and croissant.  Full marks of taste, presentation and of course service.  Be back for sure

text: If you&#39;re yelping from Singapore you&#39;re probably American and pretty basic. Luckily so am I, and this place is effing delicious. Do yourself a favor and order the Turkish breakfast. But then please get some laksa later - you&#39;re in SINGAPORE.

text: Brunch here on a Sunday morning.  Good was solid, but incredibly disappointed with poor service.  After waiving down 2 servers to see if my wife&#39;s food was coming, and being promised that it was, our original server came back and said she never even placed the order.<br><br>When I spoke to the manager about this, she said she wasn&#39;t even aware that we had been waiting for half an hour.  <br><br>Not sure we would come back.

text: Stayed at a nearby hotel and went twice to this little gem for breakfast. They have amazing coffee, and the menu is delicious! The Turkish Common Man is a really great vegetarian option. The house-baked Cornbread is like a avocado toast on steroids and Brioche French Toast is huge! Great service and great atmosphere!

text: It&#39;s interesting how there are both lovers and haters of this place.  I&#39;m a lover for sure!<br><br>There&#39;s always a line during peak hours but it&#39;s totally worth it.  We had the Veggie Wonderland and Turkish Common Man, as well as flat whites for coffee.  Everything was as delicious as it looked, the ambiance and service were great and I&#39;ll be back again and again!

text: Love this place! Super pricey, but some things are extremely worth it. <br><br>My husband and I ordered the veggie wonderland *swoon* and my husband was happily surprised at how full he could get without eating meat! <br><br>I also ordered their &#34;uncommon man&#34; coffee which I picked off the menu. Amazing!

text: We left the UK last year and haven&#39;t had an &#39;English&#39; breakfast since. Nor have we had real bacon or sausages. So this was amazing. Probably one of the best full breakfasts we&#39;ve ever had. Anywhere. I will certainly be back. Well done!

A good brunch place, with a very hipsterish vibe, reminded me strongly of Portland! They take their coffee seriously and have some splendid brews which rotate regularly, definitely taste as many as u can. Brunch menu is good as well, huge portions so come with an appetite.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=ntlvfPzc8eglqvk92iDIAw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/PlekFUmxtLp__6JEDYOd2A/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/PlekFUmxtLp__6JEDYOd2A/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/PlekFUmxtLp__6JEDYOd2A/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/PlekFUmxtLp__6JEDYOd2A/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/PlekFUmxtLp__6JEDYOd2A/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/PlekFUmxtLp__6JEDYOd2A/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Rafael R.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'altText': 'Rafael R.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=ntlvfPzc8eglqvk92iDIAw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 50, 'photoCount': 77, 'reviewCount': 562, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Unlike CHSS and Nylon, Common Man Roasters patron base is made up of an unusually large number of Westerners, akin to dining at PF Changs in The States.  The expat crowd is decidedly CBD in neck knot style and a far cry from the &#34;hipster&#34; look that so many other reviewers comment on.<br><br>I prefer the more &#34;local&#34; atmosphere at Chye Seng Huat Hardware (CHSS), where there is a livelier vibe and coffee aficionados are actually speaking with one another rather than having their heads buried in a mobile device.<br><br>A large dining room welcomes guests to a full breakfast and lunch menu complete with creative and delicious dishes as well as wonderfully prepared coffee drinks.  Bonus points for the French glassware in which lattes are served, I had purchased these very same glasses at Merci in Paris last November.

Turkish Common Man...it was alright.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Turkish Common Man...it was alright.'}]
text: Fans of 40 Hands are bound to be fans of this place. Why? Same atmosphere and food. Well, not exactly the same food but the same normal type of breakfast. <br><br>They were rather strict on the lunch menu starts at 12:00 PM rule (why?!). My gf and I came at 11:30 and I wasn&#39;t very interested in the breakfast options. I didn&#39;t want eggs or toast.  I wasn&#39;t in the mood to pop out $12 for fruit either. At the end, I settled for the Turkish Commonman but wasn&#39;t too impressed. <br><br>Overall, this is not a bad place...the hippest joint at the moment, but I don&#39;t foresee it being so much longer. The coffee wasn&#39;t good...too sour and acidic! <br><br>SUM: Go once and don&#39;t come back.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/UCB0PL9OJDJKsYR-uDrvVg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=5jYUQDvJUMzprH095kIqYw&select=UCB0PL9OJDJKsYR-uDrvVg', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: What a space. The &#34;WOW&#34; effect hits you even before you enter. If you grew up in a neighbourhood with white lions outside the house, then this is nothing new. It&#39;s quite the same. It has two huge birds placed by the entrance. <br><br>The bar is spectacularly decorated with aeropress, drip filters and a dark horse like synesso. Everyone is sleek and well mannered. The staffs are extremely friendly and take the initiative to understand you and your dining experience. Spa Esprit persona score! <br><br>Food is very flavourful, fresh, and delicious. A friend and I came here for lunch. Our food came quickly but it was served separately. So we had to wait for each other&#39;s food to arrive. Both of us ordered salads which were very refreshing. <br><br>Coffee is good but I can&#39;t help to admit the ceramic cups are not meant for coffee drinkers like me. It is most preferredwith tea, but this is just personal. Nevertheless, the clay plates are amazingly beautiful which adds a whole new level to the dining experience. Have yet to return for desserts. But first, I need to save up. <br><br>This place is pricey for their food. Definitely setting a different scene and drawing the coffee crowd to a wider approach to appreciating caffeine and food.

A good brunch place, with a very hipsterish vibe, reminded me strongly of Portland! They take their coffee seriously and have some splendid brews which rotate regularly, definitely taste as many as u can. Brunch menu is good as well, huge portions so come with an appetite.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=AbfS_oXF8H6HJb5jFqhrLw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Paco G.', 'displayLocation': 'México, D.F., Mexico', 'altText': 'Paco G.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=AbfS_oXF8H6HJb5jFqhrLw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 44, 'photoCount': 22, 'reviewCount': 55, 'eliteYear': None}
text: This is the kind of place everybody recommends. I hadn&#39;t been there because they close a bit too early in the afternoon for my taste. We ended up going there for a Saturday breakfast, a little bit by accident. The place seemed packed but they managed to squeeze us at the bar, just beside the coffee machine. My first impression was that of a place with personality, with a specific atmosphere. It is not openly hipster, which is a relief, even for hipsters. It is more on the oldish-elegant style. The green granite bar works as a centrepiece and visual anchor to this 20th century styled place. It&#39;s like some of those big restaurants from the sixties or seventies, but with true charm, industrial touches and without the decadent, depressing look. It is lively and noisy. Sitting in front of the baristas, we noticed they didn&#39;t have a minute&#39;s rest while we were there. Service is fast and hectic, but precise and quite friendly.<br><br>I had the turkish breakfast which turned out to be a delight. The eggs were a tiny bit on the dry side, but still runny. The pita bread was fantastic. The whole dish was served with precision and the flavour combination (phyllo pastry, olives, fried feta, tomato and cucumber) was a welcome explosion. The coffee was good quality, almost (but not) on par with a certain joint I love on Everton Park. It was crisp and acid as I like it.<br><br>Prices are rather expensive for breakfast, that must be noted. It is not your everyday breakfast joint, it&#39;s more like a treat, so it&#39;s up to anyone to decide if it&#39;s worth the hype. They have another locale at the second floor that might be worth seeing. I think there&#39;s more to enjoy at Common Man, I&#39;ll go back to explore more of what they do.

text: HYPE. They&#39;re really lazy here, food came out cold, presumably pre cooked. Even a Denny&#39;s won&#39;t do that. Soggy bacon and pink undercooked sausage. Looks over substance. Mediocre coffee. Pleasant service. Expensive. Better places within walking distance.<br><br>Edit: I gave a 2 star at first but changing it to a 1 because when we asked them to heat up the sausage their first answer was &#34;that&#39;s how it&#39;s supposed to be here&#34;. No. SMH
Great coffee, great ambience, great service, great food!! Come early on the weekends, it gets packed!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/-sJePOSVKkOAwJ07CZK83g/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=u782m7T5KLaLlVFet256rg&select=-sJePOSVKkOAwJ07CZK83g', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore. Veggie Wonderland', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Veggie Wonderland'}]
text: The Veggie Wonderland was delicious. I adore grilled haloumi!  I&#39;m very happy to have found a healthy breakfast spot in my hood. <br><br>But...regardless of how popular a restaurant is, you should never have to wait 35 minutes for food. They should reconsider how many covers they can serve at once without hurting the diners overall impression.

I really wanted to like this place, a work colleague suggested it, and I had heard really good things about it.  I was brunching with a vegetarian friend, so it seemed like a good option.  Thankfully she got there right around 1115 on Sunday and beat a hell of a line that came in right after her.  The place isn&#39;t super big, and they have managed to squeeze every last table they can in there.  It is NOISY, and very hipster and trendy.  That part didn&#39;t bother me.  I ordered a latte, my friend had a kale juice (which was baby sized) and for my brunch I had the kale/egg white scramble.  She had the veggie platter.  Both weren&#39;t the most exciting options on the menu, but at $23+ I expected a hell of a lot more.  My plate was under seasoned, and just boring.  I had the option of adding chicken, but couldn&#39;t bring myself to spend $30 for chicken, kale and a $2 eggwhite.  Alcohol options are limited as well, so if you are looking for a boozy (I wasn&#39;t, at least not this time) brunch this is not your place.  Honestly I could have made my dish at home for $5.  I think my dining partner enjoyed hers, but it&#39;s veggies, how hard can it be?  My latte on the other hand was more like an espresso, there was no milk in it, and it was think like oil.  So strong, I actually had to choke it down just because I needed the caffeine kick.  Service started off strong, but then took about 15 minutes after our plates were cleared to get the bill, which I had to flag down our waitress for.  Total bill was about $61.  Highly unlikely I&#39;ll return with so many other dining options in the area.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=tieQ1FQ3BdXO7PjShPE28g', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Bern T.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Bern T.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=tieQ1FQ3BdXO7PjShPE28g', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 1, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 80, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Common Man Coffee Roasters (&#34;CMCR&#34;) is notoriously crowded, so if possible, avoid the peak brunch/lunch hours, or be prepared to wait in line. Even at 4pm in the afternoon on a weekend, the buzzy cafe was swarming with expats and their SPG-hanger-ons, and teenybopper/YA hipster sorts. Obviously, I didn&#39;t like the ambience. The pretentiousness was exacerbated by how intrusively close the tables were to one another. I could hear everything our neighbouring diners were chatting about.<br><br>At least the food and service were faultless. The breakfast eggs were innovative, hearty and delicious, while service was spontaneous and upbeat.<br><br>We had:<br><br>1) Organic Eggs Benedict ($24) layered with luscious braised ox cheeks, a velvety smooth chive hollandaise, toasted sourdough, and contrasted with the peppery kick of arugula leaves<br><br>2) Turkish Common Man Breakfast ($25) comprised a duo of phyllo-crusted soft-boiled organic eggs on a hummus bed, flecked with battered feta, olives, arugula, pickled cucumbers and fresh tomato slices, all ready to be mopped up by soft pita bread. I liked the bright and tangy flavours in this one.<br><br>3) Sauteed Kale &amp; Egg White Scramble ($19) tossed with snow peas, asparagus, broccoli, sweet potato leaves, seasoned with lemon zest crumbs and showered over with grated parmesan wisps. Light and healthy without compromising on taste

Common man full breakfast plus churro!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Common man full breakfast plus churro!'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/-ioVuFndOScjUIugS5_ZeQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=-3uFm2JZIV2DQA3lhfg5RQ&select=-ioVuFndOScjUIugS5_ZeQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore. Look at that! So pretty.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Look at that! So pretty.'}]
text: My friend took me here after we went to the Sea Aquarium. I&#39;ll just review the drinks here I guess.<br>The coffee (latte art) was really pretty. I still remember how they made the latte in front of you. I guess I was kinda new to latte art at that time. Besides, I remember the barista making pour over in the back of the counter. Love the whole atmosphere of this place too!

I liked the decor, but it was on the noisy side. It was packed, but we only waited for about 10 minutes around 11.30am on a Sunday. The queue was a bit longer when we left around 1. The running theme with the dishes seemed to be that everything was dry unfortunately. The service was quick.<br><br>Veggie Wonderland ($24) - 3 stars<br>Sauce please. Or get your eggs soft boiled.<br><br>Pancakes ($21) - 2.5 stars<br>Good flavor but very dry, and not many ingredients to go along with it. I had to ask for butter to go along with it, but it would probably have been better with yogurt or some sort of compote.<br><br>Eggs Benedict ($21)<br>Tried a bit of this - the eggs were excellent. The ox cheek was a little chewy.<br><br>Soy latte ($5) - 4 stars<br>No extra charge for soy! There&#39;re two shots in one glass, and no decaf option just a heads up.<br><br>The carpark right next door/under, off Arnasalam Chetty Road was expensive - $3/hour on weekends, and small! Tight corners.

One of the places I visit every time I am in Singapore and I was a bit surprised to find that I had forgotten to review it. They are located a few blocks from the water at Robertson Quay and it actually means that it feels much calmer despite this place always being popular.<br><br>They focus is of course on the coffee as they are a roaster and I often sample several of the different beans that they offer as filter coffees. One of the reasons I find myself a repeat visitor is that they are really good at rotating the selection and there are always at least four different single origins to select from. They are all nicely prepared and while I may not always like all of them the quality is consistently very good. The espresso based beverages are also very good but as I always say - rather have a good filter coffee.<br><br>The service is always friendly and even when sitting a bit hidden outside they ensure to check on you at regular intervals (which is not always the case at other places). They also serve very good food and pastries. My main objection here is not the quality as everything I had here as been good but rather that the prices are a bit steep. I do not really feel that I am getting value for money here but it is still not that bad as to stop me from coming here. I do however mainly come for the coffee and often do not even order any food.<br><br>They also do hold some workshops and coffee training sessions so the commitment to coffee is really clear. All in all one of the better coffee places in Singapore and well worth a visit.

text: I went there twice and not impressed, neither the coffee nor the ambience. Tables are too close to each other, you can&#39;t really enjoy the food. Coffee is weak too.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/KPRv8Z__oBQQarU-vQRtHw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=MBJ9psco8n8t-8CLVhg3sg&select=KPRv8Z__oBQQarU-vQRtHw', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore. $24', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': '$24'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/A9mJ5RdzdkvjUp5pCLo94A/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=MBJ9psco8n8t-8CLVhg3sg&select=A9mJ5RdzdkvjUp5pCLo94A', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore. Turkish Common Man Breakfast', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Turkish Common Man Breakfast'}]
text: Every time i tried to go here for brunch, there would be a line snaking out the front door. Every. time.<br><br>Finally we smartened up one day and made our way down here at 11am. No line yet, but the place was already full and we were seated on the bar. Not a real problem since there were only two of us.<br><br>I immediately zero-ed in on the Turkish Common Man Breakfast ($25) - i knew i would love that stuff. My breakfast companion went with the Vegetarian brunch, which is my second option bc they have grilled haloumi and i cant say no that. We each also got a cup of the black coffee.<br><br>Verdict? Loved it. They&#39;re not your typical brunch dishes yet still tasty and filling. That crispy feta is freakin delicious and the egg wrapped in some crispy stuff (forgot what it was) is something i&#39;ve never seen before. Had a few bites of the vegetarian brunch too and it was equally delicious. Coffee was good too!<br><br>Can&#39;t fault this place. I also spotted churros in the dessert menu, but was way too full after my main dish. Will definitely come back once the crowd has settled down.. If they ever will. The line was already snaking out the door again when we left right around noon.

Brunch, and there is a line. Equally good sign and annoying. Getting seated was quicker than expected, though, and I was very sure the Eggs Benedict I had chosen were the best things possible.<br><br>Until I tried the green pea fritters; holy moly.<br><br>Super churros, too. And spotless coffee, but they&#39;re roasters, so it better be.<br><br>All thumbs up.
Great coffee and exquisite breakfast! We stopped in Singapore on a layover to Thailand &amp; found this place on Yelp. I&#39;m so glad I did! This is a MUST TRY for coffee...

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=Xd8dPasNWNiy28rtqksD-g', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/KJ3ACGjFWzsDm-ID3Jx3BQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/KJ3ACGjFWzsDm-ID3Jx3BQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/KJ3ACGjFWzsDm-ID3Jx3BQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/KJ3ACGjFWzsDm-ID3Jx3BQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/KJ3ACGjFWzsDm-ID3Jx3BQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/KJ3ACGjFWzsDm-ID3Jx3BQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Vanessa N.', 'displayLocation': 'Los Angeles, CA', 'altText': 'Vanessa N.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=Xd8dPasNWNiy28rtqksD-g', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 339, 'photoCount': 216, 'reviewCount': 141, 'eliteYear': None}
text: This place is awesome! (especially when it&#39;s within walking distance from home)<br><br>The decor is really chic. Huge glass windows = perfect for people watching.<br><br>I&#39;ve only had their coffee so no comment on the food - maybe next time. Soy latte was smooth and rich. <br><br>The only minus is the uncomfortable chair designed with a steel bar instead of an actual back. AC is a little too strong - but that&#39;s everywhere in Singapore.

A place for kopi and you tiao... NOT. Okay, I was half kidding. I ordered their western hemisphere equivalents, a pour-over coffee and churros. They&#39;re not half bad, really. But I found their churros really small for S$12. Really? Nothing&#39;s exotic about the flour and sugar that goes into these things. These are USD$1 a piece, and even less for 10 pesos in Mexico.<br><br>I also purchased a pack of their whole beans for brewing at home, it was okay but not really worth the price premium.<br><br>The dark furniture, funky interior and custom ceramic cups added to the hipster vibe. Cool hangout spot, a place to see and be seen. However, pricing-wise, everything is still a little steep. Maybe next time.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=AbfS_oXF8H6HJb5jFqhrLw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/7U3-fksAWs4oUiRlgmPGzg/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Paco G.', 'displayLocation': 'México, D.F., Mexico', 'altText': 'Paco G.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=AbfS_oXF8H6HJb5jFqhrLw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 44, 'photoCount': 22, 'reviewCount': 55, 'eliteYear': None}
text: This is the kind of place everybody recommends. I hadn&#39;t been there because they close a bit too early in the afternoon for my taste. We ended up going there for a Saturday breakfast, a little bit by accident. The place seemed packed but they managed to squeeze us at the bar, just beside the coffee machine. My first impression was that of a place with personality, with a specific atmosphere. It is not openly hipster, which is a relief, even for hipsters. It is more on the oldish-elegant style. The green granite bar works as a centrepiece and visual anchor to this 20th century styled place. It&#39;s like some of those big restaurants from the sixties or seventies, but with true charm, industrial touches and without the decadent, depressing look. It is lively and noisy. Sitting in front of the baristas, we noticed they didn&#39;t have a minute&#39;s rest while we were there. Service is fast and hectic, but precise and quite friendly.<br><br>I had the turkish breakfast which turned out to be a delight. The eggs were a tiny bit on the dry side, but still runny. The pita bread was fantastic. The whole dish was served with precision and the flavour combination (phyllo pastry, olives, fried feta, tomato and cucumber) was a welcome explosion. The coffee was good quality, almost (but not) on par with a certain joint I love on Everton Park. It was crisp and acid as I like it.<br><br>Prices are rather expensive for breakfast, that must be noted. It is not your everyday breakfast joint, it&#39;s more like a treat, so it&#39;s up to anyone to decide if it&#39;s worth the hype. They have another locale at the second floor that might be worth seeing. I think there&#39;s more to enjoy at Common Man, I&#39;ll go back to explore more of what they do.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=6uc31FT2HXbXpAbSE0xCtw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/-CZAtY7Ntg1ePLczJMMLtw/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/-CZAtY7Ntg1ePLczJMMLtw/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/-CZAtY7Ntg1ePLczJMMLtw/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/-CZAtY7Ntg1ePLczJMMLtw/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/-CZAtY7Ntg1ePLczJMMLtw/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/-CZAtY7Ntg1ePLczJMMLtw/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Taber M.', 'displayLocation': 'Manhattan Beach, CA', 'altText': 'Taber M.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=6uc31FT2HXbXpAbSE0xCtw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 387, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 6, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Amazing breakfast!  Had the kale and eggs and waffles.  Delicious!  A bit pricey for breakfast but worth it.
Nice trendy place with great coffee. I did not eat here but all of the food I am seeing brought to the tables around me looks fabulous.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=MTQAGVEdfXjvFRPwsqvnlQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/rVCG0eh2p3R6rPX57-ijGw/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/rVCG0eh2p3R6rPX57-ijGw/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/rVCG0eh2p3R6rPX57-ijGw/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/rVCG0eh2p3R6rPX57-ijGw/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/rVCG0eh2p3R6rPX57-ijGw/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/rVCG0eh2p3R6rPX57-ijGw/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Claire H.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Claire H.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=MTQAGVEdfXjvFRPwsqvnlQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 19, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 52, 'eliteYear': None}
text: This review is long overdue, especially given my below average experience.<br><br>Let&#39;s start with the good...<br>1. The space is great and you can&#39;t deny the wow factor as soon as you walk in the door<br>2. The coffee is decent<br><br>Ok now on to my experience... firstly, this place is pricey. Think Sydney prices, which would be acceptable if we lived in Sydney (and even then I don&#39;t think the food is of the same quality). Secondly, I ordered a takeaway flat white here once before, but I may as well have sat in because no one served me until I looked for a waitress (there were people behind the counter but completely distracted) and then it took 15 minutes for a take away coffee? What the.<br><br>I could have let this all go IF I&#39;d had a good food experience.<br><br>But I didn&#39;t.<br><br>One hungover Sunday I thought the burger would be a good idea. It was actually a very bad idea given the burger that turned up on my plate was RAW. Not rare, but raw. I sliced through the middle of my burger, super excited to have that first big messy bite but the inside was cold and, I&#39;ll say it again, raw. I had to fight a reflex retch motion... <br><br>Slightly embarassed (as was dining with &#39;new friends&#39;), I waved down a waiter who took it back to the kitchen to be re-cooked (no apology?). In the meantime, my dining companions all finished their meals, I filled up on the fries, and I then had to conspicuously eat my returned burger (where both halves of the meat patty had been recooked and reserved) in front of everyone... my appetite was well and truly over and  I wouldn&#39;t have even finished half of it - not an ideal outcome especially given the burger is a steep $28!<br><br>When paying the bill, I was asked how the meal was? Of course I gave my opinion (tactfully of course) but was told the burger is usually served medium... if that was the case, why was I not given a refund? With juice and coffee, the bill added up to $44 per person (insert &#34;whistle noise&#34; here). <br><br>OK rant over, I&#39;ll just vote with my feet next time and suggest elsewhere.

Common Man Coffee Roasters has been creating waves on the coffee scene. Well, with the partnership of indie coffee father Harry Grover of 40 Hands, Australia&#39;s Five Senses Coffee and the lifestyle conglomerate Spa Spirit Group, it is no wonder why and how CMCR is drawing in the crowd.<br><br>Located at 22 Martin Road, Common Man Coffee Roasters join the many artisan coffee shops e.g. Kith Cafe, Toby&#39;s Estate, Smitten in the Robertson enclave to provide us, brunch hungry Singaporeans with a reason to wake early on weekends. Be prepared to wait for your table but be thankful that breakfast doesn&#39;t run out because they serve an All Day Breakfast menu. <br><br>The decor and vibe is very Aussie. I like the cool bar seats which plays with varying heights. And those spotlights sure do make me feel like i&#39;m on Broadway.<br><br>I can&#39;t help but notice the sign behind the bar that says &#34;Free Coffee and Doughnuts for the Unemployed&#34;. Well i don&#39;t see any doughnuts on the menu and you definitely would be paying an arm or leg for the pricey food that is served at CMCR. Really there is nothing Common Man about the prices. I mean god.. what did eggs become so expensive in Singapore?<br><br>Ignoring the little dishes for breakfast, the heartier options like the Common Man Full Breakfast, Turkish CM Breakfast are all in the mid 20s range. I have no qualms with spending 30 bucks on brunch with coffee but even i am feeling the pinch here. Expect higher prices for the lunch menu. Desserts also go at a whooping $12.<br><br>Organic Eggs Benedict ($24) with two poached eggs on top of tender braised ox cheeks and lightly toasted artisanal sourdough toast. This has been raved about by many. Well, at least it is a fresh take on the typical (but always satisfying) Eggs Ben.<br><br>The meat was very tender, the eggs flawlessly poached and the hollandaise sauce was rich and creamy in terms of texture. Everything felt rich i.e. on the oily side but it was a bland dish. I was expecting the braised ox cheeks to be more umami but it was just meaty. The hollandaise also lacked the tangy citrus taste. The richness of the dish was a little discomforting towards the end of the meal so it was a good thing that the portion is small?<br><br>My Mocha ($6) was stellar. W judges V and i and anyone who orders mocha because he feels that it conceals the quality of the coffee with the cloying sweetness from the chocolate. However, this mocha was nicely perfumed with the intense chocolate aroma and i thought it enhanced the flavor of the smooth coffee.<br><br>Common Man Coffee Roasters isn&#39;t for the common man but it&#39;s ok to indulge in an expensive plate of eggs once in a while i guess.

I love this place and their food. Their common man breakfast is amazing- the beans are delicious (yes, the beans!). The potato, tomatoes, bread and eggs are yummy. The meat is just okay though, not a fan of the sausage. But its worth it juts for the beans (seriously). <br><br>Have also tried their muesli and yogurt, pretty good- very nutty. <br><br>The churros are also amazing! Dipped in chocolate goodness. They should give you a bigger portion of chocolate though.

text: A great selection of high grade coffees prepared professionally. Espresso and manual brew options available. I also tried the breakfast menu, the beans were excellent - many other dishes served near by looked equally good. Thoroughly recommended.

Love the feel of this place and the food is great - although that might be a personal taste. If you like organic feeling food with veg, grains and nuts, you will enjoy the food. The coffee and tea is a definite yes though.
Great coffee, great ambience, great service, great food!! Come early on the weekends, it gets packed!

text: The organic eggs Benedict was life changing! The absolute best I&#39;ve had, I wish they made them like this back in the US! The meat, the eggs, the sauce, the bread all perfect. As for the cafe mocha, I&#39;m a better human being for drinking that, absolutely perfect.

text: Very western. Don&#39;t expect to be able to buy a nice cup of kopi here. The iced coffee was on point. The Nitro cold brew was super smooth and simply excellent. The ambiance is beautiful. Very well decorated. Great staff. Used this place as my office for the day. Thank you.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=CF4REDiT3YX4h2MDpj9t4w', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/BOyBUaW4Nt2GhADcOBZZoQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/BOyBUaW4Nt2GhADcOBZZoQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/BOyBUaW4Nt2GhADcOBZZoQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/BOyBUaW4Nt2GhADcOBZZoQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/BOyBUaW4Nt2GhADcOBZZoQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/BOyBUaW4Nt2GhADcOBZZoQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Calista T.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'altText': 'Calista T.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=CF4REDiT3YX4h2MDpj9t4w', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 391, 'photoCount': 3, 'reviewCount': 8, 'eliteYear': None}
text: My friend raved about Common Man so much he ended up bringing me here for brunch. Honestly, I hardly eat pancakes in cafes like these but their pancakes (I forgot the name) with fruit crumbles were sooo good, fluffy and filling! Churros were exquisite too. Also for this weekend (Oct 1st and 2nd) they&#39;ll be having Almond Macadamia Mlk by The Mlk Co upstairs on Grounded to drink with your coffee. CAN&#39;T WAIT!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=dcnDXg85cM1izTQYgAnTMg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Craig M.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Craig M.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=dcnDXg85cM1izTQYgAnTMg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 42, 'photoCount': 1, 'reviewCount': 16, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Delicious coffee and fresh, quality meals, but be prepared to queue up if you come during peak periods. Due to its open concept layout and tiled surfaces, this venue can become quite noisy when many patrons are present. Not ideal for working on your laptop - perhaps bring headphones if you plan to get anything done.

I went for lunch, not breakfast like most other reviewers.<br><br>The venue is great and i really liked their filter press coffee.<br><br>The service is average by Singaporean standards (read rushed and un-attentive -- they brought me a sandwich with no napkins, and i had to ask for those; fries with no ketchup, and i also had to ask for that...)<br><br>The disappointing part was the food.  I ordered a pulled pork sandwich.  When it came, it was dripping liquid from the meat, so much that within 30 secs the brioche bun was totally soggy and started falling apart.  Really hard to eat it...  when I finished, the plate it came in had a half cup of liquid in it.  Never had a pulled pork sandwich like this.<br><br>Here is the kicker:  false advertisement! :-)  The &#34;free coffee and doughnut for unemployed&#34; claim in big cubic characters over the bar is not true.  When i asked about this, i was told is &#34;just a reminder&#34;  Of what?  Well, perhaps of the fact that if you are unemployed you should stay away.  I spent $40 for lunch, for a sandwich and a coffee!

text: This place does the best flat white! Their granola with yogurt and fresh fruit is delicious too but they are quite pricey. Two flat whites and one granola bowl around $30

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/rKnYHgdXGFwSxd46EvE0hQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=Bsz740kMGNcdzBPGP9z8sQ&select=rKnYHgdXGFwSxd46EvE0hQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore. Full English Breakfast', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Full English Breakfast'}]
text: This is a good place for meet for breakfast before work (though at these prices, probably more of a &#34;special occasion&#34; type breakfast rather than a regular one!). I had visited at 8am on a weekday and it was practically empty - just us and another table.<br><br>I had the full english breakfast which was a mixed bag. The scrambled eggs were decent and the baked beans, mushrooms and spinach were good. <br><br>The bacon... let&#39;s talk about bacon. Bacon is very important (I think we all agree). And even though overall I enjoyed my meal at Common Man Coffee Roasters, I have to say this is possibly the first time I&#39;ve met a strip of bacon that I did not like. I have no idea how it was cooked (in the oven?) but it was dry and brittle and not particularly tasty. Which is kind of tragic for bacon.<br><br>Service staff were nice and friendly though not very attentive, I have to say. With hardly any customers, they were sort of just drifting around at the edges of the cafe and not really looking at customers, which made flagging them down a challenge.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=-G1YjYxjDpxOBzFgo36ORA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'T J.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'T J.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=-G1YjYxjDpxOBzFgo36ORA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 24, 'eliteYear': None}
text: For the high cost of a nice environment, here you get cramped tables, uncomfortable stool chairs, and the usual River Valley crowds.  It&#39;s yet another place for coffee snobs than for a nice casual and affordable breakfast or brunch.<br><br>I&#39;ll take simple and affordable any day over high-end looks and coffee. Like Italian food, breakfast does not need to be expensive. Any diner in the US does it better, cheaper, friendlier, faster, and with more options, than anywhere I&#39;ve seen in Singapore. <br><br>They do have good service and good quality eggs.  The saltiness and olive oil on the eggs killed the taste for me, to where I struggled to eat them; our waitress dismissed my dissatisfaction as they being &#34;healthy&#34; that way. A Big No for future patronage.<br><br>French toast was a bit small for $18.<br><br>Warning: For those who don&#39;t like added oil on your eggs, be sure to specify without; <br><br>I see it like pepper - don&#39;t put it on people&#39;s food unless you ask them first, mention it on the menu, and better yet, rather than serve it with, have it on the table for the customer to do for themselves. <br><br>I originally gave it a high three stars for the overall quality of ingredients and atmosphere, but revised it to two (because there is no 2.5 option) as in reality, we have not been back since this visit months ago in favour of other places, and are not likely to return except out of boredom of our regular brunch places.

text: a little expensive for its food menu but then again the menu is unique and different than other coffee place in singapore.<br>they spent a lot for the decor which is a great place for catching up with friends and just hang around.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=UClvWBH5ucO5l3tA39vVwg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Elliot L.', 'displayLocation': 'Los Angeles, CA', 'altText': 'Elliot L.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=UClvWBH5ucO5l3tA39vVwg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 3, 'photoCount': 8, 'reviewCount': 11, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Let me start by saying.. I love this place.  <br><br>Its one of the best coffee and western breakfast places in Singapore <br>(regardless of the bar being set pretty low).<br><br>Everything I&#39;ve tired here, I love.  <br>The food is great.  <br>The layout &amp; ambience is great.. <br>I love walking in, every time..<br><br>All that aside, here&#39;s where you can improve..  <br>God knows there&#39;s room.<br><br>The service here has been mixed.. To say the least..<br>Whenever we&#39;ve been hosted by Casey, its been super efficient, knowledgeable and smooth.<br>Unfortunately- there&#39;s other people who work there.<br><br>Dishes NEVER seem to be able to be brought out together..   EVER. <br>If I am coming out for lunch/breakfast with people- I actually want to EAT lunch/breakfast with people..  <br>Not sit there- with half the table with plates of food getting cold waiting for the rest to come out.<br><br>Normal etiquette is to not start eating until everyone is served..  <br>Especially in western countries.  <br>So why the f**k do half of my group consistently have to wait sometimes 10-15 mins for their food to come out after the first plates are laid on our table (getting cold)??<br><br>I&#39;ve brought this up when ordering and been met with &#39;the chef will try&#39;...<br><br>Sorry.   Not good enough.<br>Being a good chef- and running a good kitchen- isn&#39;t just about the quality of food coming out of it.  Its about TIMING as well.<br>Time the orders so everything comes out together.<br>This is your job.  <br>If you can&#39;t do this- f**k back off to whatever hawker stall you were working in before landing a job at Common man.<br><br>Even when the last dishes come out- (like today, 15 mins after the first ones)- somehow half the stuff on the plate is barely warm..<br><br>How does this happen?  <br>What do I do?  <br>Send it back again- and have the 2 dishes served some 15 mins ago turn from luke warm to stone cold? while mine is cooked from scratch again?<br><br>This all goes back to timing..  <br>There is something seriously wrong happening in that kitchen that needs to be addressed...<br><br>Apart from timing- there&#39;s also an issue of how knowledgable the staff are on coffee and coffee blends..<br>This isn&#39;t a normal cafe.. For gods sake- this is a serious roasters, importing raw beans from around the world and roasting on site..  <br>I expect the staff to understand the difference between the blends, and talk a customer through.. Especially if you&#39;re charging upwards of $6 a cup..<br>Usually- when asking staff about the blends of the day- I am handed some scrunched up piece of paper out of their top pocket with a print out of the blends currently being served.. Thanks for the insight..  <br><br>Common Man..  Don&#39;t get me wrong.  You are my &#39;go to&#39; brunch place.  <br>You have the crowds- you have the momentum.. <br>But with that, please don&#39;t become complacent..  <br>The customers you are serving to are fickle.<br>You are verging on the edge of being a &#39;pretty good&#39; place to a great place- but just aren&#39;t there yet.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=3g_vgaCNlvR5uKmUkSz8Rw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QOsELxONsDJD_q1qVI646A/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QOsELxONsDJD_q1qVI646A/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QOsELxONsDJD_q1qVI646A/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QOsELxONsDJD_q1qVI646A/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QOsELxONsDJD_q1qVI646A/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QOsELxONsDJD_q1qVI646A/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Debbie T.', 'displayLocation': 'East Bay, CA', 'altText': 'Debbie T.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=3g_vgaCNlvR5uKmUkSz8Rw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 361, 'photoCount': 670, 'reviewCount': 443, 'eliteYear': None}
photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/9fSoknpEUOVKbaoUxlSPCw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=zFq7pGbuIhJXbm0ayirBdA&select=9fSoknpEUOVKbaoUxlSPCw', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore. Turkish Common Man...it was alright.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Turkish Common Man...it was alright.'}]
text: Fans of 40 Hands are bound to be fans of this place. Why? Same atmosphere and food. Well, not exactly the same food but the same normal type of breakfast. <br><br>They were rather strict on the lunch menu starts at 12:00 PM rule (why?!). My gf and I came at 11:30 and I wasn&#39;t very interested in the breakfast options. I didn&#39;t want eggs or toast.  I wasn&#39;t in the mood to pop out $12 for fruit either. At the end, I settled for the Turkish Commonman but wasn&#39;t too impressed. <br><br>Overall, this is not a bad place...the hippest joint at the moment, but I don&#39;t foresee it being so much longer. The coffee wasn&#39;t good...too sour and acidic! <br><br>SUM: Go once and don&#39;t come back.

Common Man Coffee Roasters has been creating waves on the coffee scene. Well, with the partnership of indie coffee father Harry Grover of 40 Hands, Australia&#39;s Five Senses Coffee and the lifestyle conglomerate Spa Spirit Group, it is no wonder why and how CMCR is drawing in the crowd.<br><br>Located at 22 Martin Road, Common Man Coffee Roasters join the many artisan coffee shops e.g. Kith Cafe, Toby&#39;s Estate, Smitten in the Robertson enclave to provide us, brunch hungry Singaporeans with a reason to wake early on weekends. Be prepared to wait for your table but be thankful that breakfast doesn&#39;t run out because they serve an All Day Breakfast menu. <br><br>The decor and vibe is very Aussie. I like the cool bar seats which plays with varying heights. And those spotlights sure do make me feel like i&#39;m on Broadway.<br><br>I can&#39;t help but notice the sign behind the bar that says &#34;Free Coffee and Doughnuts for the Unemployed&#34;. Well i don&#39;t see any doughnuts on the menu and you definitely would be paying an arm or leg for the pricey food that is served at CMCR. Really there is nothing Common Man about the prices. I mean god.. what did eggs become so expensive in Singapore?<br><br>Ignoring the little dishes for breakfast, the heartier options like the Common Man Full Breakfast, Turkish CM Breakfast are all in the mid 20s range. I have no qualms with spending 30 bucks on brunch with coffee but even i am feeling the pinch here. Expect higher prices for the lunch menu. Desserts also go at a whooping $12.<br><br>Organic Eggs Benedict ($24) with two poached eggs on top of tender braised ox cheeks and lightly toasted artisanal sourdough toast. This has been raved about by many. Well, at least it is a fresh take on the typical (but always satisfying) Eggs Ben.<br><br>The meat was very tender, the eggs flawlessly poached and the hollandaise sauce was rich and creamy in terms of texture. Everything felt rich i.e. on the oily side but it was a bland dish. I was expecting the braised ox cheeks to be more umami but it was just meaty. The hollandaise also lacked the tangy citrus taste. The richness of the dish was a little discomforting towards the end of the meal so it was a good thing that the portion is small?<br><br>My Mocha ($6) was stellar. W judges V and i and anyone who orders mocha because he feels that it conceals the quality of the coffee with the cloying sweetness from the chocolate. However, this mocha was nicely perfumed with the intense chocolate aroma and i thought it enhanced the flavor of the smooth coffee.<br><br>Common Man Coffee Roasters isn&#39;t for the common man but it&#39;s ok to indulge in an expensive plate of eggs once in a while i guess.

I went for lunch, not breakfast like most other reviewers.<br><br>The venue is great and i really liked their filter press coffee.<br><br>The service is average by Singaporean standards (read rushed and un-attentive -- they brought me a sandwich with no napkins, and i had to ask for those; fries with no ketchup, and i also had to ask for that...)<br><br>The disappointing part was the food.  I ordered a pulled pork sandwich.  When it came, it was dripping liquid from the meat, so much that within 30 secs the brioche bun was totally soggy and started falling apart.  Really hard to eat it...  when I finished, the plate it came in had a half cup of liquid in it.  Never had a pulled pork sandwich like this.<br><br>Here is the kicker:  false advertisement! :-)  The &#34;free coffee and doughnut for unemployed&#34; claim in big cubic characters over the bar is not true.  When i asked about this, i was told is &#34;just a reminder&#34;  Of what?  Well, perhaps of the fact that if you are unemployed you should stay away.  I spent $40 for lunch, for a sandwich and a coffee!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/KPRv8Z__oBQQarU-vQRtHw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=MBJ9psco8n8t-8CLVhg3sg&select=KPRv8Z__oBQQarU-vQRtHw', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore. $24', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': '$24'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/A9mJ5RdzdkvjUp5pCLo94A/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/common-man-coffee-roasters-singapore?reviewid=MBJ9psco8n8t-8CLVhg3sg&select=A9mJ5RdzdkvjUp5pCLo94A', 'altText': 'Photo of Common Man Coffee Roasters - Singapore, Singapore. Turkish Common Man Breakfast', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Turkish Common Man Breakfast'}]
text: Every time i tried to go here for brunch, there would be a line snaking out the front door. Every. time.<br><br>Finally we smartened up one day and made our way down here at 11am. No line yet, but the place was already full and we were seated on the bar. Not a real problem since there were only two of us.<br><br>I immediately zero-ed in on the Turkish Common Man Breakfast ($25) - i knew i would love that stuff. My breakfast companion went with the Vegetarian brunch, which is my second option bc they have grilled haloumi and i cant say no that. We each also got a cup of the black coffee.<br><br>Verdict? Loved it. They&#39;re not your typical brunch dishes yet still tasty and filling. That crispy feta is freakin delicious and the egg wrapped in some crispy stuff (forgot what it was) is something i&#39;ve never seen before. Had a few bites of the vegetarian brunch too and it was equally delicious. Coffee was good too!<br><br>Can&#39;t fault this place. I also spotted churros in the dessert menu, but was way too full after my main dish. Will definitely come back once the crowd has settled down.. If they ever will. The line was already snaking out the door again when we left right around noon.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=zWvA1Zc4sRv0DuDJb9g32Q', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'R C.', 'displayLocation': 'Washington, DC', 'altText': 'R C.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=zWvA1Zc4sRv0DuDJb9g32Q', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 5, 'photoCount': 2, 'reviewCount': 25, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Loved the slick deco design and atmosphere. It&#39;s buzzy for weekend brunch. Priced relatively high but you get quite a bit of bang for your buck spread around all the different items in a dish. The Turkish breakfast was the standout because of the egg wrapped in strands of filo and fried -- amazing looking! I was pleasantly surprised by the number of veg breakfast options. <br><br>Service was a little slow and haphazard at times -- par for the course. The staff, however, is charming through the gaffes.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=9ymgI3qzaHlHO-vimNaOQg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Irene W.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Irene W.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=9ymgI3qzaHlHO-vimNaOQg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 48, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 49, 'eliteYear': None}
text: This is probably now one of my go-to places for weekend brunch and coffee.  The service is friendly and just attentive enough by Singapore standards, and the coffee is excellent.  The place isn&#39;t cheap, but I love the emphasis on organic, free-range ingredients and many menu items that you don&#39;t typically see in Singapore like green pea fritters and quinoa salads.  You can also really see the difference in the coloration and consistency of the eggs.  There aren&#39;t too many places around town where you can these kinds of ingredients on the menu, much less cooked up to this standard.  The place also has a nice communal ambiance which I like, but most importantly it&#39;s got style and substance.  Given how busy it gets on the weekends it&#39;s maybe not the type of cafe to linger with your book/laptop but it definitely a reliable place for an excellent breakfast/lunch and coffee.

Chocolate &amp; Almond Croissant with a Latte', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Chocolate & Almond Croissant with a Latte'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/fn7dlrVDoqvLxJy8IP0FIQ/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/craftsmen-specialty-coffee-singapore-4?reviewid=uQNV4x5XeWCNxKFvsHrohQ&select=fn7dlrVDoqvLxJy8IP0FIQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Craftsmen Specialty Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. One of the best burgers and some of the better fries I&#39;ve had in my life.', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': "One of the best burgers and some of the better fries I've had in my life."}]
text: Dear lord this place is amazing. <br><br>I came in with an appetite only really looking for some espresso and a pastry. Come to find out they have a full fledged menu of breakfast and lunch items so I decided to get a burger and fries followed by my latte and a pastry. <br><br>First off, the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. I used the wrong credit card and rather than just saying sorry, the staff took the time to reverse my charge and make sure everything was right. Second, I ordered a burger and was planning to get my latte later but they allowed me to order all at the same time so I could jump to the head of the line when I went to order my latte. The burger and fries were phenomenal then the latte and chocolate &amp; almond croissant I got afterwards were spectacular. <br><br>I can&#39;t recommend this place highly enough. I will definitely be going by there again, at least once more before I leave and any time I come back.
