Salted egg yolk fries 5/5. Large portion and served piping hot', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Salted egg yolk fries 5/5. Large portion and served piping hot'}]
text: Stumbled upon this restaurant at 10pm on a Friday night and luckily they had a table open. We ordered the white wine shrimp angel hair pasta, Hawaiian pizza, and salted egg yolk fries. The pasta was al dente and had the perfect amount of seasoning and flavour. The salted egg yolk fries were highly addictive and served piping hot. The portion sizes are very generous and well worth the money. To top it all off, we got a promo for 20% off all food items. As I write this review the morning after, I am contemplating returning to get a box of take-out fries to eat at Sentosa Island.

text: Wonderful espresso! Had a double shot this morning. Very tasty. I waited perhaps 5 minutes after ordering, so turnaround was good. I enjoyed it inside at a table. There are many windows so it&#39;s got a lot of nice ambient light. Would definitely recommend any of their branches for good espresso.

text: The Coffee Academics is located on B-1 of the Raffles City. <br><br>They have a coffee menu consisting of a lot of pour over options, which they call hand crafted coffee, and espresso based drinks. I ordered the JWF Blend pour over using beans from Kenya. Very light flavor profile, but good.<br><br>In addition to coffee, they also have a menu with food. I wasn&#39;t super hungry but couldn&#39;t resist a piece of pecan pie. The pie was delicious.

text: My daughter insisted I try this place. I had ricotta pancakes with caramelized bananas and espresso butter. I added the sausage. It was good. The cruffins- cross between croissants and muffin - unusual with somewhat flaky bread like texture. Quite good but personally I prefer the cronut texture.

This is one of my fave places to grab a coffee when at raffles city. The coffee is good and there&#39;s the usual types as well as unusual coffee types for the adventurous. We tried two of the chill box cakes. Ondeh ondeh as well as chocolate mousse. The former was the last piece and I was worried it would be dry. Glad that it was not and it was really yummy. The pandan chiffon had good flavor and was soft and bouncy. The Gula melaka coconut filling was sweet and the small layer of cream helped to balance that. The chocolate cake had a thick crunchy layer at the bottom, adding a nice crunchy texture. Nothing really outstanding or unique but both well executed. Nice pairing with tea or coffee!

text: Very good pour over. Awesome iced tea. I didn&#39;t have any food, but the fish tacos and some hotdog abomination looked great!

text: Just had coffees here but service was great and coffees delicious. Many choices in underground mall below Stamford hotel but this is one of the best for coffee. Pay at the register.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/mBc2Dj8tdA1vBTvkSzplyQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-coffee-academics-singapore-3?reviewid=ldsv0MVStnoIZzb9N-OyFw&select=mBc2Dj8tdA1vBTvkSzplyQ', 'altText': 'Photo of The Coffee Academics - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: Amazing. Wish they would come to USA. Best coffee I&#39;ve had. Great craft brew selection.

Worst mocha I ever tasted!!! Tried the egglet because they are from Hong Kong and I thought that it must be good. Sorely disappointed by it as it was cold and hard when it arrived, the milk tea icecream was too buttery. The service by the staff here have lots to improve on as they were bordering on rude. Skip this place at all costs unless u are here to takeaway a flat white which is the only saving grace out of this meal. To be fair, the decor and atmosphere is pretty good but that is to be expected at any cafes.

text: located in the middle dining area of raffles city and popular brand in HK as well.  nice for meetups and good espresso.

text: The cappuccino was served just the way I like it! Not only was the latte art adorable, but it also had a nice balanced flavor. <br><br>The red velvet cake was a bit disappointing as the cake was rather dry.<br><br>Note: there is no wi-fi at this cafe!

text: Quite a central location at Novena although slightly off the beaten track as it&#39;s at Goldhill Plaza rather than within the malls. Relaxed ambience with good value for money breakfast and sandwiches. I had the lychee mint tee because it was a hot day-that was a disappointing small glass which barely quenched my thirst. Maybe I should have ordered coffee.

text: One word &#34;Yum&#34;. Greeted with warm welcome smiles and Good mornings. Very attractive and service is fast. I ordered the waffles and opp out on the bacon (no  please) with scramble eggs and a ice chai tea . EVERYTHING was amazing 5&#39;s for sure. Great American breakfast away from home

text: A delightful spot for coffee and/or bite to eat. Although the table we sat in was quite deep so chatting during busy times can be a little difficult. Excellent sandwich choices and All-Day-Brunch is always nice in my book! Missed it initially on the menu but eyed the Truffle Tater Tots on they way out. Will have to come back and try some, and also check out their specialty coffee drinks. Right outside the Novena MRT station exit (United Square exit).

Berry bliss smoothie bowl', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Berry bliss smoothie bowl'}]
text: Atmosphere is bright and inviting. Service was polite but seemed very new to the game. Very clean and so good to have a place with an included toilet facility so we don&#39;t need to walk outside or around. Food and coffee was okay. The berry bliss was nice. Would reorder that again when looking for something refreshing and light. It was served in a coconut shell which was different and the ice was very well blended so must be a good gadget making it so smooth. Coffee was satisfactory. Glad we tried it but next time I&#39;d be eager to see what else is down the road.

text: This cafe is new to the area. Makes a tasty flat white (5 Oz white coffee) and you are sure to find something tasty from the brunch selection. The decor is funky, with book shelves made out of packing crates, and artwork for sale on the walls. Help yourself to fresh chilled water. <br><br>My avocado BLT plus flat white cost around $14. The brunch menu includes typical staples like eggs benny, full English, waffles, and there is a cabinet full of delicious looking cakes for those with a sweet tooth. <br><br>By noon on Sunday there was a short queue waiting for tables - but if you get there around 11am you should be able to walk straight in.

text: A little breakfast and brunch cafe in Novena. The interior seems to be aiming for a cozy modern cottage vibe, though it doesn&#39;t quite hit the mark. I ordered the poached eggs on toast, which was two eggs on one super thick slice of white toast, which was kind of strange. It came with a side salad. Unfortunately it&#39;s cash only.

text: Very cute and clean coffee shop. Their menu has many breakfast/brunch options and their staff was accommodating. I wanted a vanilla latte, but it was not on the menu and the barista made me one anyways and it was delicious! I had the ranchers&#39; toast and it was filling and yummy. I definitely recommend this place for a quick, good, western breakfast or coffee.

text: Small and cozy cafe. I like the interesting name and location off the beaten track. I had scrambled eggs with bacon and toast. The taste and portion were just right. My friend also enjoyed the waffle and coffee. Service staff were courteous. Met all the ticks of an enjoyable cafe without any major fault!

text: Friendly service and value for money! Food was served promptly and it tasted as great as it looked! There was a variety of food to choose from and the staff are very helpful in recommending what is the most sought after option! Definitely will come back to try the rest on the menu!

text: Great brunch place with good breakfast and brunch food and amazing coffee. I came on a Sunday afternoon and it was filled with young couples with loud babies. But maybe it&#39;s less noisy during the week. Overall good Panko chicken sandwich and iced latte.

A nice lovely space in a great location of novena area. A communal table plus a few tables of 4. <br><br>The menu is tight and most impressively, reasonably priced for a change. The staff brings you a menu but you would have to make your way to the counter to place your order. <br><br>We got the iced latte which they call &#34;ice white&#34; $5.50, a iced chocolate $5.50 and a iced lychee mint tea $6.50. The coffee was strong but I felt lacked depth. The other non coffee drinks were lovely though. <br><br>My friend got a brunch plate of avocado toast topped with 2 poached eggs. Competently done for only $8.50! Where to find? <br><br>OOT but I love their crockery! It&#39;s so organic looking :)<br><br>Note: cash only; no GST. <br><br>Will be back!

text: Amazing ambiance and outstanding service. The food was great for a morning bunch and really nice with their Flat White. Will definitely be coming back to try the other items on their menu!

Great coffee with many variations of the latte -- piccolo, Gibraltar, cappuccino etc. also variants of drip/brew coffee. Watch out -- the latte is a huge cup of coffee. Too milky for me. Gibraltar hits just the right spot. <br><br>They don&#39;t offer decaf like many other proper cafes, most frustratingly. <br><br>Eggs and toast at $6, with butter and jam, is an affordable option compared to $16 similar breakfasts down Orchard Road. Bonus points to Jewel for offering vegemite if you prefer it.

text: Amazing!!! I loved this place so much in Singapore. I got a coffee, chai latte, two orange juices (really tasted so fresh!) and a latte with soy milk, chicken wrap, yogurt with homemade granola. I was staying at a nice hotel around the corner and was disappointed by their room service so I walked here and was blown away. Wish they had this store back in the US!

text: Ambitious place that challenges big-name neighbours (Starbucks, Coffee Bean, etc) and sells more than coffee and tea: salads, semi-serious b&#39;fasts (eg. waffles with fresh fruits, eggs benedict), as well as 4 kinds of beer and food (eg. linguine with clams, smoked joint, deep fried pork cubes). May not attract many customers from Orchard Towers next door; those may prefer mee sua in the basement or greasy quesadillas with mojitos at Señor Taco anyway.

Came to get some work done with a cup of coffee. Sat at the tables outside the store, not crowded in the weekday afternoon. No outlets near my table. Need to log in to WiFi again after some time. Use back the same email for a very quick reconnection
Great coffee on Orchard Rd..if Starbucks is getting 4stars then there are not enough here for this one.

They are one of the few speciality coffee shops in the area.  Very fresh and all beans have dates.  They don&#39;t have full body kind, but that&#39;s alright other beans are also good.<br>Thanks for opening here.  You are awesome!<br>こちらでは少ないスペシャリティコーヒーのお店です。ここで焼いているわけではありませんが、ストレートコーヒーをちゃんと焼いた日付を記して販売しています。日本のように苦めの焼き方はしてませんが、十分美味しいです。<br>お値段もお手頃で、いいお店ですね。2015/11

Cute place to get some work done. Pretty quiet with some chill music on a lazy Monday Labour Day. There&#39;s free wi-fi with facebook check-in or filling out a form (pretty straightforward once you connect). Too bad the outlets were few and far between though. The internet speed was pretty decent although it started out a bit slow. The A/C was wayyy too cold though, so unfortunately I had to bounce after about 2 hrs. My hairs were standing on end!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/_0xoyJ34HSBXPg8kUlPhSA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/chye-seng-huat-hardware-singapore?reviewid=U4TeThxKz5ZCx4a-VjdFHg&select=_0xoyJ34HSBXPg8kUlPhSA', 'altText': 'Photo of Chye Seng Huat Hardware - Singapore, Singapore. Coffee on tap! Nitro Black Matter.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Coffee on tap! Nitro Black Matter.'}]
text: It&#39;s interesting to witness what&#39;s going on at Jalan Besar and its vicinity. The neighbourhood is slowly changing hardware stores and workshops for cool hostels, galleries and coffee shops. Chye Seng Huat Hardware Coffee is the perfect example of this process. The building used to house hardware companies. Now it is a coffee bar, gallery and roastery. It is so hip it makes me feel like I&#39;m back on Mexico City&#39;s ultra-hipster neighbourhoods. It has a very cool atmosphere, complete with a turntable for vinyls (actually they just plug a tablet into it, but I&#39;d like to think it works), industrial-style benches, free lo-fi newspapers, and a colourful, friendly staff.<br><br>At the coffee bar they sell amazing coffee. The cold brews are very good, served in cute medicine bottles. They even have cold brewed coffee on tap, which is fresh and tasty. I also tried an earl grey cheese cake which was superb. Prices are -not surprisingly -higher than on any average kopitiam, but lower than most of those corporate coffee-shops we all know so well.<br><br>Some people admit it, most of us don&#39;t, but we all have a tiny little hipster deep inside us. And that tiny little hipster loves this kind of coffee bars. So, why not embrace the hip and treat ourselves with high-quality coffee? This is a place worth visiting, repeatedly.

text: Been to this place second time .... don&#39;t be duped by the hardware shop from outside, it is a cool place for coffee and beer. <br>Not many choice for dinner, but they are all delicious. I like their salmon donburi. The price is slightly high, but the ambience is cool

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Fl7D4utjN5fIMfKAACfnsw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/chye-seng-huat-hardware-singapore?reviewid=9-Vi17IMYJHB9GUj7szNDw&select=Fl7D4utjN5fIMfKAACfnsw', 'altText': 'Photo of Chye Seng Huat Hardware - Singapore, Singapore. Earl grey cheese cake, iced latte and lemonade', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Earl grey cheese cake, iced latte and lemonade'}]
text: For the coffee lovers - pretty basic with their coffee menu; does have quite a good pastry/ cake selection; even pastas and Rosti as well. Was pretty satisfied with my latte though I would have preferred them to have syrup on their selfservice condiments counter - I like my coffee sweet. <br>Their lemonade was really well made too, like a fizzy mojito without the alcohol. <br>The ambience and facade of a hardware store was also very interesting.

From the same roaster as Papa Palheta (also the roaster&#39;s name), Pulp and Loysel&#39;s Toy and the coffee here is the same quality but in a cooler and more hipster like setting of an old hardware store. Here they have a very nice cafe part as well as a roasting and tasting annex and some outdoor seating.<br><br>The coffee is good without being spectacular but the presentation of the filter coffee is very nice when they serve in cute little bottles. The espresso based coffees are also good and the cakes and pastries are too good to not eat one or two (or occasionally even more). The food is standard cafe fare and I have been rather underwhelmed by the quality so would come here for the coffee, the cakes and nice setting.<br><br>Service is usually friendly and if you sit sit the bar it tends to be more talkative. One drawback is the lack of free wifi but perhaps intentional to not have people sit around for too long.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/9HAitRtM9HFDGZ-FYSkfJw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/chye-seng-huat-hardware-singapore?reviewid=f9UfpKzBQI13Qctr_QYyKw&select=9HAitRtM9HFDGZ-FYSkfJw', 'altText': 'Photo of Chye Seng Huat Hardware - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: Overall, I enjoyed my experience at CSHH. It&#39;s a quaint coffee shop and great for a quick bite. I ordered the &#34;salmon toastie&#34; which was great. They food was presented well and tasted good. My only issue was the cold brew nitro coffee on tap. I&#39;ve had nitro beers and coffees before, however, this one was a bit flat. Other than that, no complaints. I would definitely return again for the food and maybe opt for a different drink instead

Tuna salad', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Tuna salad'}]
text: No hardware but they take their coffee very seriously... and fun industrial feel.<br>Wild mushroom pasta is excellent and the tuna salad is ok.  Seating is limited and place is humming with hipsters and early thirty-something&#39;s.  Cold nitro coffee on tap is exactly what it sounds like but no alcohol :(<br><br>Worth a visit for sure!

Nutella banana friands (5 for S$5) coffee and an iced latte.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Nutella banana friands (5 for S$5) coffee and an iced latte.'}]
text: Super cute little cafe!! Really wonderful coffee and pastries. The ambience and service was amazing - great little hipster pocket in the city. My only complaint would be that they did not have soy or almond milk. Will definitely be back for craft beer and pizza at night!

Reviewing the evening bar, not the coffee (I&#39;m sure Papa Palheta deserves their reputation but I&#39;m firmly in the Nylon camp). <br><br>The beers were expensive as expected, and nothing special. My amber ale tasted like Tiger with food colouring. The special was a low alcohol lager infused with mandarin peel and tasted just like it sounded, but it was, to be fair, $8 a pint. There were only 4 choices and I wanted none of them. I suspect there were bottled beers on offer (one of the staff was sipping some) but without a menu or any kind of visibility it would be hard to order them. <br><br>Just down the road are Char and 1925, the former serves Hobgoblin and the latter has decent home brews, better options if beer is what you&#39;re after.<br><br>The DJ&#39;s volume was too high so the evening ended in sore throats. It&#39;s strange because there is no dance floor nor dancing. At around 10pm the DJ changed and the sound was pushed even higher. At this point we were screaming at each other, gave up after 5 minutes and moved on. <br><br>The place seems to be a LBGT cruising spot and at least a third of the audience was visibly LBGT, as well as many on the staff. <br><br>The food looked like normal pub food. Fries, mac n cheese, etc. I&#39;d rather eat at the numerous hawkers (in fact that&#39;s what we did).<br><br>Young and hipster crowd mostly, many fashionable ang mohs. Loads of selfies and Instagram.<br><br>Maybe I&#39;m getting old.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=ntlvfPzc8eglqvk92iDIAw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/PlekFUmxtLp__6JEDYOd2A/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/PlekFUmxtLp__6JEDYOd2A/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/PlekFUmxtLp__6JEDYOd2A/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/PlekFUmxtLp__6JEDYOd2A/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/PlekFUmxtLp__6JEDYOd2A/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/PlekFUmxtLp__6JEDYOd2A/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Rafael R.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'altText': 'Rafael R.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=ntlvfPzc8eglqvk92iDIAw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 50, 'photoCount': 77, 'reviewCount': 562, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Other reviews have covered all the basics -The Roastery, The Annex, the food &amp; pastries and the like, although few ever mention the small indie style shop on the second floor of the building.  Offering small batch personal and home items, the second floor gallery space is perfect for a lazy afternoon browse after enjoying a coffee and a spot of lunch at Chye Seng Huat Hardware.<br><br>While there are few other similarly designed spaces in Singapore, such as A.R.C, or roasting their own beans, such as Common Man and Nylon, the Chye Seng Huat Hardware space is my by far my favorite.  Even if you don&#39;t opt for a baked good, just a block away is the Broadway Hawker Center, ready to fill your post coffee tummy.

text: Food is average but Coffee here is very good!! The reataurant looks like a hardware store from outside. But it is a huge coffee thing inside. Beside the drink and food area, there is a coffee selling shop inside, a coffee making class on the second floor. <br><br>Would def try the coffee making class when I have time.

text: Cold brew coffee was spot on! Strong, smooth and served ice cold, it was perfect! Space is very cool - industrial vibes galore. Menu looks very unique and cool. Large display of sweet treads by the till, the Earl Grey Cheesecake looks yummy! Staff are informative and very friendly. Wish I lived near by!

text: Quite simply, one of the better coffee places you can find in Singapore. The baristas take great pride in make the coffee.<br><br>Just note, I&#39;m not a fan of their nitro-coffee thing.  The one where they brew their beer like a stout. I&#39;d keep away if I were you.

text: I&#39;ll give it a 5 star for the conversion of a heritage building to a spacious cafe with micro roaster . This cafe attracts both locals coffee enthusiast and expats on a weekend brunch. As much as I love the space, coffee wise, it&#39;s too watery and milky for my liking.

text: First time here and love it! <br>The service was very good, everybody seems always in the mood. <br><br>I love my latte, which had similar taste with tiong bahru bakery or penny university, dont know if they&#39;re using the same beans (?). The barista lady gave me different latte art (yes i ordered 2 cuppa!). The french toast was delish! i&#39;m not eating pork and i asked for a plain omelette and they kindly made it for my son with no hassle. <br><br>Overall, it was great. I can see my self going back here soon!

Because that&#39;s not heavy or rich at all for #breaky. <br>If you&#39;re into the #pourover definitely check out this place, they take it very seriously #singapore #singaporefood #sgfood. #CSHH #CAKES #burple

text: Tucked away in the most unlikely place in Singapore, Chye Seng Huat Hardware does not sound or look like it would be a &#34;hip&#34; hangout place from the outside. Once you step inside though, you&#39;re greeted with a nice little cafe with cozy decor and chill music. Yep - a speakeasy-ish coffeehouse. who would&#39;ve thought?<br><br>We arrived 45 minutes after noon and the place was packed. We couldn&#39;t get a seat inside (which is very limited) and had to settle for an outside seat. It wasn&#39;t ideal after walking in the sweltering sun, but after sipping on the cold brew it was quite comfortable. If you come here around 2pm be prepared to wait for a seat. Some people were definitely eyeing our table as we were finishing our brunch.<br><br>Cold Brew Coffee $7 - I would really like to try their hot coffee, but for reasons stated above I would be absolutely crazy not to go for the cold brew. I&#39;m not a coffee connoisseur by any means, but this was really good quality coffee. I loved that it came in a cute medicine bottle and &#34;deconstructed&#34; form so you can mix it up to your desired sweetness!<br><br>Scrambled Eggs $11 - It&#39;s a small portion for me, but I&#39;m a big eater. Price is very reasonable in relative to other brunchy places / cafe in Singapore.<br><br>Raspberry Financier - My friend got this to share. I have no idea how to pronounce the name of this cake, but it was good and not overly sweet<br><br>Red Velvet Muffin $3.80 - This is such a disappointment! The cream was half frozen and the cake was really dry. I would never waste money on this again.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/UbPeoFgRNXXWEni05hLevQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/chye-seng-huat-hardware-singapore?reviewid=e487sDsD__cem9bi2Xoqlg&select=UbPeoFgRNXXWEni05hLevQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Chye Seng Huat Hardware - Singapore, Singapore. espresso machiato', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'espresso machiato'}]
text: I almost didn&#39;t want to go inside when I saw the place from that outside, but I&#39;m glad I did. They brew a well balanced, slightly fruity, light roast espresso just how I like them. <br><br>Pleasant ambiance, but the music is a bit too overpowering.

After walking up a narrow stair case that gave the impression of hidden wonders I was greeted into a small room that appeared to be something out of Alice in wonderland, the room was very small and in every way taken over by coffee machines of all sorts and sizes so finding space to sit was a little tough. <br><br>Turns out they are renovating the downstairs cafe so this is more of a pop up store in the meantime. If you don&#39;t mind sitting amongst the makers of natures nectar (coffee machines) which I didn&#39;t, it was actually a very nice experience to sit and collect my thoughts. <br><br>There wasn&#39;t a good selection of food but understandable as they currently don&#39;t have a kitchen. <br><br>I&#39;d love to come back in Feb once they have finished the renovations and see what treats are in store. <br><br>In the meantime, it&#39;s a great place if you feel like having a coffee and collecting your thoughts - amongst coffee machines.

Lattes', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Lattes'}]
text: It&#39;s ok. Hip place, interesting decor, love the space....but......the buts are below:<br><br>Latte - I&#39;ve had better ones. I like my coffee robust and rich. This one is quite there yet. After hearing all the hype, I have to say I am a tad disappointed.<br><br>Coffee ale - interesting. It reminds me of a light stout, but not something I&#39;d crave.<br><br>Banana cake - probably the best thing here for me. Moist and banana-y.<br><br>Good to go if I am in the neighborhood but not enough to make it a destination. It&#39;s so popular these days that it is virtually impossible to get a spot indoors. If you come in a group (more than 3 or 4), you probably have to sit out in the yard. Not exactly fun if the weather is hot like these couple of weeks.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=3g_vgaCNlvR5uKmUkSz8Rw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QOsELxONsDJD_q1qVI646A/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QOsELxONsDJD_q1qVI646A/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QOsELxONsDJD_q1qVI646A/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QOsELxONsDJD_q1qVI646A/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QOsELxONsDJD_q1qVI646A/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QOsELxONsDJD_q1qVI646A/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Debbie T.', 'displayLocation': 'East Bay, CA', 'altText': 'Debbie T.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=3g_vgaCNlvR5uKmUkSz8Rw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 361, 'photoCount': 670, 'reviewCount': 443, 'eliteYear': None}
text: I&#39;m always a bit hesitant when I read Marcus L.&#39;s reviews. I find him to be a very optimistic man. But, I can certainly say now that he KNOWS his coffee. And, folks, Chye Seng Huat Hardware KNOWS their coffee. They KNOW KNOW KNOW--if you know, know what I mean. <br><br>My gf and I stopped by after brunch and tried their signature blend, Treva Link (I believe?). It was fantastic to the very last drop! I generally don&#39;t finish my coffee at artisan places, but my pretty coffee cup was licked dry! The tables and bars are kind of small so I don&#39;t recommend ordering a proper meal. There was barely enough space to hold our two small espressos cups so I can&#39;t imagine two full plates on top of that. This place is definitely more of a coffee haven to chit chat so no book worms, please!  <br><br>The crowd does seem to be the hipster type. A trend I seeing bursting along Jalan Basar and Tiong Bahru. But hey! Who doesn&#39;t love the Brooklyn, Filmore, or Art District kind of vibe? If you miss the art-sy, popular coffee shops found in New York, San Francisco, or L.A., definitely stop by this place.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=zwVYz5sXfeaxdbRr7nXb7g', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/KdUPKezY9t_CKN2wwjZJnA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/KdUPKezY9t_CKN2wwjZJnA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/KdUPKezY9t_CKN2wwjZJnA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/KdUPKezY9t_CKN2wwjZJnA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/KdUPKezY9t_CKN2wwjZJnA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/KdUPKezY9t_CKN2wwjZJnA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Katy G.', 'displayLocation': 'London, United Kingdom', 'altText': 'Katy G.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=zwVYz5sXfeaxdbRr7nXb7g', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 193, 'photoCount': 37, 'reviewCount': 195, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Absolutely delightful find! Loved the space, vibe, service and coffee options. We came here on Easter Sunday with recommendations to try the cold brew. I know I&#39;m not normally a fan so opted for the regular brew of the day and was very pleased with my (very affordable) choice. After finishing my coffee I spent time wandering the cafe looking at the different coffee makers and observing the barristas making their creations. My only regret was not trying some of the food (which looked great!) and coming too early to browse the upstairs shop.

OK, as far as the roast quality and barista-ship goes, I&#39;m a fan of Papa Palheta. I think the coffee here is probably the best in Singapore. That&#39;s where it ends for Chye Seng Huat however. I get that it&#39;s trendy &amp; cool, with the pseudo-industrial layout and the name that harks back to Singapore&#39;s roots. I&#39;m down with all that. But the place on weekends is a madhouse. <br><br>No table service means long queues to order coffee. I&#39;ve sometimes had to wait 15 minutes in queue just to get an order in. Hell if they were serving $1 kopitiam stuff I&#39;d probably be fine with that but considering the prices here, a bit of table service wouldn&#39;t be too much to ask. But if people are willing to queue then table service would probably be bad business.<br><br>Similarly, I assume, comfortable seating with ample space would be bad business. Why give people space &amp; comfort when you can pack them in &amp; contort them like sardines? Turn those covers! Good business, Papa. Good business.<br><br>Related side-note: I once saw two rather portly gentlemen and one very large lady try to squeeze themselves onto their bar-stools. It was... uncomfortable to watch. I actually had to look away.<br><br>I&#39;m also not a huge fan of the food, which is 90% misses with very few hits. I frequent this joint reasonably often as it&#39;s near where I live. On my last visit I ordered a benedict. The eggs were overcooked and the ham... my God the ham. It was that radioactive pink colour. I&#39;m not even sure that it was technically &#34;ham&#34;. Well maybe technically but it sure didn&#39;t taste like it.<br><br>So what&#39;s a four star rating doing accompanying a review that sounds this bad? The coffee is that good, guys.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/m90u83auf40edM2A8rq0eA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/chye-seng-huat-hardware-singapore?reviewid=xiGk7MR0EjJRLe1QuXU9UQ&select=m90u83auf40edM2A8rq0eA', 'altText': 'Photo of Chye Seng Huat Hardware - Singapore, Singapore. Espresso + Milk', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Espresso + Milk'}]
text: *Drum rolls* CSHH is the flagship store of Papa Palheta. If you like PPP, you will definitely love this place featuring a Coffee Bar, Coffee Retail, The Roastery, The Workshop and The Annex. The roastery and coffee bar is exactly what it means, the annex is where the tasting happens (call and reserve in advance! 23 bucks!) and the coffee retail is where they display the coffee gadgets and add ons some of which are really interesting. <br><br>Jalan Besar is definitely not the easiest place to get to but I went there twice without driving. so its not impossible lol. Don&#39;t be fooled by the front of the store, it may look closed due to the shutter grills but the &#34;main entrance&#34; is actually on the side, just like how PPP&#39;s entrance was behind. Pretty cool concept and it definitely fits well into the entire row of shophouses in the area. <br><br>Check out the menu too. its really simple.. espresso + milk, espresso + water and brewed coffee. no coffee jargon involved. with a really interesting drink that I didn&#39;t get a chance to try.. the beer (&amp; coffee) moment where the description was something like Jungle Beer x Papa Palheta if I am not wrong. maybe someone who has tried that can let me know if its awesome :p<br><br>Smooth, creamy with no residual bitterness.. Coffee junkies.. u know where to head to for your next caffeine fix.
It&#39;s my go-to place for coffee! It serves the BEST coffee here! Love the snacks as well.

I never figured it out...was it a hardware store? or was it built up as such?  quite honestly it doesn&#39;t matter.  The coffee here (iced or hot) is some of the best I had in Singapore...but it&#39;s a bit far to get to.

Good coffee. I mean really good coffee is actually harder to find in Singapore than you would think given the plethora of coffee shops opening here. Chye Seng Huat&#39;s blend is not only good on most days, it can be one of the best in Singapore. We have been tag teaming this establishment and Toby&#39;s Estate over in Robertson Quay for sometime and we think Chye Seng Huat may be starting to edge out the Quay&#39;s competition including Kith.<br><br>Having said that, the reason why they lost out those extra points to score well in my books:<br><br>1. Their food is just A-OK. I think the best dish I&#39;ve had in there is their steak sandwich. Cakes lift their game a little.<br><br>2. Floor service is really good for a coffee shop so the fact that they have so many service staff on the floor puzzled me as to why the staff can&#39;t take orders. You must go queue at the cashier and order there. Make sense? Not to me. They have a strength but are not entirely using it effectively.<br><br>3. Cashier service, as it has become a customer front and interface is actually not that good despite the good floor service. As Chye Seng Huat has pushed the customer experience to us queuing at the cashier, I have to say that the cashier has on a number of occasions not controlled the queue properly by allowing selfish customers who stand right in front of the cashier waiting for their takeaway coffee and hindering attempts from customers behind wanting to place their order so they can sit down again!<br><br>4. Chye Seng Huat opens at 9am (its stated very clearly). Yet, on one morning, management apparently decided to hold a staff meeting at 9am that didn&#39;t finish until 9:30am. Not only that, they decided not to offer customers standing outside waiting to come in to sit down.<br><br>So while the place definitely serves good coffee, we feel that management needs to pick up some common sense and optimise and improve quality of customer service and its hot food menu.<br><br>Has POTENTIAL but is not recognising and/or addressing the gaps. I feel their overall rating is a little inflated because I have read reviews here where they point out similar flaws I&#39;ve found and still rate it as 4 stars?!!! C&#39;mon people. Stop promoting poor service in Singapore please.

I love this place!! I was told by a local to come here, and I was not disappointed. This is coffee roasting at its finest complete with a coffee bar to enjoy your favorite brew and some delicious homemade snacks as well. I had a flat white perfectly blended with some curry puffs. Both were delicious and the price is on par with other coffee shops in Singapore except this one was top notch. Don&#39;t expect a place like this to ever be empty-if you want a seat you&#39;ll be waiting and or jumping in front of someone to take it, but the ambiance is cool, the music was nice and it was a  great place to hangout. I ended up buying some beans here from their own blend-again the prices being very reasonable (10-18 SGD a bag) against the USA and other Singapore coffee shops. I must say the area throws you off a bit. It appears to be in a residential area with hardware stores around but the area is for sure in the process of changing. Don&#39;t expect free wifi-as in many places in Singapore since they don&#39;t want people camping out here for the day. However, clean toilets and free water abound!

You know I&#39;d really love to like Chye Seng Huat. I don&#39;t hate it but I don&#39;t love it either.<br><br>Actually, I&#39;m just bitter that they got rid of their original french toast. The brioche one with loads of banana slices and swimming in maple syrup. Add a bit of powder sugar, almond slices and we were golden.<br><br>Maybe I came back too late for a second helping because last time I went it was no more. I didn&#39;t get what I came for and instead got a really sad looking plate of what they wanted to pass off as french toast.<br><br>Bring it back CSHH, then maybe we can be friends again.

text: CSHH coffee shop is quaint and boutique.  Coffee is awesome and the cakes have good selections.  They even have Nintendo games from year 2000s era!!!!   We will be back.  Highly recommended for a first date meet.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=0KUdmnSW925Zj6RO6fz2ZA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Yzkm5TP8ibZ1AoBMLCcC2A/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Yzkm5TP8ibZ1AoBMLCcC2A/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Yzkm5TP8ibZ1AoBMLCcC2A/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Yzkm5TP8ibZ1AoBMLCcC2A/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Yzkm5TP8ibZ1AoBMLCcC2A/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Yzkm5TP8ibZ1AoBMLCcC2A/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Chubby Botak Koala H.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Chubby Botak Koala H.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=0KUdmnSW925Zj6RO6fz2ZA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 3, 'photoCount': 37, 'reviewCount': 14, 'eliteYear': None}

BLT Sandwich', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'BLT Sandwich'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/MX67Fb19ezug_WWldg5Q4A/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/chye-seng-huat-hardware-singapore?reviewid=Rs9L6IamVefOxjUarY0R0Q&select=MX67Fb19ezug_WWldg5Q4A', 'altText': 'Photo of Chye Seng Huat Hardware - Singapore, Singapore. The Coffee @ CSHH', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'The Coffee @ CSHH'}]
text: Chye Seng Huat Hardware - Top 3 Cuppa in Singapore<br><br>Chye Seng Huat Hardware (&#39;CSHH&#39;) is the second outpost of Papa Palheta which located in the new headquarters for Papa Palheta. Instead of going the boutique way, such as in Bukit Timah establishment, CSHH is a full fledge café serving Coffee, Coffee flavoured beer, food and desserts. At the back of the café, you can see their workshop roasting machines. Beside the workshop is the Annex, this is where you can buy coffee beans and other coffee apparatus. The coffee school and gift shop can be located on the second floor. <br><br>This time around, I decided to pop by for a quick shot of caffeine and a quick bite before my next appointment in Novena. <br><br>The coffee here can be considered as one of the best roasted coffee beans in Singapore. Just check with the crowds flocking this place every day. With the third wave coffee movement hitting its stride in Singapore, you can be sure that you will get a good cuppa just by judging the Rosetta latte art in your coffee. If it does not have one or the rosetta does not look good, you better lower your expectations. <br><br>Most of the time, CSHH will be using their own blend of coffee bean which is known as Terra Firma for their milk base coffee, such as cappuccino, latte, other variety. Their coffee is smooth, dark with a slight chocolate flavour at the end. The best part, is that you will not need to add sugar into it.<br><br>For food, this is the first time around I have a grub here. Ordered The BLT sandwich, and it does not disappoint. The bacon and bread is nice and crispy. The tomato and lettuce inside the sandwich is fresh. They serve the sandwich with chips and mesclun salad with Italian dressing. <br><br>Overall, the quality of the coffee here is excellent. The top 3 best coffee in Singapore in my opinion. Don&#39;t forget to check out The Annex for coffee beans and coffee apparatus.  Cheers!!<br><br>Food &amp; Drink: 8/10 (Coffee 9.5/10)<br>Value: 8.5/10<br>Service: 7.5/10<br>Ambiance: 7.5/10<br><br>*** If you want to check out the complete review with pictures, please click on my food blog. The link is on my profile page

If you&#39;re looking for a bougie cafe and don&#39;t mind paying an arm and a leg, this place for you. If you&#39;re looking for coffee and a bite to eat (like I was) keep looking. I&#39;m staying in Little India about 20 minute walk from CSHH. Let me start by saying there are barely any places to get coffee in the vicinity of my hotel so my gf and I walked a few blocks to 20F coffeehouse which was closed due to renovation. A guy who worked there recommended CSHH after I asked him if there was anywhere else to get coffee in the area. Although the menu prices were shocking, by the time we finally got to CSHH we were too hungry and in need of coffee to find yet another place to have breakfast. Needless to say it cost $48 for two of us to have a mediocre breakfast in a super busy cafe with no wifi (it&#39;s also confusingly half order-and-get-your-own-stuff and half waitress run... I was instructed to get my own napkins across the restaurant when I asked the waitress who delivered our food).  <br>Latte was ok.. Not at all worth $6. Lemonade was seltzer water with a squeeze of lemon and food was good but way over priced ($18 for eggs, ham, sausage and toast are you kidding me?!) this place deserves way more $s than Yelp gives it

Awesome tea cake', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Awesome tea cake'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/4UWutiajf8RiXUKWv628Hw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/chye-seng-huat-hardware-singapore?reviewid=pgAazDGBP3p171rSsyGE1Q&select=4UWutiajf8RiXUKWv628Hw', 'altText': 'Photo of Chye Seng Huat Hardware - Singapore, Singapore. Platter', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Platter'}]
text: Adding on to the indie cafe scene, Chye Seng Huat by Papa Palheta does a coffee education, true to its roots as a coffee roastery and father of third movement in Singapore. They kept the exterior of the hardware store and also elements of steel bars and grills are incorporated into the interior.<br><br>The food is surprisingly fantastic despite the rather limited menu. Each item is carefully crafted. The platter saw a fresh mix of pork rillette, duck terrain, salami and Parma ham. The smoked salmon sandwich was also delightful.<br><br>Save some space for their desserts. The hazelnut ginger tea cake was a great end to a fantastic meal.

text: You&#39;d probably dismiss Chye Seng Huat Hardware because of its rather nondescript traditional looking exterior. Go through the gate and you&#39;ll find a very cool and newly opened little coffee joint hidden inside. <br><br>We popped by CSHH (I have so much problem trying to remember the name!) for lunch and the food there is so-so, nothing particularly outstanding and must-have - it&#39;s a coffee joint after all so food isn&#39;t quite the key thing here and it shows. The omelette was a tad small, the beef patty&#39;s a little lacking in taste for me (though presented beautifully with 3 different condiments), but the salami sandwich was ok.<br><br>The really unusual thing they have here is Coffee Ale - a special collaboration of Papa Pahelta beans with local brewery Jungle Beer. Owner Leon who was in store that day took time out to explain the brewing process quite thoroughly - this is a guy who knows his beans and beer! It was a really unusual brew with a pleasant (not overwhelming) coffee smell and aftertaste, yet still refreshing as a cold beer is.<br><br>The staff here are friendly and amiable, the environment is cozy and organic, definitely an upcoming hipster hang-out and a nice place to chill out (hopefully it doesn&#39;t get too crowded!). Besides the main area, there are also smaller areas behind - an Annex, Workshop and Roastery, as well as an empty courtyard which I assume is where the crowd might spill over to in future.

text: Been here twice and I love the place. The coffee&#39;s good (no ice lattes though), and there&#39;s a wide selection of pastries and cakes to go along with it. <br><br>So far, I&#39;ve found myself sitting outside which is the smoking corner. Most of the people tend to sit inside so the smoking area is always available. A good place to sit down and have coffee when you&#39;re bored.

text: It&#39;s name is very misleading, the shopfront (if you even call it that) depicts that of a hardware company very convincingly. Housed in a standalone shop house on Tyrwhitt Road, this new coffee bar is an interesting mix of the old and the new. While it&#39;s exterior retains the traditional look of a usual shophouse, complete with chinese characters on its walls and metal bars at its windows, the interior is an interesting spin on the modern day cafe and bar. <br><br>I had their pistachio cranberry cake as well as their raspberry fingers. For $4 for 2 slices of their cakes, it is one of the most value-for-money ones around. It was pretty nice too, albeit being a tad bit too sweet. I had a regular flat white, as well as a cold brew. While the flat white did not impress, the cold brew had an interesting acidic and slightly fruity undertone. It was a nice refreshing drink that is great to have on a hot day. <br><br>They also have The Annex, which is reserved for exclusive tasting sessions involving coffee and light bites at $23 per pax.

text: CSHH is the new flagship venue of the Papa Palheta group. Located on Tyrwhitt Road (beside Jalan Besar stadium), CSHH is a roastery, retail space and coffee academy. The Steeping Room - previously a pop up space at Bras Basah - makes a welcome return in the form of the Annexe, a dedicated area for coffee and food pairing.  <br><br>Papa Palheta cafes tend to have a very distinct decor, feel and atmosphere - CSHH is no exception. The original shell of the hardware store is intact, with art deco lettering and exposed light fixtures enhancing the effect. The interior is bright, airy and contemporary - a new lease of life for one of the old workshops that was here before. Combined with a large retail space, this is not unlike Barista Jam in Sheung Wan, Hong Kong - a venue I like a lot.  <br><br>As always, I started by ordering an Espresso. The blend used was a combination of <br>Brazilian Coromandel, Guatamelan Antigua and Ethiopian Sidamo. In general, Brazilian and Guatamelean coffees have hints of chocolate, and low acidity, while Ethiopian sidamo has a smooth aftertaste. The shot had an intense aroma, with a dark brown crema, indicitave of freshly roasted beans. There was a syrupy mouthfeel that I typically notice in shots from third wave outlets - this is an indicator that the shot has been extracted for the correct amount of time. The intensity and robust body of the shot was evident from the first tasting - the combination of dark chocolate paired with a citrus, floral notes gives rise to a complex, long lasting bouquet with perfect balance. The aftertaste lingers, and I could taste it long after I had finished my shot. Some things are simply better in their places of origin - like eating chicken rice in Singapore, or drinking Guinness in Dublin, drinking a Papa Palheta blend in CSHH was a coffee experience to savour. There were more notes, flavour and mouthfeel in the last few drops than in any number of shots from other cafes.<br><br>I ordered a Cappuccino also. It arrived with beautiful latte art and dark brown foam - a nice contrast of light and darkness. There was a lovely foamy, light texture with an intense coffee hit a few seconds later. The espresso did not dominate in this drink, even though it was a strong shot - the milk and espresso work in conjunction, a 1-2 punch straight to the pallete, where one hits right after the other. They accentuate each other rather than fight for dominance on your taste buds. The layer of foam on top was the correct thickness also - a simple thing, but not something that every cafe gets right.<br><br>The retail space is large and well stocked, with Chemex woodneck products, Hario Buono kettles paired with V60 pourover rigs, Aeropress and syphons all on display. There were 5 bean varities available also, which can be bought whole, or ground on request. Professional espresso machines and grinders are available. This is significant - the staff are are baristas who use machines such as these each day, rather than sales people who may receive commission for recommending a particular type.<br><br>Some other notable points are the menu, which has a wide variety of brewing types, and clever pairings of food to coffee. Also, I like the pairing of Jungle Beer (brewed in Admiralty) and Papa Palheta coffee - this is entirely consistent with the creative approach of Papa Palheta. I have not yet tried the Annexe, where food, coffee and alcohol pairings are explored more fully, but based on the work that has been done in CSHH to date (and from one or two experiments that are being prepared at present), this is something to look forward to.<br><br>In short, it&#39;s some of the best coffee that I&#39;ve had. The original Papa Palheta at Hooper Road may be no more, but the same intense, robust and complex shots live on in a quiet street at Jalan Besar.

Disclaimer time: I have to admit my review is a little biased - I used to work with these guys, and I&#39;m ever so proud of what they&#39;ve done.<br><br>Chye Seng Huat Hardware, or CSHH, (or Ah Huat, if you will) is really the evolution of the Papa Palheta coffee journey, which began just over three years ago (three years and two days, as of this review).<br><br>This place is in a word - cool. You can come here for three things:<br>1. A coffee.<br>Beans are roasted by the team in their other locations, but operations will be centralised to the Workshop (in the adjacent building in the near future). <br>Your beverage is made before you, in the island bar, and you can see the baristas in action, no matter if it&#39;s an espresso-based coffee, or one of the many other filter brews.<br><br>2. On quieter days, a conversation.<br>Talk to the baristas - the island bar is built for interaction, and ask them why the do things a particular way. Like why your filter coffee has water poured in a particular fashion, and the importance of the right temperature.<br><br>3. A taste experience.<br>If you&#39;re a little more keen, call ahead to book a session at the Annex. You can geek out with a few of your friends over the intricacies of flavour in each small-batch-roasted origin, and even get some off-the-menu treats as flavour pairings.<br><br>If you&#39;re mega-geeking it out, there&#39;s number 4. An education.<br>They do barista training upstairs as well, so if you&#39;ve wanted to get behind the coffee counter, here&#39;s where you can start.<br><br>As a barista, I can&#39;t think of many other places I would want to be/work at. and If you&#39;re as much of a coffee geek as me, you&#39;ll feel the same way.

The good: Fantastic space, very friendly staff (smiles and was asked if my coffee was good) considering it was packed. The crumble cake was decent and the coffee I drank was surprisingly tasty. I&#39;m not a huge coffee fan but when I do, it&#39;s full of sugar. This one (bright brew) I drank straight up and loved it. Cudos. <br><br>The bad: Selection lacks. From food to drink options, I struggled to find anything I really wanted to order. Mentally I was prepared for breakfast, which they didn&#39;t have. Another huge bummer, no soy. It&#39;s Asia, almost 40% (could be way off, but it&#39;s high) of people are lactose intolerant. Need a non dairy option stat!  Another thing was the music, I was only there for 25 minutes and heard the same song twice.  Saw a record player playing spinning, but it seems it&#39;s there for show and not to actually play music.  If I&#39;m wrong, mix up the records, if I&#39;m not, plug it in and let people play the records they want to hear. Turntables are not meant to be props.    <br><br>The ugly: Couldn&#39;t fit my finger in the cup handle, how am I suppose to drink?! Almost dropped it a few times while sipping, which would have been extra embarrassing since it seemed everyone there is there to stare at each other.

A nice idea and pleasant enough place. But with the ordering process it builds up the anticipation for some great coffee. Have to say I was greatly underwhelmed. I was gonna give a generous three stars but my<br>Fellow yelper Li ting says it&#39;s two stars tops. Forgettable.

If you&#39;re not a coffee fan (like me) and can&#39;t tell the difference between a kopi-o at the local hawker center and the new Starbucks Asian Dolce Latte (I swear by God they taste the same) then don&#39;t come here. Because you&#39;ll not be able to appreciate the coffee - tried the latte and house brew but couldn&#39;t tell the difference between this coffee and others. I think the food here is decent (tried the pancakes and french toast) but there are better places for food if you&#39;re really hungry. I can imagine this being a nice chill out place but when I reached on Saturday afternoon is was just super crowded, and packed to the brim. Managed to get seats but I found them squeezy and it was hard to get past the long line of people at the counter.<br><br>The one thing I liked was the lemonade though! Tastes exactly like a virgin mojito. Yum :)

text: Sigh. Their coffee sucks.  <br><br>We ordered cappuccino, an espresso and drip filter. Cap and espresso were bad -- I guess the machine was way too hot during the pour. Filter was meh. <br><br>This place has a roaring business. Its a &#39;hip&#39; place. Its style over substance. What they serve is at best passable.<br><br>I wish Liberty up the road was open more frequently. THAT is a good spot for coffee.

text: Meh...cute location and nice ambiance but I was not super impressed with the espresso. Steep prices and pray that you are lucky enough for on street parking.

Love the surroundings and set up that is really unique and indie. The coffee blend borders slightly acidic but still acceptable for me. It&#39;s strong and robust. Cakes are average. Good if you need a bite. Didn&#39;t try the savoury food but they look good!

The location (tucked away in Jalan Besar with a nondescript entrance ) and concept (nostalgic exterior) makes CSHH a go to place for people looking for something more than just a cup of coffee.<br>However, the lacklustre mains really let this place down. The food tasted and looked like cold fast food. I had pancakes with sour cream and smoked salmon, topped with beansprouts. It looked and tasted like it was hastily put together. The chicken wrap and banana cake were better and more enjoyable.<br>Having said that, the coffee is, like what the other reviewers have said, quite good. And I would pop by here for a cup if I am ever in the area. But I would hesitate to recommend it to people who want to come all the way down to have a meal.

text: Quality coffee with reasonable price. Coffee bean is good and ratio of milk to coffee is awesome. Will recommend

text: There&#39;s everything that you need here. It&#39;s no longer as cheap as it used to be but you will be able to find some hidden gems if you try hard enough! Go go!

surprisingly quiet for a saturday night. i wonder if it was the rain that deterred the crowd from coming out. this place is pretty unique and i like it even though i am not a coffee drinker. i ordered the homemade lemonade and it was tangy and yummy - not too sour, not too sweet.<br>one thing i did note was the air conditioner was really powerful on the inside; too cold for my liking so i opted to sit outside despite the strong smell of incense coming from a nearby temple.<br>the staff were friendly too and it has a laid back atmosphere. i definitely want to go back again. the mains and dessert looked pretty attractive.

Long black, cappuccino, raisin scone and carrot cake with lemon frosting...', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Long black, cappuccino, raisin scone and carrot cake with lemon frosting...'}]
text: It was good, acceptable. The cake was too dry though... And the coffee was rather milky to my liking. The long black was good though. I love the place... It was hidden and the concept was unique. Atmosphere was very good.

Situated in an old building the decor of the restaurant is quite unique, and although named like a hardware stall it sells anything but hardware. The menu has a whole lot of variety from pancakes, sandwiches, pastries to coffee and French toast.<br><br>I really like their French toast and the maple syrup that they serve with it, a real valued for money dish. Their banana cake was really good too as i love the moist texture that it had and the little bits of banana that i could taste inside too.<br><br>Service was really good too and i would definitely go back for more food and coffee and of course the unique looking stall too.

From the same people who brought you Loysel&#39;s Toy and Papa Pahelta, we now have another coffee experience brought to our shores. Featuring an island bar counter for you to watch the baristas at work, this joint promises a lot to come in terms of enjoying coffee. (I&#39;m still reeling in all the information.)<br><br>That aside, I dropped by early today for breakfast. Had the cold brew which was served in a medicine bottle-like jar. Very symbolic for how potent it is. I like it watered down slightly by the ice. Also had their breakfast in a cup which was a mix of tomatoes, herbs and eggs baked in a ramekin. Interesting concept which can do with more shaking up.<br><br>I like how they continue to surprise. This one is one to watch.

Chye Seng Huat is a welcome addition to the cafe scene, in my opinon. With the recent cafe craze and mass genesis of indie/third wave cafes, CSHH really is a standout for a number of reasons.<br><br>The space is really interesting. It looks like like a hardware store shophouse that isn&#39;t in use from the front. But if you walk in through the metal gate next to the shophouse shutter doors, then you&#39;re greeted with a hive of activity and a large courtyard area. <br><br>The most interesting feature for me is the roastery. CSHH is owned by the people behind Loysel&#39;s Toy and Papa Pahleta&#39;s and I hear the coffee beans used at all three establishments are roasted at CSHH. <br><br>The cafe area also has a unique layout/configuration, with a bar style coffee making area in the centre of the room. There are seats around the bar.<br><br>The coffee itself is also really good. I like the new cold brew, though my latte was a little flat when I visited.

text: The latest hipster cafe is worth visiting. The general vibe is similar to that of Papa Palehtta. The coffee - Ethiopian cold brew - was decent. I really like the  furnishing and deco of this place which was rather antiquated and the 360 degree coffee bar is the first in Singapore which gives the customers a full view of the baristas making the coffee. They also have an Annex, a place where they hold coffee-tasting sessions.

The latest coffee joint also happens to be the most underground one. Disguised as a traditional hardware store on the exterior, it reveals a painfully hip interior that&#39;s sure to attract all the hipster and wannabe types.<br><br>And the hipster invasion has already begun. Judging from our first visit there, conveniently located near my girlfriend&#39;s workplace, we stopped by after lunch expecting some peace and quiet before she went back to work, but we had no such luck. Well it wasn&#39;t noisy or overcrowded, but the overall vibe and feel there wasn&#39;t what we expected. That said, it won&#39;t deter us from coming back as the coffee on offer here is really good.

text: Great coffee but the service is so awfully inefficient it drives me mental - lots of staff but they seem to require 2 people to watch while one works in slow motion. Bring lots of patience when coming here and keep out of peak periods

text: Packed. Limited selection of food and drinks. Service was reasonably good. Enjoyed the ambience. No comments on their latte.

Don&#39;t dash by this white building with a distinctively chinese name; looks can be deceiving. Rather, labels can be too. Hardware may not be hardware here at CSHH, they are afterall coffeesmiths hidden inside this enclave. What a location, wait till you go in. A big establishment bringing you the best of coffee-land, with all processes integrated into one. Roasting, espresso machine workshop, coffee school, café and even a tasting room by reservation only, are housed in this &#39;hardware&#39; warehouse. Coffee is the familiar Papa Palheta, afterall they are the ones who&#39;ve brought you new concepts, year after year (think Loysel&#39;s Toy). Come for the entire experience, with more interesting flavour pairing here as compared to Loysel&#39;s Toy.

text: I have been in the service industry for almost 2 decades now, and they have the best service ever. Super welcoming and authentic, the entire team of staff are amazing. The positive energy is so refreshing in the local scene. <br>Coffee... fantastic!, from the temperature, aroma the blend.... Ooo . Makan... the quality and attention to details is immaculate. For real foodies that appreciate fresh ingredients and culinary skills, it&#39;s awesome. Simple dishes like scrambled eggs. Just check it out, it&#39;s done so well. For OCD people ah, you will get it.<br><br>When you feel sickened by society and silly workplace cultures,  <br>To experience their crafts and sincerity, it allowed me to feel hopeful again knowing that it isn&#39;t extinct.

Avocado toast', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Avocado toast'}]
text: Excellent little hole in the wall cafe, next to the old badminton hall, kind of out of the way. But it was packed to the brim on a sunday morning, so clearly its popular inspite of the location. Between the three of us, we got the Avocado toast, curry chicken wrap and baked eggs with salmon. The food was fresh, well presented and tasty. Coffee was great as well. Its a nice place for a brunch and chat with friends, tables may be sharing if it gets crowded, but that&#39;s ok!

Cappuccino $5.50', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Cappuccino $5.50'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Ifel1_5gDfK-BMi4D4fMvA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/brawn-and-brains-coffee-singapore?reviewid=cL77GC38pDUp0LDxMgcI0A&select=Ifel1_5gDfK-BMi4D4fMvA', 'altText': 'Photo of Brawn & Brains Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Avocado Toast and Egg on the side $12.50', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Avocado Toast and Egg on the side $12.50'}]
text: Weird location but pretty spacious. Gets pretty busy during weekday lunch which is surprising as there was not much else around this industrial/residential area.<br><br>Avo toast and egg was $12.50. Bread was thin and hard but avocado and egg was nicely seasoned. The egg was served on the side. Definitely not worth the price though.<br><br>The coffee was good. Cappuccino was $5.50. Earl grey tea was $7 though.<br><br>Self-serve for cutlery, water, and everything else but they do serve your order to your table. I don&#39;t get why it can&#39;t just be full service...?<br><br>The menu was decent but prices are pretty expensive. It was not bad if you&#39;re in the area but I wouldn&#39;t necessarily recommend going out of the way to return.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/mqVOpfcoFdCLhD3IffhQmQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/brawn-and-brains-coffee-singapore?reviewid=nznzyXk8Y7LTntcbLZEffA&select=mqVOpfcoFdCLhD3IffhQmQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Brawn & Brains Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Glorious molten eggs', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Glorious molten eggs'}]
text: AMAZING brunch. We had about 20 minutes of waiting before we could get real food, so we got croissants and coffee. I had an iced, single-origin white and the Earl Grey scone. Both were phenomenal. The single-origin is an amazing coffee...the flavor is very complex and delicious. I liked it a lot more than the house blend coffee. The croissant was also great. It was moist and flaky and you could really taste the Earl Grey. <br><br>Once we did sit down (pretty uncomfortable sitting unfortunately), we ordered the molten eggs. So good. Cheesy, crispy, very filling, and flavorful. The spinach on the side is crisp and all of the side veggies go really well with the eggs. It&#39;s a creative and eggcellent (ha) dish unlike anything I&#39;ve ever had for brunch.

Flat white ($5)', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Flat white ($5)'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/cUtuGJvDCjeOKLEYzLahDQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/brawn-and-brains-coffee-singapore?reviewid=11LgYGBU-mWnxjcP0fdeTA&select=cUtuGJvDCjeOKLEYzLahDQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Brawn & Brains Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Cold brew ($7.80)', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Cold brew ($7.80)'}]
text: Situated at the front of the old badminton complex, the cafe is easily located just 6 minutes away from Mountbatten MRT. <br><br>Despite a decent seating capacity, the cafe was rather crowded when we visited on a weekday afternoon. Though spacious, the small square shaped metal chairs are not ideal for a long afternoon of chilling. <br><br>What made the visit worth it was the coffee. I ordered the flat white ($5) and the cold brew ($7.80) as well as the raspberry coconut cake ($7.70) and the coffee walnut cake ($7.30). While the cold brew and cakes were average, what stood out for me was the flat white. Creamy with distinct fruity notes, it was the perfect combination one would demand from a cuppa. <br><br>While not the best place for intense mugging, Brawn and brains is undoubtedly second to few when it comes to brewing the perfect cuppa and would make a great place for catching up with friends or that casual afternoon tea.

text: Quite good coffee located at the weirdest location you can imagine - the former Singapore Badminton Association. But it works. This cute little cafe is away from any competition (compared to the densely populated cafes in Tiong Bahru or Tanjung Pagar area) and just a stone throw away from my current office. You can easily missed this place if you&#39;re here for the first time, so look out for their banner hung outside the association and just follow the sign. The cafe is located at the back of the building, btw. <br><br>We came here for lunch one weekday and love everything about this place. The owner, Gwen is friendly and always so welcoming with her warm smile. I ordered a latte and was asked which coffee blend I prefer. Since it was my first time, I asked for a recommendation and they recommended an African blend with a hint of chocolate and citrus. Very nice. Also, all coffee comes in double shot, which is slightly too strong for me.  I had a slight &#34;heart attack&#34; the moment I finished my coffee and had to dilute the caffeine with a lot of plain water. Haha. It could be the main draw why people come for their coffee - for it is strong! <br><br>The food menu could be limited but I salute café that concentrates on a few items and do it right and B&amp;B is one of them. I had a chicken and mushroom grilled Panini while my colleagues had curry chicken Panini. All food is prepared fresh upon order hence the waiting time of 15-20 mins. But that&#39;s alright, nobody wants to eat frozen or food that has been sitting in the refrigerator for days. The chicken and mushroom as well as the curry chicken filling for the Panini were flavorful paired with a handful of fresh rockets. Portion wise, it was just right as it leave you with some space for dessert. We ordered a dark chocolate tart to share to finish off the meal nicely. <br> <br>B&amp;B together with a couple of cafes like DOC and Drury Lane will remain my favorite and foresee myself coming back again and again.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/4k0skp4SrL_lcezjiiKcxA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/brawn-and-brains-coffee-singapore?reviewid=kiuXKLmzN7e3bqkrgajypw&select=4k0skp4SrL_lcezjiiKcxA', 'altText': 'Photo of Brawn & Brains Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: We visited on a Saturday afternoon for lunch. The variety is a little limited but I settled on what&#39;s essentially poached eggs with smoked salmon and additional avocado. It was thoroughly delightful, sufficiently filling and I would recommend it. <br><br>The coffee was alright. Maybe I had hyped myself up too much but the beans just wasn&#39;t up my alley. <br><br>In all, a nice place to hang out with friends though it gets crowded.

text: This little cafe run by a husband and wife team &amp; their friendly staff gives this place a very homely feel. You will see regulars dropping by for their usual fix. They have just expanded to a larger space which can accommodate more customers. But the place still gets filled up fairly quickly. Definitely a place to sit down, chill &amp; enjoy the atmosphere.

text: This is a good spot if you are into super-thick coffee. The coffees are all served with a double shot and it may be an acquired taste before you enjoy your cuppa.<br><br>Two blends are usually available: one house blend, and the other single origin seasonal. There are fans for each blend and it is all a matter of personal preference. The coffees also tend to have a tannic aftertaste which some may not like, but I think it gives it a certain personality, not unlike a well-balanced bottle of red wine.<br><br>Note: Coffees definitely taste better if it is the lady boss who pulled it for you!

text: Food was... oh who cares. Come for the coffee, stay for another coffee (food was fine, I had a croissant.)<br><br>Coffee really was good though.

text: Very fresh beans and superbly great atmosphere, however if your looking for a hearty meal this is not where you should be going. Only serve breakfast menu here. <br>Beans are seasonally changed and every roast has their distinct flavor. Whether your looking for a robust or a weak perk me up kind of coffee, this place will satisfy all your needs. Food is just regular cafe sandwiches and wraps, no surprising wow menu. Consistent flavored will be a big draw to those that love their food standards to be stable.

text: This place is pretty cute and definitely reminds me of the hipster vibe back home but it is pretty chill and not super pretentious ha. Love the open layout and the community tables. Feels roomy and love the natural light. <br><br>Earl Grey croissant warmed up and a single shot caffe machiatto. Overall impressed. Great coffee flavor. Strong and tasty which is how it should be, in my opinion. <br><br>In general, I am overall impressed with Singapore and its norm of using earl grey which is one of my favorites so seeing cafes use it in baked goods and pastries is so awesome! Love it. <br><br>That being said, the croissant was yummy warmed up. I think the icing was a bit much making it a tad too sweet. But I still enjoyed it. <br><br>I like that they roast their own coffee and all their pastries are made in house. <br><br>The service was welcoming and friendly. <br><br>Overall, if I&#39;m in the area again, I&#39;d stop by :) <br><br>Tip: you have to purchase your own bottled water <br>Tip2: it didn&#39;t look like there was wifi or charging available but it could be a nice place to study and/or just chill

text: Nice cafe tucked in the corner of a parking lot right next to the Onsight climbing gym. This place is super small. The cafe can fit ~ 12 people comfortably and there is also a small table for outdoor sitting. I went there at noon and had to wait for a bit to get a table. <br><br>I had the ice mocha, lemon tart and salted caramel tart. I am not a big coffee drinker but the coffee tastes pretty smooth. The lemon tart has a good mix of sweetness and citric taste. I thought the salted caramel tart is far too sweet. <br><br>All in all, good place to chill out and have coffee and desserts. 10 mins walk to the circle line.

Latte', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Latte'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/lIl4lYW6PmVDl7BHi0og9g/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/brawn-and-brains-coffee-singapore?reviewid=LeFhEYsBEhXxUBPPw5OUZg&select=lIl4lYW6PmVDl7BHi0og9g', 'altText': 'Photo of Brawn & Brains Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Sencha tea', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Sencha tea'}]
text: B&amp;B has moved to a bigger unit just in front of the road. More spacious and seats but still insufficient to cater to the crowd that poured in just before lunch. Second day at the new location, no kitchen service is available so no food or cakes. Shame. <br><br>Coffee was good as usual. Double shots are default but if you want yours milder, tell the cashier ! <br><br>Tea is served in a small cup and free refill of hot water once. <br><br>Don&#39;t really like that you have to pay $0.30 each for extra refills and milk. <br><br>Free wifi can be tapped from the indoor climbing place just beside!

Down a large road off the centre of Geylang resides Brawn and Brains. The large windows bathe the space in natural light and the space owes everything to the prevailing hipster look.<br><br>But the comforts end there.<br><br>Stealing from fast food outlets who prefer a fast flow of customers, Brawn and Brains&#39; stools are small and hard. The offered comfort doesn&#39;t promote a &#34;sit around and chat&#34; atmosphere.<br><br>Brawn and Brains promote the a coffee conscious image. If all I cared about was image I could happily buy into this outlet. However I love coffee more than I love how it is housed. The coffee is so-so. Having lived around the Mediterranean for many years, I can&#39;t excuse a venue that doesn&#39;t include water with their coffee. Not only is coffee dehydrating and cloying without water, but the water helps clean the palate and keep the mouth fresh. Disappointingly Brawn and Brains didn&#39;t offer water immediately and refused to offer tap water.  The only option is imported water.<br><br>The food is ok but was western themed. It was a little cliched with the dish coming with packet crisps. <br><br>Very few local people were eating here, mostly Europeans and North Americans, presumably looking for a reminder of home. For a traveller in this area, why not just eat something local instead? There is a great selection of low price food and authentic cooking along Geylang road. Even &#34;The tuckshop&#34; up the road would be a better place to drop in.<br><br>If I was looking for a coffee I would have wanted to head to Collective Brewers, but now they have closed down. Instead, I&#39;d rather head to &#34;Curious Palette&#34; on Prinsep street, or, if I can get in, &#34;Space Mob&#34;, at 8 Claymore Hill.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/XD82WWRjznybOHlQOU9zsA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/brawn-and-brains-coffee-singapore?reviewid=zRecYpu_TmENfr55nGBk-w&select=XD82WWRjznybOHlQOU9zsA', 'altText': 'Photo of Brawn & Brains Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Nice and clean Restaurant! The coffee is great!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Nice and clean Restaurant! The coffee is great!'}]
text: Its not a one dollar restaurant, prices are moderate, but the staff, atmosphere, food and coffe are very good. There is even a veggie options for every dish.

With all the rave reviews I don&#39;t understand just a 4 * rating. For me, anyway, it&#39;s 5 all the way. <br><br>Yes the spot is (was - expanded space opening soon) tiny, but that doesn&#39;t detract from the quality or experience overall. You&#39;re greeted upon entering, served with a smile, and thanked on your way out. Even if the coffee and food wasn&#39;t that great it would still be a pleasant experience. But the coffee and food IS great. Limited food menu, but I prefer quality over quantity. <br><br>I get the chicken and mushroom wrap or roast beef sandwich with a coffee and am always pleasantly satisfied - good, reliable, quality. Add a pastry for dessert if you&#39;re still hungry. And if there are no seats left, have your coffee to go and take a seat in the climbing gym next door to watch the action. <br><br>I have nothing but praise for this place!

This place is great, you can feel the passion behind the people who made it. Slightly quirky and unique and at the core a great product. The prices are reasonable too.<br>Flat white &amp; an early grey croissant for me every time!

Dozens of cafes and how many of them have any character? A very very low proportion. But Brawn &amp; Brains is absolutely buzzing with it. The team behind this cafe obviously care a lot about the way it looks &amp; feels.<br><br>The coffee was also excellent - easily one of the best cups I&#39;ve had in Singapore. I neglected to ask exactly who roasted it but I will definitely be back to try some more. Unfortunately the location is a little out of the way but Guillemard Road is close enough to where I live to make it worth a trip out.<br><br>The star gets knocked off for the uncomfortable seating. I get that you&#39;re a hole in the wall serving only drinks &amp; pastries but that&#39;s still no excuse for trying to force patrons out by way of uncomfortable seating. <br><br>Having said this, Brawn &amp; Brains is the only place I&#39;ve ever hesitated on before taking the one-star backless-seating demerit. And that says something.
