text: Excellent reasonably priced world-class coffee.<br>Easily among the best in Singapore.<br><br>Croissant could be better, served cold, it was nice and crispy on the outside, but almost hollow inside.<br><br>The toasted wraps &amp; sandwiches were tasty, meticulously prepared by seriously focused staff. Worth the longer than normal wait. <br><br>Seats could be more comfortable (got sore waiting for food to arrive), perhaps some cushions would help?<br><br>Recommended for take away coffee or lazy weekend brunch (byo cushions).

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/MHLuYj07JraVABFnG31Wyg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/brawn-and-brains-coffee-singapore?reviewid=Sj88fh8ezO2BPbbo1ksMvg&select=MHLuYj07JraVABFnG31Wyg', 'altText': 'Photo of Brawn & Brains Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: Dropped by after a huge downpour to find a really cosy setup manned by one half of the partners, Gwen. She was alone managing the cafe that has 5 people including us who just walked in. She set us down very nicely whilst continuing to prep a sandwich for the other customer. After serving that customer, she took our order of coffee and went about preparing our drink, using the Brazilian bean that we chose out of the 2 offerings (the other being a Sumatran). Not once did she showed any haste or panic to deliver and we were extremely impressed especially when a little 2 year old (there-about) gal threatened to wreck the entire cafe apart with her wilful behaviour, with her dad being a slave to her actions. And not surprisingly, she spilled the dad&#39;s entire cup of iced mocha all over the floor but Gwen simply went about to coax the little girl from crying, etc. Full thumbs up for her immaculate service. Extra brownie points for the not-too-sweet banana cake that she somehow managed to baked whilst all these drama was unfolding in the shop.<br><br>Hopefully they will start roasting in house soon and will drop by again for another cuppa.<br><br>Parking is easy but watch the clock ticking as it&#39;s gantry-cashcard based.

Run by two fantastic human beings and their polite and well trained crew, these guys churn out consistently great coffee. Having a plethora of choices is overrated, so simplicity is the key here. Two types of brew and that&#39;s it! Oh and it&#39;s not overpriced in this age of five buck coffees. Can you tell I&#39;m a fan.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=XOiEM321sU6AJCZVWU4_6Q', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Yun Li L.', 'displayLocation': 'Berkeley, CA', 'altText': 'Yun Li L.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=XOiEM321sU6AJCZVWU4_6Q', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 212, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 4, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Coffee was alright, but the boss was very rude. Space was also very tight. Not worth the price or the wait.

Lovely little joint - the furniture, lights and even the shell for the espresso machine are custom made, and beauuuuutiful. Gwen handles the shop on her own, from baking to coffee-making to cashiering and dish washing. SALUTE! And she&#39;s got a smile on too... Very very impressive. Coffees were pretty good. I preferred the Sumatra Lintong + Colombia blend: fuller body and flavour. And that slice of lemon cream cheese bundt cake was just what I needed this afternoon. Will be looking to come back!

text: This is a sweet and cozy place where you can hangout with a really good cup of coffee. Everyone must try their cake selections. It&#39;s not much, but you will drool for more. This is going to be one of my regular weekend hangout.

I had the Iced Caffe Latte, which is the more popular drink here. They had 2 type of coffee beans: organic fair trade and Sumatra Lintong (blend), which I had the former. This had a double shot of ristretto. One taste and I really enjoyed it. It doesn&#39;t have a strong bitter taste while retaining the strong coffee taste. Possibly one of the nicest coffee I have taken to date.

text: One of the best brunch places we went to in Singapore! I ordered an iced coffee, truffle scrambled eggs, and avocado bruschetta which were all delicious. I would only recommend the truffle scrambled eggs if you know you&#39;re a fan of truffle oil, as the taste can be a little strong! The coffee and appetizers were great!<br><br>On top of this, servers went out of their way to be kind and even ran after us outside when we forgot a pair of glasses at our table!

text: They have really good food over there! I especially love the Rostis and the desserts, although the price might be more on the expensive side! Would get it again once in a while

text: One of the best brunches I&#39;ve had in a long time. Reminded me of the hipster brunch places in PDX, which is always a good first sign. They have delicious coffee.. a second good sign. Great vibe too, and its a hole in the wall place below a nondescript HBD complex. But easy enough to get too via MRT/Bus.<br>I got the smoked salmon with scrambled eggs and a baked tomato. The salmon was fresh, eggs were done perfectly. Wife got the baked eggs which were delicious, cupcake sized baked eggs wrapped in bacon on brioche..just mouth watering!! Had the affogato to wrap up brunch, and the espresso was just delicious, warm earthy tones, that paired well with the salted caramel ice cream. Must try place in SGP!

This was actually our first meal in Singapore and it was absolutely delicious. I got the Iced Orange Mocha and the Norwegian Smoked Salmon Scrambled Eggs. The mocha had a great flavor and was not too sweet. My actual meal came with a lot of fresh avocado slices and was just the perfect, hearty and healthy breakfast that I needed. The workers were so friendly and the place is extremely aesthetic. My friend really wanted to come back to try their other foods, but unfortunately, there were just so many places to try. Definitely my favorite brunch place when we were there though!

text: Finally, a delicious brunch spot in Singapore that doesn&#39;t charge an arm and a leg for a decent meal. <br><br>Located at an HDB block about an 8 minute walk from both Lavender and Bugis MRT stops, Tolido provides fantastic all day breakfast items along with a robust pasta menu. With most menu items priced between S$10-15, I left the cafe feeling full and satisfied. They also take reservations over the phone, which makes getting a coveted spot indoors very feasible. <br><br>Will definitely be coming back again to try some of the other items on the menu.

text: Having stayed in Singapore numerous times, we discovered this place through trip adviser and what a great find as we tire of hotel buffets. So we revisited again to discover it&#39;s still as good as 6 months ago. <br>I&#39;m not into coffee but Anna and rated it highly, all coffees are double shot unless single preferred. Milk options a little light compared to Australia ie Almond milk. <br>The food serves are generous and really tasty as displayed in the photos, plenty of truffle in the eggs and cherry tomatoes in the shakshouka. <br>We haven&#39;t had lunch here so cannot comment on the dishes to the right of the menu. <br>Highly recommend Toledo&#39;s.

text: Prawns for breakfast? Sure, why not? This is a cute place to have both Singapore based food and the American breakfast---both utterly crucial to WHERE me and my boyfriend were going to eat (he wanted American vs I wanted Singapore food). Tolido&#39;s came to the rescue! Although the walk was a bit of a hike from where we were staying (Bugis shopping mall area), it was worth the walk. The service was spot on and the wait wasn&#39;t too terrible. Granted, I still recommend making reservations if you want a spot inside! It can get pretty busy otherwise.

Tolido&#39;s Espresso Nook is a great little breakfast place.<br><br>Tolido&#39;s is a cute little place in Singapore that, while not particularly convenient, is definitely worth walking over to.  Neither the coffee nor the sweet breakfast is the best I&#39;ve ever had, but both were definitely pretty solid, and service was appropriately quick.  It&#39;s hard to complain in that regard - I got in, had a good breakfast, and got out in less than 30 minutes!

The Good:<br>  :: a local business!<br>  :: service is you get seated, then you order food from the counter. when it&#39;s ready they deliver it to you at your table. very straightforward!<br>  :: delicious, healthy fare. go for brunch! i had the eggs with mushrooms and bacon, and it was so yummy<br>  :: they also serve coffee, tea, and pastries<br>  :: they take credit cards<br><br>The Bad:<br>  :: can get really really crowded during peak times<br>  :: not ideal for large groups. small groups are fine, but if you want to come here with a group larger than 2-4 people, you are going to struggle to find a place for you all<br><br>The Ugly:<br>  :: none<br><br>Would I go back? For certain! This place is a really great, charming, casual dining experience that makes me feel like I&#39;m back in the States. <br><br>This place is IN.

text: Ok wow. We were dropped off a block away and got nervous due to the other stores on the shopping strip - but DO NOT turn back, keep going and make it to Tolido&#39;s! There is a huge menu of coffee drinks, both &#34;safe&#34; choices as well as local inspired creations. Iced coffe, ice blends, and espresso drinks alike. The food menu offers unique items with fresh ingredients like smoked salmon lox and sausages. They have an all day menu and a entree menu with seafood and pastas. We had the Rösti with smoked salmon, as well as baked eggs with capers and fresh dill. So satisfying! Thanks Tolido&#39;s!

text: One of our finds for Sunday brunches. Good coffee and all day breakfast. The sea salt caramel latte was heavenly. Cafe had a nice relaxed vibe.

text: This is my first time to Singapore and Tolido&#39;s was a great recommendation!!  Service was great, atmosphere was pleasant and the food was amazing! The portions were very nice and I will be back:)

text: This is going to be one of my new favourite brunch places. We found the recommendation online and in spite of the difficulty in finding good parking spots, this place is definitely worth thevisit. It reminds me of the cafes that you would find in Melbourne, Sydney. Locals and travellers seem to know of this place as it was packed on a Saturday morning. Their version of baked eggs brought us back to our favourite haunts in Sydney and their pandan pancake was delightful with its full pandas flavour and gula melaka on the side. They serve their coffee with a standard double shot. While the kinds of food is not revolutionary, they do it very well. One of the major plus points to this place is the lower price of food compared to other similar establishments. Most items are priced in the 13-18 dollar range. I&#39;m going to keep this place in my rotating list of brunch places.

text: I have to admit this place wasn&#39;t the easiest to find but the food is good and it comes out very quick after you order even when it&#39;s a full house! We ordered the tolido pancakes and 3 egg omelette. The bacon was so good! Need more of that! The pancakes are so light and fluffy! Def a treat for me! The 3<br>Egg omelettes are also very fluffy and almost liquidy on the inside!<br><br>Update 26th sept 2014: so now that it&#39;s my 3rd time here. I decided to try the ultimate combo and it&#39;s delicious! The bacon smelt so good, it would make anyone hungry! The pancakes were just as good.. They may look like normal pancakes but just wait till you put them into your mouth! It&#39;s so fluffy and tasty!! The Rosti with cheese sausages for $12.90 is a good price and the Rosti is delish! I did have to tell them to cook with less oil as the last time I had it. My plate was flooded with a layer of oil...  I need to visit here more often to checkout more menu items like the cereal bacon! :)

text: The ambience is fabulous and the decor is hip! A great hangout for youngsters for sure. Love the cakes, latte and cappuccino and the service is impeccable!  <br><br>The price is slightly steep. I would really love to hangout here if parking is easier.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/LKBDLMVcWF7ngBWskxmzxA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tolidos-espresso-nook-singapore-3?reviewid=LuCKyCfjsydQ8Frvbnr1Ww&select=LKBDLMVcWF7ngBWskxmzxA', 'altText': "Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore", 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: I had a flat white and was very pleased they used Yahava beans. The coffee was great, second only to Yahava. The barista was also very friendly, taking the time to explain what a kopi latte was and recommend some choice picks at the cafe. Apparently, the barista came in third at a Singapore latte art competition. <br><br>As we were stuffed, we did not order any food but we saw many orders for the pandan pancake which looked sumptuous. We&#39;ll be back to try that. <br><br>The place was doing a roaring trade on a Sunday afternoon.

text: Amazing breakfast spot. We tried the Ultimate Combo. Perfect portion size and good price. Sat outside and watched city go by. Croissants were amazing and perfectly baked. Served hot with New Zealand Anchor butter. Service was really great with a smile. Food came fast. Perfect breakfast spot! Clean restrooms.

text: First time here. Good vibes hit me as soon as I  walked thru the doors... &#34;hmmm good start&#34; I thought to myself :) <br><br>Super friendly and happy staff - checked<br>Tasty yummy food - checked<br>Awesome coffee - checked<br>Affordable prices - checked<br>Fairly accessible - checked (either 5-10mins walk from Lavender mrt or park at nearby hdb parking lots behind)<br><br>Had the croissant with scrambled eggs and streaky bacon, rosti with sunny side egg and bratwurst (recommended by staff), pandan pancakes with vanilla ice cream and gula melaka sauce *hhhhhhhnnnn* few cuppa flat whites..<br><br>Walked out with a happy tummy and a smile on my face. Kudos, Tolido&#39;s! I&#39;ll be back for sure :D

Double shot coffee at a much lower price than Starbucks and with a wonderful latte art!!??  I say kudos to the owner as passion for good coffee shows.  Service was also efficient and food wonderful.  Only thing is you got to be patient for the wait as good things come to those who waits :).

text: Another hipster cafe? Great. There aren&#39;t enough of them to go round this little island :)<br><br>The food is generally tasty - standard fare that you would expect from a regular hipster cafe. Likewise for decor - it may not necessary &#34;wow&#34; you but it certainly isn&#39;t poorly done up. Would I recommend it? Yes, if you happen to be in the neighborhood.

Pandan pancakes (bottom)", 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Pandan pancakes (bottom)'}]
text: I&#39;m so happy to find so many cozy cafes popping up around the island, and it&#39;s always heartening to see local spins on usual brunch items.<br><br>The one thing that stood out to me on the menu was an SG50 special - pandan pancakes! Don&#39;t expect it to be like a pandan chiffon cake (because duh it&#39;s a pancake), but they were still delightfully fluffy and I easily downed the whole plate of three.<br><br>They currently have pineapple waffles for CNY, and I would be back to try if I have the time.<br><br>One star off for the rather overwhelming truffle oil smell that hits you when you walk in - I like them truffle fries, but don&#39;t really want to smell like one.

Rosti, egg, bratwurst.", 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Rosti, egg, bratwurst.'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/mG32P4awziGPyHHv4Lst2g/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tolidos-espresso-nook-singapore-3?reviewid=ciFgIbVZfOxLJGe6AMhF1A&select=mG32P4awziGPyHHv4Lst2g', 'altText': "Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore", 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}]
text: After the giant surge of cafes opening up in Singapore in the past 2 years, I confess I have been biased against cafe food, because they tend to be a standard cookie-cutter menu in some sort of hipster backdrop.<br><br>We came here on a public holiday for lunch, and waited about 10 minutes for a place for two, inside. We ordered an ice blended chocolate, an ice blended coffee, strawberry cream cheese pancakes, and bratwurst on a rosti. Oh man, I do love the food here. The food here didn&#39;t take too long, and the drinks were decent and not overly sweet, and they do ask if you want whipped cream on or off your ice blended drinks. The cream cheese pancakes are two giant fluffy pancakes with A LOT of cream cheese custard filled in between the two, and strawberry sauce drizzled all over. I am glad we got a savory other dish, because we were sugar-overloaded, but happy nonetheless. The crispy rosti really deserves a special mention, with two bratwursts, a fried sunny-side-up, and sour cream. Would be even better with green scallions on top, but this is as good as it gets!<br><br>I would come back. Again and again.<br><br>Oh, and free wifi.

text: This place was a special find!  We stumbled upon it in search for a breakfast spot on our last day in Singapore!  Delicious food and the coffee is outstanding.  It has an American flare of a menu and similar to the quirky PDX (Portland) food which is exceptional.  They it you won&#39;t be disappointed.

text: Tolido&#39;s is a nice escape from the heat, and an intimate setting with incredible food. If I spent more time in Singapore, I would definitely become a regular.<br><br>To start, the pandan waffles are just amazing. An incredible blend of pandan topped with coconut ice cream... But of course, I couldn&#39;t just stop there! I decided to go all out and also ordered the truffle eggs. A combination I wouldn&#39;t have thought of on my own, but it couldn&#39;t have been more perfect. I still dream about the food here... Amazingly delicious.

I visited here while on vacation and was very pleased! The service and food were great. I recommend it to everyone and would definitely eat here again!

text: Excellent baked egg royale, brioche was awesome with Wasabi cream cheese. Highly recommend

I am so happy that we found Tolido&#39;s Espresso Nook.  The place is cute as a button, trendy, comfortable and friendly.  The coffee is on point - the staff is awesome, and the breakfast we had was excellent.  We really enjoyed the vibe - and the laid back atmosphere.  Just what the Dr. ordered while on vacation.<br><br>Don&#39;t delay - go today!

text: We&#39;ve been here twice now.  Definitely make a reservation and sit inside unless you&#39;re just looking for a quick coffee.  The food is unbelievably good here.  I highly recommend the Pandan pancakes!

Flat White Coffee!", 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Flat White Coffee!'}]
text: Love, love, love Tolido! Who can&#39;t resist a charming neighborhood hangout that boasts a top-notch Barista and a kitchen that can whip up a seriously good breakfast meal (not to mention an assortment of pastas).<br><br>I went here with my wife for our usual Sunday brunch where we normally try to recover from a night of going out by eating a filling breakfast. I ordered the Banana Pancakes (Yum!) while my wife ordered the French Toast (Double Yum!). What stood out to me was not just the great taste and the beautiful presentation, but rather the intangibles. Specifically, the soul and love that was put into each dish and each cup of coffee made for that matter. It definitely brought me back to that feeling when my parents used to serve me banana pancakes when I was a young boy. <br><br>So much can be said of Tolido, but I&#39;ll some it up by these select adjectives: welcoming, charming, neighborly, pleasant, and cozy. Did I mention the All Day Breakfast!!! Count me in! <br><br>Kudos to Douglas for introducing himself to my wife and I and making us feel at home.

text: This little coffee shop was a great escape from the heat. The interior reminded me of coffee shops that you find in the Northwest. I got the affogato (ice cream with espresso). Both the coffee &amp; ice cream were of superior quality making it a wonderful afternoon snack on a hot day.

text: American in Singapore, had breakfast two out three mornings. Great American style breakfast and great friendly service, highly recommend.

I liked the Gula Melaka pancake. For local tastebuds, that&#39;s the bomb. <br><br>Sadly, service was a huge disappointment. Person taking orders was abit rude and unable to customise orders ( like adding cheese to egg, was like super challenging) and he doesn&#39;t know the ingredients well so was clueless most of the time. <br><br>It feels like mostly a student hangout place. Coffee is not bad.

text: Great French Toast, one of the best we have had in the last few years in around Asia and Europe. Coffee is better than average.

text: Great menu and service though go early on weekends if you don&#39;t want to queue. Coffee was fabulous as was.the hot chocolate.
By far my new favorite breakfast spot in Singapore. Reasonable prices (for Singapore), great food, friendly staff, and an all day hip vibe. We&#39;ll be back tomorrow.

Spiced Chai Latte", 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Spiced Chai Latte'}]
text: Been hearing all the raving about this place from a bunch and friends and I FINALLY got to visit today and it didnt disappoint. While small, it&#39;s not too noisy even when crowded. So I guess the crowd are pretty refined (albeit young). <br><br>They serve up Yahava Koffee here so fans of Yahava KoffeeWorks can enjoy a nice cuppa here though they wont have the full Yahava selection here. I&#39;m really not a coffee person so am just happy to settle with a nice cup of fragrant Chai Latte. <br><br>Didnt had too much time to try the mains but I managed to grab a bite of their plain pancakes. It&#39;s a little pricey at $6 for 3 plain pancakes only, at $7 or more, you could try their Banana Pancakes or the Tolido Pancakes that comes with sausages. The pancakes are soft and fluffy, nice texture but still lacks a little bit of the richness compared to those that you&#39;ll get at McDs.<br><br>They have breakfast all day menu and pasta mains. Simple cafe with a good variety. Staff are really friendly and nice. Would not hesitate to go back to try more food from their menu soon!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/s6mGYCVF_OB0-NJWoMYZCQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tolidos-espresso-nook-singapore-3?reviewid=K7u94qSj__x_riwMVoCDlA&select=s6mGYCVF_OB0-NJWoMYZCQ', 'altText': "Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. When craving western breakfast go to Tolido&#39;s! Plus they&#39;ve got REALLY great coffee  #Singapore", 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': "When craving western breakfast go to Tolido's! Plus they've got REALLY great coffee  #Singapore"}]
text: Their food is so delicious here. Everyone in my group (7 people including young kids) all loved their food. Their coffee is really delicious as well!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/TnqADHcvlmfIoFhjdIipWg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tolidos-espresso-nook-singapore-3?reviewid=Fo7fj6RmG2mRSscFq9KA6w&select=TnqADHcvlmfIoFhjdIipWg', 'altText': "Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Pandan Pancakes and Salted Caramel Latte- great enough to make me battle the line to the carpark!", 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Pandan Pancakes and Salted Caramel Latte- great enough to make me battle the line to the carpark!'}]
text: My friend has been telling me about their pandan pancakes for a while, so after lunch at Kampong Glam we decided to get some dessert and coffee at Tolido. It was still buzzing with the lunch crowd but emptied out pretty soon after  1.30. My stack of three Pandan pancakes were good. Fluffy with a whiff of pandan, they were great with the ice-cream and Gula Melaka drizzle. I had the perfect Salted Caramel Latte too- smooth, milky, and rich enough to leave you wanting. I like that unlike some cafes, they have their act together - AND the staff are smiling. Win. (And TIP if you&#39;re impressed ok. That&#39;s how we spread the love!)

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/w-amlbihuFiLql0BNqJbeA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tolidos-espresso-nook-singapore-3?reviewid=nKe20YXXiHjonQHI1N90Tw&select=w-amlbihuFiLql0BNqJbeA', 'altText': "Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Attractive frontage", 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Attractive frontage'}]
text: The ambience is fabulous and the decor is hip! A great hangout for youngsters for sure. Love the cakes, latte and cappuccino and the service is impeccable!  <br><br>The price is slightly steep. I would really love to hangout here if parking is easier.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/kcCRKKxO9Lm4fZo9TNIGuQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tolidos-espresso-nook-singapore-3?reviewid=0RUDSrsHFuh12mI7l9jYxA&select=kcCRKKxO9Lm4fZo9TNIGuQ', 'altText': "Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Prawn laksa noodle", 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Prawn laksa noodle'}]
text: Good vibe, good food. Came here based on yelp reviews for breakfast. My husband ordered pancakes and the pumpkin spice latte. He really enjoyed his meal, which is a plus. I ordered the laksa prawn noodle as I wanted to try what locals love to eat. It was good, but probably not my favorite flavor. Staff is nice here and the restaurant is a nice place to relax and have a wonderful time. Worth a visit!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/LKBDLMVcWF7ngBWskxmzxA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tolidos-espresso-nook-singapore-3?reviewid=LuCKyCfjsydQ8Frvbnr1Ww&select=LKBDLMVcWF7ngBWskxmzxA', 'altText': "Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore", 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: I had a flat white and was very pleased they used Yahava beans. The coffee was great, second only to Yahava. The barista was also very friendly, taking the time to explain what a kopi latte was and recommend some choice picks at the cafe. Apparently, the barista came in third at a Singapore latte art competition. <br><br>As we were stuffed, we did not order any food but we saw many orders for the pandan pancake which looked sumptuous. We&#39;ll be back to try that. <br><br>The place was doing a roaring trade on a Sunday afternoon.

Pandan pancakes (bottom)", 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Pandan pancakes (bottom)'}]
text: I&#39;m so happy to find so many cozy cafes popping up around the island, and it&#39;s always heartening to see local spins on usual brunch items.<br><br>The one thing that stood out to me on the menu was an SG50 special - pandan pancakes! Don&#39;t expect it to be like a pandan chiffon cake (because duh it&#39;s a pancake), but they were still delightfully fluffy and I easily downed the whole plate of three.<br><br>They currently have pineapple waffles for CNY, and I would be back to try if I have the time.<br><br>One star off for the rather overwhelming truffle oil smell that hits you when you walk in - I like them truffle fries, but don&#39;t really want to smell like one.

Kopi latte", 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Kopi latte'}]
text: Finally, a delicious brunch spot in Singapore that doesn&#39;t charge an arm and a leg for a decent meal. <br><br>Located at an HDB block about an 8 minute walk from both Lavender and Bugis MRT stops, Tolido provides fantastic all day breakfast items along with a robust pasta menu. With most menu items priced between S$10-15, I left the cafe feeling full and satisfied. They also take reservations over the phone, which makes getting a coveted spot indoors very feasible. <br><br>Will definitely be coming back again to try some of the other items on the menu.

Tolido&#39;s.", 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': "Tolido's."}]
text: Another hipster cafe? Great. There aren&#39;t enough of them to go round this little island :)<br><br>The food is generally tasty - standard fare that you would expect from a regular hipster cafe. Likewise for decor - it may not necessary &#34;wow&#34; you but it certainly isn&#39;t poorly done up. Would I recommend it? Yes, if you happen to be in the neighborhood.

text: People are nice, tap water is for free, The cold low fat chocolate was great and the banana pan cakes I had were the best ever! They just don&#39;t get full points because I were missing one savory vegeterian solution on the menue such as avocado smash...

text: The coffee is good, really good. But under no circumstances is it appropriate to wait 30 minutes for a coffee. We ordered, received our food. I went to the counter after 15 minutes to confirm they remembered our coffees. Food now finished. Someone comes over to confirm our coffee order and we repeat our order. 15 more minutes we receive a coffee. This place has great potential, but great coffee without great service makes for an average experience.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=n0irZkZMvXNrEWn8Ny20uw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/MXKqCMpIgyiykasVzBpjFA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/MXKqCMpIgyiykasVzBpjFA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/MXKqCMpIgyiykasVzBpjFA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/MXKqCMpIgyiykasVzBpjFA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/MXKqCMpIgyiykasVzBpjFA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/MXKqCMpIgyiykasVzBpjFA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Donnie C.', 'displayLocation': 'New York, NY', 'altText': 'Donnie C.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=n0irZkZMvXNrEWn8Ny20uw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': 25, 'reviewCount': 25, 'eliteYear': None}
text: If your from the states like I am and looking to take a break from the local hawker stand and looking for alittle taste of back home; this is definitely a place to check out. The staff are awesome and they really make you feel at home. Definitely try the milk shake even for breakfast; with the Singapore heat wave, this delectable frost of goodness just make the meal complete.
Great little cafe! One of our favorite spots during our trip to Singapore. Great food, atmosphere and coffee!
Very good breakfast with reasonable prices. We had the bacon and eggs, croissant, banana almond French toast and waffle jammer. Americano coffee with one shot was more like coffee in the states.
Fine way to eat breakfast western style. Its really cheap in terms of singapore prices :) we eat some pancakes and scrambled eggs which were good!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=ahdXxJl2wiEIKzr26akDzw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Jane S.', 'displayLocation': 'Concord, CA', 'altText': 'Jane S.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=ahdXxJl2wiEIKzr26akDzw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 1, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Pro:<br>- Food is delicious<br>- French toast is amazing! But to small (more bacon)<br>- ultimate combo is tasty and good amount of food <br><br>Con:<br>- Portion size between plates varies to much <br><br>- Smoke salmon not worth the cost. Flavor is ok but nothing amazing<br><br>- Service is terrible, they bring u food but no utensils. If u ask them for something don&#39;t expect them to remember. <br><br>- Seating is poorly done. It&#39;s a mixture of first come first serve, reservation, and who ever tells the guy walking around where they want to sit.

Excellent food. They understand what real Western breakfast food is. The maple syrup is potent; the pancake is eggy and fluffy; the coffee is good, but a but sour. It&#39;s a great place to get your early morning fuel.

text: Eating in Tolido&#39;s is a great opportunity for people who love breakfast and pastas. The food looks very presentable and the taste is oustandingly perfect. If any of you are breakfast and pasta fans or even either one, come to Tolido!!!
Cheap and easy. Food was good and came quick. If I&#39;m in the neighborhood, I&#39;ll definitely come back.
Love this place! One of the few brunch places in Singapore where you can get some decently priced grubs! Food is good too!

text: Ice blended sea salt caramel latte was great (but not so much when it&#39;s hot). Smoked salmon carbonara didn&#39;t quite work. The Ultimate pancakes and bacon were good separately but as a whole, the dish didn&#39;t make an impression. Service is excellent, staff were friendly and accommodating.

text: The coffee is good, really good. But under no circumstances is it appropriate to wait 30 minutes for a coffee. We ordered, received our food. I went to the counter after 15 minutes to confirm they remembered our coffees. Food now finished. Someone comes over to confirm our coffee order and we repeat our order. 15 more minutes we receive a coffee. This place has great potential, but great coffee without great service makes for an average experience.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=0yzeBHzE_pipN2AUO1S1WQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'andrew a.', 'displayLocation': 'Houston, TX', 'altText': 'andrew a.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=0yzeBHzE_pipN2AUO1S1WQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 37, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Oh, so delicious! So glad we found this place, with wonderful breakfast specials to go with their extraordinary brewed offerings. Would be very difficult to choose which dish I liked the most, but I think I&#39;d go with the pandan pancakes, which were perfectly prepared and the pandan adds a wonderful touch. Would not go to Singapore without visiting this place.

text: Glad I took the recommendation from them to try their pandan pancake. And the waffles with egg, bacon and scrambled egg was heavenly. Loved the scrambled egg especially!

text: Fortunately, there are quite a few places in Singapore to grab a decent cup of coffee, and while I didn&#39;t actually end up having a coffee here, it is still one of those places where coffee is basically available at any time of the day. Actually, I just stopped here for a cup of tea, and it wasn&#39;t all that bad either, and neither was the price. In fact before I knew it, the tea was in front of me and I was merrily enjoying it. Oh, and it&#39;s also open twenty-four hours, which basically means you can also come here first thing in the morning and expect it to be open.

Front entrance as the queue starts to form...', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Front entrance as the queue starts to form...'}]
text: Let me begin by saying this is a small, neighborhood establishment. It opens at 8:00 AM. Me and my friend decide to get there before the opening because we had an engagement which required us to leave the hotel at 8:15 AM. We showed up at 7:45 AM and there was already a queue. This tells you how good this place is.<br><br>Taking a hint from the French patisseries, this establishment is quaint and comfortable, typical of its European model. The individual comes in, grabs a Danish or a breaded product with a cappuccino, and makes their way towards the beginning of a new day. <br><br>I cannot say enough about how good the bread is in this place! The almond croissant stole the day, it&#39;s crispy, sweet base contrasted delightfully with it&#39;s flaky, soft body. I almost wish I had purchased two of them!<br><br>The apple (my apologies that I did not get the full name of it) also had that sweet succulent flavor combined with the flaky bread crust. The ham and cheese croissant would have been stupendous except the ham selection left a lot to be desired. <br><br>Whenever I am in Singapore I will make it my business to show up at this establishment in order to enjoy it&#39;s fattening but delightful

text: Neither my kouign amann nor my green tea croissant were as up to snuff as snob carb moi expected. The expectations were much too high. Certainly the ones I have had in other places had better buttery lamination with gooD flavor.<br><br>The KA simply wasn&#39;t buttery or fluffy enough ( sounds funny that a KA could actually NOT be buttery enuf)-- And the caramel-y bit was amiss. Not cheap prices, just expected more. Places like B and arcisault and Tartine are my benchmark comparisons.

I set my expectations too high for a high-end bakery named after the hipster neighborhood it&#39;s in. When I arrived 5 minutes before closing time, I was hit with a nice gust of AC. As expected, options were limited. I expected some sort of discount, as many bakeries do near closing time, but they did not have.<br><br>After I settled on the Mille Feuille, the older woman behind the counter said it was $9.10. The display had said $8.50, so I asked her if she charged me the dine-in price. Instead of just answering me, she snarkily started explaining that here in SINGAPORE, they have to pay a &#34;thing&#34; called &#34;GST&#34; to their government and this money does not go to them. I said yes, I&#39;ve been in Singapore for 4 months already and that wasn&#39;t my question; I want to know if you know mine is to-go. Then she said, &#34;you should know that already then.&#34;<br><br>Who talks like that to a customer overpaying for your pastry? Eventually, I figured it out and said, oh I see that GST isn&#39;t included in the price, although sometimes it already is. <br><br>But speaking of the Mille Feuille, it was such a letdown. The cream had barely any flavor and the puff pastry layers were bland too, leaning on the salty side. The highlight of this dessert was literally the raspberries.

Plain croissant', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Plain croissant'}]
text: If you&#39;re desperate for a good French croissant, Tiong Bahru nails it. <br><br>It&#39;s fluffy inside, has crisp outer layers that fall apart into flakes when torn apart and your fingers get a little greasy. My daughter loved it too.<br><br>I tasted their croissant at their Safari location (such a cute ambiance!) and had a few other classic French items there. Hence, the determination to go to the original location.<br><br>This bakery is a stone&#39;s throw away from Tiong Bahru Food centre, so if you&#39;re in the neighborhood, do stop by. Stick to the classics (plain croissant, latte, cannele) and save yourself some dough (haha) from the expensive items on the pastry display case. I tried a flawless looking chocolate eclair (S$7.50)  but was a bit disappointed when I bit into it. The custard was nice tasting, but the outside didn&#39;t taste fresh. <br><br>Things took a downturn when I received my iced earl grey lavender latte, because it arrived with just plain 3 tea bags. Did I just pay S$6.80 for ICED TEA?!  I asked the lady who brought my tea to confirm this is my order, she came back to say this is correct. Last time I checked, a latte comes with milk (!!) should I have brought my own?!<br><br>Also, do note that even if you purchase items for take away, you still get charged for the 10% cover charge. <br><br>This place was named best French bakery in Singapore. I highly doubt it.

text: Really awesome bakery in a young kinda hipster neighborhood of Singapore... make sure to walk around and check out stores/bookshops/murals!<br><br>The croissant was heavenly, but i think my favorite part was the creams and jams available in little pots. I was able to put as much nutella as i wanted on my croissant, which made me quite happy :) Def take advantage!!

text: We definitely over carb-ed here LOL trying everything and being two people, but ONE LIFE - NO REGRETS! <br><br>Came on a weekend - and everyone was there!!! So super hard to get a table, we waited a bit. The traffic was just flowing with ppl buying pastries and coffee - some to go and some to stay. <br><br>We bought a bunch of goodies. Then ate it. Then more goodies!!!!

Latte, salmon spinach quiche, and chocolate almond croissant.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Latte, salmon spinach quiche, and chocolate almond croissant.'}]
text: Amazing place for breakfast! Nothing short of perfection. <br><br>The latte I ordered was flawless, and the salmon spinach quiche was simply delightful. I found nothing wrong with this place. It was not crowded, extremely clean, and the staff was engaging during our visit. <br><br>I think a return visit is mandatory.

Green tea almond croissant ($4.50) - 4 stars<br>Much better than I last remember/reviewed, and probably one of the best croissants I&#39;ve had in Singapore. Would love for it to be a bit less sweet though.

Yes, it&#39;s as good as the hype.<br><br>Take it from a pastry-hating, sweet-tooth-lacking miser. Even though the almond chocolate croissants are over $4, they are worth it. <br><br>Their flaky outside somehow holds a thick, kind of gooey, but not cloying, center, outlined in good rich dark chocolate. The paper bag is hefty in your hand when you carry it out - felt like a good pound.

text: Nothing can beat handmade croissants with homemade pandan egg custard jam (free from the condiment bar). We have been going back to this place every time we are in Singapore. Located in quiet neighborhood, worth checking the shops around the bakery store.

text: Alway a lime at this outlet at lunch time.<br><br>Good quality sandwiches and croissants.<br><br>Almond croissant was a little heavy. Some sweet thing stuffed inside that makes it a bit jelat.<br><br>Coffee is strong.<br><br>Friendly service. Systematic way of dealing with the crowd.<br><br>From the notice board, I found that they have another 100% gluten free cafe called The Butcher&#39;s Wife which is about 5 minutes from this cafe.

text: Delicious pastry..<br>I have tried many different bakeries and out of all the locations, this is the BEST.<br><br>I can&#39;t remember the names of the pastries I ate but I have photos..  These are the most popular and best selling items in the store.  Crispy outside and so soft inside...<br><br>Also, their coffee is so good..  This is not normal coffee..  Just to give you an idea, Starbucks coffee level 3, coffee from here is level 8.  Coffees are specially brewed by barista to perfection.  It takes time to receive the order but worth it.<br><br>I also ordered Ice Chocolate glass bottle drink because I love the bottle...  Not only the bottle looks pretty, taste is even better.  Very deep rich taste.  Employee told me these are made and prepared daily.  Very good but expensive compare to other items..  <br><br>Next time, I should try their fresh juice...

text: This is a really nice Little Bakery.  They have many pastry selections as well as coffee to choose from. The Cinnamon Chocolate swirl that I ordered was nice and flaky and tasted good.  Although the mocha that I had ordered was okay.

text: The baked goods and sandwiches are top quality. Coffee is too, but they only have medium roast beans. This is Asia and they like it medium. I preferred dark roast, and I would rate this bakery a 4-star.<br><br>The teh tarik is one of the best that I have had. And the first that I have seen with latte art. This would be an awesome beverage if they make the tea a bit stronger.

text: very nice bakery just outside the hawker center. nice place to cool off from the heat once you have had your hawker center fare. I was very impressed with their latte art! Nice selection of pastries and baked goods too.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/gknSpo1xzohdt1_SS2BOvA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tiong-bahru-bakery-singapore-4?reviewid=D2RGQ5EoTPYOm-ZRh0F7ow&select=gknSpo1xzohdt1_SS2BOvA', 'altText': 'Photo of Tiong Bahru Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. What is left of my croissant + my hot chocolate', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'What is left of my croissant + my hot chocolate'}]
text: This place was right next yo my hotel. Lucky me!!. Ofcourse I got the croissant. Yummy. They are really soft and chewy. Not like typical croissants.<br>I got the plain one with hot chocolate with soy milk. I got these 2 days back to back. I will likely go back for the hot chocolate but I had to say to myself &#34;Self, you can&#39;t eat croissants every day while you are in Singapore!&#34;<br>So today I will go elsewhere.<br>The store itself it&#39;s moderately sized. I really like the door..<br>Staff there are pleasant.

Famous bakery chain in Singapore known for its croissant. The croissant is the heavy dense kind (as opposed to the soft airy flaky one). The croissant is rich and guiltily good. The other signature item I would recommend is the Krouig Amman. Though a tad bit sweet, the crispiness of the pastry goes very well with the sugary filling which seeps through each layer of the pastry. Other dessert items are so-so.<br><br>One comment is the quality is a bit inconsistent across branches - the best one is at the original Tiong Bahru branch. Tried it at another outpost, but they slightly overbake/ burnt the croissant.

text: Great bakery... With air conditioning and nice indoor seating! Enjoyed a kouign Amman and cappuccino here and a great start to the day!

text: Definitely a popular spot for people to hangout. I found it a little expensive for certain items and their pastry selection was good. Croissants are kind of flaky. And apple kouign amann was a little too sweet but a good consistency and taste. I&#39;d say the atmosphere was quaint and pleasant. The people working seemed nice although there was a customer in front of me and that was unsure of what to order and the server kind of seemed annoyed. <br><br>The bakery was okay but if I wasn&#39;t in the area, I don&#39;t think I&#39;d travel just to go there. <br><br>Tip 1: go earlier to have more selection. <br>Tip 2: if you&#39;re unsure of what to get, many people try their almond croissant and their coffee

text: COOL OFF<br><br>They make 1 of the best coffees in Singapore and great pastry and cake. Their savoury not so good, no real selection of cold drinks. only 2 to select from so that was a bit strange. On the upside, this place is freezing inside. it&#39;s the first proper air conditioned establishment I have found here. so go in an cool off.<br><br>I love the neighbourhood, very hip n happening. My mate lives upstairs so I like to visit and hang out here, great for people watching.<br><br>Because of their cold drink &#34;situation&#34; I usually go to the market that you can see from the door, take the escalator up and on your left you will see the fresh juice lady. I grab a large watermellon juice (1.20) then go for coffee and cake.

Vibranium pastry', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Vibranium pastry'}]
text: Espresso is not bad actually. I&#39;m assuming they are sourcing from common man because they had boxes with their logo. Anywho, I feel the style is a little dated. Maybe 6 years ago it would have been hipster heaven. <br>Cons, no wifi which is sort of understandable as people will camp out. The major sin is the inedible pastry I ordered. Seriously very old. Are they dumpster diving outside other cafes ?

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/oQtlt9j2Hp92QmX_ortaQQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tiong-bahru-bakery-singapore-4?reviewid=giHyI3usn8T4ZZadmBjNcw&select=oQtlt9j2Hp92QmX_ortaQQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Tiong Bahru Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. Vanilla millefeuille', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Vanilla millefeuille'}]
text: Can here for the first time today as I&#39;ve heard so much about this place. Could only try one thing as it was post-lunch dessert. The VANILLA MILLEFEUILLE was definitely the right choice. It was difficult to cut so we had to resort to using our hands, but it was heaven in every mouthful. The sweetness was just right. The vanilla cream just melts in your mouth and the the biscuity puffs sandwiching it were a perfect complement. <br><br>My latte was alright - have had better coffee elsewhere. Ambiance is so-so. Would be nicer if the staff made sure all the tabletops were clean after customers leave. But if you&#39;re just grabbing and going, nothing to concern you about. <br><br>I also bought some kouign amanns to go. Will update again if I end up being the one eating them!

I have not reviewed this place yet?<br><br>Well, I am trying to hide this from all of you here.<br>This place is crowded in the weekend as people from all walk of life come here for a cuppa of coffee and some delicious croissants! <br><br>In the weekday&#39;s mornings, thankfully, it is not as packed but it is still buzzing. I wonder why people do not have to work and hang out at coffeeshop all the time. <br><br>The bakery is good, though I chance upon quite a disappointing macha croissant today. Just order the original croissant will do. The kouign amann is also good, but a lil too sweet. <br><br>Overall, I like this joint better than the one at City Hall as it is more quaint because it is located within the hip Tiong Bahru neighbourhood.

text: Described as the Tartine Bakery of Singapore, I went here a few times.  I gotta say, I never liked the coffee but the sweet pastries were good (if you&#39;re into that kinda thing) but I did just enjoy the plain croissant.  Enjoy the funky center hinge door when you go.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=h5ZGxCBgeIp4wjHF21UNdQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/6n7OIXI8iTy-Rep_pjguOw/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/6n7OIXI8iTy-Rep_pjguOw/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/6n7OIXI8iTy-Rep_pjguOw/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/6n7OIXI8iTy-Rep_pjguOw/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/6n7OIXI8iTy-Rep_pjguOw/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/6n7OIXI8iTy-Rep_pjguOw/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Irene U.', 'displayLocation': 'Brooklyn, Brooklyn, NY', 'altText': 'Irene U.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=h5ZGxCBgeIp4wjHF21UNdQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': 1, 'reviewCount': 16, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Amazing croissants and beverages. Croissants were the right amount of sweet and their flavoring pleasant and not overpowering. Similar could be said of the tea, coffee, and hot chocolate.

Recently tried their new savoury croissants.<br><br>Speaking of the &#34;Rolling Dumpling&#34;, I would not have guess that it was inspired from Xiao Long Bao if not for the menu description as it lacked the distinctive traits of this classic chinese dumpling such as the slurpy pork broth. Yes, there were pickled ginger and succulent minced meat but the black vinegar dressing could not lift up the dish.<br><br>Nonetheless, the sparkling chemistry between the subtly spiced chorizos and the sweet caramelized onion jam in the &#34;Flying Pig&#34; left me clamouring for more. Its miso dressing did not overpower the dish and I wouldn&#39;t even mind if the sausage was spammed with even more of the tasty onion relish on top. <br><br>As a person with a soft spot for fish, I thought I would love the &#34;Jumping Fish&#34; the most but it turned out otherwise. A bite into this voluptuous croissant revealed an oasis of minced spinach and salmon filling. The smoked salmon was not too salty but the filling, which reminded me of the classic Greek Pie Spanakopita, needed a shake of herbs to bring it to life. <br><br>Another calorie-worthy croissant is the &#34;Running Egg&#34; that was garnished with non-heady Japanese spicy flakes. While ramen egg gurus might insist that the &#34;molten&#34; egg yolk could be more gooey, I thought the current consistency worked well with the bonito flakes and mayonnaise sauce, which contributed to the tasty umami flavours.<br><br>Prepared fresh in batches and kept warm in hotboxes to retain the temperature, all the croissants, except for the Ramen egg, are baked together with the ingredients. This results in a croissant dough that are more moist and chewy while the external layer retains a delightful crunch.<br><br>Each croissant is retailing at $4.50 each or you can select any two flavours to go with the tangy salad with yuzu dressing, dried cranberry and mixed seeds for $12. My suggestion is to enjoy these savoury croissants at the outlets where they are served piping hot and fresh from the oven. <br><br>It&#39;s alright if your stomach acknowledged the aroma of caramelized butter by making some embarrassing growls in public.<br><br>Mine did but so did everyone.

Ordered a chocolate and almond croissant as well as ice chocolate. <br><br>The ice chocolate is very chocolate. Which is great. This is by far the best ice chocolates I&#39;ve ever had, beside la galate de Paris. Which is just awesome to have something so close to perfection. <br><br>They do use real melted chocolate instead of chocolate syrup. Which JC quite rare to find in just any cafe around Singapore. <br><br>As for the croissant. It&#39;s buttery, melt in your mouth buttery. It came very close to what I have had by a professional pastry chef. <br><br>All in all, because it&#39;s too damn close, but as I said... It&#39;s close but not quite... Therefore, it might be the best for Sunday times, but not really for me. I&#39;ve had better... Sad enough I&#39;ve had better.

text: After a disappointing chai, we stopped by Tbb thinking we could at least rely on an oldie. The crumble seemed to have dropped in standard. The filling of fruit was barely there and the layer of crumble was so hard.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/EJR9m4if6HTOjWIuQ-7WxA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tiong-bahru-bakery-singapore-4?reviewid=IG5MDWH5UjbcFb5dRzfOaw&select=EJR9m4if6HTOjWIuQ-7WxA', 'altText': 'Photo of Tiong Bahru Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. Squid ink bun &amp; smoked salmon', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Squid ink bun & smoked salmon'}]
text: There are many awesome bakeries and cafes in Tiong Bahru but none are as packed as this one. This is both the upside and downside of this local bakery - the constant line and flow of people means they are always putting out fresh goodies and pastries and even the displayed cakes aren&#39;t laying around for long. On the downside, it is rather difficult to find a place to sit especially on the weekends and lunch time. With that said, Tiong Bahru bakery is worth a visit as they have many original pastries, cakes and even savory treats, including one of my favorites the squid ink bun. When I lived in Tiong Bahru and even now, it is one of my favorite breakfast cafes.

The bakery in Tiong Bahru is almost always packed with people and I would say it is for a good reason. They have an excellent selection of different pastries to satisfy your sweet tooth. My clear favorite is their Almond Croissant. It is a bit different than most other croissants as it is bigger, heavier and has a slightly more dense feel to it. The generous filling of almond does however make it really nice. <br><br>Most of the other pasties I have tried have also been very good as well as some of the savory croissants as well. They do also sell &#39;regular&#39; bread but actually never tried any of it but it does look nice.<br><br>They serve pretty good coffee as well (from 40 hands) and the teas are also nice. I also like that they manage to keep things moving smoothly despite the place being full and the service is with a smile.

Signature chocolate croissant', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Signature chocolate croissant'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/1BPlOlnX6gaVqFyxMr7byw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tiong-bahru-bakery-singapore-4?reviewid=9oEXR0DJj7HQeUA6kMUX-A&select=1BPlOlnX6gaVqFyxMr7byw', 'altText': 'Photo of Tiong Bahru Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. Nice latte art they serve!', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Nice latte art they serve!'}]
text: Decided to check out the place with the hype among Singaporeans.<br><br>I was pretty excited the moment I stepped into the little store.<br>Got served by this awesome waiter who tries very hard to ensure customers don&#39;t wait for too long for their seats. *thumbs up!*<br><br>Queued, and order a chocolate croissant, pandan croissant and kouign aman.<br>The overwhelming buttery taste of the croissants were SO GOOD. I had this infusion of butter in my blood kinda feeling after my breakfast. (if you know what I mean). <br>The chocolate croissant has a really thin layer of chocolate in appearance, but the taste of chocolate was really strong! pretty delighted with that!<br>Pandan, to me it&#39;s a very localized flavour, and I like the idea of it! It gave croissant a different punch in fragrance, worth a try!<br>Kouign Aman was my companion&#39;s favourite, as it&#39;s salted caramel flavoured! (bread infused with salted butter and caramelized sugar!) <br>Overall taste of the breads were really good!<br><br>Had a latte and received a fantastic latte art. The sight of it makes me love the cup of latte I was holding on to. Taste awesome!<br><br>The bad side: over priced. Totally over priced.<br>Even the coffee is over priced.<br><br>My first bite into the cold breads in the morning was a huge disappointment. I was expecting the bread to be at least warm. All my 3 breads that I ordered were served cold. :(<br><br>All in all, it was only A-OK for me. <br>too much a hype.<br>=/

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/71GrLSSuQCdD95UlXo92iA/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tiong-bahru-bakery-singapore-4?reviewid=5Ib4rbbReOrHE_zoUl_4QQ&select=71GrLSSuQCdD95UlXo92iA', 'altText': 'Photo of Tiong Bahru Bakery - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': ''}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/WL2CW0fIpOPeNu9YfCTuUw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tiong-bahru-bakery-singapore-4?reviewid=5Ib4rbbReOrHE_zoUl_4QQ&select=WL2CW0fIpOPeNu9YfCTuUw', 'altText': 'Photo of Tiong Bahru Bakery - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': ''}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/GFHZgvBQt1YIAngfb-Tx3g/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tiong-bahru-bakery-singapore-4?reviewid=5Ib4rbbReOrHE_zoUl_4QQ&select=GFHZgvBQt1YIAngfb-Tx3g', 'altText': 'Photo of Tiong Bahru Bakery - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': ''}]
text: The Pastry: <br><br>I had the Kouign Aman. Think of a light croissant - crispy, buttery layers topped with salt and caramel. More tasty than their plain croissant and not too sweet, which I liked. They also provided an assortment of fruity jams at the side (self-service). I picked a dark, pump colored one which I suspected was a mixture of fig and blueberries. <br><br> <br>The Sandwich: <br><br>KH had &#34;The Speciality Bun with Bacon&#34; and not being a big fan of bacon, I only took a small bite out of it. It consisted of bacon as its name suggests, onions, rocket salad and sun-dried tomatoes. The bacon strip was neither deep fried nor salty but still tasted good. A much healthier way of consuming bacon has been invented (hurray!). The bun was really soft and not heated. Personally, I prefer my carbs hot and crusty but this was ok too. <br><br>The Beverage:<br><br>The coffee was divine (probably the best part of my meal). I had a simple latte. Later, I learnt that the coffee was provided by Forty Hands (also part of the Food Collective owned by Spa Esprit Group.) Fun Fact: This is the same group behind the concept of House @Dempsey and Skinny Pizza, both of which I enjoy. Definitely looking forward to checking out their other food joints that I haven&#39;t tried, like Open Door Policy  and Forty Hands. <br><br>Overall: 3.5/5 (but I can&#39;t seem to do a 0.5 on Yelp. oh wellz... 4 then :))<br><br>Overall, I think it&#39;s a pretty decent place for an afternoon tea or a light snack if you are around the area (Tiong Bahru can be pretty far and there&#39;s not much to do around there except eat *again* at other places, which we almost did at Rachel&#39;s outrageous suggestion if our bellies weren&#39;t at the brink of exploding).<br><br>Pictures of the cafe and its food can be found on my website, pandarcakes :)
Nice place to sit down for an expensive cup of joe or pastry and pretend like you&#39;re hipster yet chic. Minus one star for no wi-fi.

This place has managed to take all of my money since I&#39;ve started working here, as it&#39;s a 2 minute walk from the office.<br><br>This original location has been around for some time, and it&#39;s still as busy as ever. I am amazed at the amount of people who chill here around 10 AM on weekdays, both locals and expats. I almost want to yell, &#34;Does anyone do any work around here?!&#34;*<br><br>There&#39;s a lot of baked goods to choose from, but I normally aim to satisfy my sweet tooth by ordering their chocolate croissants. Their plain croissants are also worth a try, as they&#39;re super soft, flaky, and buttery. There&#39;s also a savoury that I love, but it has a French name that I can&#39;t remember... all I know is that it smells like pizza and it&#39;s delicious!<br><br>I&#39;m not sure if they do this all the time, but the coffee that they offer is from Forty Hands (as they&#39;re related.) So if you&#39;re a fan of the brand, you can easily get your fix here.<br><br>The only criticism I have is that the furniture is starting to show some wear and tear. If they could just repurpose the chairs and tables, perhaps it will give it a less tired look.<br><br>*You know I would never do such a thing. I&#39;m obviously just jealous!

text: I travel a lot and am always on the search for the perfect Croissant. It is half a world away from where I live (US), but I found it in Singapore in this great Bakery. Who would have thought.

text: Not only are their baguettes possibly the best that you can find in Singapore right now, but they&#39;ve also brought the simple art of jambon beurre sandwiches to our island as well! <br><br>One of my favourite staples whenever I&#39;m in Paris, the ones at Tiong Bahru Bakery are the real deal and the two main sandwich ingredients, ham and butter, are of great quality. Talk about simple pleasures.<br><br>This is definitely THE bakery of the moment, so it gets pretty crowded, even on weekdays. Worth a visit, and make sure you get one of their baguettes to enjoy back at home as well.
