Cute jams!', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Cute jams!'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/yqw6XqLKkp5yY1So8tCTkQ/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tiong-bahru-bakery-singapore-4?reviewid=kTDm-51Sbs3J7ILrEgmKZg&select=yqw6XqLKkp5yY1So8tCTkQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Tiong Bahru Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. Sweets', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Sweets'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Sqt6KQCHXMlForOxxqYttA/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tiong-bahru-bakery-singapore-4?reviewid=kTDm-51Sbs3J7ILrEgmKZg&select=Sqt6KQCHXMlForOxxqYttA', 'altText': 'Photo of Tiong Bahru Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. Savouries', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Savouries'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/s09TCzCbmeX6LVZsTIwKAQ/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tiong-bahru-bakery-singapore-4?reviewid=kTDm-51Sbs3J7ILrEgmKZg&select=s09TCzCbmeX6LVZsTIwKAQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Tiong Bahru Bakery - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': ''}]
text: Bewildering. I never imagined so many types of bread were possible, and is that black bread? Oh squid ink that&#39;s really clever. <br><br>OMG tarts, and croissants, and savouries too, with coffee and tea, in a pleasant great smelling and great looking French bakery that&#39;s quickly gaining popularity judging from the waitlist of people trying to get in. This must be what heaven is like, and French heaven is just extra sexy.<br><br>These were the first thoughts running through my head when I first saw Tiong Bahru Bakery in the first week of its opening. Tiong Bahru is really getting its hip on, there was no doubt.<br><br>I had Kouign aman -- if a croissant and a salted butter sultana got together and had a baby, this would be it. It was buttery and only slightly sweet, and so fluffy, I could taste a hint of salt (and a bit of heaven), life was good there and then. <br><br>To be kind to my waistline, I&#39;m going to make it a point to try something new every week here, instead of doing it all at once, and because I just want an excuse to come back all the time.<br><br>Coffee was nothing to write about, but hey, that&#39;s not what Gontran Cherrier is famous for.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/FtgTbwUDNpKc4mQqxHUtYg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tiong-bahru-bakery-singapore-4?reviewid=7E5oeENJYDvXNZkOhKJmDQ&select=FtgTbwUDNpKc4mQqxHUtYg', 'altText': 'Photo of Tiong Bahru Bakery - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: The cafe Latte was really really aromatic and rich in taste. The milk they used was really good that it didn&#39;t leave an aftertaste. <br><br>The crossaint was by far the best i&#39;ve tasted in the long while. Only gripe is that it isn&#39;t bigger. Otherwise, its rather creamy and fragrant. definitely a must try.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=zDgtQd7v-D0POPlXIKJuvA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/e7I2t9IVOPAo5R4B41X51Q/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/e7I2t9IVOPAo5R4B41X51Q/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/e7I2t9IVOPAo5R4B41X51Q/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/e7I2t9IVOPAo5R4B41X51Q/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/e7I2t9IVOPAo5R4B41X51Q/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/e7I2t9IVOPAo5R4B41X51Q/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'John C.', 'displayLocation': 'New York, NY', 'altText': 'John C.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=zDgtQd7v-D0POPlXIKJuvA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 19, 'photoCount': 211, 'reviewCount': 67, 'eliteYear': None}
text: First breakfast in Singapore definitely a great place. You can tell the break is freshly made every morning.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/RXizM2_ogsbxFwmW-M8FXQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tiong-bahru-bakery-singapore-4?reviewid=272BJJ9FH5kYzflAFSSTgQ&select=RXizM2_ogsbxFwmW-M8FXQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Tiong Bahru Bakery - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/5NmIwZxRCN2Uu2LIU8mIZA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tiong-bahru-bakery-singapore-4?reviewid=272BJJ9FH5kYzflAFSSTgQ&select=5NmIwZxRCN2Uu2LIU8mIZA', 'altText': 'Photo of Tiong Bahru Bakery - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: The latest addition to the quaint Tiong Bahru area that has seen an explosion of indie coffee joints, Tiong Bahru Bakery is the result of a collaboration between French Baker and the Spa Esprit Group.<br><br>Despite the rather quaint location, the bakery is frequented by many and its quite common for it to get packed during lunch. Serving up a range of pastries and desserts that are all freshly baked to perfection according to the chef&#39;s recipes, the number one selling item here is the plain croissant. <br><br>While it sounds too basic to be a best seller, the flaky and crispy exterior has a soft airy interior that will blow your mind away. Othermust-tries include the Kouign Aman and chocolate brioche. Definitely a place to visit, but somehow I still prefer Maison Kayser.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=6kEfVfKfJQo38jFqVfk9CA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/aoj8FKO71hheRe8Caq-KkA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/aoj8FKO71hheRe8Caq-KkA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/aoj8FKO71hheRe8Caq-KkA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/aoj8FKO71hheRe8Caq-KkA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/aoj8FKO71hheRe8Caq-KkA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/aoj8FKO71hheRe8Caq-KkA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Anum H.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'altText': 'Anum H.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=6kEfVfKfJQo38jFqVfk9CA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 267, 'photoCount': 18, 'reviewCount': 83, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Two words. Chocolate slipper. Two more words. Almond croissant. Honestly, this place is just across the street from my work and I find it hard to not want to devour everything. It&#39;s a Singapore institution and I can see why. Everything is freshly baked, the staff is super friendly, and they really know what they are doing! Big kudos to the team at TBB!

I have such a nostalgic attachment to Tiong Bahru Bakery - it was one of the first cafes I visited when I was rediscovering the new old Tiong Bahru and I dare anyone to resist their drool inducing displays!<br><br>The coffee infographic menu is the eye-catching centre piece of the entire bakery and true enough, it was very well made (might have something to do with the guys from forty hands!) Unfortunately, the both Pandan Flan didn&#39;t impress - most of their baked goods are priced above $6 and I was just hoping for that little bit more. It&#39;s a beautiful space with such a vibrant atmosphere; I&#39;d be happy to come back and give TBB another go! Apparently - the croissants are legendary!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=NueVo7bvyT4ropk_vbTuTw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/9ZJvtCmFaSLgKTLPK_SVMA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/9ZJvtCmFaSLgKTLPK_SVMA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/9ZJvtCmFaSLgKTLPK_SVMA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/9ZJvtCmFaSLgKTLPK_SVMA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/9ZJvtCmFaSLgKTLPK_SVMA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/9ZJvtCmFaSLgKTLPK_SVMA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Shen L.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Shen L.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=NueVo7bvyT4ropk_vbTuTw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 22, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 12, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Got a few desserts and breads, and have to say the breads are awesome, and some of the desserts look better than they taste (lemon tarte is tooooo sour and slippery too bitter).

Coffee is good. Especially when paired with their pastries and other goodies.<br><br>I found my sweet tooth here. Do not go pass the Kouign Amann or the Almond croissant. Sandwiches are good but its their Danish that gets me coming back.

Like that ex you can never cut ties with, I have a love hate relationship with Tiong Bahru Bakery.<br><br>Let&#39;s get this clear. Tiong Bahru Bakery is expensive. Whether you think it&#39;s worth it is of course, up to you, but I generally don&#39;t think it is.<br><br>The sandwiches are good, but cost more than two plates of chicken rice at the market down the street... and isn&#39;t more filling. <br><br>What&#39;s worth going for? The Kouign-amann. Buttery caramel-y goodness, this is absolutely delicious and the one thing I go back for again and again despite my verbal insistence that I actually boycott the place. After a few weeks of having it regularly though, I&#39;m proud to say that I&#39;m finally so-over it and managed to stay away for a good 3 months.<br><br>That all came crashing to an end today after I popped in for a coffee. If you didn&#39;t know, TBB is owned by the same company that owns Forty Hands, meaning you know you&#39;re going to get a good cup of coffee here. It&#39;s a little pricey, for a &#39;small&#39; cappuccino, meaning that coffee here is actually a touch more expensive that most places in the CBD. But it&#39;s good, robust coffee, and if you&#39;re already overpaying for bread and pastries, well you might as well overpay for drinks too right?<br><br>Why is it still receiving 3 stars then? Why do I go back? Because it&#39;s across the street from my office, and it has the best coffee in the area. Because the quality of what it offers is undeniable, they do good shizz. But the prices. Oh the prices.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=L7zt8jZEE1Xj3ZT2fgO79w', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/J-zbhKy1MLJDWaZBiXAPrw/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/J-zbhKy1MLJDWaZBiXAPrw/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/J-zbhKy1MLJDWaZBiXAPrw/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/J-zbhKy1MLJDWaZBiXAPrw/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/J-zbhKy1MLJDWaZBiXAPrw/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/J-zbhKy1MLJDWaZBiXAPrw/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Kathryn B.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'altText': 'Kathryn B.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=L7zt8jZEE1Xj3ZT2fgO79w', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 242, 'photoCount': 41, 'reviewCount': 350, 'eliteYear': None}
text: I knew this was going to be a interesting meal when I saw the fun front door. The line was terribly long on the Saturday afternoon we first visited.  I think everything is pretty tasty but the choice, while seemingly extensive, is kind of just variations on a theme.  I would like more diversity in bread products than pastry and sandwiches.  My iced latte was delicious.  The guacamole sandwich was tasty but not filling.  The pear tart should have had more pear.  The food was only two thirds of the experience because the cafe was so lighthearted and bustling.  We couldn&#39;t help but have fun.<br>I&#39;ve been back since and enjoy the food but I&#39;m still looking for my favorite.

I&#39;m typing this after being done with the salmon and cream cheese bun thing and the pear tart. Had a flat white as well. I must say, I had high expectations seeing as to how my friends have raved about this place. Verdict? Nahhhh<br><br>The salmon wasn&#39;t fresh, very unlike the salmon baguette I had at Broers Cafe (and their specialty isn&#39;t sandwiches!). And they could&#39;ve been a bit more generous with the cream cheese. The pear tart was okay (with the so-so hand action). Could&#39;ve been sweeter, given how the girl asked me &#34;would you like any sweets to go with your meal?&#34;. Coffee was okay too.<br><br>I guess it could be because it&#39;s 6pm and the food isn&#39;t quite as fresh. I&#39;ll give it a second chance and be sure to be here much earlier in the day. So far, seems pretty overrated.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=WPw0LDmsT5HLc5itX8YLVA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QQtHcqWr8HF7TFfsN5BHtA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QQtHcqWr8HF7TFfsN5BHtA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QQtHcqWr8HF7TFfsN5BHtA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QQtHcqWr8HF7TFfsN5BHtA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QQtHcqWr8HF7TFfsN5BHtA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/QQtHcqWr8HF7TFfsN5BHtA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Joel Y.', 'displayLocation': '麻布十番駅, Minato, Japan', 'altText': 'Joel Y.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=WPw0LDmsT5HLc5itX8YLVA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 417, 'photoCount': 141, 'reviewCount': 704, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Croissant is nice and chewy and flaky on the outside. Delicious. Add some strawberry jam and a latte and it&#39;s a great way to start the day.  <br><br>The apple crumble has got to be one of the best things here. Heat that bad boy up and it tastes just like mom&#39;s apple pie! Love it. Big enough to share. Huge portion.<br><br>Tried the Tuna Bread as well--- sadly it was disappointing and difficult to eat/cut.  Not the most dainty if you ask me, plus you get kickin&#39; breath after so don&#39;t order this if you&#39;re on a date.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=hw9HCKQetOK5z9bFxE7A_w', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/N63pq3vLIjB0F_cXL7wgTQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/N63pq3vLIjB0F_cXL7wgTQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/N63pq3vLIjB0F_cXL7wgTQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/N63pq3vLIjB0F_cXL7wgTQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/N63pq3vLIjB0F_cXL7wgTQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/N63pq3vLIjB0F_cXL7wgTQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Carolina R.', 'displayLocation': 'Baden-Württemberg, Germany', 'altText': 'Carolina R.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=hw9HCKQetOK5z9bFxE7A_w', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 3, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Best bakery in Singapore! Croissants, bread, sandwiches, pastries and drinks: real quality! Plus I enjoy the local scene in Tiong Bahru. To return many times...

Three visits over three days - probably wont be a 4th if there are more than 2-3 tables in use....The service dropped drastically in proportion to the number of people they had to serve - asked for sandwich ro be toasred/ heated - came out &#34;just warm&#34; - 3 coffees ordered at same time ....but each came  separately. ...5- 10 minutes apart - no warning, no explanation - not good enough.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=__Ksf1CCgaKdS3Gi5f6PcQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/eKDVIeYVKOG9ozxzu-hkmA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/eKDVIeYVKOG9ozxzu-hkmA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/eKDVIeYVKOG9ozxzu-hkmA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/eKDVIeYVKOG9ozxzu-hkmA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/eKDVIeYVKOG9ozxzu-hkmA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/eKDVIeYVKOG9ozxzu-hkmA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Renuka V.', 'displayLocation': 'Los Angeles, CA', 'altText': 'Renuka V.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=__Ksf1CCgaKdS3Gi5f6PcQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 191, 'photoCount': 37, 'reviewCount': 744, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Had the squid ink buns stuffed w ham+cheese and croissants (plain+almond paste) and everything tasted good although pricey. Extra star was for the fact that we could walk there from our apt.

The crowds here are insane. Despite heading over post lunch hour, we were still met with queues. And what&#39;s up with the separate lines for orders and drinks anyway? The order queue is so long, it will definitely intersect with the drinks queue at some point, creating a confusing mess. Found it very frustrating, and decided to do a takeaway of lemon zest tart and berry crumble. Both items were at $6 each, which was a little eh? as the tart is smaller than one&#39;s palm, and the crumble was easily twice the size of the tart. <br>Tart was well.. not tart, which left me a little disappointed. It was actually rather sweet, given the candied lemon zest. Tart shell was firm to the bite, and made a mess when it shattered all over my desk. I quite liked the berry crumble - now that was tart and sweet all at once. The base was buttery, the crumbled top crunchy, and the whole item summery and yummy.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=kWpV8BiFGNRhpeHYXl_q6g', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Azira A.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Azira A.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=kWpV8BiFGNRhpeHYXl_q6g', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 6, 'photoCount': 140, 'reviewCount': 119, 'eliteYear': None}
photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/cui0EG1yrSbZN9qsfExVMA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tiong-bahru-bakery-singapore-4?reviewid=hfwOgrfUsS07rCZtH0iAyg&select=cui0EG1yrSbZN9qsfExVMA', 'altText': 'Photo of Tiong Bahru Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. coffee &amp; croissant, tiong bahru bakery', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'coffee & croissant, tiong bahru bakery'}]
text: There is alot of hype surrounding Tiong Bahru Bakery, it&#39;s gotten alot of press ever since it opened so I wanted to see if it lived up to all the glowing reviews.<br><br>Quite easy to miss if you walk a little too fast along Eng Hoon St, the bakery&#39;s got quite a welcoming interior as a long row of pastries greet you as you enter.<br><br>I tried the supposedly &#34;best croissant in Singapore&#34; with a cup of flat white. There is free flow of butter and jam and water on a separate counter which I loved. The croissant was still delicately crispy on the outside and buttery on the inside, it was good yes! But then how much better can the plain dough of croissant get? Not to dismiss the skill behind baking a really quality croissant but surely there&#39;s more to this bakery than the croissants!<br><br>So I had the salmon sandwich which came with a cardamom bread. All the sandwiches have been pre-made so you can&#39;t really choose whether you want salmon with the squid ink bread or chicken with the cardamom bread, which is quite a bummer because I wanted to try the squid ink bread with the salmon. I didn&#39;t really enjoy the cardamom bread because the cardamom seeds kept getting stuck in my teeth.<br><br>It was very crowded for a weekday and the queue was busy throughout!<br><br>Final verdict: I dough not know if it will continue to reinvent itself or get too complacent with its current success but for now I&#39;ll just come for takeaways because it gets way too crowded.

Their baguette&#39;s the best I&#39;ve had so far in Singapore - easily a five star rating, but what brought it down is the below average crowd control (which can easily be explained by the craze caused by word-of-mouth and being in the Straits Times!). <br><br>Taste-wise, the baguette&#39;s near-perfect, down to the hard, flaky brown skin, and the moist, chewy &#39;flesh&#39; that has the texture and bite comparable to the boulangerie in Rue Caulaincourt in Paris (loved it!). Price-wise, at 65 cm (the benchmark), the one in Singapore comes up to S$2.80, while a Parisian counterpart would be €0.80 (about S$1.50). <br><br>A little too overpriced (especially the croissants!), but lending the Gontran Cherrier baking touch comes with a price (I guess). Will definitely be back for the basic breads, but will give the sandwiches, savoury items and coffee a miss as there&#39;s no way I&#39;m paying S$8.00 for a sandwich the size of my palm.

I must say that Tiong Bahru Bakery is quite a cheeky cafe, this. From the outside you may easily walk past, disregarding it as one of them shophouses, especially with the chinese teal stamp on the wall outside. Yet on the inside it was as though past met present - its choice of furniture created a feel of a 70s bakery, yet it also had all the luxuries of a present day air-conditioned cafe. If anything, it can get pretty congested when fully seated, and so rather noisy - but I guess that just adds to the buzz and bustle of it all.<br><br>I asked the lady at the counter (as I always do) for their recommendation, and was a little surprised when she pointed me to their simplest of plain croissants. It did seem quite pricey ($2.50), but I thought that if she&#39;d dare to point me to something as plain as that, there must be something to it, so on I went to get that, and just that. <br><br>It was such a treat! You could help yourself to as much butter and jam as you wanted from the side, and trust me you&#39;ll want more than one little dish of it. The prune/plum jam was such a good balance of sweet and a little sour and a tinge of bitter, which made my croissant taste like a good after meal sweetener. Then if you&#39;d add the butter you feel like it could well be a pre-meal bite. Such versatile tastes based on the freshest, crisp and perfectly baked croissants you&#39;ll find in this country! I found it to be $2.50 well spent.

text: I absolutely love the vibe of this cafe.  Because I have celiac disease and cannot eat gluten I cannot speak to their food items (beautiful looking muffins, pies, tarts, etc.), but the coffee is fabulous.  They always have a line, and the buzz of energy makes for a very pleasant environment.  We always look forward to a stop here while we&#39;re doing our marketing!

text: Best bakery in Singapore!  Having recently moved here from San Francisco, I&#39;ve been trying to find a good bakery with good coffee and both savory and sweet options.  Tiong Bahru Bakery is it!<br><br>Everything I&#39;ve tried there has not disappointed.  Traditional baguette is amazing,  Chocolate Almond croissant is good, and the specialty bun with ham sandwich is excellent!

text: Definitely one of the best croissants that I&#39;ve eaten. Although the place was small and crowded, the servers were friendly and efficient.  We waited less than 10 minutes to get a table for four.  The latte was rich and flavorful.  The brownie is good and so were the almond croissant and brioche. Took away a squid ink bread with salmon and ham but my sister said it was on the salty side.  The cafe music is rather loud and I do recommend going to Raffles City outlet for a more luxurious and lazy way to spend a Sunday morning.

Come for the kouign amann and buzzy atmosphere. Spotted before: Zoe Tay<br><br>The weekend that Tiong Bahru Bakery first opened, traffic snarled to a stop on Eng Hoon Street. Despite new outdoor seating, the best place to sit is indoors, close by the long display of breads and pastries, sandwiches, and baked desserts (in that order). If you&#39;re just ordering the fabulous 40 Hands coffee, skip the (usually long) queue and go straight to the counter, one for cash payments and the other for credit cards. <br><br>Tiong Bahru neighbours swear by the kouign amann ($3.50), a salted caramel spiral-shaped &#39;croissant&#39; which offers crisp layers and layers of buttery, sticky delight. There is no fruit filling (if you like those, Pullman Bakery does a decent version). There are three croissants - plain ($2.50), almond and chocolate. The texture of the plain croissant isn&#39;t the classic flaky sort; here it has many distinct layers - not a unanimous favourite. The almond paste version is much too sweet for me, while the chocolate has a really good quality to it. Baked desserts are rather pricey for the size, but seem to be popular. Try the palm-sized lemon tart ($6), which is sweet and zingy with a lovely short crust. Sandwiches are a good deal, with various ingredients such as bacon, avocado and tuna, each matched to a specific bread such as squid ink or sunflower seeds. (And makes for a cheaper lunch than at sister establishment 40 Hands on the other side of Tiong Bahru). <br><br>From the recreated old skool look to the freshly baked and high quality goods, this place deserves all its kudos - but the slightly high price point keeps it from becoming a true daily hangout.
The coffee is good but not fantastic either.  Pretty standard but over-priced. Pastry is nice yet not cheap as well. More for ambient if go there again.

the baguette is way too tough. i prefer maison kayser&#39;s baguette. <br><br>the plain croissant was crispy on the outside, but a bit too doughy in the inside --- at least for my taste. <br><br>they&#39;re closed on tuesdays by the way

text: Good coffee and AMAZING croissants! I&#39;ve also had their lemon tarts and it was definitely tart enough! I&#39;d totally go back for more of those mouth watering croissants! really cute place, great to chill and snack - they also have the coolest door ever.

text: Coffee is excellent and the pastry is divine.  A little on the pricey side.  but very cool and hip.  A must-try if you&#39;re in the Tiong Bahru area.

the best  FOR croissant !! it&#39;s real remind me home and italian bakery!! I know the place is French !! but the location and the aroma seems to be back when was child going to my bakery on my street

Lychee Rose Cheesecakes with Lychee jelly and a crumble base. Delicious!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Lychee Rose Cheesecakes with Lychee jelly and a crumble base. Delicious!'}]
text: Sugar fiends can satisfy their cravings with any of the beautifully crafted cakes and pastries Patisserie G has to offer. A classic lineup of espresso drinks and a small menu of savory items are available as well. <br><br>Chef extraordinaire- Gwen Lim, born and raised in Singapore, paid homage to her heritage by offering innovative and contemporary forward confections with Asian infused flavors.  <br><br>Among the hits are the Lychee Rose Cheesecakes with Lychee jelly and a crumble base. The lychee jelly added a nice texture and flavor to the creamy yet light cheesecake. Simply delicious! <br><br>The flat white with a subtle bitterness was a sophisticated pairing and balanced out the sweetness quite well. <br><br>The in-store seating provides a quiet oasis while the additional seating in the center of the Millenia Walk Mall is great for people watching. <br><br>With an outstanding service, delicious indulgences and a chic vibe makes this place worth visiting.

text: Almost a year after my first visit to Patisserie G, I found myself here again, twice in fact since I arrived in Singapore 6 days ago. So what holds the attraction to this place for me? Clearly, my darling girlfriend working at Millenia Tower is one big factor. Then it comes to: <br><br>FOOD 5/5<br>I love their cakes! Not only they looked esthetically pleasing, they tasted good too. I just had a cake named &#34;Poison Apple&#34;. It looked like an apple. It was so pretty. I told my friend I would either be Snow White or the evil Queen. But she agreed since I had to eat the &#34;Poison Apple&#34; then I would be Snow White then. I hope the seven dwarves would appear if I fell on the floor, and my prince would eventually show up. Right!! ;P Anyhoo, this &#34;Poison Apple&#34; tasted good, inside was a mix of cake and the center reminded me of apple pie. <br><br>The other cake I had tried recently was the Lychee Rose Cheesecake. I recommended that cake too. Even though it was a cheesecake, it was not too heavy. <br><br>The Mango &amp; Pear iced tea was refreshing. I had the same during my last two visits. <br><br>AMBIENCE 5/5<br>I love the openness of Patisserie G. I particularly like the outside seatings.<br><br>SERVICE 5/5<br>The staffs were as always friendly and helpful. <br><br>Now I am already thinking what cake should I try next? :D

text: Quiet setting on late Sunday morning, great music!  Latte&#39;s are rich and well made, almond croissant was large and tasty.  Ordered scrambled eggs with mushroom and chose the croissant instead of the fluffy toast.  Got 1 out of 3 right, it has eggs and they are scrambled, but no mushrooms and got the toast.  I returned the plate, 5 min later they got 2 out of 3 right; added the mushroom but not the croissant, reminded me of Henry Ford&#39;s saying &#34;you can have a car with any color as long as it&#39;s black&#34;.  I have to say the eggs were moist well made, and the mushrooms were good too, not your average button mushrooms, they had a bite to them.  By then l decided that the toast soldiers are good enough to have, never mind the croissant.  <br>Only thing is, you can&#39;t dip the soldiers in scrambled egg, like you do in fried eggs.  Toast eaten!  Third latté had the right effect. <br><br>It&#39;s all good.

text: Love how the place is quiet and peaceful-great to chill even on a weekend. By the vibes alone, I would consider this place a gem I&#39;d want to keep to myself for the alone times c:<br><br>Had their Tropical cake ($8.50) and a flat white ($5.50). Not usually a fan of these type of cakes (see the photo) but this is hands down the best I&#39;ve ever had. Mango passion mousse, banana marmalade, chocolate sponge, coconut chantilly and a butter crumble base.  The flavours came together in a harmonious fashion-simple texture, yet layered and intriguing. <br><br>The flat white is not bad too-above average, considering how it focuses on it&#39;s bakes. <br><br>Will definitely be back!

Never tried the sweets here but came numerous times for their croque Monsieur! It has the perfect brioche bread, topped with the perfect bechamel sauce and melty Gruyere cheese and ham....it is EXACTLY what a croque Monsieur should be. <br><br>I also love their simple ham and cheese croissant but I am into something lighter and their scrambled egg is also done the way I like it - very runny and creamy.<br><br>They have recently expanded their menu and expanded their seating area to outside the store. More choices yeah! <br><br>Prices are not cheap but you do get quality. Coffee is good too.<br><br>For the price, I only wish it is not self-serve.

text: In a little nook of a rather quiet mall, Millenia Walk is a lovely little gem of a cafe. They get the small things right and that&#39;s what keeps me coming back. Decor is in light, natural wood colors. Relaxed music in the background. Polite service. Water and newspaper for your free taking and reading. Perfect setup to chill, relax, grab a bite with a friend or colleague. <br><br>They manage to keep it simple when it comes to the menu. For savory, eggs cocotte/scrambled and gourmet sandwiches. All of 7 sandwiches to choose from. Not a problem as they make them very well. My fav is the Parma ham, mushroom relish, arugula and Gruyere. Accompanied with crisps. Yummy to the last bite. <br><br>Not a big connoisseur of coffee. I only know when it tastes good. And to me this is good, especially with the desserts they have. Again, not a mind boggling vast selection but what they make, they make well. <br><br>My only sticking point these days is that it gets pricey to have these types of lovely dining experiences. Fine if you make oodles of dough but for many it&#39;s out of reach. =(<br><br>Very much recommended!

text: Was around the area and felt like having a coffee. I was torn between Kith next door and Patisserie G. Both were just as crowded so I looked at the cakes they had on display. Kith&#39;s cakes were larger and richer, and i felt I wasn&#39;t really that hungry. So I chose Patisserie G. The cakes were smaller, but had this artisinal look to them. <br><br>The apple crumble and cappuccino I ordered were pretty good. I wish they offered me the option of having a warm Apple crumble though. <br><br>The cappuccino was delightful. Nice foam and a nutty aftertaste. Would come here again if I&#39;m around the area again.

text: Patisserie G is the Crown Jewel of Millenia Walk. It&#39;s an ultra modern French cafe that plays feel good songs. Coffee and Pastries are definitely their strong suit. <br><br>Their coffee selections are extensive ranging from: double expresso, to double macchiato to Cappuccino and Flat white. I understand they source all their coffee beans from local artisan roasters, liberty coffee. I would say Patisserie G&#39;s coffee edges out it&#39;s neighbor Commune upstairs. I find the cappuccino here tastier, the latte art more detailed, and the coffee having more of a subtle finish (which I prefer).<br><br>The pastries, albeit on the expensive side, are Classic French favorites: macaroons, cheese cakes, chocolate mousse, lemon cakes, strawberry cakes, etc. I&#39;m not a Pastry expert so I won&#39;t elaborate more than I have to, but they are of very high quality, among the highest on the red dot, especially among those offered to the regular consumer outside of high prices restaurant establishments.<br><br>Overall, I&#39;m a big fan of Patisserie G. However, I will ding this pastry shop one-star for removing &#34;Everyone Loves Us Yelp&#34; sticker. This is a very special accolade that few local establishments get globally. Yes, some yelpers may give tough reviews, but overall the Yelp Community in SG are huge fans of Patisserie G, especially me.

text: Love the pastries here. The chocolate sea salt cookies are an exact match to the Pierre Herme chocolate sea salt cookies - decadently chocolatey with the zing of salt to keep things happening. <br>They also do a lovely crumbly buttery salted egg yolk cookie for Chinese New Year. <br>The chocolate eclair is also very decent - some places have their eclairs sitting in the display cases slowly drying into cardboard crumbliness. But Patisserie G&#39;s eclair is fresh enough that the choux has a crisp shell and light interior. Helps too that the cream filling is usually richly flavoured. <br>They&#39;ve done well enough over the years to expand to additional seating outside the shop. I love their morning breakfast offerings - croque monsieur, buttery croissants and lightly brewed coffee.  <br>Good place to hang out, chill over a cuppa and a nicely made sweet.

text: Revisited the possibly most French local patisserie shop in Singapore to try its not-so-new cakes that were launched during my absence in SG. Gone was my favourite Douceur. Along the way, we had the Eggs En Cocotte with Bacon ($16), a French dish that hasn&#39;t seem to rise to much popularity for brunch in Singapore yet. The savoury custard was well-seasoned and wiggly, speedily demolished with the soldiers of fragrant toasted brioche. <br><br>Meantime, the Creamy Scramble Eggs ($15/add on with smoked salmon $3) might not be as grandiose as the soft luscious yellow clouds served at Bills, but was a heart-warming delight to go with its reputable croissant. Yes, I&#39;ve had it previously with my dark chocolate drink and it still stays VERY delicious. <br><br>The Lemon Cheesecake ($9) exhibits great character, distinguishing itself from the usual baked cheesecake with a livid lemon curd in the centre and a reliable chocolate biscuit base instead of the occasionally cranky graham crust. <br>The Hazelnut Opera ($8.50) was particularly iffy; unquestionably tri-textures of the hazelnut ganache, coffee sponge and chocolate ganache, but the hazelnut tones weren&#39;t pronounced. <br><br>The Nouvelle G ($9), a 73%-63% dark chocolate spaceship lookalike that had a delicate sandy yet crispy chocolate feuilletine which was finer than any of the feuilletine here. <br><br>But the star was the Coconut Choux Tart ($9), a pretty revolutionary piece that focused on the coconut-flavoured Carribean rum. Nothing much to speak in terms of coconut accents, but the beloved textures of all the components; chantily cream, (empty) choux puff, salted caramel sauce and Creme brûlée custard tart is enough to make this gateaux a highly saleable one.

I would go for 4.5 if there was an option. But hey I will give the cafe some space so they can push themselves to even higher level! <br><br>My all-time favourites are THE G SPOT and BOMBE CERISE, and also maybe the LEMON TART (tanginess that cleanses your palette and balances with the sweetness). Their cakes are delish and also pretty to look at. G Spot would appeal to dark chocolate lovers, and BOMBE CERISE is just smooth with a good punch from the Kirsh-Soaked Cherries and crunchy-chewy base. Not forgetting the minimal deco which makes the whole experience even more insta worthy,

text: back here again wanting to try e eclair but alas! I was distracted with e pastries and ordered a chocolate gnut instead.<br><br>1. Flat white - good coffee but nope I still didn&#39;t get my 3D coffee art. sigh<br><br>2. chocolate gnut - $4 - price is kinda steep for a mini bite size pastry. I have no idea what it is but it kinda tasted like a mini donut hybrid with croissant (cronut) good amount of chocolate cream with every bite but e price ... e price... e price $$$$$<br><br>3. ham + cheese croissant - $5 this was just OK, wished it came warm but it was kinda cold when i had it.<br><br>I srsly have to try that eclair next time - looks nomilicious

text: I love to come here especially in the early mornings when its just me and the baristas. They are uber friendly and the latte art is really endearing. Love the chillout environment where I can get reading done.<br><br>I always buy more coffee just to see what interesting things they can draw for me. <br><br>The desserts are pretty and delectable. Sometimes just too pretty that I wouldnt want to stick the fork in. G spot is the dessert I&#39;d recommend for all chocolate lovers like me. <br><br>Recommend this place for people who just wanna have some me-time and enjoy a good cuppa (or two or three) If you ever do, invite me along as well.... :p

Patisserie G is located in the Marina Walk shopping center.  I was looking for some non-Singaporean coffee aka &#34;kopi&#34;, and Yelp led me to Patisserie G.  It&#39;s more of a &#34;fancy&#34; French cafe and it is definitely reflected by its prices.  <br><br>A simple iced black coffee cost me $5 SGD.  I guess that&#39;s not bad, given the ridiculous prices that Starbucks charges in Singapore.  Still, my coffee was just okay for $5... and not even an extra large size at that, which would have been nice :)<br><br>Plenty of seating to go around.  The place wasn&#39;t very busy even in the morning... maybe because its located in the middle of the mall?<br><br>Worth a try, but even if I lived here I wouldn&#39;t be a regular.

text: great little cakes at this popular cakery in millenia walk - so popular, in fact, that they&#39;ve now expanded twice their original size. and for good reason, I think - if the cakes I had were anything to go by, they know their desserts.<br><br>I finally managed to catch this place when it wasn&#39;t maniacally filled with sweet tooths (like mine) - probably because it was about 5 minutes before they closed the cashier. it&#39;s very good cake, so it&#39;s going to be an easy review: two cakes - a chocolate dome, and a opera-style one (sorry for the lack of titles, but hey, that&#39;s what photos are for!)<br><br>both were surprisingly well done (surprising for hype doesn&#39;t always translate to skill) - neat clean layers, crispy pâte feuilletée or biscuit layers playing contrast to the soft, not-too-sweet chocolate mousse/ ganache layers, and prettily shiny glazes to top everything off.<br><br>I like that there&#39;s a good mix of chocolate and other-than options - which span the spectrum from cheesecake to eclair. but these two were plenty lovely, good portions for a post-dinner treat, and very much worth ordering again.<br><br>service is young but helpful and smiley, and the space is scandinavian white-and-wood and beautiful - clean, neat lines and pretty little desserts that aren&#39;t cheap but plenty satisfying, this place is a good one for some post-meal (or actual meal, why not) indulgence.

Allow me to preface this review by saying that I didn&#39;t order dessert! I know, I know, I basically broke the cardinal rule of this establishment, but allow me to explain. <br><br>I came and held one of my CMYE* Office Hours here around 2 PM on a weekday, and I was amazed at how busy it was. It seems to be a quite popular mid-day hangout for the nearby office workers. <br><br>I hadn&#39;t eaten all day, so I ordered a ham and cheese croissant. To be honest, it wasn&#39;t mindblowing, but it took away my hunger pangs. I also had a flat white which tasted perfectly fine to me. :)<br><br>Everyone else seemed to be enjoying their desserts and coffee, so I&#39;d definitely come back and give those a try sometime!<br><br>--<br><br>*CMYE stands for &#34;Community Manager Yelp Event&#34;, which are casual meet ups hosted by yours truly. :) Office Hours are also when I answer any questions you have about Yelp. Check the Events Page to see what I have coming up next!

text: Saw the croque Monsieur which was my original thought, ordered the full breakfast instead. Sausage egg bacon, all good, salad and brioche didn&#39;t go well with the traditional food. Coffee was good, no decaf. Plate was cold, to help with the salad, therefore the egg and bacon were warm. Will go back later and try a cake.

The baristas&#39; skill at creating elaborate designs out of milk foam is testament to how seriously the owner of Patisserie G takes her craft. Ms Gwen Lim identifies her target consumers as &#34;a niche group of people who understand French pastry and are discerning about good-quality French products&#34;, namely the &#34;well-travelled&#34; Singaporean. Mm not the humblest way to plug her pâtisserie, but must say she really knows how to appeal to the yuppie psyche.<br><br>Lemon Cheesecake, $9.00 - One forkful of the cheesecake should be enough to convince you that these cakes are worth good money. The filling is zesty and creamy without being too heavy on the palate, and flecked with crushed vanilla beans. The biscuit crust is actually crispy (!!) and tastes slightly singed, but went pretty well with the citrus filling and the strip of candied lemon peel. There&#39;s this thin gelatinous cover on the cake which I find odd, but its mostly tasteless and adds glossiness to the cake so meh, I&#39;ll live with it.<br><br>Triomphe, $8.50 - Named after a historical monument, the Triomphe sported a lustrous toffee-brown coat that made it resemble a giant piece of Werther&#39;s candy. This baby was calling out my name so I decided I had to eat him. The caramel mousse was malty, ever-so-slightly burnt and, to sum it up: just divine. Within the cake there are a couple layers of soft hazelnut sponge, but the mousse was the friggin&#39; star of the show. If it were up to me, I&#39;d add a praline base or something crunchy at the bottom to provide some contrast in texture, but I&#39;m sure the chef is better than I am at knowing which ingredients go together. In any case, the magical mousse is reason enough to justify repeated visits to Patisserie G.<br><br>Flat White, $5.50 - The coffee selection here is proof that Patisserie G isn&#39;t going to bend over backwards for pedestrian crowds. Our respective requests for a mocha and a skinny latte were met with an apologetic &#34;We don&#39;t do those here.&#34; from the waitress taking our orders at the counter. Embarrassed by my wimpyness, I manned up and got a flat white. <br><br>Patisserie G gets its blends from artisan roasters Liberty Coffee (specifically the Speakeasy brew), which should please coffee aficionados. My flat white was nutty and robust.<br><br>I watched in slack-jawed wonder as one of the baristas artfully crafted the smiling face of a bear on another customer&#39;s latte, then scowled in displeasure at the very unelaborate heart on the surface of my flat white. I&#39;ll be back, and I&#39;ll be sure to request for a bear on my coffee.

text: The pastries are good but the coffee is a hit or miss. The double macchiato was super sour while I&#39;m guessing the piccolo latte&#39;s milk helped to neutralize the acidity. Pastries are good but pricey but I don&#39;t mind that. However, having an inedible piece of paper of their logo on the cake is a faux pas to me.

Cappuccino and Triomphe. Burnt salted caramel mousse and hazelnut sponge.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Cappuccino and Triomphe. Burnt salted caramel mousse and hazelnut sponge.'}]
text: Chic japanese themed cafe located in Millenia Walk. Not a typical place that I would head to for a cup of cuppa. Heard and saw pictures of the 3d latte art totally made me want to check it out myself. Coffee beans are from local roastery Liberty Coffee was definitely a plus! Be sure to try out the desserts from the Cordon Bleu pastry chef Gwen Lim who has apparently worked under Pierre Herme himself! Pretty Awesome!
The quiche is amazing and cute cafe latte delicious. If I lived in Singapore I would visit all the time!!!

The Salted Caramel macaron was rather salty for a liking.<br> <br>The Milk Chocolate White Miso macaron started out rather sweet and milky but then the salty taste kicked in after that.<br> <br>The Lychee Rose is probably the better macaron I have ever eaten. It is sweet with very noticeable taste of lychee and rose. For someone who likes sweet stuffs, this fits perfectly into the picture.<br> <br>The Salted Hazelnut macaron is also very nice. The hazelnut taste was very distinct and was less salty.

Had a lovely skinny latte and tasted a bit of a coconut choux tart, which didn&#39;t look that inviting but turned out to be delicious. They tend to run out of items (e.g. Croque Monsieur) by later in the day so the early bird catches the worm...

text: WOW!  The hot chocolate was remarkable, I might just has well have been drinking a chocolate creme soup.  I&#39;ve never had anything so amazing.  Amazing, good word to describe the desserts as well.  I tried the G-spot, an amazing chocolate mousse creation and another which was a creme broulette dessert.  The tea was excellent as well.  I highly recommend checking this place out.  Walk past the Starbucks and into PatisserieG instead!  You won&#39;t be disappointed.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Re2E-6N2S1z2T3eE3yb0jg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/grind-coffee-singapore?reviewid=m2O0J49AN5CtFJ0DpKlAcg&select=Re2E-6N2S1z2T3eE3yb0jg', 'altText': 'Photo of Grind Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: One of the best coffee places I have come across in all my world travels. Singapore has a rich coffee culture and Grind has really captured a poll position in my book these last few months.<br><br>The brand is very well designed and inviting. The quality of the equipment and the personnel is very noticeable in the coffee and atmosphere.<br><br>A small enterprise for now, but surely this gem cannot stay little for long.<br><br>There are multiple coffee shops around, but the coffee is better priced and much more fulfilling at Grind.<br><br>Personally I recommend the Signature Iced Coffee (I ordered it with less syrup and less ice) that has a secret blend of syrup flavors ranging from caramelly molasses with a hint of cinnamon perhaps. I will never know the secret probably.<br><br>Worth the visit, just off the Raffles Place MRT.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=MMzE2p8FwNt_xDt4ZqFi1w', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Zzw31LuXjaZiIbMT9ydUAw/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Zzw31LuXjaZiIbMT9ydUAw/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Zzw31LuXjaZiIbMT9ydUAw/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Zzw31LuXjaZiIbMT9ydUAw/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Zzw31LuXjaZiIbMT9ydUAw/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Zzw31LuXjaZiIbMT9ydUAw/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'J R.', 'displayLocation': 'Mount Sophia, Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'J R.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=MMzE2p8FwNt_xDt4ZqFi1w', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 3, 'photoCount': 47, 'reviewCount': 98, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Grind coffee is my go to coffee shop for work at Raffles Place. This shop is in the second level of the Arcade near the Collyer entrance escalator. The Arcade building is pretty beat down, but I am a regular because of the superior house bean selection which is flavourful, but not too acidic. The owner is loud and friendly and takes his time to make a proper flat white. I still frequent the plethora of shops in the area but always find myself coming back. As mentioned in other reviews, this place is best for take out although I will occasionally dally during off peak hours.
Singapore&#39;s best kept coffee secret! Excellent coffee. The owner is so passionate about coffee, it&#39;s a joy to watch him work. It&#39;s definitely worth your time to hunt down this little gem.

Situated in the midst of the food street that is Bugis Junction&#39;s basement, it&#39;s hard to notice the aroma of coffee brewing - but that is through no fault of the wonderful baristas at awesome coffee.<br><br>As the name says, they serve awesome coffee here, along with delectable portions of pasta and meatballs for those of you looking for a quick meal fix. The coffee is perfect for a mid-day pick-me-up - mellow and smooth, not too strong, with a rather nutty flavour. The baristas have got the temperatures down pat too - the hot coffee was the perfect temperature, just enough to bring out the fragrance of the coffee, without burning your tongue in the process. <br><br>One of the drinks that I would strongly suggest though, is the Iced Mojito Latte (I think that&#39;s what it&#39;s called...) - a perfect blend of coffee and mint for sunny (and hot) Singapore&#39;s climate! It&#39;s the perfect chilled drink to bring out into the sticky heat - provided you finish it before all the ice melts!  <br><br>All in all, I&#39;d say skip Starbucks, and head into the basement for this. You can thank me for this advice later.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/WzUIo_oDkJEEnkF7SB2ieg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/awesome-coffee-singapore?reviewid=hX7y4bXgrYWOb71yOZFSGw&select=WzUIo_oDkJEEnkF7SB2ieg', 'altText': 'Photo of Awesome Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: I&#39;m going to pop the cherry for Awesome Coffee since there don&#39;t seem to be any other reviews. <br><br>If the below looks like it&#39;s going to be a TL;DR situation, here&#39;s the lowdown: Lattes - I&#39;ll take Awesome Coffee over Starbucks. <br><br>Okay so! <br><br>I can&#39;t speak for anything except the coffee since that&#39;s all I had time for today, and it is frickin Amazeballs. <br><br>Perfect milk to coffee ratio, fresh as hell and fragrant too. They have a little sign that tells you what beans they&#39;re using and although I&#39;m often skeptical of Sumatran beans, this one left me with no regrets. Latte wasn&#39;t very hot but I will assume that&#39;s because the barista noticed my severe eyebag situation and realized I needed to chug some caffeine, stat!<br><br>I like that the coffee cup is sturdy, service is great, menu is entertaining, and they have something really cool - ice cream IN a wafer stick. <br><br>I do NOT like that their logo is a sticker on the cup (but hey if we support their business, maybe they&#39;ll spring for actual printed cups LOL) <br><br>Also their menu seems huge, so I&#39;m not sure how good a job will be done for the food items. I&#39;ll be back to find out. <br><br>Lastly - awesome coffee is in Bugis junction. You can&#39;t fully appreciate the fragrance of the frickin coffee. Also probably why it took me so long to find the damn place. Guys, get a cafe and Awesome Coffee will be 101% awesome.

Sweet Spot is located right across the elevator bank of Marina Bay Sands Tower 3. My aunt and I stayed in Tower 3, and after walking pass it many times, we finally decided to grab breakfast here one morning.<br><br>A simple breakfast day.<br><br>I really have a lot of appreciate for simple breakfast days when I travel. Why? There are a lot of times when traveling in Asia where breakfast is included in the overall hotel package. Don&#39;t get me wrong, I&#39;m all about free food, let alone a free buffet! Double score! But there&#39;s also something nice about not going all out in eating tons of food for breakfast, which is what I do when the breakfast buffet is deliciousss (notice the emphasis on the triple S&#39;s! Lol). Although I do have to admit I love getting and eating everything I can possibly eat at a breakfast buffet, a simple croissant and tea is great on those laid back, chillaxing, and casual mornings. And during one of the mornings in Singapore, Sweet Spot served that purpose.<br><br>There are three TWG Teashops in Marina Bay Sands and I didn&#39;t go to any of them. Instead, I got to try the Chamomile TWG here. I actually really like the TWG chamomile tea. Chamomile is always my go to. I&#39;ve had not so good chamomiles before, but I thoroughly enjoyed TWG&#39;s. On to the almond croissant, man - no complaints here! The croissant was good! And they are generous about the almonds too. :D It was soft and flaky. Just the way I like it. I&#39;d recommend it, for sure. I&#39;d get it again if I find myself in Marina Bay Sands again in the future.<br><br>I ate SO much in Singapore, that I was really that full that my tummy didn&#39;t have room for sweets. Crazy, I know. However, I did take a picture as a souvenir as well as memory of how good they looked, hah.

Not to be confused with the Sweetspot which is inside MBS, this one is in the ArtScience Museum.  It&#39;s a well-lit, but not particularly well-known cafe.  Take advantage of that and come here to get some work done or meet a friend.

The inside of the café', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'The inside of the café'}]
text: If you&#39;ve got a sweet tooth, look no further. Inside the big Mariana Bay Sands lies this little café of sugar. The food looks superb, and it is a chocoholic dream. There is an absolutely HUGE array of French sweetie goods, such as cakes, macaroons, pastries and madeleines. The staff are polite and are very warm towards the customers, and the service is speedy. Three big drinks took less that 10 minutes to get out.It is a bit crowded though, and they could use a little more seating. Good music plays in the background as you sit and eat. But be prepared with your finances when you come here, and the items are a bit pricey, but under Singapore standards, it&#39;s an average price. The place is definitely a good little gem in the bay, and I would definitely come here again.

text: Hmmm,  not bad but frankly disappointing.  Looks like a high end french pastry,  but it turns out it lacked of finesse.  We tried 4 different pastry cakes, a vanilla-cherry speciality, a full chocolate one,  a chocolate with hazelnuts one,  and a strawberry and litchees tart.  Their mousses are way too dense, and the flavours are either non existent (killed by too much refrigeration ?) or are lacking of subtlety. Too much use of gellifying stuff too : yes the cakes look very nice like in a high end place, but the absolute rule is that aesthetics should never be priviledged over how the pastry will taste in the end.

Mille Feuille', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Mille Feuille'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/x1r26bcH-sJYZYtXxTfrtA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/sweetspot-singapore-2?reviewid=phEuedEsImdux_wEmwViZA&select=x1r26bcH-sJYZYtXxTfrtA', 'altText': 'Photo of SweetSpot - Singapore, Singapore. Le Petite Antoine', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Le Petite Antoine'}]
text: Got to try the classic Le Petite Antoine, created by the chef after his godson who loved the dessert. A sweet note to it with a delectable crunch. The cream is unbelievably light too. Crowd pleaser.<br><br>I also got the Mille Feuille along with it. For those who are not quite up for chocolate (how can you ever?), the Mille Feuille is the perfect option. Layers of crème pâtissière and puff pastry for a light treat with a nice buttery aftertaste.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=Qr-WoW6Vye4aH3I-YZ2ZyQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/nOwOO0eaohEXAYNTxlZZ9A/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/nOwOO0eaohEXAYNTxlZZ9A/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/nOwOO0eaohEXAYNTxlZZ9A/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/nOwOO0eaohEXAYNTxlZZ9A/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/nOwOO0eaohEXAYNTxlZZ9A/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/nOwOO0eaohEXAYNTxlZZ9A/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Steffenie S.', 'displayLocation': 'Bukit Timah, Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Steffenie S.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=Qr-WoW6Vye4aH3I-YZ2ZyQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 341, 'photoCount': 1742, 'reviewCount': 357, 'eliteYear': None}
text: This place has quite a few desserts that is worthy to try. One of it is the macaroons. I&#39;ve been in search for good macaroons ever since I step into Singapore. I love fruity taste macaroons so I tried strawberry, passion fruit and I forgot the other one. All of it are not that sweet which is good as I normally eat it in two bites without tea/coffee. The outside layer is crisp which is good. After eating the macaroons you will still have the flavour tangling on your tongue.<br><br>Another kind of pastry/ bread I would recommend is the mocha bread. The best is when you actually get it when it is fresh and bite straight into it. The top part is crispy and after biting, you will taste the mocha. I am not a fan of coffee but this is good and the price is reasonable.<br><br>This place is located at tower 3. Depending on where you park, you might need to walk more. Treat it exercise :) Enjoy. I hope that there will be more varieties of baked good soon!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/IE9GvJ0lp4VT6xKkIsZIMA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/sweetspot-singapore-2?reviewid=bFkRhK6anNM7-SLmtVUqiw&select=IE9GvJ0lp4VT6xKkIsZIMA', 'altText': 'Photo of SweetSpot - Singapore, Singapore. Two shells of macaroons with chocolate mousse and raspberries in between.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Two shells of macaroons with chocolate mousse and raspberries in between.'}]
text: SweetSpot is tucked away in the corner of Marina Bay Sands Hotel. The only thing that makes one aware of its presence is the smell of their bread and desserts. That was how I was lured to the bakery. Next thing I noticed were the colorful desserts lined at the shop front. I am a sucker for pretty things and this shop has nailed down my weakness with their pretty desserts. <br><br>I bought the Raspberry Macaroon &#39;cake&#39; which is two big macaroon shells with five raspberries and chocolate mousse in between. I got it because well, I love macaroons, I love chocolate and the fruits were just an excuse to make me feel a little bit less guilty. The taste of the &#39;cake&#39; was interesting... the taste of the raspberry compliments the sweetness of the macaroons and the bitter-sweetness of the chocolate. The overall taste was simply an explosion of different flavours from the chocolate, raspberries and macaroons. I was so sorry to finish it all and ended up wishing I can have another. If you are in the area ready to check in for a night&#39;s stay in MBS, do pop by SweetSpot and buy their desserts up into your room and savour it while enjoying the view outside your window like I did!

Great coffee and pastries', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Great coffee and pastries'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/GWct4x-tla8U_Y0WmxmU6w/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/sweetspot-singapore-2?reviewid=V82NUzqsx27OGtS8L_oT8A&select=GWct4x-tla8U_Y0WmxmU6w', 'altText': 'Photo of SweetSpot - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: I&#39;ve been here numerous times.  They serve up a great Americano coffee and the croissants and pastries are delish.   Tip though....go early in the day....by 4-5pm they are stale and not as good.

Lego is something that accompanies the childhood of most people and now it has been turned into an art exhibition which has been held since last year and will end this April at the Art Science Musuem, Marina Bay Sands. But the main thing is not the arts but the cakes at Sweetspot.<br><br>Though enrobed with a green chocolate case, this consists neither matcha nor pistachio. But is simply a very sweet white chocolate mousse with tangy raspberry compote and a layer of sponge cake. The texture was smooth and everything fits well, but not convincing for a second try.<br>             <br>The Sweet Thyme and Orange sounds special and worth trying if you don&#39;t mind herbs and spices in cakes. The mandarin orange cream centre sitting on a hazelnut meringue sponge cake is surrounded by a thyme-infused white chocolate mousse. The sweetness of the white chocolate mousse overshadowed the taste of thyme though.<br>                      <br> Lychee rose mousse cake ($9)<br>No matter how poor the food may taste, I usually tell people to go for a try because taste is subjective. But this Lychee rose mousse with raspberry could not have been produced by the same team which came up with the delicious creations above. It was not mousse but like a chewy rubber which could be due to too much gelatin powder. It is just too simple to be priced as the most expensive cake among the selection.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=rW-iz5OKzzp2WOHh-CC9uQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/aF6yHUIP-eQruVRKsJVnZQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/aF6yHUIP-eQruVRKsJVnZQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/aF6yHUIP-eQruVRKsJVnZQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/aF6yHUIP-eQruVRKsJVnZQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/aF6yHUIP-eQruVRKsJVnZQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/aF6yHUIP-eQruVRKsJVnZQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Stan L.', 'displayLocation': 'Seattle, WA', 'altText': 'Stan L.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=rW-iz5OKzzp2WOHh-CC9uQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 149, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 1203, 'eliteYear': None}
text: this is located inside the marina bay sands next to tower 3.. <br><br>we came here multiple times for a quick breakfast before heading up to the pool.. the croissants are excellent.. the macaroons are delicious and i don&#39;t even like macaroons.. the blueberry danish (probably my favorite thing here) is damn good and it&#39;s even better than their peach danish.. the coffee is decent.. <br><br>it&#39;s absolutely the perfect way start a morning to sneak some baked good and coffee upstairs and read a paper by the poolside..

I really enjoyed brunches. Decor and service were both charming, the prices were very decent for my plentiful breakfast combo, and the coffees were good and cleverly plated.<br><br>I will definitely be back.

text: A little pricey but the food was quite good. The in house coffee is quite interesting that requires the star to melt in the milk.

Ice cream with waffles', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Ice cream with waffles'}]
text: I was in the mood for a sweet brunch so ordered ice cream with waffles. The taste of the food was good but a bit pricey for the quality. The appeal was definitely the cafe decor. Very colorful, creative and captivating. I hope to sit in the popular car inside the cafe next time. Reservation service was very user friendly. Worth a visit!

Soy mocha - 4 stars<br>Decent! Asked for it to be less sweet so they reduced the chocolate syrup.<br><br>Chocolate on the rocks - 4.25 stars<br>This was interesting! An espresso ice cube served with a pitcher of milk. This allows you to change up the flavour of your drink!<br><br>Ambience - 3 stars<br>The place was a bit too dimly lit, crowded and kitschy for me to be honest.

text: In the heart of Rangoon, more famous for bak kut teh, is this hidden gem of a cafe. It has a laid back hippy charm and the service is very good. Unusual nowadays for cafes to have table service but it works for me and I will come back for sure. Special kudos with their Halloween menu and decorating the place so well.<br><br>Tip: they also bake their own bread which they provide to taste for free!

text: Second visit there... love it! The service was warm and sweet. The food was awesome ... the coffee on the rock was mmmmm ... more than words can describe. <br>I ordered their September monthly special, firey crab aglio oglio... it was good! The taste of the fresh crab meat blended in the pasta ... I think the chef cooked the pasta with the crab meat soup. It was really good! And their bailey coffee on the rock,  it&#39;s superb as usual. <br>It is a good place to catch up with friends.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/RS8rJg2lijiUvNJjT9uV5g/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/brunches-cafe-singapore-3?reviewid=QfYcgYC4aLX1zBuhrKpRwg&select=RS8rJg2lijiUvNJjT9uV5g', 'altText': 'Photo of Brunches Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Cute place to enjoy a morning!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Cute place to enjoy a morning!'}]
text: Let me just start off by saying that this is the best service I&#39;ve ever received in Singapore. <br><br>I&#39;ve never had wait staff be so kind or accommodating to me, especially when I&#39;m one of those pesky café patrons who are there for the wifi. I&#39;m definitely a demanding customer at times and they&#39;ve always worked with me and with a smile! Once I was seated, I needed an outlet and they found a table with one, unplugged the diffuser that was currently using the outlet, and helped me move my things there. This kind of hospitality and problem solving is definitely rare in Singapore. <br><br>The food here is amazing as well. I had their King Caesar Salad and was expecting the same bland grilled chicken that every restaurant serves but no, this chicken had crackly skin and was delicious and flavorful! <br><br>I also ordered a chammomile tea with longan and expected it to get a pot with a bag of nice tea inside. Nope! I got a clear pot full of the individual ingredients. I&#39;ve never received tea like that at a café. It was such a pleasant surprise! <br><br>Finally, finally, I must give a shout out to their music. Whoever put together their playlist would have probably been my best friend in high school because it is such a random assortment of music I love but haven&#39;t heard in so long like Jennifer Love Hewitt&#39;s &#34;Bare Naked&#34; or &#34;Back to the Beginning&#34; from the Anastasia soundtrack. I have never been in a place where I actually know the obscure songs. <br><br>The only thing I don&#39;t like about this place is that it&#39;s so great, it makes it difficult for me to explore other places in my neighborhood because I&#39;m happy to go here every time I need to work out of the office.

Thai Milk Tea Cheesecake and Beauty (Berries) tea ;)', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Thai Milk Tea Cheesecake and Beauty (Berries) tea ;)'}]
text: Nice place to chill around the Farrer park area.<br><br>Passed by this place once and wanted to head over for lunch but unfortunately my friend chose another dining site instead.<br><br>Came here at 2 pm on a Wednesday after lunch and stayed more than 2 hours here. The door opening was pretty small and the door was tough to push. And the waitress helped me out and guided me to a seating which is brightly lit. Was also given menus to look at (the interesting part was when they gave me alcoholic menu to look at). Without much hesitation, decided to order a slice of cake and tea in a teapot. <br><br>Headed to the counter to see the available cake slices for the day and Thai milk tea cheesecake caught my eyes. For the tea, I headed for fruity tea and hence I ordered blissful berries tea.<br><br>The Thai milk tea taste was pretty mild but the cheesecake was silky and smooth; not too sweet either. Price wise it is reasonable for a decent slice of cake.<br><br>The berry tea was strong (depending how long you soak the tea leaves) and it has strong smell. I tend to go for a stronger aftertaste so I consumed it when it was darker in color. The tea came in a clear glass pot so you will see the color changes overtime (from the tea leaves) and you will see the floating berries as well.<br><br>Service was alright here. More servers to cater to more customers. So one will be greeted and served pretty quickly.<br><br>Love the antique touch in this cafe. It is also a good place to hang out and chill. Small touches added to increase the vibrancy of the cafe. I&#39;ll come back to try out their mains another time.

text: Came for lunch - Loved the ambiance: eclectic place with lots of vintage decorations including a converted vintage car ! Very relaxed and easy going. Good for brunch, lunch, hanging out with with friends &amp; family. The coffee was excellent and the food was yummy. We ordered the baked eggs and eggs benedict. The high tea set looked intruiging - will have to come check it out sometime.

We tried some other dishes before and guaranteed, our plates are EMPTY! Friendly service (a bit shy sometimes). Slightly cramped inside, but hey, it makes it cozy regardless. Love it.
Cute place. Vintage decor and plays covers of mando and English pop songs. Good food and service, but no service charge!

text: Super cute and whimsical cafe on Haji Lane that offers a selection of cakes, tea and coffee.  By the time I got there (around 5) pretty much all the cakes were gone, so I opted for the Pearl on the Orient, which is a green tea with hints of rose. text: One thing really outstanding was the wait.  Wait to be seated, wait for food, wait for check.  Can coffee come when dessert come? No.  End up cold coffee and ordered another just be sure to have something warm.  Cakes not impressive, Croissant ok.  Pricing just way off for what you get.   Nice glitter and showmanship.  Coffee is good though thank goodness but not good when cold

text: A rather beautiful and &#34;instagrammable&#34; coffee shop located in the little hidden corner (GF) of Ion Orchard. The shop is opposite Gentle Monster and you can&#39;t really miss it. <br><br>You&#39;ll love this place if you&#39;re a coffee connoisseur as they take their coffee blends very seriously. As you enter the shop, you&#39;ll be greeted by walls of coffee beans that reminded me of TWG, but better. I learned that Bacha Coffee originates from Morocco so it&#39;s just fair that the shop is designed to look like you have just stepped into Marrakesh, with much-elaborated decor. <br><br>I visited Bacha Coffee on a Sunday morning and scored a table rather easily at its 30 seater cafe. I was rather impressed by the menu as it looks like a coffee encyclopedia, listing out bestsellers, flavored coffee as well as rare beans sourced from all around the world. I couldn&#39;t recall which I ordered but the coffee was delicious, to say the least. A pot of coffee comes with a $9 price tag - served in a nice gooseneck pot and good for two to share.  The accompaniment includes raw sugar and its signature chantilly cream to add to your coffee if you fancy. <br><br>Besides coffee, there&#39;s also an array of pastries and cakes to satiate your sweet cravings. I ordered 2 small croissants (pistachio and raspberry)  and they were super delicious. I wished i have a bigger stomach so I can order something else, but I guess ill have to make a return trip soon.  <br><br>Overall, worth checking out if you&#39;re in Ion Orchard and looking for a coffee break. Amazing selection of coffees and delicious pastries / finger food available throughout the day.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/4CGX4-aFSB8rwqA9InNjHQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/candour-coffee-singapore?reviewid=iRbUQc2vw7Y7GXk8k8AYlA&select=4CGX4-aFSB8rwqA9InNjHQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Candour Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Sea salt caramel latte', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Sea salt caramel latte'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Vjgaow_iK5vAisXJyT2RqQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/candour-coffee-singapore?reviewid=iRbUQc2vw7Y7GXk8k8AYlA&select=Vjgaow_iK5vAisXJyT2RqQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Candour Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: My friend and I were looking for a quick caffeine fix to start off our day after an incredibly long journey to Singapore. I looked on yelp, and saw that Candour Coffee was walking distance from our hotel--so we decided to check it out.  <br><br>Candour Coffee is a cute cafe located just off of Beach Street. We walked in and were immediately greeting by the cashier/host and the barista. They also serve food, but we were on a mission for coffee. So after skimming the menu, I decided on a (hot) sea salt caramel latte, and my friend ordered a chai latte. The host then told us to seat ourselves and he would bring out our order. While a little small in the interior, there was plenty of seating. A few minutes later, my latte was ready and the host brought it to our table with a smile. My goodness was that latte tasty! It was the perfect temperature, with a thick layer of milk foam with a cute design. The taste was blended and smooth. The sea salt caramel flavor was faint but it was good--it didn&#39;t need to be overbearingly sweet. My friend also really enjoyed her chai latte as well. I asked her how it was, and she read my mind: &#34;good enough for us to come back tomorrow.&#34; So that&#39;s how it will go! We will definitely be back to Candour!

Strong and smooth coffee that is perfect for wetting your throat and perking your spirits up. You want to come here many times to try their different food offerings as well. A beautiful and cheery spot in Beach Road to escape the crowds and hot weather.
