Berry Ricotta Hotcake $14.90++', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Berry Ricotta Hotcake $14.90++'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/6GfF9-KXwY38lTlgjqEL2Q/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/curious-palette-singapore?reviewid=pzAZUXO9syUcIqGlPkOzTw&select=6GfF9-KXwY38lTlgjqEL2Q', 'altText': 'Photo of Curious Palette - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/euLMeIHeNfEsw0fb7z1Ujg/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/curious-palette-singapore?reviewid=pzAZUXO9syUcIqGlPkOzTw&select=euLMeIHeNfEsw0fb7z1Ujg', 'altText': 'Photo of Curious Palette - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/bmc3aa-7skhFOWpgkkLHbw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/curious-palette-singapore?reviewid=pzAZUXO9syUcIqGlPkOzTw&select=bmc3aa-7skhFOWpgkkLHbw', 'altText': 'Photo of Curious Palette - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}]
text: Located along the busy stretch of prinsep street is curious palette! From the owners of stranger Union is curious palette! Opened in 2015, this interesting and rustic looking cafe can accommodate huge groups of diners in its two storey shop house cafe!<br><br>Looking at the menu, they offer soft shell crab burger, chicken, western fares as well as interesting sounding buttermilk waffles and hot cakes that have taken over Instagram!! They also have a wide selection of cakes. All very vibrantly colored to emphasize the flavours!! The range from $8 and up!<br><br>1. Matcha Azuki Cake $8.50++<br><br>I&#39;m a green tea lover and this cake was calling my name. Although, I did feel that this cake was too articially coloured. The green was too vibrant for my eyes. Nonetheless, I dug in and disappointingly, I couldn&#39;t really taste the green tea but the azuki (red beans) sweet and pretty much ended up causing the cake to taste like a red bean cake. I didn&#39;t even bother to finish up this cake. Skip this cake and get the earl grey lavender manjari cake instead, save your $10.<br><br>2. Nachos Con Carne $12.90++ *Highly Recommended*<br><br>With slow-cooked hand-pulled pork, sour cream, jalapeno and melted cheddar. I really liked the pulled pork here, it was well seasoned, tender and also extremely flavourful. The salsa here was abit too sour for my liking. This dish could&#39;ve used a bit more cheddar, there really wasn&#39;t enough cheddar, more than 3/4 of the nachos didn&#39;t have cheese on it. Probably one of the most underated dish at Curious Palette, as I hardly saw anyone ordering it! Do try it! You will like it! Truffle fries are overated anyways! Have some meat with your carb!<br><br>3. Cafe Mocha $5.50++<br> A nice cup of mocha to perk me up during my later afternoon at Curious Palette. A good balance of chocolate and coffee. This fared alot better than the iced mocha, which literally was too diluted before the ice even began to melt.<br><br>4. Iced Mocha $6.90++<br>A very typical iced mocha, nothing fancy. It had chocolate powder on top of it. It tasted kinda of diluted, not a very strong chocolate, milk or coffee taste. I was kind of disappointed in this drink, considering the price that you pay and the fact they they had easily 4 staff behind the coffee counter. <br><br>5. Earl Grey Lavender Manjari Cake $8++ *Highly Recommended*<br>This was the first cake that caught my eye in the cake display. It had a slight blue-ish purple colouring on the top. There were several layers to the cake, which the staff described as &#34;chocolate layers&#34; And indeed they were. They were chocolate ganache layers that had a lavender aroma and taste! The fragrance of the lavender was subtle but yet enough for me to pick it up! The cake was on the slightly dryer side, wasn&#39;t as moist as I had hoped it to be. But everyone on the table agreed, it was one of the most interesting cake we had ever come across!<br><br>6. Pina Colada Tea $7.50<br>This was a very interesting tea, as it tasted very fruity and even without sugar, there was a hint of sweetness. The sweet aroma itself, made me wonder about what ingredients were used to make this tea! Served in a tea pot, it&#39;s a pretty tea set that comes with this order.<br><br>7. Berry Ricotta Hotcake $12.90++ *Highly Recommended*<br>With vanilla bean ice cream, fresh seasonal berries, pumpkin seeds and sunflower seed. These are breakfast pancakes summer-style, ridiculously light, and lemony somehow! They are crispy like a biscuit on the edges and super soft and fluffy on the inside. Almost like eating a freshly baked moist cupcake!<br><br>If you imagine the flavour of cheesecake combined with a texture that&#39;s best, if wordily, described as a kind of souffled griddle cake, you&#39;re somewhere near getting the measure of these.<br>In my view, this is their fabulous delicacy and, besides, there is some accompanying fruit allows you to delude yourself that these are healthy.<br><br>8. Spam Fries $11.90++<br>These spam fries served with Kaffir lime mayo, which tasted like plain mayo. No lime fragrant or taste was evident. The spam fries though were slightly softer and tender in texture in comparison to other spam fries I&#39;ve tried. The edgers weren&#39;t crispy though, they were just hard.<br><br>Overall : It&#39;s quite expensive considering you have to pay 7% GST and 10% service charge. It can get quiet full, so do call and make a reservation. The food isn&#39;t all that great. Although I didn&#39;t try any mains, I did see alot of people order the soft shell crab at $22++. I would only come here for the Earl Grey Lavender Manjari cake or the Hotcakes.

text: The last time I was in Singapore a friend of mine suggested that we meet up here for a cup of coffee. The problem was that when we met up, the place happened to be closed. So, upon my return it was my desire to make sure that I checked this place out. Apparently the owners had been to Melbourne and we so impressed with the café scene there that they decided to bring the experiment back to Singapore. Well, from my experience, it seems that this has succeeded, particularly when you consider the number of other coffee shops here. As for this one, well, it was pretty good, not fantastic, but still pretty good.

text: This is a really beautiful cafe/bistro. I had an affogato. The espresso is seriously good and goes perfectly with the gelato. I noticed they had AeroPress coffee too, which makes me happy as a coffee aficionado. <br><br>I&#39;m a snob when it comes to fries (I&#39;m Belgian, so I have to be a snob about frites) but the truffle fries here were decently good. The mayonnaise they came with was really good. <br><br>A friend had the savory?? hotcakes which looked amazing. We did have to wait quite a long time for them, but we&#39;re a patient group. I wanted to try them too but I didn&#39;t because I was too full. Next time!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/u-fIMbhafDbq2Dptl6CzJQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/curious-palette-singapore?reviewid=-XS-x5t3Ix4vYE0XSYI3Pg&select=u-fIMbhafDbq2Dptl6CzJQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Curious Palette - Singapore, Singapore. Synesso? Check. Lightbulbs? Check. Unpainted bar counter? Check. Hipster café CONFIRMED.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Synesso? Check. Lightbulbs? Check. Unpainted bar counter? Check. Hipster café CONFIRMED.'}]
text: From the folks behind Strangers Reunion, comes a brand new hipster cafe-eatery with all the usual hipster trimmings - arty lightbulbs, reclaimed wood tables, custom coloured Synesso machines, bespoke denim and leather work aprons and the ever-present scent of artificial truffle oil in the air, not to mention a few mandatory hirsute baristas behind the counter. The only deviation from the hipster template comes in the form of the thumping club techno that&#39;s loud enough to make you speak just a bit louder than you&#39;d normally do in a café. <br><br>The place is definitely well decorated, and the lighting and layout seems almost deliberately set up for patrons to take instagram-worthy photos of their very photogenic food. <br><br>Popped by for a coffee, so can&#39;t say much about the food. Friends had several variations of milky coffee, and I had a Kalita&#39;d Finca Santa Teresa. The drip coffee was well executed, and highlighted all the rich, chocolatey, berry notes of the coffee. <br><br>Craft beer menu looks decent as well - Brewdog Dead Pony Club and Green Goblin on draught, and a slew of very drinkable craft bottles. <br><br>Would pop by again if I&#39;m in the area. Despite the hipster trappings, seems like a place I&#39;d enjoy returning to. Now if only they&#39;d turn the damn music down a notch or two...

text: I have no idea about this place until a fellow Yelper suggested to come here. Located at a row of shop houses, this restaurant is easily recognised without a signboard. We were there with our goggle map showing us that we were at the right spot, but looking around, we saw signboards of others except for this one and when we went closer for a look, we saw the signboard in small blackboard on a chair. I am not too sure whether I am impressed with this idea. <br><br>Stepping inside, I saw many paintings of Asian arts on the walls and it was pretty crowded. We had to wait for a while before our table was ready. As hungry as a bear I ordered the $22 plus Chicken leg, why so expensive? I was curious to find out. My friend&#39;s meal came quite fast while mine seemed to take forever to come (15 minutes later in fact) and my jaws almost dropped when I saw the portion of it. It was ok on the whole especially with the rice - I thought it was not bad. However, I wasn&#39;t full at that point as the portion to be honest has a lot to be desired. <br><br>The service on the other hand was average, neither bad or good, guess there weren&#39;t enough staff around, but at least we didn&#39;t wait long for the bill. Well, I would come back to give it another go to try other dishes.

text: This cafe was catching on the hype, so decided to pop by before queues start forming. <br>Interior is a cross between Strangers ReUnion and Pacamara cafe, white washed with nice earthy details, and perhaps Magic (caffeinated drink) made me guess they&#39;re related to Strangers&#39;. <br><br>Anyway, menu sufficiently extensive to include the typical Eggs dishes, and several savory ones. (Appreciate that!) <br><br>Food was decent but not mind-blowing, if this place doesn&#39;t get too crowded, will patronize it more often.

text: Great ambiance, though definitely on the pricey side. Also good for impromptu brunch plans since we waltzed in at noon without a reservation and managed to get a seat immediately. Service, while not particularly prompt, is polite and attentive.<br><br>Salmon was well-executed, moist, flavorful and complete with a crispy skin. The guacamole and haloumi were definitely a nice touch, though the bacon scone was a slightly bizarre addition to the dish. Didn&#39;t seem to really jive with the other elements on the plate. For the portion, it is on the pricey side though. <br><br>Pulled pork sandwich was decent, with an adequately thick slice of bread to hold the mound of pulled pork. Egg was also perfectly poached.<br><br>Truffle fries were awesome and special mention to the truffle aioli. They do, however, charge for topping up the aioli.<br><br>The lavender manjari was great as a chocolate cake, and while photogenic, the lavender taste was imperceptible. <br><br>Spent approximately $80 for 2 in total for brunch. <br><br>Saw neighboring tables order the famous berries hotcake and would love to try it one day when we aren&#39;t overly stuffed :P

text: New place in the neighbourhood, suspiciously similar to Strangers&#39; Reunion - which leads me to assume they&#39;re related. <br><br>Great decor and a much better vibe than the stupidly overrated Forty Hands. And with better coffee (on par with Strangers). <br><br>The brunch menu has usual fare - eggs and salmon and such - but throws in a few more interesting items like pulled pork and coddled eggs. <br><br>There&#39;s a dinner menu which sounds pretty good too, and we&#39;ll be back to try. <br><br>Pancakes are crazy looking things that look more like cakes, and will also be a must-try on the next visit. <br><br>Food was good - not going to waste words trying to describe every element. Solid and good. <br><br>(Service generally good but unfortunately let down by the inevitable resident sour-faced angsty hipsterish polytechnic student waitress)

text: Updated my review from 3 to 4 stars cos the food is awesome too!<br><br>Chanced upon this place walking down Selegie Road looking for a place to chill a little after catching a performance at SOTA.<br><br>First impression : if you don&#39;t know what hipster means, you get your answers in this cafe. <br><br>From the discreet sign outside the restaurant that scribbles &#34;Curious Palette&#34; in such a unreadable cursive font, to the ondeh ondeh inspired cake and of course chai tea latte, it&#39;s hipster stamped all over it. <br><br>(Context as to why I used chai tea latte as a hipster barometer. Having recently been to Melbourne that has a super fantastic flare of hipster cafes, for a non-coffee drinker like me, chai tea latte is like the next best substitute for the inability to enjoy the great coffee brew. If you have chai tea latte in your indie lookig cafe, you are hipster certified. At least, in my opinion. Heh)<br><br>Don&#39;t let the exterior of the cafe fool you as its quite a large cafe that stretches deep into the back. Plenty of seats and a pretty nice ambience. <br><br>My friend had truffle mushroom soup and it was pretty awesome. Fragrant and thick, it&#39;s a pretty dense soup. <br><br>As it was really late, thats about all we had, including a nice huge slide of ondeh ondeh cake. I still prefer the real ondeh ondeh as the beauty of the kuey is really being able to enjoy the sweet and warm hula Melaka burst in your mouth as you bite into it. That&#39;s something a cake cannot replicate. Good effort, but just not the same experience.<br><br>Will be very happy to try it out again and this time, for the mains and the beautiful pancakes!

text: A 30 mins wait for the pancake. But quite worth the wait because the pancake is very fluffy and nice. The strawberries and blackberries are very sour. It is good. Friends ordered other pastas and light bites.

This place has its ~*aesthetic*~ on point. The cakes were A+ as well. I can&#39;t personally vouch for the coffee but my friends seemed to be quite satisfied. There were all these complicated coffee things on the wall that my friends got all excited about so I&#39;m assuming this place is legit. <br><br>The place was packed on a Saturday afternoon and I saw at least two millennials just chilling reading the newspaper. Who does that. So cool. Keep doing it. <br><br>TL;DR A nice, beautiful place to chill with friends and/or your favorite publication.

text: The espresso here is top notch, one of the best in town for sure. Waffle ice cream dish was good as well although I&#39;m not a fan but it&#39;s a 10 min prep. Honestly i wish I ordered the hot cake variety as they peak my interest. It&#39;s a 40 min wait. Next time come with people with patience...<br>Venue typical Instagram hipster joint. Nice vibe.

text: Have been here couple of times and the food and coffee served are quite good, though I felt it was a bit pricey. Staff are helpful and friendly and the management really do care about their employees. Cosy setting, nice place to chill but it is usually crowded during lunch and dinner.

text: For brunch, perfect place. Trendy and modern with a slightly rustic effect.. the food was good. Ricotta took 30 mins but friends said it was totally worth it. Had the waffle myself and was good. I would rather have had the scrambled eggs with portobello mushrooms..they looked a lot nicer! Definitely worth a visit.

We popped in for a quick brunch- the place was packed. The decor is nice and the menu had good variety. Due to the layout, it seems like there was a constant echo where we were seated. <br>We ordered the pulled pork sourdough and the baked eggs. The food was passable - won&#39;t say that it was amazing. The pulled pork was pretty good but the eggs were too runny and cold. Overall service was cold and not very welcoming. The price point is also pretty high.

text: Great coffees, nice brunch options and the ambience at the place was very cosy too. Keep it up.

My friends and I needed a place for dinner on Friday that was close to Cathay as we were watching a movie afterwards. We booked some seats at Curious Palette purely because it had pulled pork sandwiches on the menu and that is enough to get me excited. Eating proper meals at hipster cafes is always a risk because they are probably more adept at making coffees or reselling central kitchen cakes, than cooking proper food. That turned out to be the case but I&#39;m not surprised. <br><br>First, the good thing about Curious Palette is that the cafe is in a fairly long shop house that stretches to the back. There&#39;s quite a few tables and waiters/waitresses running around so you can get decent service. The decor is bright and I could see why people would want to hang out here. I arrived for dinner last and was seated at our table for three at a seat with the back facing the &#34;walkway&#34; where servers constantly were passing through. It wasn&#39;t a great idea because I felt like I was in everyone&#39;s way all the time. I ordered a &#34;wagyu&#34; burger, while my friends ordered the chicken confit and fried chicken (yes apparently they like fowl), as well as a bottle of NZ Sauvignon Blanc (the wine list is extremely limited and obviously curated to meet the $50-70 price point so you either get overpriced pedestrian village (in an attempt to satisfy the old world lovers) and a not so overpriced new world selection, since the latter tends to be cheaper anyway...so we went with the latter). <br><br>My &#34;wagyu&#34; burger was tasty with a heavy dose of truffle derivatives/seasoning on it, but the meat/fat wasn&#39;t mind blowing so it made me wonder why bother using a low grade of wagyu just for marketing purposes. At the $20-30 range, this is likely to be Australian &#34;wagyu&#34; chuck though I would guess the cow is actually a mix breed, given the lack of fat and real flavor. To use a really poor analogy, its like being promised plate of char kuay teow without the fried lard - tastes fine and you can probably hide the lack of lard with some wok hei, but it&#39;s not the same. What annoyed me a little more was the doneness - I asked for my patty to be cooked medium because unlike steaks, ground meat can be quite mushy and grotesque when it is below 140F in the middle, which was the case with my burger. I sent back my burger a second time and was told by the kitchen that anything with a medium doneness will usually err on the bloody side and all I&#39;ve to say is...get a good broiler or a sous vide machine? I am paying at least an arm for this burger. Anyway the accompanying sweet potato fries were fine, the fried chicken my friend ordered was crispy and juicy and the wine did its job (although our glasses were unbelievably frozen and the waiter clearly wasn&#39;t trained to pour wine). So yes, a meh passable experience. Maybe it&#39;s just me but does hipster = expensive and nothing except the coffee is supposed to taste great?

I like the bright and open feel of this cafe. Food was pretty good, especially the pancake (very fluffy and moist). The baked eggs dish could be done better with the eggs cooked a little more - so maybe you can tell them this when you order. They did forgot our order and it took a long time for try baked eggs to show up, but they didn&#39;t rush us to leave at all after we finished our food and stayed a little longer to do some girlie catch up.

text: Cute space. Pretty good coffee. Every item on the menu has too many elements. They take the no substitutions thing too far. I wanted ciabatta instead of foccacia under my smashed avo. Seriously. Is it really that hard? Why do you have so many different breads then?

text: No words to describe how chill the vibes is and how friendly the staff are, going back to drink coffee or tea again is just like visiting old friend.<br><br>Love the little cards they prepared and serve together with the drinks

text: Omg I love this place!! So clean and so refreshing! If you&#39;re looking for a place to hang out or do some reading, this place is it! (wifi available) Just what I was looking for to do some research while having a nice cup of coffee. I&#39;ve been to several places for coffee and none were as good or modern as this.<br><br>My favorite coffee with milk was the El Salvador Los Pirineos. It has a dried fruit, honey, almond note to it. I added a little brown sugar for a little sweetness but you honestly won&#39;t even need it. I&#39;m not a no sugar kind of gal but this coffee was so light yet delicious, it didn&#39;t need it. Ive already been here twice and hope to come one last time before I leave!!

Brought my family there to the tg pagar outlet. Was surprised that only take away / pick ups are available for now. We ordered their fisherman and cheetos. Coupled with plain bagels - cream cheese and Nutella and pistachios schmears.<br>The hash brown add-on was amazing.<br>Overall, we enjoyed the hearty breakfast. Thank you!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=-5YMIME_WEin_by41Bj-3Q', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/XzO0vlN24SvnUbjEiiWCCQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/XzO0vlN24SvnUbjEiiWCCQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/XzO0vlN24SvnUbjEiiWCCQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/XzO0vlN24SvnUbjEiiWCCQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/XzO0vlN24SvnUbjEiiWCCQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/XzO0vlN24SvnUbjEiiWCCQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Jian Hao T.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Jian Hao T.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=-5YMIME_WEin_by41Bj-3Q', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': 6, 'reviewCount': 21, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Keeping this review short. Taste is good, but not the kind I would give 5 star for. <br><br>This review is purely done on taste, as I did a take away

When my friend swore Two Men Bagel House was close to the real thing in NY I refused to believe it. If no where else in America could get it right, how could a small place inside of a mall in Singapore do it? I&#39;m not sure but this happens to be one of my only repeat experiences in the city because the bagels are just that good.<br><br>Is it true to form NYC? Not entirely. They&#39;re a bit on the small side but boy, do they have a bite to them. The old myth of New York bagel success was something along the lines of &#34;it&#39;s (the elements) in the water&#34; but was later debunked to be the boiling process of said water and barley to make it truly stand out. Could Two Men be employing a similar method?<br><br>They claim to be the first bagel house in all of Singapore and started only a handful of years ago. Each bagels are supposedly handmade and they recommend that folks who don&#39;t want to face the daily disappointment of their potential selling out should call ahead of time to confirm availability.<br><br>The bagels themselves are soft and have just the right amount of density. The variety is not impressive to most New Yorkers / Montreal folks, but they do have some interesting ones like cheddar, salt, garlic, and all-sorts (everything bagel). The salmon they&#39;re using is not the kind of lox I&#39;d find back home, but this is a respectable alternative for being on the other side of the world.<br><br>For first timers, keep an open mind. This is one of the only games in town and the closest thing to anything from the US. Try one of their bagel sandwiches (I vote for the lamb or bo-ssam) and beware of the morning lines.

I wanted to wait until I visited NYC before speaking on TMBH and I&#39;m glad I did.  <br><br>I can say, after having top rated bagels in NYC, that THIS bagel house is legit, and for my sake, the best I&#39;ve ever had.  I&#39;ve had some fabulous bagels but what really sets this place apart are their creations.  <br><br>Nothing is spared when creating a fresh, well made (be is smoked brisket or pickled beets, capers or properly crispy hash brown) sandwich with perfectly complimentary fillings and add ons. <br><br>Staff and super friendly and knows your name within one visit.<br><br>Seating is more adequate than others in the area, as there are plenty that don&#39;t have any at all. <br><br>I know there are a LOT of amazing choices in TP area, but if you want an amazing breakfast with healthy (or not) options and a variety to satisfy any palate, you&#39;ll be glad you stopped here on your way!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/gRNumIFk9iWIKooWw_BI2A/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/two-men-bagel-house-singapore?reviewid=tYRV3qIMAQkri6KYeVef3g&select=gRNumIFk9iWIKooWw_BI2A', 'altText': 'Photo of Two Men Bagel House - Singapore, Singapore. A.B.L.T. on black &amp; white sesame', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'A.B.L.T. on black & white sesame'}]
text: What is a bagel? It&#39;s a hole with bread rolled around it. Ha ha just had to get that out there. Just gobbled down the last bite of my A.B.L.T. from Two Men Bagel House and boy am I happy. SG may look back in the future and possibly say the Eastern European food scene started right here at TMBH, albeit by a Singaporean. <br><br>Love the vibe from this place and of course the bagels. Walked up to the order counter and just about everyone in the kitchen greeted me with a big hello and a smile. Don&#39;t come here if you&#39;re looking for a bona fide, proper New York bagel because the owner, Borne, tells me that his bagels are made with the Singaporean taste buds in mind. He&#39;s tried bagels from both coasts of the U.S. (probably in between too) and has decided to make the bagels lighter and smaller. He make batches throughout the day to ensure freshness and quality. Business had a rough start a couple of years ago but things are really rolling now. Swing by and get treated like a VIP customer, which is becoming a rarity these days, and treat yourself to a round of deliciousness. You won&#39;t regret it.

text: Two Men Bagel House makes me upset:<br>-  why have I been living in Singapore for 10 months without having their food?<br>- why don&#39;t I live in the Tanjong Pagar area?<br>- why don&#39;t I work in the CBD?<br>- why isn&#39;t the service as good everywhere else?<br><br>So many regrets just to tell you that this place is DA BOMB!<br><br>I heard many raves so I was super hesitant, mainly due to previous experiences with hyped Western places in Singapore but Two Men delivers! I took one bite of their Cowking bagel which is pastrami based and I was sold. It was everything I expected and more!<br><br>In addition, the staff is amazing: they are super friendly, knowledgeable and cheery.<br><br>Once I am done crying in my corner over the fact that it is quite far for me, I am going back!! <br><br>Highly recommended!!

text: 9am on a Sunday when the store opens and there is a Q?!!! what the??!!!   thought I was being smart be there early? think again.   <br><br>ok Bagel really good.   these guys have done it well.   the combo bagelwiches pretty good.   execution of orders efficient and the coffee even comes out at the same time as the bagel.   <br><br>all in all wonderful meal though like the bagel - a hole in the pocket

text: Unbelievable how the food and the staff are equally as great. The lady at the wrap was all smiles and will to recommend and navigate the menu. I got the hot link bagel add Avocado and it was really great. <br><br>Looks like the lunch options would be just as amazing if not better. <br><br>Thanks TMBH

text: After recently moving from the US, one thing I&#39;ve been craving immensely is bagels. I visited TMBH after reading fellow Yelpers&#39; reviews and was not disappointed. <br><br>One bagel plain with no cream cheese (schmear on their menu) costs $2.60, or you can order 3 bagels for $6. I went with a friend and got 3 bagels toasted, with no schmear, mostly due to the price tag. The schmear costs +$3-5 extra, which is quite significant compared to the cost of the bagel. <br><br>All three bagels I ordered (black and white sesame, multigrain, and cinnamon raisin) were excellent, tasting fresh and perfect. Will definitely come back again when I have my carb cravings!

text: An amazing place! A great combination of service and product. They can stand their ground with any NYC or NJ bagel shop, it was that good!! A lox bagel for less than 10 USD. Easy to find and short walk from the MRT station. Very friendly staff! Love it! I&#39;ll be back

Smoked beef bagel. Don&#39;t remember the actual name.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': "Smoked beef bagel. Don't remember the actual name."}]
text: Let&#39;s face it, bagels for $10 in Singapore is like chicken rice for £30 in London. You have to make sacrifices if you&#39;re not eating local specialties. <br><br>Once I got over that, it was great. Every choice so far has been done perfectly, the bagel toasted yet soft, the ingredients top quality. The smoked beef one is particularly good, although being able to go and buy a decent smoked salmon bagel in Singapore still remains one of my favourite discoveries in the relative food desert of Tanjong Pagar. <br><br>The filling is generous enough that these days we split one between two, but we&#39;re not big eaters. Service is fast and friendly.

text: Best meal in Singapore!!! It was delicious! Bagels fresh daily, we got the last two bagels when we arrived at 2:00pm. We had the avocado bacon sandwich, AMAZING! And also had the walnut cream cheese on another bagel, so good!! Just go!!

text: Visited Singapore prior to a Cruise during Holidays-Dec. 2018.  We located this place by TripAdvisor and Yelp so gave it a try.  Ordered the Bacon-Avacado Bagel and PB &amp;Jelly for kids and food was excellent!  Also had their Coffee and Mango Smoothies.  All good.  As others have commented, service was excellent..... BUT BEWARE..... place was absolutely packed-busy.  We came around 10 am and there was a que and was standing room only.  Limited seating.  Obviously its busy for a reason.  Also, the music was so loud.  Felt like I was in a club with base pounding and could not hear ourselves talking.  Reason why I fave 4 stars instead of 5.  Just be aware it will be busy with loud music..  As others have commented on, great place to do takeout. <br><br>Also it was not cheap.  40$ USD for breakfast.....

text: This gets 5 stars from me. I&#39;ve been living in Asia for about 5 years, and bagels are really tough to come by. This place reminded me of the bagels I had growing up, they&#39;re definitely top quality. <br><br>The layout of the restaurant is very &#34;chill&#34; and carefully planned. The menus are written across the wall in chalk, in a font that screams hipster style. You can take your time and read the menu, and I&#39;ve seen quite a few people (myself included) taking pictures so you can remember what they have for next time. When you order at the register, you give them your name and they&#39;ll holler for you when your order is ready. <br><br>I recommend doing their &#34;Two Men&#39;s Crafted Bagelwiches,&#34; don&#39;t just get a plain bagel with cream cheese. They have gotten so creative with their menu, and I have to say there is not one thing on the menu that doesn&#39;t sound mouthwateringly delicious to me. I am working my way through their menu, and so far everything I&#39;ve had is top notch. My favorites so far are the &#34;Cow King&#34; and the &#34;Bird,&#34; and what I really love about this place is that you can choose whatever type of bagel you want for the bagelwiches. <br><br>I really hope they do well and open more locations!
My fav is the Avo Baco bagel. It fills me up all the way til early dinner. It&#39;s a little hard to find, but once you find it, try it, you will keep coming back for more. Great bagels in cbd.

text: My recommendation is &#34;Pearl Harbour.&#34;<br>Spam, cheese, scrambled eggs and some greens. This is one completed delicious plate in one buns. <br>Wish I had when it&#39;s still warm.

text: Probably the best bagels I ever had!<br>You can choose between different bagel dough and complete bagels or create your own.<br>Very nice staff who will help you out if it&#39;s your first time there.<br>I can recommend the Bacon Egg Avocado Bagel super delicious and tasty!

text: If you&#39;re looking for a bagel in Singapore, this is probably your best bet. NY still knows how to do it best, but these bagels have a respectable density to them. <br><br>I went by on a Friday afternoon, and they were nearly out of everything - best to go in the morning if you want full choice of bagel types. <br><br>I loved that they had scallion schmear. It lacked the tang I was craving, but still decent. <br><br>The staff was super friendly and very nice.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/gXEx0JPuXGAwZ6vFvRGahQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/two-men-bagel-house-singapore?reviewid=WLqMQI4k8qQG6Lm5FfFEcA&select=gXEx0JPuXGAwZ6vFvRGahQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Two Men Bagel House - Singapore, Singapore. Spam me with Bagels.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Spam me with Bagels.'}]
text: First up: They&#39;ve MOVED across the street to Icon Village so don&#39;t go knocking on those closed doors on Enggor Street.<br><br>Icon Village&#39;s hopeless with its food offerings, saved for 2 men&#39;s and we instantly picked out the Spam Bagel (spam duh) which had luncheon, rockets, scallion, sriracha aioli, sunny side &amp; avos, clasped between 2 hand-rolled toasted bagels.<br><br>Everything was freshly made to order so it took some<br>15mins for our orders to arrive despite a pretty lean crowd (on a deserted Sunday afternoon). I suppose if you&#39;re running tight on the clock over a typical lunch hr frenzy, this isn&#39;t exactly fast grub. <br><br>The combination was spot on. I&#39;m no fan of rockets/arugula but the creamy sriracha aioli masked the earthy greens and I was secretly glad to be chomping down on those greens. The sunny side, albeit thoroughly cooked, was a perfect complement to the diced avocados. For a weekend mid-day indulgence, this spam offering certainly came with some saving grace.<br><br>If life was a circle, please at least let it be a bagel.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/f4Eg-BVh_iwVHW7wo5R97g/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/two-men-bagel-house-singapore?reviewid=MViDkiE91ZKxnOONBaVdtw&select=f4Eg-BVh_iwVHW7wo5R97g', 'altText': 'Photo of Two Men Bagel House - Singapore, Singapore. Salted Two Men&#39;s Bagglewiches: salted beef brisket, melted cheese, mustard, gherkins.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': "Salted Two Men's Bagglewiches: salted beef brisket, melted cheese, mustard, gherkins."}]
text: Do not come here with half-empty stomach because the portion is huge and filling! Came during lunch hour and the place is almost full, maybe due to people are still afraid to try bagels. Well, don&#39;t be! <br><br>I ordered the Salted Two Men&#39;s Specialty Bagelwiches which consists of so much salted juicy flavorful brisket layered with melted cheese, gharkins, and mustard. Simple but divine! Can&#39;t stop mentioning about how juicy, melt-in-the-mouth tenderness of the brisket. <br><br>The portion is huge, suitable for 1 very hungry person or shared with another person.

Based on other Yelpers rave reviews, I must have ordered the wrong thing.<br><br>T.A.B. on multigrain bagel ($10.90) - 2 stars<br>Too little cheese and too much tomato, while the multigrain bagel was oddly tasteless... It just didn&#39;t even taste like bread - it didn&#39;t have the right yeast-y flavor I suppose.<br><br>We ordered 3 cinnamon raisin bagels and 20 minutes later they told us they&#39;d ran out... Broke my heart. A tub of cream cheese to go is rather pricey - $8 for plain, $12 for the flavored ones. I suppose I should come back to try something else - maybe a cinnamon raisin bagel with the walnut raisin cream cheese... And I wish they had whole wheat bagels!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/9RsVRkmJ9OXz7d1l7GqcGA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/two-men-bagel-house-singapore?reviewid=ynVYWY-xTJyzsjT5LbHJhQ&select=9RsVRkmJ9OXz7d1l7GqcGA', 'altText': 'Photo of Two Men Bagel House - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: Came here with incredibly high expectations but it turn out alright.<br><br>Ordered cinnamon and raisin bagel with cream cheese.<br>The bagels that i wanted, all 3 choices were sold out so I do wonder if that was a defining decision of my review.lol!<br><br>I felt that the cream cheese could do with more oomphf, and I loveeee cream cheese so much so it was a bummer.<br><br>It was crowded and we had to be seated next to the speaker blaring music. <br><br>I&#39;ll visit next time to try my bagel of choice and one of those roast beef sandwiches!!

text: I&#39;ve finally tried this place and although it&#39;s not a NY bagel, this is the closest damn thing! I loved it. I should say I ordered breakfast from this place (avocado, egg, cheese, bacon) and the only downside was that I didn&#39;t get two!<br>The bagel sandwich was glorious as if I&#39;d just gotten it from a bodega down the street. I didn&#39;t quite understand the weird white sauce (was it mayo? Was it cream?) but honestly who the hell cares? It was delicious and I&#39;d happily stuff one in my pie hole again.

As someone who moved here from New York, I was accustomed to having a nice, crisp, chewy bagel at least 3 times a week. Hence upon moving to Singapore, I scour the island every time my inevitable cravings hit. <br><br>Two Men Bagel is an obvious choice for bagel lovers and you can see from the queue that it&#39;s made up of a lot of homesick westerners. <br><br>The bagels are no where near as massive as in New York and it doesn&#39;t have that sheen to it, but then again, they don&#39;t have the water. The sandwiches are inventive, bordering on too ambitious. Because the bagels themselves aren&#39;t that large, the filling often falls out, leaving your hands a mess. <br><br>Like all foreign foods swept far from their homeland, it&#39;s more expensive (especially the drinks, my God it&#39;s robbery) and not as good, but it&#39;s all we have. <br><br>+1 star for the great 90&#39;s and 00&#39;s rap and hip hop playlist, interrupted only by great 00&#39;s emo music.

text: This is probably the best breakfast place I&#39;ve ever been to. The wait on a Saturday morning is 100% worth it. I&#39;d recommend getting there as soon as they open if you do want to avoid the wait. The staff and the quality of their food is a 10/10 for sure.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/kJ-dZ6s-1inE0PRcfqWsFA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/two-men-bagel-house-singapore?reviewid=vSWb4eNrbmomZTBRM3tylA&select=kJ-dZ6s-1inE0PRcfqWsFA', 'altText': 'Photo of Two Men Bagel House - Singapore, Singapore. My favourite- sesame seed bagel with plain cream cheese :)', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'My favourite- sesame seed bagel with plain cream cheese :)'}]
text: One thing I love about Singapore is that there are enough western options available if I ever get tired of Asian cuisines. Sure, sometimes it might cost an arm and a leg to get a taste of home, but c&#39;est la vie, right?<br><br>It&#39;s about damn time bagels have come to the red dot, and Two Men Bagel House is filling that void for me. You can find these guys opposite Cold Storage in the Icon Village extension.<br><br>I&#39;m somewhat of a bagel purist, so I stuck with my favourite sesame bagel with plain cream cheese. (I did love how they added black sesame seeds to theirs, though!) My colleague had a cinnamon raisin bagel with walnut raisin cream cheese, which she loved. I mean, where else in SG can you get walnut raisin cream cheese?!<br><br>They also have heavier meals if you&#39;re looking past cream cheese, so check &#39;em out. I also loved how they were blasting a live recording of John Mayer while we were there. And the chalkboard is titled &#34;Menu of Sorts&#34;. These guys just speak to me and I must say they&#39;re as good as it gets in SG!

text: I was very impressed with the bagels from Two Men Bagel House!<br><br>As a long-time bagel lover it&#39;s great to see a business take these delicious doughy circles seriously. Apparently there are very few places to get a good bagel in Singapore.<br><br>These guys are the real deal. The owners told me they travelled to all the bagel hot spots around the world to work out exactly how to make the perfect bagel. I think they&#39;ve nailed it.<br><br>I had the fruit and cinnamon bagel with walnut and raisin creamed cheese. I had never tried walnut and raisin cream cheese before and it was a revelation, especially on the spicy fruit bagel.<br><br>They don&#39;t just offer the bagels, they have more full breakfast options (eggs etc) that accompany bagels too.<br><br>My only gripe is that they didn&#39;t have any tea - a breakfast drink staple.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/NbjcniuCkntxwqoueQJRHA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/two-men-bagel-house-singapore?reviewid=T4KsOmGT9gU9MVkD4pUJ-A&select=NbjcniuCkntxwqoueQJRHA', 'altText': 'Photo of Two Men Bagel House - Singapore, Singapore. Chix between a bagel', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Chix between a bagel'}]
text: As a fan of all things pastry, I was really delighted that I somehow managed to convince my colleagues to have bagels for lunch! It was one of the establishments that kept appearing under most recommended whenever I was around the area, so i really had to try it.<br><br>The place itself reminded me of a small cafe, seatings were limited and the menu was mostly written in chalk on the boards above.<br><br>Pricing aside (hint, its abit expensive for bagels, but then again, everything around this area is priced on the higher end), the bagels were really fresh and delicious! I ordered myself a &#39;chix&#39; bagel which was basically mayo chicken with an assortment of herbs and spices inside. What took me back was not the filling, but the bagel itself! They went out of &#39;rye&#39; bagels and i decided to go for the caramelized onion flavour (i think thats what its called), not knowing what to expect. The explosion of moist flavor from the bagels was really something i was not expecting, since what i ordered was actually quite dry.<br><br>That being said, I&#39;ve decided to make it my personal mission to at least try half of the bagels on menu, the flavour combinations all sounds very interesting and delicious!<br><br>If you&#39;re looking for a quick quality breakfast, lunch or snack and dont mind paying abit extra for yummy FRESHLY made bagels, do give this place a try!!!!

Cowking bagel', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Cowking bagel'}]
text: They have bagels of course but also all-day breakfast bagelwiches as well as pizza bagel.<br><br>I picked a seeded bagel and chose Cowking (pastrami, parsley &amp; onion, sour cream, jalapeños, Montreal bacon, gherkins (not for me!), melted cheese and sunny side egg. $13.90.<br><br>Bagel is nice and chewy.<br><br>Add a home-made iced tea for $2 - not great.<br><br>Will come again!

text: Very good and healthy fast food, however located within a mall, it tends to be a bit chilly. It is popular and was packed when I went there.<br>The bread makes you full, I would not call this a brunch but a proper bagel lunch.

This place makes me so freaking happy. Every time I&#39;m even remotely near Tanjong Pagar (so maybe all of Singapore) I think to myself, ohemgee I could get a bagel.<br><br>&#39;The Lox&#39; comes with pickled beets that are freakishly pink and delicious. Other innovative sandwiches are also great. <br><br>Tbh these bagel sandwiches get a little messy and filling, but it&#39;s Singapore and if you&#39;re looking for bagels, it&#39;s really only here or Sacha and Son&#39;s in my book. (But plz let me know if you find anything else!!!!!)<br><br>Yours truly,<br>A New York Bagel Freak

text: I was really impressed by this place. <br><br>When I woke up craving a bagel in Singapore, I knew I shouldn&#39;t set my expectations too high (I&#39;m from New York), but they really proved me wrong. The food was delicious, and the staff were wonderful. It was a bit difficult to find, but it&#39;s well worth the search - highly recommend!

My timing was pretty bad - lunchtime, very crowded. Nevertheless I made it to the counter and ordered a Rodeo.<br><br>I love roast beef and it sounded great. I ordered a rye bagel and set down at one of the large tables that are meant for sharing. <br><br>The bagel arrived shortly thereafter. What surprised me was the brown colour of the roast beef but I tasted it anyway. It did taste different from what I am used to, and was a bit too thick and fatty for my personal taste, but the greens and the relish and the sauce.. very nice. The bagel itself was close to fluffy, but still some density for a good bite and taste without having to worry about an immediate shutdown of any bowel movements which is often the case with heavy bagel dough.<br><br>Later on I was curious whether roast beef in S&#39;pore is different from what I am used to and went on their Facebook page: there was a photo that showed the Rodeo with pinkish roast beef. So, I don&#39;t know what piece of meat I had today but it surely (unfortunately I forgot to take a photo..) wasn&#39;t the standard.<br><br>I did love the friendly, smiley staff. Having had my share of snobbish, ignorant staff at other places this week, this was really nice.<br><br>So, I&#39;ll be back!

text: As a New Yorker who is unashamedly picky about bagels and sandwiches, two men bagel house is one of my favorite places to go to. <br>As a pregnant lady who&#39;s been craving bread, two men bagel house is the only place I want to go. <br><br>Consistent quality for all bagels, you can&#39;t go wrong with any of the options - though I&#39;ve only tried their regular/savory bagels, not the sweet ones. <br><br>Top two faves: <br>- the ABLT (highly recommend adding some scallion cream cheese) <br>- the Lox. So good.

Piglet: Montreal bacon served with deep fried potato patties,lemon garlic aioli,runny eggs and greens', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Piglet: Montreal bacon served with deep fried potato patties,lemon garlic aioli,runny eggs and greens'}]
text: This place was very good and that coming from a New Yorker who is a bagle snob. Staff was very nice

This may be the first time I&#39;m doing a review without having even gone to the shop in question, Two Man Bagels. Let me explain. <br><br>I organized a potluck brunch on Sunday and my American friend brought a giant brown bag to lunch. I was all &#34;hrmph who brings store bought food to a potluck?&#34; as I cooked my organic sausages from Ryan&#39;s when he said, &#34;I brought bagels&#34;. That made me almost drop my sausages right there.<br><br>Bagels?!! In Singapore? &#34;<br><br>&#34;Please tell me it&#39;s not those expensive things masquerading as bagels from &#39;New York&#39; that are sold in Cold Storage?&#34;<br><br>&#34;Nope it&#39;s from Two Man. It&#39;s right by my house, I chat with them all the time and they make awesome, as-good-as-it-gets-in-Singapore bagels...oh and try the walnut cinnamon raisin something magic spread in that tub and thank me later.&#34;<br><br>At that point I was pretty stoked to find the bag contained TWENTY bagels in a gazillion flavors. I couldn&#39;t find a sesame bagel (cos I&#39;m boring like that) but I found a brown raisin one, popped it in the toaster and generously spread the magic stuff on. <br><br>Oh. Ma. Gawsh. <br><br>Oh. My.<br><br>I ate that bagel in about a minute. And then I ate a half more.<br><br>It was crisp on the outside and had a good chew. Granted it isn&#39;t New York or Bodo&#39;s great, but hey we&#39;re in Singapore. Plus I&#39;m told the prices are faaaairly reasonable, unlike the child I traded in at Sacha &amp; Sons for a lox bagel. So yes, the next time I intend to blow my carb budget, I&#39;m taking this bum down to icon village. Wherever that is.
A no funky business self-service bagel<br>stop serving excellent combinations from basic spreads to heartier multi-topping sorts (think BLT on steroids) at prices that are highly reasonable

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=TUAiW8Lcdla5Ii53kV6RFw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8THfMDpO-mZIcSkzhJM8fQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8THfMDpO-mZIcSkzhJM8fQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8THfMDpO-mZIcSkzhJM8fQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8THfMDpO-mZIcSkzhJM8fQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8THfMDpO-mZIcSkzhJM8fQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8THfMDpO-mZIcSkzhJM8fQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Eric C.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Eric C.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=TUAiW8Lcdla5Ii53kV6RFw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 534, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 20, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Best bagels in Singapore. <br><br>Not quite what we&#39;re used to in NYC, but still hits the spot. And they only seem to be getting better with time. <br><br>I&#39;m here once every couple weeks, and consistently leave happy. Staff is nice, and bagels/sammiches affordable and good. I&#39;d say breakfast items are better than lunch, but I&#39;m also just a big fan of breakfast. <br><br>FOOD (have tried everything on the menu O_O): <br>* my order: sesame bagel toasted, with jalapeno cream cheese, tomatoes, and cucumbers<br>* would also recommend Spam or Chorizo breakfast sandwich<br><br>SERVICE: <br>* very friendly (they&#39;ll remember your order) <br>* usually pretty fast<br><br>PRICE: <br>* $ (less than $20 per pax)<br><br>OVERALL: <br>* good for breakfast/brunch<br>* delivery available through deliveroo (carries pretty well)

I&#39;m a crazy bagel fan. I&#39;d have one (or two) a day every time i&#39;m in NYC (it&#39;s my post yoga breakfast staple). I even signed up for bagel baking classes just so that i can make my own (i still haven&#39;t though) because nothing in Singapore satisfies my craving. Well Sacha &amp; Sons does a decent one but there is only 1 option (sesame, with garlic herb schmear). I&#39;ve been meaning to try Two Men Bagel for the longest time, upon word that freshly baked hand-rolled doughs are done here. <br><br>To determine the quality of the bagel, i had to order them on their own. Bagels are priced from $2.60 onwards. I went with the Cinnamon Raisin Bagel with Walnut and Raisin Cream Cheese ($4.50) because sweet is always logical with a latte.<br><br>Well well. Knock knock. The crust was more like a shell, with a slightly blistered crust all around. It was too hard (mind you i&#39;m comparing them to the NYC ones). Plus the dough was a little thin, thus it lacked that nice doughy chew. Flavor wise, it was also kind of strange, with an alkaline aftertaste, possibly due to the almost pretzel like shell. Perhaps i should have stuck with the regular cream cheese because the walnut raisin one was kind of grainy instead of rich creamy and the amount was so little! URGH. #spoiltbynyc Next time, i may just go with the Plain Cream Cheese and Berries Jelly but honestly they need to have more cheese on these.<br><br>Well Jr really liked the Chix ($9.90) on his onion bagel. The tender house-roasted diced chicken thigh were generously smothered in lemon garlic aioli and peppered with the sourish pickled relish and fresh greens. We both agreed that the filling was delicious but it overshadowed the bagel. It could have been any other bread. In fact, it would have been better if it were a different carb that didn&#39;t jab our gums with the hard shell. I had a few bites of the onion bagel on its own and it was rather flavorless, alkaline, and hard. BAH.<br><br>I really wanted to love Two Men Bagel, but i can&#39;t. Can i like it? Maybe. But it kinda ranks the same as the packaged NYC Bagel Factory bagels, which may not be as fresh but at least their crust is better. Go for their bagel-wiches to avoid disappointment. At least it&#39;ll fill you up and the filling will distract you from the bagels. Or get the sesame bagels from Sacha &amp; Sons and slather it with your own cream cheese mix.
Went to eat there with a group of friends and they had ran out of bagels...<br>Annoying, especially having travelled there specifically from seeing good reviews.

Wow. This place is truly exceptional. They get everything spot on. The bagels are fresh, chewy, and tasty beyond belief. The piglet, which includes a hash brown, crispy bacon, garlic aioli sauce, lettuce, and maybe tomato(?), was scrumptious. Definitely one of the best bagel sandwiches I&#39;ve ever had. On top of that, they serve these bad boys all day long.<br><br>Prices are reasonable ($8.50 for the piglet) if not a touch pricey given the size of the servings. Taste makes up for that though. I also went out on a limb and splurged on the $4.50 lemonade. It was worth it. I even got a free refill; probably wouldn&#39;t happen if I hadn&#39;t been one of only 3 or 4 customers on a lazy Sunday, but kudos for the responsive service given the circumstances.<br><br>The vibe is relaxed and you can see the young staff rolling the dough and tossing those suckers in the oven. Absolutely, 100% worth another (or multiple) visits.

text: A small little place nestled inside a mall in Tanjong Pagar, offers a verity of bags. Usually very packed around noon - lunch time, good to go there a little earlier, excellent lox bagel and walnut cream cheese bagel as well.

text: The bagels here are LEGIT. Having lived in New York and Philly for more than ten years, I&#39;m a huge bagel snob and was suffering from huge bagel withdrawal after moving to Singapore. It wasn&#39;t until I discovered TMBH that I was cured. Sure, you can find bagels at Fair Price and Jason&#39;s, but if you want high quality bagels that actually taste fresh and authentic, you have to come here. It&#39;s located in ICON with AC and free seating. Their bagels are chewy on the inside and crispy on the outside. They also have an amazing, creative selection of savory bagel sandwiches. The staff is also very friendly and tries to remember the names of the regulars. Great food + great service + great atmosphere = scarcity in SG.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=IbMr3yiw2RSr0GeF8z0vCQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/E8f8XUEVLipBA3ls0tUSLw/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/E8f8XUEVLipBA3ls0tUSLw/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/E8f8XUEVLipBA3ls0tUSLw/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/E8f8XUEVLipBA3ls0tUSLw/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/E8f8XUEVLipBA3ls0tUSLw/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/E8f8XUEVLipBA3ls0tUSLw/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'John B.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'altText': 'John B.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=IbMr3yiw2RSr0GeF8z0vCQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 1, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 3, 'eliteYear': None}
text: This small hole in the wall place is to die for! Packed when we went in, the staff is bustling with energy. My wife and I got different bagels and both agreed they were by far the best bagel sandwiches we&#39;ve ever had. Our only regret is that we didn&#39;t have room for seconds! Will be back.

This place is great. The guys in the kitchen were adorable and working hard to create orders from the line forming behind me. I ordered the &#34;Gypsy&#34; on rye bagel which came with egg, bacon, black forest ham, and hash browns. Don&#39;t bother to order any sides because it&#39;s like a Denny&#39;s grand slam breakfast shoved between two slides (but tastier). And it&#39;s inside a clean, air-con, accessible mall right next to my hotel (Carlton City hotel). Would have given 5 stars if the $5 coffee were bigger than 8oz. but I loved the food, people, and vibe.

First off I&#39;ll have to say I&#39;m a bit jaded because I live upstairs so it gives me a reason to like this place. That being said. I totally love this place.  The bagels are great and fresh.  I love the sandwich selection. And then they have seasonal ones during the holiday like pumpkin cream cheese around halloween.  They have great breakfast sandwhiches too.  <br><br>The people are ALWAYS super nice. They say hi when I walk by.  Always ready to strike up a conversation. It has a nice little cafe feel.  Its a nice spot to just hang out and work on your laptop and have some coffee.  Totally recommended.

If you want good food, and a cute view (according to my colleague), this is the place you want to be for breakfast, lunch and maybe even dinner? <br><br>My first counter with Two Men Bagel House was during a Yelp event that my friend brought me to (also the event where I downloaded the app and joined the community) where there were coffee and bagels! I had quite a good impression of the menu that they brought over during the event and definitely fell in love with the Jalapeño cream cheese - it is to. die. for. (IMHO*) <br><br>The bagels that were brought to the event were way beyond the normal plain bagel, and my friend and I were lucky enough to be the last to share a sundried tomato bagel - I highly recommend this because the bagel itself is so flavorful! It was a more DIY / pick-your-own-fillings at the event, which I liked because friend and I decided that we should share the bagel AND have two different flavours in one bagel as we didn&#39;t want to take one each - too much bagel for breakfast! <br><br>My office recently moved to somewhere near Icon where TMBH is located, in fact, we&#39;re practically across-the-road neighbors now! And, I had to had down to try at least one other bagel, right? Thus began the quest to find lunch buddies who wanted bagels too - which wasn&#39;t too hard because all I had to do was shout &#39;bagels for lunch?&#39; and I got a few brave volunteers that took the journey to TMBH with me. <br><br>There was a crowd! It was around lunch time and there were many other brave knights who had braved the CBD heat to Icon and were waiting be around for their orders. Even though TMBH has seats, not many were filled up because office people, we just like to have lunch in office (me especially, because what&#39;s a cafe in the office for if we don&#39;t use it!) <br><br>I got myself a Piglet to bring back and I swear, best piglet ever. It&#39;s something I highly recommend everyone to try if they&#39;re looking for a breakfast /brunch / lunch bagel!<br><br>* in my humble opinion

text: Best bagels this hemisphere. Living in Australia where there is a severe lack of quality bagels, these were delicious. They offer classic schmeres plus bagelwiches with a bit of Singaporean flare. Will be going back again on our stop over. Not sure where the negativity is coming from
Bagel heaven. Need to try them plain for the real test but so far so good based on the 2 sandwiches I&#39;ve tried. Shame there are no poppy seeds allowed here though.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=fxjtQzPIb7AeZeQT3gI0fw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'julie p.', 'displayLocation': 'Pompano Beach, FL', 'altText': 'julie p.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=fxjtQzPIb7AeZeQT3gI0fw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': 3, 'reviewCount': 88, 'eliteYear': None}
text: YUCK!!!  Traveled across the city for this and I can promise you these are NOT NY style bagels!  They are dry, not chewy, and this is the first time I&#39;ve ever had an everything bagel with ZERO flavor.  The eggs were so wet and the cheese was so greasy it was just a sloppy mess on top of a dry, tasteless roll.  People in Singapore must never have tasted real bagels because these sure aren&#39;t them.  Yuck!

We had:<br>Smoked tomato soup<br>Tomato Avocado Basil bagelwich (in an onion bagel)<br>Rye Bagel with Jalapeño cream cheese <br>aaand an Olive rosemary bagel.<br><br>if you&#39;re feeling overwhelmed by the different types of bagels, you should be!!! it&#39;s got really flavor-fullllll food. Oddly hard to get these days, no idea why.<br><br>Really wish I worked nearby so it could be my go to place for lunch.<br><br>-1 star because I really wished it was in a café type place instead of a bistro in a mall. It deserves a better place!! :)

Plain bagel with Nutella and pistachio shmear. Yum!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Plain bagel with Nutella and pistachio shmear. Yum!'}]
text: Currently I&#39;m sitting here in icon indulging in this bagel as my little fingers type away. I read a review from a fellow yelper and felt the need to try this place... It doesn&#39;t hurt that this place is two minutes away from where I live. Back to the bagel! It&#39;s a little greasy but I love it! The Nutella, the added crunch of the pistachios and the bagel itself are superb! The people working here are super nice too! Give this place a go if you&#39;re yearning for a good ole fashioned bagel!
I wish they had a larger sitting area but otherwise delicious bagels. Plan on lines and long wait time but its worth it.

Yep... Official... This place just changed my life with only one bagel!! Do yourself a favor and try something!<br><br>this place has got style, flavor fusion and makes me so happen when i get one of these.  while the calorie count is not great, it is totally worth it!<br><br>i cant wait to get back and try more of their crazy flavors!

text: Outstanding service &amp; the Bagel Sandwich&#39;s are delish (cold turkey &amp; Hawaiian sandwich bagels)

Er. Muh. Gawd.  That shiz was good.  <br>I was looking at new apartments (long story) in the area and needed to pop over to Cold Storage to get Ranch Dressing and other annoying American crap, and spotted this little unassuming bagel place blasting rock music.  I was going to keep going when a guy was like HEY! Hello! How are ya?  I was intrigued, and everyone knows you shouldn&#39;t go into the grocery store hangry, so.... off to bagel land I went. <br>I asked him what the most popular bagel situation was and he told me two, one was the Rodeo.  I was a little skeptical being from Texas, anything in Singapore called the Rodeo could not like up to that name, right?  But it sounded mildly interesting so I went with it.  The service first of all is super friendly, but they only take cash, or net.  No CC.  My bagel goodness gcame out in a jiffy, and it was REALLY good.  I chose the sea salt bagel (they should sell them to go) and it came with some kind of mustard relish and roast beef I think.  Whatever the mixture, it was good.  I could barely finish it, because it is a meal, but VERY tasty.  My only worry is that if I move in the neighborhood this will up my carb intake, but it&#39;ll be worth it!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=YQ6MAHSW4jTAzGRUvio1yA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Boris P.', 'displayLocation': 'Manhattan, NY', 'altText': 'Boris P.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=YQ6MAHSW4jTAzGRUvio1yA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': 7, 'reviewCount': 47, 'eliteYear': None}
text: I don&#39;t think I can add much to all the reviews here.<br><br>If you&#39;ve never had a bagel, this is probably a rather overpriced experience, but if you cherish the memory of a deliciously crisp and chewy bagel with cream cheese, lox or pastrami, then this is one of the only good places that serves up a taste of New York.<br><br>I think the pastrami here isn&#39;t quite as good as the only other place I&#39;ve found with good bagels here (Sacha &amp; Sons), but it&#39;s still pretty decent. The bagels themselves are, of course, amazing.<br><br>I like their non-pretentious attitude here - they allow you to bring whatever drinks you want to accompany your bagel (in fact, they helpfully suggest that the Cold Storage opposite has chilled wine for sale). I&#39;ve never seen that level of hospitality elsewhere. Kudos to them!

text: Went to try this Bagel shop in Icon village.  Awesome bagel sandwich for breakfast.  Highly recommend..

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=n0irZkZMvXNrEWn8Ny20uw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/MXKqCMpIgyiykasVzBpjFA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/MXKqCMpIgyiykasVzBpjFA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/MXKqCMpIgyiykasVzBpjFA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/MXKqCMpIgyiykasVzBpjFA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/MXKqCMpIgyiykasVzBpjFA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/MXKqCMpIgyiykasVzBpjFA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Donnie C.', 'displayLocation': 'New York, NY', 'altText': 'Donnie C.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=n0irZkZMvXNrEWn8Ny20uw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': 25, 'reviewCount': 25, 'eliteYear': None}
text: So visiting my brother here in Singapore and we wanted some bagels for breakfast. Now we&#39;re from NYC so we know how a bagel should taste. For some reason this bagel was flat it was missing some of that cushion. Now I&#39;m sure it&#39;s really hard to get bagels here in Singapore. But 101 before in baking dough is, dough needs to rise. This gives it that consistency of that doughy taste. Unfortunately there was no rise. They have great combinations of putting a sandwich together but their main focus should be making that bagel taste great. Try it out and you can see what I mean.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=0QbkP7RVevYTy2LPeDRMPw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Bev G.', 'displayLocation': 'San Diego, CA', 'altText': 'Bev G.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=0QbkP7RVevYTy2LPeDRMPw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 15, 'photoCount': 19, 'reviewCount': 153, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Fresh bagels made right in front of you, very delicious! Any of the items looked good so I&#39;m sure you can choose any and it&#39;d be great!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=03FwU4BcyHJnft4uVlx9NQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'A G.', 'displayLocation': 'New York, NY', 'altText': 'A G.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=03FwU4BcyHJnft4uVlx9NQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 1, 'photoCount': 10, 'reviewCount': 66, 'eliteYear': None}
text: While I&#39;m very impressed to find a top tier bagel in Singapore, it&#39;s hard to give this place 5 stars. Perfectly tasty and well prepared, but relatively small bagel for the price. It&#39;s probably the best bagel in Singapore, so don&#39;t misunderstand the lack of a 5th star, but it&#39;s hard to be blown away by something this simple. <br><br>The guys manning the shop are friendly and hard working. They take cash and Nets, but no credit cards which I find annoying in this day and age.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=kF5aJQFOTiY-0YiuxgsyLg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/L7MpYou5cepLTiNlJvXXeA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/L7MpYou5cepLTiNlJvXXeA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/L7MpYou5cepLTiNlJvXXeA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/L7MpYou5cepLTiNlJvXXeA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/L7MpYou5cepLTiNlJvXXeA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/L7MpYou5cepLTiNlJvXXeA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Nikki C M.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Nikki C M.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=kF5aJQFOTiY-0YiuxgsyLg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 1086, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 1, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Best bagel I&#39;ve had in a long time. Love the atmosphere too! Definitely recommend it to anyone in the area looking for a quick and yummy bite to eat.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=Xdo_0B5_Dqpwzc9Gj4dKRA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/m38DBZBaw8ITwd3Z03C3Iw/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/m38DBZBaw8ITwd3Z03C3Iw/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/m38DBZBaw8ITwd3Z03C3Iw/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/m38DBZBaw8ITwd3Z03C3Iw/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/m38DBZBaw8ITwd3Z03C3Iw/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/m38DBZBaw8ITwd3Z03C3Iw/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Kyle P.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Kyle P.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=Xdo_0B5_Dqpwzc9Gj4dKRA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 74, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 3, 'eliteYear': None}
text: They make their own bagels,  and the bagels alone are amazing.  Some creative sandwich ideas,  or just have it with cream cheese or butter if you want to keep it simple.  The gorilla press orange juice and coffee is also delicious.  Very friendly and welcoming staff.  This is the bagel shop Singapore needs.
Disapponted. Wanted to try for the first time. But was not opened when we reach at 645pm. And Yelp say it closes at 8pm.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=lN2EfhmL2sd1g8mOA_Z6_Q', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/FbOurWx8xtqqgsoesHhHvg/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/FbOurWx8xtqqgsoesHhHvg/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/FbOurWx8xtqqgsoesHhHvg/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/FbOurWx8xtqqgsoesHhHvg/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/FbOurWx8xtqqgsoesHhHvg/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/FbOurWx8xtqqgsoesHhHvg/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Ali G.', 'displayLocation': 'Los Angeles, CA', 'altText': 'Ali G.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=lN2EfhmL2sd1g8mOA_Z6_Q', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 3, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 10, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Great bagels- hot fresh and boiled like a good new york bagel should be! The guys who work there are really nice too can&#39;t beat a bagel coffee and genuine exchange all before 10am.

This is the only dedicated bagel place I know of in Singapore and they serve up delicious bagels and bagel sandwiches. Definitely try their breakfast sandwich bagels and the Lox. Every week seems to bring some new speciality sandwiches which keeps the menu fresh. I would give them 5 stars but there isn&#39;t a huge variety of cream cheese schmears or types of bagels. But that being said the got they basics down right!

text: Rather plain. like the vibe and kindness of the owner but taste doesn&#39;t live up to the reputation it has

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=FL0P3s618m3G-Q867sOYkA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Jen W.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Jen W.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=FL0P3s618m3G-Q867sOYkA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 1, 'eliteYear': None}
text: I have lived in New York and there&#39;s nothing like an authentic bagel -- slightly crisp on the outside and chewy on the inside. Unfortunately, Singapore bagels have never been up to scratch until now.  TMBH bagels are pretty close to the real thing!  I had the classic salmon and cream cheese.  The filling was substantial and the salmon perfect (not too salty).  i will be back.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=Lq_Mwj5zhxgCbs43vz9tyg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Christine L.', 'displayLocation': 'Houston, TX', 'altText': 'Christine L.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=Lq_Mwj5zhxgCbs43vz9tyg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 92, 'photoCount': 1, 'reviewCount': 38, 'eliteYear': None}
text: So delicious, fast service, great coffee. We tried plain and onion bagels, with various combinations of cream cheese, peanut butter &amp; jam, and Nutella. The bagels are toasted perfectly -- maybe with a bit of butter though I&#39;m not certain -- to have that nice chewy dough. We will be back!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=Dh1lPePatbrjqV2Lcit-3w', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Elsa T.', 'displayLocation': 'College Park, MD', 'altText': 'Elsa T.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=Dh1lPePatbrjqV2Lcit-3w', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 1, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Initially I found this bagel place from Yelp. At that time I was not too sure if Yelp in Singapore works as good as the one back in the states. But glad I read through all the reviews before I went into the actual store. Told my colleagues about this place and got her hook up with this AMAZING bagel house. She ended up going to this bagel house almost everyday. Meanwhile, I was busy with my works and didn&#39;t start to visit this place until two weeks ago. It turns out to be the best bagel place I ever been to!!! HANDS DOWN!!! <br>They HANDMAKE all of their bagels (which you rarely find it even in the states) Personally, I grew up eating a lot of bagels during my high school years. I always had some cravings when I came back to Asia. Luckily, I discovered this place and all the bagels here are on point. Also, all the staffs are very SWEET and shoutout to Borne for making amazing coffees all the time. <br>Food: a variety of bagels you can choose from. They have some great menus and definitely going to suit your taste buds. My favorite one is LOX bagel and they deliver good quality foods consistently! <br><br>People &amp; service: I always value customer services more than anything else. I promise  you, you won&#39;t regret talking to any of those staffs there!!! I pay a full respect to the business model they have for the bagel house.<br><br>Keep up with the good work man!!! <br>Will definitely come back visiting when I come to Singapore :)

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=HLd_bvine7sRJt2K7RHTPQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Jay M.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Jay M.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=HLd_bvine7sRJt2K7RHTPQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': 2, 'reviewCount': 9, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Freshly made bagels, high quality ingredients,  solid portions and great and friendly staff and service. Closest thing I&#39;ve found in Singapore to the bagel places back home (U.S.). I come here every week -- awesome.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=bF6PqsugCWjBZ-RVIJzrmQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Neil M.', 'displayLocation': 'Irvine, CA', 'altText': 'Neil M.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=bF6PqsugCWjBZ-RVIJzrmQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': 1, 'reviewCount': 11, 'eliteYear': None}
text: What stands out more than bagels, which are as authentic as can be, is the friendly owner and wonderful customer service. Something you don&#39;t get to see in Singapore.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=_QcTzDdpdGYTlsAsQkOp2Q', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Archit S.', 'displayLocation': 'New York, NY', 'altText': 'Archit S.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=_QcTzDdpdGYTlsAsQkOp2Q', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 1, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 6, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Great spot to grab a bagel sandwich on the weekend. The TAB is great, and you can add to their sandwiches - the guys were more than happy to cook up some egg whites for me and add it to my sandwich! Super friendly crew manning the restaurant as well. If you&#39;re craving a bagel, this is definitely the spot to go to in Singapore.

text: Best croissants in Singapore?! Even better than France??!! Hmm...this I gotta try.  I ended up at the Tong Bahru connected to Tangs on Orchard, thought it would be a great way to kick start my day of shopping hee hee hee :) <br><br>Despite it being a weekday, the re was a sense of hustle and bustle in the cafe.  You can see people rushing to grab their morning coffee and breakfast, while others are catching up with friends over a cup of coffee, and those that are simply waiting for the malls to open (aka me).<br><br>After much deliberation, I decided to stick to my usual cafe misto and a chocolate almond croissant....and I must say, they were pretty darn good.  I&#39;m not sure about better than France, but I was pretty satisfied with what I had.  The misto wasn&#39;t bad either.<br><br>ps. Not sure whats with all the blue lattes lately saw it on display at the bakery....been seeing them all over the place, from Toronto to Singapore.

One of the most consistent bakeries on the island. Their croissants are amongst the best value you will find. And according to my wife who is the coffee connoisseur in the family their coffee is top notch too especially for a chain establishment. A solid place for your bakery fix!
