Waffle with Sweet potato ice cream and Hana matcha', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Waffle with Sweet potato ice cream and Hana matcha'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/xgyWXGin63IMGIXPFBDNcQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/hvala-chijmes-singapore?reviewid=9A232zLubrTXNc6ntfAbdg&select=xgyWXGin63IMGIXPFBDNcQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Hvala CHIJMES - Singapore, Singapore. Yuki Matcha latte, Sobacha hot brew, Hojicha ice cream and a sample new menu taste like yuzu sorbet kinda.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Yuki Matcha latte, Sobacha hot brew, Hojicha ice cream and a sample new menu taste like yuzu sorbet kinda.'}]
text: Missing Matcha and found this cafe with chill concept.<br><br>Tried few stuffs:<br>1) Hana matcha - real dense and pretty good if you are real matcha lover. <br>2) Yuki Matcha latte - blend real well both matcha and milk.<br>3) Sobacha hot brew - well roasted buckwheat tea<br>4) Goma ice cream - it&#39;s real tasty and sweetness is just nice.<br>5) Hojicha ice cream - well balance with roasted teas and seeetness<br>6) Waffles with sweet potato ice cream - Waffle texture is just nice, not too crispy and not too soft. Probably the Japanese flour affect the texture of the waffle if compared with American waffle. It&#39;s interesting taste when I had it with sweet potato. Its creamy, not so sweet yet satisfying.<br><br>Overall, worth the long queue for Saturday tea break.

The amazing decor', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'The amazing decor'}]
text: The Enchanted cafe is situated in Little India. It&#39;s such a cute decor setting cafe - perfect to their name! I had made a Sunday brunch reservation through their FB page &amp; so getting a seat was not a problem. The cafe is small but the decor &amp; vibe will totally make you feel like In the sets of Harry Potter. The server was very sweet &amp; friendly! This was my first visit &amp; I wanted to try their famous Elixir drink- it was just perfect summer drink, very relaxing &amp; the effects of dry ice gave it a real magical potion feel!! We loved the Creamy Carbonara &amp; Choco-nana-tella toast. The food is presented very well &amp; everything tasted so good!! The prices seemed fair &amp; reasonable. The restaurant is going to relaunch after a week with new menu &amp; look! Although I am sad that their Elixir drink won&#39;t be included.. I am excited to return to see the new look &amp; try their new menu! This is definitely one of my fav cafes so far.. Can&#39;t wait to return.

Truffle fries', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Truffle fries'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/FVWnpwdff3NNfisrsTu7BA/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/enchanted-cafe-singapore?reviewid=aAAgh1OOH-BHU9w9v66E0g&select=FVWnpwdff3NNfisrsTu7BA', 'altText': 'Photo of Enchanted Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. The enchanted wall.', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'The enchanted wall.'}]
text: It&#39;s amazing that this cafe was around for a year and I have not been here! Probably it was over-shadowed by Old Hen next door? ;)<br><br>Beautiful dried flowers surround the cafe and it looked as if you&#39;ve indeed stepped into an enchanted forest. Not to worry, there&#39;s not too much green that it might be scary for those with sensitive noses, like me. The wooden chairs/tables (though not all consistent in type) complemented the plants/dried flowers very well. My favourite, was the wall of oddities right next to the main door - you wouldn&#39;t even know that they were selling wrapped novels from The Novel Encounter (see pictures).<br><br>Anyway, we were partly enticed by the promotion that the cafe is having now, that&#39;s why we headed there - Order a burger and get a specialty coffee for $1(Promotion valid til 13 April!)<br><br>Verdict:<br>* Ngoh Hiang Burger (with extra side of scrambled eggs as recommended by the lady boss) - The patty was juicy but I felt it was a tad small (I love patties, so the bigger the better!). The cold potato salad was heavenly; not sure what spices or herbs they used but I love the herb-y taste. The buns themselves were not too big but were nicely crisp on the outside. Overall, quite a creative dish.<br><br>* Truffle fries - This didn&#39;t make it to my Top 5 list but the truffle smell did last longer and tasted better then average. A good snack to order should you decide to sit for a while longer and chat.<br><br>* Mocha - If you&#39;re a Mocha fan, you&#39;ve got to try this. The balance of coffee, milk and chocolate is perfect! After sipping many a Mocha in Norway and Iceland, I was pleasantly surprised to find that the first cup of Mocha I tasted in Singapore seems to be on par with what I had there.<br><br>* Latte - Another perfect cup.<br><br>Also, the theme of flowers/trees/magic lives on in the washroom. Look in the mirror and you might find a very thought-provoking quote - kinda reminds me of Snow White.<br><br>p.s I like my coffee not so milky or bitter so if you have similar taste as me, you might like my recommendations.

text: A cute little cafe tucked around Little India..you will easily miss this place if you are not attentive..the interior decor is simply amazing and you will feel you are in a Harry Potter set..the name of the drinks are also very interesting - definitely try the Elixirs potion! We tried the creamy carbonara with mushroom and it was delicious. The choco nana tella toast with the caramelized banana was also pretty good..

text: Reasonable pricing and pretty decent portions. Nice new addition amongst the coffee shops and hawker Centre. Bold venture in my opinion. <br>They bring in a small range of tiong Bahru bakery&#39;s bread and have their own cakes. Their coffee menu is also pretty standard with reasonable price and size, great for the office crowd nearby who wants an upgrade from the local kopi. <br>Had the ratatouille pasta, a vegetarian pasta with squash, cherry tomatoes  and a veggie stock base   The pasta was surprisingly quite good! <br>Liked their raspberry cheesecake too <br><br>The coffee is also decently made with a decent size <br><br>I see myself coming back to try the rest of the menu!

text: The long awaited indie coffee chain serves great coffee even coffee snobs love albeit at a rather steep price. Try the Spanish latte ($7.80 for short, hot) which is sweetened with condensed milk for something special, or go for the classic Cafe Latte ($7 for short, hot).<br><br>Despite the cafe being rather crowded even on a weekday afternoon, the waiting time for the coffee was a short five minutes. Service was good. While some benches and tables are available outside the cafe, seating inside is limited.<br><br>Overall, a good coffee to try if you&#39;re at the nearby Haji lane but a bit pricey and inconvenient to get as it&#39;s not near the MRT

text: Dining is limit to 2 hours. While I understand the rationale behind it, I was still a bit disappointed when we were asked to leave after 2 hours even when the space was not full. <br><br>The all-day breakfast menu was pretty average and standard like other brunch cafes. I did enjoy their pastas (especially the Umami), but overall prices are pretty steep. They are on Burpple Beyond and Entertainer, so you can enjoy 1-for-1 deals. <br><br>I would revisit only for the coffees as I really enjoyed those. Their signature coffees are really interesting, and I really enjoyed the Okinawa coffee.

text: The food was absolutely delicious - quite damn pricey though - but I was very happy with my keto salad! <br>However,,, the waitress got my order wrong at first and brought me a quinoa salad, and when I told another staff that it was the wrong order, she HAD to come over and tell me that she did repeat &#34;quinoa&#34; when I was just like, well I&#39;m not sure what you heard but I ordered keto salad. <br>So staffs were not quite friendly.... that was the disappointing part of this cafe, since the food and coffee are great

text: This place is not bad, but the price is expensive! I suggest using entertainer app to get 1 for 1 deal. Once you have the deal, the place is great.<br><br>We ordered The Academics Breakfast and Egg Royale which came out great. My girlfriend loves the poached egg and salmon and for mySelf the grilled butteer beard was so crispy. It&#39;s worth checking out if you have the 1:1 deal!!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/35zqMyBx35rOd5ErTf6juA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-coffee-academics-singapore?reviewid=Y1AzSv2fj5npezZLix-t0g&select=35zqMyBx35rOd5ErTf6juA', 'altText': 'Photo of The Coffee Academics - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: Hubby and I were excited to try out this restaurant. We came out disappointed though. The service was slow, extremely slow.  When we were finally able to wave down a waiter after being told &#34;hold on a minute&#34; by a slightly irritated waitress five minutes earlier, the waiter didn&#39;t want to take our request to cook my poached eggs well done because (according to him) poached eggs must be runny and that&#39;s the only form they are cooked as. Glad the chef complied, thank you.  The butter was too hard for me to spread on the toast and there wasn&#39;t salt/pepper on the table. Would be good to have this served on the tables along with the silverware.  Hubby&#39;s manuka latte coffee was quite nice. My chai latte was too sweet but that was my fault as I forgot to say no sugar. <br><br>The menu is limited for food options, but does offer a customized breakfast ONLY for weekdays. This was a bummer as we love to customize our meals being the professional breakfast eaters that we&#39;ve become in Singapore. <br><br>Conclusion is we probably won&#39;t come back.

text: I came here on a Sunday afternoon in hopes of making progress on a book. Little did I know that the place would be completely packed like sardines in a can.. <br><br>I ended up trying the special which was the Iced Apple Macchiato. Unique menu item but nothing special in my opinion. <br><br>Still searching for a decent place in the Orchard area that isn&#39;t so crowded all the time.. Recommendations welcome

text: Wow, the Okinawa latte blew me away. Smooth, aromatic with a hint of brown sugar from Okinawa and the right balance. <br><br>The famed cafe from Hong Kong is finally here and I am very surprised  few people raved about it (well within our Yelp community). Browsing through the menu, I see an extensive list of food and beverages, and of course the specialty coffee they&#39;re famous for. The Coffee Academics can easily give cafes like Wild Honey, The Connoisseur Concerto (TCC) and others a run for their money with it&#39;s delicious food and of course their very beautiful instagram worthy interior. While it creates a healthy competition among these cafes, what great news for us consumer for we have more choice for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Or perhaps our upcoming YUBE. <br><br>I am definitely coming back to try the food to give a more wholesome review of this place so stay tuned!

Crab and Avocado Salad', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Crab and Avocado Salad'}]
text: Recently there is a newly opened cafe called The Coffee Academics, taking over the space formerly occupied by Arossa Wine &amp; Grill. The Coffee Academics, origins from Hong Kong, is well known for its coffee. The cafe is quite big and zen in decoration, with japanese style square table with tatami mats around. <br><br>There is 7 stations:<br>1. Espresso Bar - Featuring our Spirit Triplette by Kees van der Westen<br>2. Tea Academics Bar - Offering a curated tea menu using Steampunk or traditional brewing methods<br>3. Cupping Corner - Where they will host coffee classes and events<br>4. Culinary Counter - Chef&#39;s Table experience with a view into our open kitchen<br>5. Custom Blend Concierge - Where customers can book appointments to explore their personal flavour profile and create a bespoke custom blend.<br>6. Hand Brew Bar - Tatami area where customers can sit and enjoy hand-brewed single origin coffees<br>7. Roasting Corner - Where they will be roasting their Custom Blended coffees on-site<br><br>Crab and Avocado Salad ($22+)<br>Crab meat, sliced avocado mixed with seasonal green salad, topped with herring roe and signature TCA dressing.<br>The salad is nicely plated, but take care when eating the crab meat as there is small pieces of shell in the meat, which some got stuck between my teeth. I could not taste the dressing in the dish. The crab meat tastes quite fishy to me. But lucky there is buttery avocado to balance the taste.<br><br>Okinawa ($7.50+)<br>one of the 3 special espresso based coffees available.<br>Cafe latte with Okinawa dark brown sugar.<br>Milky creamy drink with a hint of brown sugar at the top. It is not that exciting as expected.<br><br>Service is not bad. Prices included 10% service charge. Not crowded during weekday. Total bill was $32.45.

Fish tacos', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Fish tacos'}]
text: Popped by here on a Saturday noon for brunch, and the nicer interior was all reserved so we had to sit outside (2 people), so it would be prudent to call ahead at peak times. <br><br>I had the fish tacos and a hot chocolate with soy milk. My companion had the big breakfast and a cappuccino. My fish tacos came with salad and curly fries, which I really liked, and wiped out. The tacos themselves were okay, with fish and a mango salsa, and a very crunchy taco. I do wish they had a cream element within to balance the flavors, but all in all, I wasn&#39;t disappointed. My hot choc wasn&#39;t overly sweet, and still frothy despite the soy. Yum. <br><br>While the prices are on the high side because of its location, it is still cheaper than it&#39;s upstairs neighbor, and offers non-brekkie options for you! <br><br>I didn&#39;t get any coffee because I don&#39;t drink coffee - but I&#39;ve heard it&#39;s good!

text: I&#39;ve heard a lot of hype over The Coffee Academics, and I&#39;ve been wanting to visit for months. Sadly, it fell short of my expectations in a couple of ways (so I suppose, it really is just hype after all). I&#39;ll weigh up the pros and cons of my experience. (NB: I&#39;m allergic to coffee, so I won&#39;t be commenting on their coffee.)<br><br>Pros: <br>1. They answer the telephone quite promptly if you call them up to enquire. <br>2. The interiors are quite interesting. There&#39;s a lot going on, visually: scrolls with Chinese calligraphy, antlers on the wall, Japanese tatami-like seats, etc. <br>3. The Academics Breakfast ($25++) is quite delicious, and is pretty well executed. I would recommend this. <br><br>Cons:<br>1. Note: They don&#39;t take reservations on Public Holidays and weekends, if it&#39;s busy, you most likely would have to queue up. <br>2. It can get quite packed, so it isn&#39;t really a conducive place to spend hours at.  <br>3. The food is quite overpriced in my honest opinion. I would expect the breakfast to have bigger portions. The food is essentially a little on the steep side, so I wouldn&#39;t come back as frequently as I would like to.<br>4. The Pancake Tower ($20++) wasn&#39;t as amazing as expected. The pancakes were way too sticky, and weren&#39;t fluffy enough. The maple syrup tasted ordinary and was a tad bit too sweet. Actually, to put it succinctly, McDonald&#39;s is a much better option for breakfast if you&#39;ve craving hotcakes, which the Pancake Tower more closely resembles (than actual pancakes).<br>5. The service is meh. The service upstairs (Wild Honey) in comparison, is much better.

text: Cool and chic décor, although tables are too close to each other for privacy or comfort. The food is meh - the chili crab is flavourful, but the pasta is way too mushy. Service staff are absent most of the time, and forgetful. Many requests had to be repeated, and even so, some were never satisfied. Too pricey for the quality of food and service; I wouldn&#39;t go if not for the Entertainer 1-for-1 offer. Many Caucasian expats and tai-tai customers due to location and décor.

text: Idk man... if I pay $22 for avocado toast (which I did here)... I&#39;m expecting something phenomenal, which The Coffee Academics didn&#39;t deliver :/ <br><br>I met up with an old friend here for some coffee under her recommendation. I will say, I did enjoy the ambience and decor. It felt modern and hipster and a bit upscale, so I had huge expectations for their food. I ordered a long black and avocado toast, and my friend ordered a capp, which totaled $40... yeah what? I don&#39;t mind paying $$ for food and drinks, but if you&#39;re gonna charge me $40 for two coffees and a piece of toast, it better be of excellence. <br><br>My long black wasn&#39;t bad. I mean... it&#39;s espresso with water, so you can&#39;t really mess that up. The coffee wasn&#39;t burnt or too acidic so I&#39;ll give it that. Now, the avocado toast. AYE. The dish came with two small slices of bread, half an avocado, some pesto (?), one poached egg, and a few greens on the side. Y&#39;all, I love my avocado toast to be flavorful. Throw some lemon, chili flakes, olive oil, and whatever else in the avocado mix and Nicole is a happy girl. But this toast... this toast was as basic. Sure, it looked pretty, but it wasn&#39;t packed with flavor like I hoped. If it was $12, I wouldn&#39;t be complaining, but for $22 you can&#39;t serve me basic, almost flavorless avocado toast. <br><br>Overall, I&#39;d say this joint is overpriced and over hyped. The coffee isn&#39;t bad, but I can&#39;t say the same about the food!

Fluffiest pancake ever! Worth every penny, instant perk me up!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Fluffiest pancake ever! Worth every penny, instant perk me up!'}]
text: The fluffiest pancake ever, and not exaggerated- British friend who grew up eating pancakes said this was one of the best she ever had. Fresh berries toppled on warm fluffy pancakes. Berry sorbet had a slight tangy twist and was aromatic enough to be whiffed from far away. Cream was light and easy to smear. <br>Want something that can instantly lift your mood up? <br>Well here is your answer. <br>Suggested to pair with a hot latte, and you&#39;ll find yourself having a very good mood after this meal.<br><br>Store location is in orchard, accessible. <br>Only negative is long queue awaits if you arrive at popular brunch timings, so do come earlier to beat the long queues.

text: Their coffee is excellent, but I found the food pricey and underwhelming.  If you want a well-crafted latte near Orchard Road, this is definitely a good choice.  Its a huge space one level up  with lots of different seating areas.<br><br>Vegetarians beware - the menu doesn&#39;t always list all of the ingredients so best to confirm with the wait staff before ordering. But as other have said, I&#39;d skip the food and just stick with coffee.

text: My second visit here and they are still out of the JWF ice drip coffee. *sad face. <br><br>Definitely love the ambience and vibe of the place but it gets pretty noisy and crowded during tea times on weekdays and weekends. <br><br>The coffee is slightly pricier then the average coffee but alas they are housed in the atas Scotts Square along Orchard Road hence the rent must be pretty stepped. To me, the Panama Blend lived up to its expectations and boast a soothing fruity flavour. I chose the Chemex cup as my choice of brewing method and it brought out the flavours perfectly. On my second visit, I tried the Manuka (Cafe Latté with organic Manuka NZ honey) and it was a-ok to me. Just the normal Cafe Latté with Manuka drizzled on top. <br><br>Would visit again on weekdays and perhaps to try their mains which looked oh-so-good.

Panama coffee made on Chemex', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Panama coffee made on Chemex'}]
text: The Hong Kong cafe and roastery the Coffee Academics have set up shop in Scott&#39;s Square and they are a nice addition to the Singapore coffee scene. They are still doing a soft opening so I am a bit more generous in my rating then I would perhaps otherwise have been.<br><br>They are on the second floor of the mall and they have a nice and open space that they have filled with a mix of counters (one for tea, one for coffee etc) where there is seating as well. There are also high tables as well as some smaller tables on their own. They serve a variety of different coffees where one can select the beans as well as the method (clever, Aeropress, steampunk, Chemex, V60 etc) and in some cases if it is hot or cold. They also offer a range of proper dishes and even a set menu as well as pastries and such. <br><br>We sampled an excellent Kenyan ice drip coffee and a decent Panama made on the Chemex. They did however bring the wrong coffee first (despite verifying the order) and they also made a mistake in the food order (but the food was good but would to some extent expect a bit more at this price level). Small things that were promptly foxed but it was clear that they are not yet fully up and running. They are doing a soft opening but it would of course be nice if they then also (as often is the case in London) they would also do heavy discounts during the period when they they to fine tune things. I am sure they will improve further and since the coffee was already good I am sure I will visit more times.

Duh!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': "Special Espresso-based Coffee Okinawa (Cafe latte with Okinawa dark brown sugar) - it's not even hot. Duh!"}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/QXXgurdexZFKJwyP11Y5Cw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-coffee-academics-singapore?reviewid=tXYKxmNcUawvpsa5a3zTYg&select=QXXgurdexZFKJwyP11Y5Cw', 'altText': 'Photo of The Coffee Academics - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: After hearing my hairdresser rave about the Special Espresso-based Coffee Okinawa (Cafe latte with Okinawa dark brown sugar), I had to have it.<br><br>It was nice but not hot, just very slightly warm, which is a total disappointment.<br><br>The staff&#39;s response to my question about why the coffee wasn&#39;t hot is &#34;Er..oh it is not very hot&#34;. I am not sure if that is a statement or a question. Duh!<br><br>Ambience is nice. <br><br>Two staff walking around but no one clears 2 tables full of dishes and so I could not sit on the more comfortable cushioned chair and had to sit at a taller round table with a non-cushion metal chair. There were only 3 tables occupied (including mine).<br><br>They also serve:<br><br>Other Special Espresso-based Coffees - Manuka and Pepper Agave Latte<br><br>With original creations every month. In January it is Chocolate Chili Mocha (Taipei) and in February it will be Golden Potsto Ginger Flat White (Taipei) etc.<br><br>Brunch - Academics Breakfast, Croque Madame, eggs sur le plat, scrambled eggs with crayfish, eggs Benedict with 36-month aged cinco jotas jamon bellota and acal berry bowl<br><br>Salad and Light Bites - crab &amp; avocado salad, kale &amp; quinoa Waldorf salad, hot Brussels sprouts salad, chicken pot pie, salmon mi cuit, curly fries with dip trio and soup of the day<br><br>Big Bites - crispy fish fillet tacos, beef soft taco, miso cod risotto, Margherita pizza, jamon belotta &amp; arugula pizza and Mac &amp; cheese<br><br>Sweet bites - Academics pancake tower, Academics cinnamon churros, TCA gelato selection<br><br>TCA Signature Affogato Coupe  - TCA blend espresso vanilla gelato, TCA blend espresso, TCA blend gelato, TCA blend espresso, JWF ice drip coffee and your choice of coffee special gelato of the month <br><br>Homemade Baked Goods &amp; Cakes - assorted cakes and tarts as well as pastries.<br><br>Will try their food another day.

text: Pleasantly surprised by our impromptu brunch date. Was actually intending to go to wild honey, but stopped by our of sheer curiosity. <br><br>We had quite a big brunch; the academic&#39;s breakfast, eggs Benedict with cured ham, mushroom soup, &amp; coffee. Lots of coffee. <br><br>The food was flavorful, and I especially enjoyed their baked beans, which were slightly spiced. I don&#39;t usually enjoy beans, but these were too good! The only thing I would change would be the amount of cured meat they gave; it was pretty sparse. It wasn&#39;t exceptionally pricy either. <br><br>The coffee was great! I really loved the Pepper Agave Latte! I know it may sound a bit scary/ foreign because there&#39;s pepper, but the pepper really added another level of flavor to the coffee, and I really appreciated the heat! The other coffee worth trying would be the Okinawa Coffee. I&#39;m not much of a distilled/dripped coffee fan because there&#39;s no sugar, and my boyfriend, being the purist that he is, refused to add any so I didn&#39;t particularly like the drip coffee.<br><br>The knowledge of their waitstaff could also be improved; it really surprised me when my waiter gave me an option on how I&#39;d like my eggs done when I asked for eggs benedict, which is, to the best of my knowledge, typically poached. They also could afford to be more attentive to their customers, but other than that, it was altogether quite a pleasant experience.

I&#39;ll start with the good, the coffee was good, but that&#39;s where it ends. I didn&#39;t mind waiting in line for 15 minutes for a seat, but then waiting 20 to have our order taken, another 25 for the first meal to come and then another 20 after that for the second, only to end up with a completely boring breakfast (the academics breakfast I think it was called, definitely don&#39;t recommend it) made it a frustrating experience, particularly as this was our first meal since arriving in Singapore.<br><br>The couple next to us arrived after us waited a similar time to order, got their drinks and walked out before their food cake - I wish we done the same. They also forgot one of the meals for the mother and son next to us who ended up waiting longer than we did; their only consolation was they good their drinks free. <br><br>Try the coffee, don&#39;t bother with the food, the service was atrocious.

text: A pepper agave latte! Delicious! I don&#39;t normally sweeten my coffee but this was good as the black pepper cut through the sweetness. Definitely hope to come back and sample all of their crazy coffee concoctions! Good, prompt service as well which is important first thing in the morning when you need coffee!

Crab and avocado salad with crab shells', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Crab and avocado salad with crab shells'}]
text: The coffee is good! Lots of variety in their coffee selection. But the food standard needs a lot more improvement. Ordered the crab and avocado salad with crab shells in every mouth. Would certainly hope that they can improve their mains.

It&#39;s unfortunate that Yelp doesn&#39;t allow for any lower rating than a 1 star. I came here with my family thinking we could have a nice coffee break from all the Christmas shopping we were doing. Seeing an empty table for 4, we thought we were in luck. We were sorely mistaken as we were approached by a waiter claiming that a party of 3 was not sufficient for that empty table of 4. As the rest of the cafe was already full, we were told to wait for another 30 minutes and it was a unanimous decision to ditch this place. Overall, maybe if I even had the opportunity to try the food, I&#39;d give this more stars. But unfortunately, I doubt there&#39;ll be any foreseeable opportunity.

text: A very beautiful cafe, artistically decorated with great coffee choices! Highly recommend this place for a laid back afternoon or evening with a friend. There is brunch available too

Awesome creativity. Terrible service. I gave this place another try after last time because the coffee was good, but they fell so short I had to leave. Their service is slow as a snail, half of their customers end up leaving before they even get in the door. Improving the service would be 4 stars. Improve prices would be 5.

text: Beautiful classy restaurant and They take their coffees too seriously which is on point for serious coffee drinkers, some menu items are still not available (ie wine). Staff members are pretty uptight and will make a difference if they smile a little. Good place for a coffee stop around Scotts Rd.
My god. The coffee here is phenomenal (got the Jawa and the coconut flavor is on point). The atmosphere is perfect. 10 / 10 would recommend.

text: Great coffee and salads.<br>Service needs to go a long way in this place.<br>Not even half full and took forever to be helped by a waiter. Then guests sat next to me an they were served way before I did.<br>Asked for salt and pepper.... Forget it.<br>After lunch, let&#39;s have coffee ( what I came here for) had to raise my hand several times so I could order.<br>Ready to pay... Good luck, had to ask several times for the bill.....<br>Still coming back for the good quality of their coffee, just not trying this place if I&#39;m in a hurry ;-)

text: I wouldn&#39;t go... Ordered mochas and they ran out of chocolate (we were the only customers in at 1030am), ordered cappuccino, came out so burnt it was not drinkable. Looked at ground around us, is covered in hair and old lollies and food crumbs that had seemed to be there a very long time. I think there was a reason we were the only ones in there for breakfast.

text: This is my first visit to The Coffee Academy.  We came here around 5pm on Saturday and there was a line of three groups waiting before us.  We got seated within 5 mins.  We ordered a beef soft taco, pancake tower, signature egglet and a Manuka coffee.  The beef soft taco came first, then the coffee came about 10 minutes after.  On the menu, the Manuka honey came on the side, but mine already had the honey drizzled for me. Vehicle the coffee tasted smooth, the Manuka honey was over powering it.  I&#39;d prefer to add the money myself to my taste.  The taco tasted ok.  Beef was well seasoned and not too chewy.  The outer edge of the taco was slightly crispy while the enter was soggy and mushy.  The pancake tower (dessert item on the menu) has three fluffy pancakes.  It was still soft and fluffy when cold.  Three pancakes were too much as a dessert though.  It would make more sense to be a brunch item given the portion size.  The signature egglet, like the Manuka coffee, came with the salted egg sauce pre-drizzled, rather than on the side like the menu&#39;s picture.  The egglet itself was decadent!  Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside.  The mango was ripe and sweet. The first taste of the milk tea gelato was rich and creamy.  But as you continue to eat it, it got way too sweet.  Sweet egglet plus sweet mango plus very sweet gelato equals sugar over load.  I&#39;d be very happy to eat just the egglet with a HK style milk tea or a cappuccino.  Oh and if you ask for water, the waitresses will direct you to get your own.  For a restaurant/cafe that charges service charge, I didn&#39;t expect the need to get my own water.  Overall it was a positive experience.  Next time I&#39;ll be sure to ask for sweetener or sauce on the side.

Pleasantly surprised by this gem of a coffeehouse. <br><br>I visited twice and both times found the place quite crowded, which is a great sign! I expected more of a coffeehouse vibe but it was definitely more of a mix of that and a restaurant - some people are doing work on their laptops and some people are eating some damn good looking food. You even sometimes need to be seated by a hostess as if it is a restaurant, but you order at the counter.<br><br>The attitudes of the staff is beyond friendly and I love it. They love being there and it makes me love to be there too. The coffee is good and they have much variety which keeps it fun.<br><br>Highly recommend if you are in the area and need a lively place to be to yourself, catch up with friends or even have a meeting.

text: It&#39;s quite a hike to get to this gem of a brunch place, but it makes a good stopping point after you&#39;ve explored the wonderful Botanic gardens (just make sure you are exiting at the Bukit Timah exit). Its a popular place and you might have to wait for a table. The menu is eclectic. Its a good mix of brunch items with a good amount of local (SE Asian) fusion food thrown in. I tried the soba salmon bowl with a poached egg and it was excellent. Wife tried the prawn alio olio and it was one of the better pasta dishes we have tried in a while. They also do a mean kombucha and some home made cold brews. Really like their menu so will go back for more!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/6kPRzyetjfOE2qLWjz9O0A/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/atlas-coffeehouse-singapore?reviewid=LpOSOlPaqbsmyogeuIq5Pg&select=6kPRzyetjfOE2qLWjz9O0A', 'altText': 'Photo of Atlas Coffeehouse - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: Let me be perfectly clear about the 3-star​ rating for this awesome coffee place.  I have absolutely no issue with food and drink here which is deliciously fresh, fastidiously prepared, and served up with pride.<br><br>Atlas is a great concept and I wish them all the best!  I really do.  Independent coffee roasters are just coming into their own in Singapore and there need to be more outlets that care about where their coffee comes from and how this affects the final product that they serve their customers.  So businesses like Atlas are critical to the growth of the artistry of Singapore coffee roasters, and consequently the quality of the coffee that Singaporeans get.  <br><br>I visited on a not particularly busy weekday and it still took about 15 minutes for magic to appear.  I reference the Melbournian creation.  The coffee when it did arrive was spot on, balanced, aromatic, full-bodied, and thoroughly enjoyable.  The mouth temperature was a little too close to room temperature for my liking, but overall still a very solid effort.<br><br>Food made it to the table before the coffee did and the coffee order went in first.<br><br>Quite simply, awesome place, hipster-heaven ambiance​, hearty food, solid coffee, service needs a little tweaking.  Atlas is going to do great and be a neighborhood institution, all the parts for sustainable greatness are there.

White Cold Brew', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'White Cold Brew'}]
text: The cafe was walking distance from the MRT station and opened from Tuesday to Sunday 8am to 7pm. While there was no 10% service charge, there was a 7% GST charge in the bill. Pay as you order at the counter.<br><br> Low &amp; Slow Pulled Pork (S$20+)<br>Braised pulled pork, scrambled eggs , streaky bacon , arugula served on sourdough<br>The serving was huge. The pulled pork was topped with curry like sauce, quite tender and savoury but a tab too salty on its own. The bacon was a tab salty too. The scrambled eggs was creamy. The arugula was lightly dressed. The sourdough was soft which I like best.<br><br>White Cold Brew (S$7+)<br>Recommended to have the drink  without ice cubes so that one can taste the chocolatey notes more easily. Although it was non sweeten, it was not bitter in taste.<br><br>Overall the food was not bad. The crowd started to come in at around 9am, so best came early.

text: I passed this newly opened cafe a few times already but it was always super busy during weekends so when I had opportunity to go for brunch on a Friday, I decided to give this place a try. When I entered I was a bit wary as the place oozes a hipster atmosphere which to me often translates into average quality food against a premium price, you pay for the stylish environment, not for the food: WRONG, this is not what Atlas is about! The food is great and the price point is more than acceptable.<br><br>Atmosphere: as mentioned this place has a relaxing hipster vibe, it&#39;s very instagram worthy, I am not a good photographer so I did not capture this in my pictures but google some pictures and you&#39;ll see what I mean. The service is friendly and punctual.<br><br>Food: The menu had many interesting and healthy looking dishes but I decided to go for a brunch-style dish, I had the Creamy Mushrooms on Sourdough  with scrambled eggs and Italian pork sausages. This could potentially go wrong in so many ways: chewy canned mushrooms, overcooked scrambled eggs and dry sausages but it was fantastic! The creamed shimeiji mushrooms are tasty, they provide a nice touch of unami to the dish and the sausages are juicy but the real stars are the sourdough and the scrambled eggs. The sourdough toast was perfect: good crust and one of the better tasting breads I had here in Singapore, the eggs were fluffy and light yet creamy, yum!<br><br>Food part II: since I was hungry and greedy, we ordered next to our main dish a Maple Strawberry Pancake to share between two people. Once I had the Mushrooms &amp; eggs on toast, I kinda regretted I&#39;d ordered more as I was quite full and more than satisfied. More so, when the pancake arrived I feared it would be dry and bland as it looked thick. Wong again!! Whilst we both just really enjoyed our mains, we wolfed down the pancake like we hadn&#39;t eaten in ages! It is really delicious, the combo of fresh strawberries and the moist pancake is just great. The people next to us ordered the Caramelized banana pancakes with ice cream which looked absolutely delicious too (but I don&#39;t eat bananas so not for me).<br><br>Price: I was pleasantly surprised to learn that our total check for two coffees and three mains (two savory dishes and one sweet to share) was similar to what I am used to pay for a typical weekend brunch for two in this neighborhood (around 50$). Prices are nett here, GST and service charge included. Additionally, they offer large jugs of ice water without charge!<br><br>I&#39;m coming again? 100% sure, their counter had cupcakes and cheese cake which looked very tempting and the I can see myself craving their dishes in the future! Since it is a new opening I hope they can keep this standard up.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/JIpnG8P0vhfQQMdYQxZFTA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/atlas-coffeehouse-singapore?reviewid=uCuzfuFNUj6a9EsXzl3iUg&select=JIpnG8P0vhfQQMdYQxZFTA', 'altText': 'Photo of Atlas Coffeehouse - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: Pros: <br>It&#39;s a stone&#39;s throw away from Botanic Gardens MRT station, and there&#39;s a bus stop right in front of Atlas Coffeehouse, making it a convenient cafe to visit for those residing in the West.  <br><br>The truffle fries aren&#39;t too pricey for local cafe standards ($8++), and the portion size is good for sharing among 2-3 persons. The flakes of cheese scattered on top of the fries is delicious! <br><br>I also like how there are window seats and plenty of sunlight comes into the cafe. Their black, matte, industrial-looking stools are also surprisingly, quite comfy. And if you&#39;re a fan of white marble tables, there are plenty of those in this cafe. <br><br>Their service also isn&#39;t too shabby.<br><br>Finally, their peppermint tea tastes superb, so do give it a try! <br><br>Cons: <br>The truffle fries are a little on the greasy side, and I found this to be the case on both my first and second visit to Atlas Coffeehouse. On my second visit, the fries definitely tasted hard and crusty. <br><br>I&#39;m however, still a loyalist to PS. Cafe&#39;s truffle fries, as they are more consistent and fresh, as compared to Atlas Coffeehouse&#39;s. <br><br>The cafe is quite popular and can get quite crowded, even on weekday afternoons.

Brunch place in Bukit Timah. Had the signature mushroom on toast here and it did not disappoint. I got a huge slice of sourdough bread with an overflow of mushroom in white wine cream sauce topped with parmesan cheese. The dish was creamy, rich and delicious. The mushroom texture really goes well with the texture and creaminess of the sauce. While it could easily be too rich / heavy to be enjoyable beyond a few bites, this wasn&#39;t the case. I managed to finish the whole dish despite not being a fan of super creamy stuff. The only letdown is probably the bread which was a bit chewy to begin with and gets worse over time as it becomes too soggy from the creaminess of the mushroom. <br><br>My friend had their other famous dish - the pancake - which was fluffy and as sinfully good. Would recommend checking it out.

Came here on a Saturday morning and the place was packed. Seems to be popular for bikers because we saw groups of them sitting outsides. You order and pay at the counter first before you&#39;re given a table holder with a number. We liked everything we ordered (waffles, avocado and greens and roasted chicken, croissant, flat white.) but the service could be significantly improved. One of the waiters came to tell us our roasted chicken would take 20 minutes and asked us if we would like it with the avocado or later. We said we could just get the avocado first. However, the chicken took so long that we had finished everything and were still just sitting there waiting for the chicken to come out. There were lots of customers waiting outside so the other waitresses came &#34;thrice&#34; to clean our plates and attempted to take our table holder away. Clearly bad communication among the staff.

Man the place is pack at 10:30am on a Friday??!!   Seems like nobody works here?   The noise level can be a little high but fortunately i got a slight ear infection so got bit of muffle ear.   Otherwise a nice utilitarian cafe.   Food again was wonderful even though place waa busy service was still good.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/OLBMajaq6w5iVk9UWGpxsQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/atlas-coffeehouse-singapore?reviewid=v0puykBDR87ViNe7rxqNcQ&select=OLBMajaq6w5iVk9UWGpxsQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Atlas Coffeehouse - Singapore, Singapore. Salmon soba noodles', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Salmon soba noodles'}]
text: I dropped by on a Wednesday afternoon to meet a few acquaintances for a late lunch and loved the chilled out vibes of the place. It can be slightly hard to find but it is otherwise just a short walk from Botanic Gardens MRT.<br><br>We ordered lattes all round and everyone agreed that the coffee was pretty decent. They had a large range of coffee so it was a pity we all had the same thing. Also a point of note, free water. I had the salmon soba noodles which came with glazed salmon and a fried egg. The egg was cooked well and the salmon was in my opinion, well-marinated. <br><br>Did not get to try the waffles which looked really tantalising. Definitely worth a repeat visit.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/R6q2qjmArxhUbpCbTa644w/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/atlas-coffeehouse-singapore?reviewid=GKlxKl_453-o0gvijfUNsA&select=R6q2qjmArxhUbpCbTa644w', 'altText': 'Photo of Atlas Coffeehouse - Singapore, Singapore. Salmon soba noodles and iced coffee.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Salmon soba noodles and iced coffee.'}]
text: I was looking for a place for good coffee near Botanical garden, and found this place on yelp as the top rated place. The place was nicely crowded with young locals, and the staff was friendly and attentive. I very much liked the vibe and decided to have something to eat besides a cup of coffee.  I ordered salmon soba noodle, and everything on the plate was cooked just right; salmon in medium rare, egg over easy, shimeji crispy, and most importantly, soba in just right firmness! I never order soba in US because they&#39;re somehow always overbooked, but this is Singapore, I gave it a try, and I&#39;m so glad I did.

Love the coffee and small local shop vibe! Waffles are great too! Hidden along the bukit timah area, just before you reach the stretch with many schools, sits this adorable cafe! <br><br>Make reservations on chope before you head there for brunch on the weekend, it&#39;s already busy by 9! The wooden tables and minimalist designed serving  plates are awesome! Make your order at the cashier when you&#39;ve decided but otherwise, don&#39;t bother with self-service. The servers don&#39;t get too pleased when you try to help yourself. <br><br>Several notable items I&#39;ve tried:<br>Nitro brew - not too acidic, smooth, good for patrons who enjoy coffee but have gastric problems<br>Berries waffle - love love love this. Great crisp and chew to waffle. Berries compote is a great balance of sour and sweet. Definitely a YES. <br>Banana pancake - it&#39;s more like a sponge cake than pancake. The cornflakes are awesome but why are they soaked in syrup? The dish was too sweet for me. <br>Hash - excuse me this is mashed potato not hash. Hash needs to cast iron pan to get its crust there&#39;s no crust in this hash. Flavors wise it was not bad. The sausage was delicious! <br>Scrambled eggs - just get it! Great moist and delicious. Huge portion! <br>Truffle fries - thin crispy fries with generous serving of Parmesan cheese. No truffle taste though. The cheese was nice <br><br>I&#39;ll be back if I&#39;m in the area but I probably won&#39;t travel the way here to have brunch

A nice place for coffee and eats, that gets super packed.  The space is very modern and cool and...noisy?  With concrete floors and high ceilings, this place does get loud, but it&#39;s still a very pleasant space with lots of light, large tables and friendly staff.  I had a very solid latte here, and food also looked quite good and also with some healthier options, although I didn&#39;t try any this time.   But as it&#39;s close to our church, it&#39;s good to know that there is more than just MCD around!

text: The place was buzzing with activity when we went on a Sunday morning. Thankfully the wait for a table and service wasn&#39;t long. It looked like they were running a full roster of staff for the weekend, and kudos for keeping the service and table turnover running efficiently smooth. Food was a refreshingly different from your standard brunch fare of egg bennies. If you&#39;re looking for a healthy alternative, try the Superbowls. The tasting flight of 3 cold brews was interesting; rather liked the Iced Carbon Black coffee, which I found out, was their house blend cold brew with tonic soda. Will be back to try their other brews.

text: Get my vote for best coffee in Bukit Timah area. Great blends and excellent pour overs. Gets busy on the weekend. Try the waffles they are great, and go with the Nautica blend for your white coffees.
Great coffees, tasty dishes, lovely ambience, friendly service.  Keep up the good work, Atlas!

text: Waffles arrived brown and over cooked. Mixed berry compote is too sweet. Overpriced cafe and not worth it.

text: Stumbled upon this cafe by accident and had no idea that it recently opened this month! This is a bit of an odd cafe - called &#34;The Autobus&#34; but has lots of bicycle gear? But the food is good, so who am I to complain? You can find this restaurant right when you come into Downtown Gallery from Maxwell &amp; Shenton Way. The nearest MRT is Tanjong Pagar.<br><br>For food, your first stop is to a station to fill out your order on paper. You basically get a salad, and you get to choose the ingredients. You get a certain amount (depending on size you choose, priced accordingly) of protein, grain, and sides. Vegetarians can forego the &#34;protein&#34; (all meat) and choose extra sides instead, which I appreciated. You also get your choice of dressing, and to add on a drink for a reduced cost than if you ordered it separately (note: I believe only certain drinks are available at this reduced price). Then you stand in the queue with your order, pay, and then take your order form over to the kitchen to be fulfilled.<br><br>I really enjoyed my meal; the bowl was huge, everything in it was delicious! I chose extra sides, and the pesto dressing with quinoa, which was all excellent. Seating/space is ample, which is always nice.<br><br>They still have some kinks to work out. My drink and my food arrived up at the same time and the drinks guy was really ringing the bell trying to get me to pick it up... dude, my hands are full with the food that I am also picking up now! Also, it was supposed to be an iced drink to takeaway, and neither of those things happened (it was a hot drink to stay). They also asked me my name for the drink, but, as I said, they were furiously ringing the bell instead of calling my name (which is fine, I got the message). Still, it really was all delicious, and arrived fast so I can;&#39;t complain too much! Standing in the queue itself took the longest, which is kind of silly since everyone &#34;orders&#34; on the sheets ahead of time. But the restaurant is just opening, so I guess I should let them work out the kinks before complaining.<br><br>Here are the hours I found for them online (hopefully accurate):<br><br>Mon to Fri: 7am - 10pm<br>Sat &amp; Sun: 7am - 3pm

Yummy Char Kway Teow', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Yummy Char Kway Teow'}]
text: Been to Coffee Lounge eons ago for their famous porridge. Goodwood Park Hotel is known for their durian cakes and pastries. My brother made a reservation for the whole family right after I purchased my air ticket to visit Singapore this summer for a 3 course lunch including a dessert buffet at Coffee Lounge. <br><br>Needless to say, I am looking forward to the few buffets my brother has lined up. I told my sis we girls need to lose some weight before we started stuffing ourselves with food and more food and dessert too. My sister said we needed to lose weight before and after those buffets ;( <br><br>When we arrived at the hotel this noon, my brother went to check in with the host at the Coffee Lounge. The host then led us to our table. The restaurant was already buzzing with many patrons. I guess the large crowd was due to the public holiday today.<br><br>FOOD 5/5<br>We could opt for either a 3 or 4 course lunch including a dessert buffet. We decided a 3 course was good enough. One could choose a starter and a rice/noodle dish from the New Degustation Menu - Design Your Own Local Menu (see pic). I chose a Singapore Rojak for starter and a Char Kway Teow. Both items I chose were delicious. I tried the chicken rice my sister ordered and our mom&#39;s Xing Zhou Bee Hoon (Singapore style vermicelli), my Char Kway Teow easily edged out the two. So yummy!! :9<br><br>The dessert buffet station comprised of a number of durian pastries like durian mouse cake, durian puffs, durian pancake and also pastries with durian accents. Other non durian dessert includes strawberry cheesecake, bread pudding, green bean soup, mango pudding to name a few. The dessert buffet spread was not huge but adequate. Quality was definitely there. <br><br>AMBIENCE 5/5<br>The restaurant was lively. I like the high ceiling. The restaurant was huge, spacious and has lots of seatings. It is not a restaurant with intimate setting but it will be great for families and friends.<br><br>SERVICE 5/5<br>Our server Auntie Betty (Betty Ho) was so sweet and kind. She took very good care of us and our mom. Since our mom was not very mobile, Auntie Betty would advise to be careful of those steps. When the coffee our mom had was too bitter, Aunty Betty was so nice to offer to make her a flat white. She made our mom felt good in going out and having met Auntie Betty&#39;s friendly and kind gesture. Thank you Auntie Betty! <br><br>So here&#39;s a well deserving 5 stars to Coffee Lounge at Goodwood Park Hotel!! :)

I was taken here for a late Sunday dinner and the porridge ala carte buffet is really quite delish. They differ from your standard porridge outside with the dishes cooked to order. We had the prawn paste chicken (3.5/5), deep fried baby squid, chyepoh egg, and pomfret. Everything here was of a good standard and quality, and if you were after the homecooked feeling, you might actually find it here.<br><br>The waitstaff are personable, doling out recommendations freely, which I really liked. On their recommendation, do go for the kuehs at the dessert counter, as they are from a reputable bakery chain in Singapore - nom! Would return.

text: When it comes to comfort food, nothing beats a steaming bowl of plain porridge. <br><br>A signature Goodwood Park restaurant, the Coffee Lounge has a porridge a la carte buffet ($38) with unlimited servings of over 20 items including appetisers and hot dishes.<br><br>Dishes are cooked to order, so they arrive piping hot at your table. All the staples like braised pork belly, mui choy (preserved mustard) with pork, salted egg and braised peanuts can be found on the menu. <br><br>And if you still have space after such a fine feast, you can always stuff yourself silly with the desserts!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/nfq7guBZ9hwr6l8UaO4n1Q/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/coffee-lounge-singapore?reviewid=rJ7bOPaOKq4aXdi7kIDhCQ&select=nfq7guBZ9hwr6l8UaO4n1Q', 'altText': 'Photo of Coffee Lounge - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/vsb7_93tjusWhb2OF47rBA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/coffee-lounge-singapore?reviewid=rJ7bOPaOKq4aXdi7kIDhCQ&select=vsb7_93tjusWhb2OF47rBA', 'altText': 'Photo of Coffee Lounge - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: I have come here a few times - over the past few years and I just love this place! Their buffets are well-known and their selection is pretty comprehensive. Their High Tea Buffets are very famous - though I&#39;ve only come for their Dinner Buffets. I would be giving this place 5 stars, it&#39;s just that I don&#39;t do buffets anymore - so, only for that reason, this place gets 4 stars. But if you&#39;re a Buffet kinda person, then this is your place!<br><br>What I Love: The selection. They have Italian food - pasta and all, that a chef would whip up for you instantly, the salad bar, the seafood bar, the sushi bar, local Singaporean food, and my fave - is the desserts counter. I could just go there and have the desserts all night. Their chocolate liqueur shots are amazing. Apart  from that, there&#39;s bread pudding, ice cream, custard, and other pies and chocolate cakes.<br><br>What I Don&#39;t Love: For dinner, it can get crowded. Watch out for the lines at the seafood bar. A dinner buffet would set you back $29.50.

text: Upscale coffee place with friendly service. Also a great second office outside the office.<br>Very good for lunch breaks too, they have a good variety of sandwiches and small meals.

text: Having been to all the coffee shops in this area for the past 2 years, I can unequivocally say these guys do the best coffee.<br><br>It&#39;s consistent, high quality, and the team have friendly charm to put a bounce in your step and send you on your way.<br><br>Oh yeah - they also do a killer vegemite &amp; cheese toastie - so as an Aussie I&#39;m now completely committed to this as my #1 coffee stop!

text: Consistently good and comforting. It&#39;s a tiny counter, Yen seems to be there everyday, usually 2 people on duty. Serious but with a smile. I rate the coffees. Get the loyalty card, 6 chops gets you a free drink. Magic is a double ristretto flat white but the volume of milk seemed to be more like a piccolo. I generally go for flat whites or lattes (depending on how full I am) for that extra bit of length in comfort. Ask for latte art (I ask if there&#39;s no queue) and they&#39;re happy to oblige. It&#39;s $4.90 a drink. Brought my work friend there twice and she enjoyed her mocha then ice latte. She even made a comment about how she might be getting used to drinking coffee without sugar since Cindy kept bringing her there..*facepalm*<br><br>I try.<br><br>Easy in easy out. The setup is no frills, just order your coffee and imbibe. It works for a quick decompress between that dreaded thing known as work.<br><br>No seats though but if they&#39;re not busy I stand and chat or sit outside the building on the grass edge. Sunshine - free!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=4Imxj8nYyM2Vw56l2y1noQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Yasmar V.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Yasmar V.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=4Imxj8nYyM2Vw56l2y1noQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 7, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 55, 'eliteYear': None}
text: I&#39;m updating my review and deducting 2 stars in the process as I feel that standards have dropped quite a bit. Quality control and consistency is lacking - different amounts of milk used for the same drink ordered, depending on the day and the barista making the coffee. The milk is sometimes merely lukewarm and gets cold very quickly. But the nail in the coffin was when the lid of the coffee cup was not closed properly by the barista and my colleague had coffee on his white shirt, pants and shoes when he drank from the cup. No apologies from the barista who swiftly proceeded to take the order from the next customer instead. And this was in the morning before work. Needless to say, that was an awful start to work. For all these reasons, regrettably, I will not be making this place my regular joint anymore but will probably still drop by from time to time to see if standards have improved.

Maybe I&#39;m a little biased, but I really love Pantler. They have very decent pastries at prices that range from reasonable to exorbitant, and the waitstaff are always friendly. It&#39;s a nice spot right in the middle of the CBD yet sitting in there on a weekday afternoon, you&#39;d never feel like you&#39;re in the middle of the city.<br><br>My favorite pastries here are the roll cake, cream puffs, strawberry shortcake and the chocolate cake (possibly called the Yatsura... My brain forgets). Some of their more experimental cakes can fall flat when they try to combine different flavors and textures, others are very decent, and still others sing. I think they do the classics quite well and you&#39;ll need to be a little brave to venture beyond them. Sometimes you&#39;re rewarded, and other times, you&#39;re glad you tried those flavors anyway.<br><br>You can ask for ice-packs if you get the cakes to go which is really nice in the horrendous tropical heat. And you can either dine in-store with a nice cup of coffee or tea, or get take-out and stuff your face at home. No one&#39;s judging.

Almond croissant', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Almond croissant'}]
text: The place was deserted when we were there around 1pm on a Saturday afternoon. I guess it is usually quieter on weekends without the office crowd. They do online delivery though. <br><br>I had a slight cough so I did not share the cakes with the others. Besides cakes, they sell tarts and pastries and even sandwiches for those who need more sustenance. <br><br>The bestsellers or signature cakes are actually the Pantler Roll Cake, Pantler cheesecake and probably the yatsura. As I was having a slight cough, I figured it would be better to avoid chocolate or anything which would be too sweet.<br><br>The pastries and tarts actually looked more appetizing that day. There was a raspberry pastry which looked interesting, likewise for the pear tart. <br><br>I had a cappuccino and a Pantler roll cake. The cappuccino was surprisingly good with no acidic aftertaste or bitterness. My gauge for a good coffee is whether I need to add sugar to it as I usually need sugar to mask the bitterness/sourness of coffee to make it more palatable to me. So I did not need to add sugar to it. <br><br>The Pantler roll cake was not that fantastic. The top was a bit hard and hard to cut through with a fork. It tasted like bread instead. The cream was good and the bottom part of the roll was softer. <br><br>I also had an almond croissant which was divine. Flaky crispy crust which did not fall all over the place with an almond paste inside. There was no overpowering almond taste, just a slight hint of it. A perfect snack or a light breakfast for those who work in the area. <br><br>I also tried the pear tart who was a bit too sweet to me. The crust was light and balanced the pear slices and filling well. <br><br>The yatsura is definitely on my list to try the next time I am in the area.

Other than the chocolate Delice being a little dry got to say pastries are ok.   would not go all out to come by.   Coffee ok better than starbucks for sure.   Staff friendly and cafe with not too many seating.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/tyLABFe_mkSiPoYCVBCmag/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/pantler-singapore?reviewid=dtL9e5-bIZnftlgf0YdbCw&select=tyLABFe_mkSiPoYCVBCmag', 'altText': 'Photo of Pantler - Singapore, Singapore. Banana rum tart ($8), flat white ($6)', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Banana rum tart ($8), flat white ($6)'}]
text: A nice and comforting cafe on a rainy Saturday afternoon :) it was rather crowded but was able to find some quiet seats at the back of the cafe-woukd probably be a nice place to chill on a weekday. <br><br>Was wowed by the pastries in the case and couldn&#39;t make up my mind. Asked and was reccomended the ruby tart, banana rum tart and the meringue. Bought the banana rum tart and for someone who isn&#39;t a fan of banana, cream and crispy pastries (Everything this tart is), I must say that the tart was extremely satisfying. The flat white was above average and had little acidity while the notes were clear and pleasant. Similarly, the chai latte did not disappoint-smooth with a strong cinnamon flavour (somewhat like Costa&#39;s). What makes it different is that rather than using the usual syrup or tea bag, they use chai powder, which is coarse and adds a nice texture to the drink. <br><br>Would definitely come here again especially on a weekday to chill and maybe get some work done :)

Best cakes to go with coffee or tea', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Best cakes to go with coffee or tea'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/qGmne_Rmq2AFTzt9weFvkg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/pantler-singapore?reviewid=jZu0gLV2HDwtY3G9kXJ_dQ&select=qGmne_Rmq2AFTzt9weFvkg', 'altText': 'Photo of Pantler - Singapore, Singapore. Birthday cake this year was also from Pantler!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Birthday cake this year was also from Pantler!'}]
text: BEST cream puffs you can get in Singapore!! The patissier is Japanese, so you can expect the Japanese standards in terms of perfection and pride in their work. <br><br>So far have tried most of the menu, even had a few birthday cakes ordered from Pantler.<br><br>The pastry cream that they use for the cream puff goes so well with the light and slightly crispy shell that has a biscuit base. <br>The smooth creamy, yet not too sweet pastry cream with a tinge of vanilla is also in the Mille-feuille where the Puff pastry is airy and melts in your mouth.<br><br>We ordered a fruits tart once and it costed close to $200 but so well worth it. The pie crust was crumbly and filled with the pastry cream once again(my favorites are anything with this cream!) and topped with all the best harvests from Japan!!! The fruits were sooo sweet and fresh it was well worth the amount paid for.<br><br>So far there is not one cake or pastry from Pantler that has disappointed, and I will strive to try everything on their menu.

text: When I think of bakeries, I think of warmth, and usually this translates to colours as well. I feel that a lot of bakeries are naturally lit, with lots of pastel colours and just very light.<br><br>Pantler is different to me because their walls are dark grey. The interior strikes me as very minimalist, but in a good way. Their desserts are beautifully displayed and naturally draws you to the counter. In addition to the desserts, there are a few pastry items such as bread and croissants.<br><br>As this was the second part to Yelp SG&#39;s monthly brunch* I wasn&#39;t too hungry to try everything, so I depended on trusty Sonya C to choose on our behalf. She didn&#39;t disappoint, choosing a good range from fruity to chocolate-y.<br><br>DAT YATSURA THO...<br><br>I took bites of a few of the desserts, but I can only remember the Yatsura. I want to say it&#39;s like an Opera cake, but with chocolate/hazelnut flavours. It was like Ferroro Rocher in cake form. In short- amazing.<br><br>This seems like such a wonderful after-dinner place to visit; a shame they&#39;re only open until 7 PM! Not sure if it&#39;s because of their CBD location, but considering they&#39;re close to Club Street I&#39;d say it&#39;d make sense to open later.<br><br>--<br>*For those who want in on our monthly brunches, check the Talk threads to find out where we&#39;re going next. All are welcome!

text: 2nd stop for the day on 17th Jan 2015.<br><br>Came here with other yelpers to try out their desserts. Tried ten types and my favorite is still Yatsura. It was like eating Ferrero Rocher as a cake form.<br><br>The shop&#39;s space is small so it might be better if you come in smaller group. Our big group had to split into three tables and can only mingle with the people closer to you. Unfortunately, 1/2 of the size of the store was the display cases. <br><br>The second top list was definitely the ruby grapefruit. The small cuts of grapefruits blended well with the tart. The third one will be Vera. <br><br>It will be better if the cakes are a little colder cause it will bring out more of the chocolate and fruity taste in order to give a better review.<br><br>Will definitely be back for more Yatsura in the upcoming future. :)

text: Best cream puff in singapore ! Love this place - very modern cute place with a great ambiance.

text: Small and cozy. The lighting here isn&#39;t fantastic for pictures, but the chocolate croissant and iced latte were fabulous. It isn&#39;t pricey at all, but you definitely get some quality quiet time and food.

As most of the reviews have already recommended - Yatsura! It is fluffy, chocolatey rich, a crunch to the bite and just the right size.<br><br>This is a little cafe tucked away with lots of goodness. The staffs are very friendly and accommodating. I went with a huge group and they didn&#39;t mind that we occupied a large area. Without our group, I think it is a lovely place to hang out and chat with the long time no see friend. <br><br>They provide a water station for you to clean your palate between their cakes and tarts. Their seatings are quite nicely separated for the ones who comes in group or the one or two person who are looking for a quiet moment.<br><br>In addition to dessert, they also have simple sandwiches and pastries if you haven&#39;t had lunch. I definitely recommend trying out their dessert when you visit though!
Love the yatsura - hazelnut praline cake. It&#39;s light but it hits the spot! :)<br>The cheesecake was good too.
Nice, frosty a/c and cream puff! I was here with a friend in the middle of the day and it was the perfect place to hang out and chat if you&#39;re around the area!

text: I love the pastries here, their sweets are pretty good - try the puff pastry! Their coffee was just so-so. But i did like the peppermint mocha, the oomph!

text: Heard so much about their cakes and wanted to try them.<br><br>They were decent, but nowhere near the best i&#39;ve had. Not worth the money in my opinion.<br><br>Seats were uncomfortable and not what I expected from a premium cafe.
Love it. Good quality desserts. The banana rum pie is yum! Coffee is alright too. Worth to go if you have a sweet tooth and is in the area

Pancake Fried Chicken', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Pancake Fried Chicken'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/yz2E65pMSOE_sCcoJmpTjw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-populus-coffee-and-food-co-singapore?reviewid=vZjIar_AsbBQ0xkVwQvY5Q&select=yz2E65pMSOE_sCcoJmpTjw', 'altText': 'Photo of The Populus Coffee & Food Co - Singapore, Singapore. White Coffee', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'White Coffee'}]
text: Food taste wise was good - typical kind of cafe food. Pancake was savoury and not the usual kind of pancake made w butter batter. Think they used spring onions. Quite a vege taste. Coffee was decent. Atmosphere is great for couple date and friends catch-up.

We ordered delivery for Mother&#39;s Day. Definitely some of the best brunch dishes I&#39;ve had!<br><br>Seafood linguine ($21) - 5 stars<br>Stellar! They braise the linguine in lobster bisque and the result is a rich and flavourful pasta unlike any I&#39;ve had! The scallops and crabmeat were cooked perfectly. Hands-down the favourite dish at our table.<br><br>Buckwheat pancakes ($20) - 3.5 stars<br>Too dry this time - definitely better when we had this at the cafe itself - but still had good flavour. The passionfruit curd and berry compote that came with it had just the right touch of sweetness.<br><br>Populus scramble with lobster bisque and crab meat ($22) - 4 stars<br>My sister wished the croissant could have been packed separately. Decadent scrambled eggs with the lobster bisque and crab meat but eggs only do so much for me. I personally prefer the seafood linguine.<br><br>Butter rum banana French toast ($19) - 4 stars<br>Solid but I&#39;m a dessert alcoholic and thought it could use more rum. Topped with Greek yoghurt.<br><br>Tuscan lamb harissa baked eggs ($19) - 4 stars<br>Had a tiny bit of this. Pretty sweet from the tomatoes. Flavoured well. The ciabatta was a little hard.<br><br>Wagyu beef donburi ($18) - 4 stars<br>A touch too sweet. The toppings (purple cabbage and ginger I believe) were well done as was the Japanese rice. Strong truffle taste. I didn&#39;t try the beef though.

text: I must say this is a solid place for a brunch spot. A combination of great food and great ambience. We all ordered the following dishes: <br>- Chicken Burger <br>- Spring pancake and fried chicken. <br>- Avocado Super food green platter<br><br>I ordered the Chicken burger, which came with a side of Cajun spiced fries. The chicken patty itself was a piece of fried chicken ( same as the Spring pancake and fried Chicken, but still good nonetheless) the fried chicken itself was juicy but a bit on the small side.  <br><br>For the spring pancake itself, is a hard pass though, so if you&#39;re craving fried chicken, the burger is suffice. <br><br>A friend ordered the Avocado Super food green platter which just looked super healthy, it did lack a little on the flavor side.<br><br>Overall, I think I just found my new brunch spot. You do need to reserve in advance as this places filled up quick.

Coconut, lemon &amp; lime smoothie', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Coconut, lemon & lime smoothie'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/WuF_Md7k2L5d-bYWQf8-yw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-populus-coffee-and-food-co-singapore?reviewid=bESf4dg2ysc5n9puA6awhQ&select=WuF_Md7k2L5d-bYWQf8-yw', 'altText': 'Photo of The Populus Coffee & Food Co - Singapore, Singapore. Spring Pancake &amp; Fried Chicken', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Spring Pancake & Fried Chicken'}]
text: The cafe was opened not long ago along this popular stretch filled with lots of other cafes. Located in the middle of a row of shophouses. The place was narrow and long. The place was packed with a long wait list. But lucky for me there was the counter seat which nobody wanted, so I took that.<br><br>Water was served when I was showed to my table.<br><br>Spring Pancake &amp; Fried Chicken ($21)<br>spring onion &amp; corn pancake, crispy succlent fried chicken fillets, hint of cumin, house special ranch dressing<br>This dish required an estimated waiting of 20 minutes, which I waited quite long for it.<br>It looked quite sinfully with lots of sauce on the fried chicken. However I am quite disappointed to find a pool of oil on top of the pancake, after removing the chicken. The fried chicken was not crispy. In fact it was soft and doughy. The pancake was not bad with pieces of corn in it, although would prefer it to be crispy. The dressing tasted creamy rich with hints of lemony and spicy taste.<br><br>Coconut, lemon &amp; lime smoothie ($7)<br>This milky drink was rich and thick with a minty taste.<br><br>Overall the food was not bad. The place was very crowded. With long queue outside, it would be best to make reservation before coming here. Since it was very crowded, the place was quite noisy too. Topped with the background music, it was giving me a headache.

text: Nice coffee served, however it can get slightly noisy when it is packed during the wkends.<br>Gd for a quick brunch or dessert, but slightly pricy.<br>Will try to return on a wkday again.

text: This place is one of the reasons that I don&#39;t mind stopping off in Singapore before heading elsewhere. Okay, while Singapore isn&#39;t necessarily a place where I would spend too much time, these coffee shops are actually pretty cool, particularly since a lot of them serve a pretty decent drop. Okay, since I don&#39;t drink all that much coffee anymore, I can&#39;t comment on the coffee, but I can mention the tea, and the breakfast options. Basically they have some good selections, though it is a little pricey, but that is to be expected in Singapore. It is also a little out of the way, but it is certainly worth checking out.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Khdou-0HdX9zs2qCm76_fg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-populus-coffee-and-food-co-singapore?reviewid=HINPOorVnuimwAk3O2BMsQ&select=Khdou-0HdX9zs2qCm76_fg', 'altText': 'Photo of The Populus Coffee & Food Co - Singapore, Singapore. Teriyaki salmon donburi', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Teriyaki salmon donburi'}]
text: I had the teriyaki salmon donburi and it was surprisingly delicious. I love anything with runny egg on top, and this one was one of the best I&#39;ve seen. The salmon was well-cooked and you get a good amount of fish for the bowl. I loved the cucumbers in it as well, and the rice was just the right texture. <br><br>I wish I&#39;d tried the coffee here, because seeing all the other coffees go by me was really tempting.

Strawberry sundae!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Strawberry sundae!'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/XFW3GhHPY10bod4ebHrpRg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-populus-coffee-and-food-co-singapore?reviewid=C1JTOSnh4O-rD8shZwLMsw&select=XFW3GhHPY10bod4ebHrpRg', 'altText': 'Photo of The Populus Coffee & Food Co - Singapore, Singapore. Chicken grains bowl, beef rendang donburi, and cod with soba. All delicious.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Chicken grains bowl, beef rendang donburi, and cod with soba. All delicious.'}]
text: This place blatantly tries to appeal to the hipster yuppie crowd and successfully does just that. <br><br>Everything is Instagrammable to the hexagonal wall paneling, the Edison bulbs, the water glasses, and of course the food and drinks themselves. <br><br>As expected, there&#39;s about a 30-45 minute queue for brunch when I went mid-day on a Saturday. They have a nice system where you can sign up via an app and they&#39;ll call you automatically when your table is ready. <br><br>The one thing I don&#39;t like is that there&#39;s no table service. This is a place that for the price and the ambiance, you&#39;d think there would be table service. You get seated when you arrive with menus, then you&#39;re given a table number and are told to order at the counter with it when you&#39;re ready. It&#39;s a little confusing. <br><br>The food itself is creative yet familiar and all done really well. My cousin got the roasted chicken grain bowl and that flavor was . His girlfriend got the cod with soba which was delicious and fresh as that dish always is. My limited edition beef rendang donburi was aight, I just discovered I&#39;m not much of a beef rendang person so I can&#39;t fault them for that. <br><br>Overall, if you&#39;re looking for a trendy brunch place in the red dot, Populus is a solid option.

text: I ordered the scrambled eggs on croissant which came with bacon and I asked to not have feta on top. For drinks, I ordered the cold drip iced coffee and an elderflower soda. <br><br>It&#39;s rather a sticker shock to eat in cafes and restaurants in Singapore. Mostly the price of &#34;artisanal&#34; coffee is ridiculous. But I understand that Singapore&#39;s rent is ridiculously unaffordable so guests have to pay a premium to come to bricks and mortar cafes, bars, restaurants. <br><br>My cold drip coffee which was served in a tiny glass with ice was $6.  <br>I was suffering from major jetlag and needed extra caffeine so this obviously made me incredibly sad. <br><br>The food made up for it. My friend ordered a curry chicken and truffle fries to share. I tried a bit of her chicken and it was good. Not too spicy. I can&#39;t stand when curries burn a hole in your mouth. (Insert fake Asian joke here!) it was creamy and hearty but lacking in a depth of lemongrass, galangal, and tamarind. The truffle fries were salty, just enough Parmesan for umami, and addicting! <br><br>My dish was better though. <br><br>The dish came out looking HUGE! I gave some to my friend. The fluffy eggs were cooked beautifully and the croissant was buttery, flaky, and soft! My only complaint would be the bacon but that&#39;s a personal preference (which many people share) of having super crispy bacon. I like my bacon crispy and these were just mediocre. <br><br>Would I come back here? Sure but I&#39;ll try something else.

text: Populous has a nice hipster interior although a very poor table arrangement, as in the tables were so close to each other, we had to get up every time the people at the tables around us moved out. <br><br>We came for brunch and had the spring onion pancake with fried chicken and scrambled egg on potato Rösti with fried mushrooms, baked beans, sausage and salad with a side of truffle fries with Parmesan cheese. As good as this all sounds we were seriously underwhelmed. Lack of seasoning in everything, soggy pancake, overly sweet baked beans, truffle fries tasted like standard industrial fries, no salt, just a minuscule sprinkling of truffle oil and Parmesan (none at the bottom of bowl). <br><br>Pros: friendly service, crispy fried chicken <br><br>But.... definitely not worth the 70$ for a basic, uninspiring brunch.

Black forest sundae, limited edition', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Black forest sundae, limited edition'}]
text: Amazing bugolgi quiona salad, comfortable ambience and good music  we stayed till it closed at 6pm xD<br><br>Need to come back to try all the other items on the menu, saw so many I liked!<br><br>The limited edition Black forest sundae was not bad too. Surpring, since I dislike vanilla. Brownie chunks, popping candy, Chocolate syrup and waffles.
Tried many different brunch places in Singapore, quite a few I would like to have another visit. This is on my favorite list, which I could even go everyday, right after the first try.
