text: Aw, I wanted to be the first one to review this place :(<br><br>Anyway, I had popped by here during the soft launch with some yogi friends when we were told by the folks at the Lokal a 40 minute waiting is required. Umm, we love food but we wouldn&#39;t wait that long for food.<br><br>Over at the Populus, we shared a few dishes and not bad! This place is opened by the same ones behind Department of Caffeine. Needless to say, the coffee is amazing! <br><br>My gf and I shared their specialty, bread pudding, otherwise known as scrambled eggs atop waffles. The scrambled eggs were wonderful--not overcooked and the perfect amount of gooey-ness. The waffles were not as nice...they had seasoned these waffles to make them savory. The seasoning: select herbs + coriander seeds. We hated the coriander seeds--much too strong for our liking. However, I do think that if you&#39;re acquainted to the strong pungent taste (as it&#39;s quite a popular spice in the region), then you&#39;ll most likely enjoy it. <br><br>We&#39;ll definitely be back to try some of the other dishes and for some more coffee. <br><br>Loved the ambiance as well!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/l6IzBQefCIqkcq6F1dzG-Q/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-populus-coffee-and-food-co-singapore?reviewid=6Dg2LhdJ6598yXHSvHc8Xg&select=l6IzBQefCIqkcq6F1dzG-Q', 'altText': 'Photo of The Populus Coffee & Food Co - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/AH_MlexvlDyKmK6t5r74jw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-populus-coffee-and-food-co-singapore?reviewid=6Dg2LhdJ6598yXHSvHc8Xg&select=AH_MlexvlDyKmK6t5r74jw', 'altText': 'Photo of The Populus Coffee & Food Co - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: We visited on a Sunday afternoon. We tried to make reservations the night before but they were full. On arrival, the place was packed. We were told to wait 15-30 minutes but thankfully there was a counter seat which we were happy to have, so no waiting. <br><br>We had the Populus scrambled eggs, pulled pork bowl, piccolo and flat white which came up to about 50 bucks. I really enjoyed the mains as they were plated well, and very tasty. The scrambled eggs came piled on a croissant which was light and moist. I especially enjoyed the pulled pork which consisted of quinoa, barley, generous amounts of pork and a good variety of vegetables though I wished there were more greens.<br><br>The coffee was mediocre. It wasn&#39;t bad but it was more acidic than we prefer so we&#39;d hop over to Nylon for coffee instead.<br><br>The service was inconsistent. On one hand, the staff were friendly. On the other, they didn&#39;t seem to anticipate customers&#39; needs. Case in point, a waiter came by with a set of fork and knife, and fork and spoon. He asked who was having the bowl. When I said we were sharing, he just left the cutlery and left. I would have expected him to return with another set of knife and spoon but he didn&#39;t and I had to request for it when the food was served.<br><br>I&#39;d return for the pulled pork bowl.

Tandoori chicken sandwich.', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Tandoori chicken sandwich.'}]
text: Came here on a Saturday morning for brunch with my Yelpers and I had a a tandoori chicken sandwich and an iced chocolate. <br><br>I did like my iced chocolate a lot, which was made with high quality chocolate and wasn&#39;t overly sweet. My sandwich... Well... They say that size matters, and big is better, but it was so big I couldn&#39;t bite into it. The giant slab of tandoori chicken was sandwiched between two HUGE pieces of bread, and I spent an hour eating the top slice, then the bottom slice, and then the chicken. If not for the great company it would have been quite excruciating eating this one-on-one with a date. Sandwich came with some rocket salad so that was great. I think they ought to relook their choice of bread. Maybe the kopitiam style bread that is easily compressed would do better. <br><br>Their food does take a while to come, but they have a disclaimer about that on their menu. I also had a taste of the spring onion pancakes and they were gummy. I don&#39;t understand why this place is packed. <br><br>I&#39;d come here for a drink and to read, if it wasn&#39;t so crowded. The food is a hit-and-miss.

text: Good coffee and good food. Very rare to find this combination in SG.<br><br>We had the scrambles and pulled pork sandwich. Scrambles comes with a croissant, aesthetic. Pulled pork has too much mayonnaise for my tastes.

text: Great Coffee and Buckwheat pancakes! Love the Interieur and friendly staff! Best Coffee so far in Singapore;0)

Spring pancake + fried chicken', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Spring pancake + fried chicken'}]
text: Was at the place on a weekday afternoon for lunch. Love the interiors and the wide space! <br>The food was good. My friends and I ordered the spring pancake + fried chicken, pork belly sandwich, scrambled eggs and pesto linguine. The best one was the spring pancake!

Nice menu spread, although on the pricey side. The whole place smells of truffle oil, which could be good or bad depending on your taste. Needless to say, truffle fries are a popular order here. <br><br>Free wi-fi takes a while to connect, but it&#39;s pretty speedy once you&#39;re on at 3mbps down/1.5 mbps up. There are only a couple outlets here and there, so you have to snag them quick, or come with fully charged devices. Nice alternative music to get you in the productive or daydreamy mood. <br><br>There&#39;s several different interesting teas and coffees as well as all sorts of dishes. I hear the buckwheat pancakes and the fried chicken are pretty bomb, but have yet to try them myself.

One of the most reliable and delicious brunch place in Singapore for me! Definitely reflected by the crowd constantly seen in line outside the shop. Recommended to make reservations ahead of time but if you&#39;re nearby and early, you can usually walk in before 10am. <br><br>The industrial decor with wooden tables and old-school bulbs and geometrical light shades make the place especially comfortable. Due to the relatively small space, the tables are however, quite close to each other. <br><br>I&#39;ve enjoyed most of the dishes I&#39;ve tried here, especially the following: <br>Breakfast sandwich - croissant refried with ham and scrambled eggs. Superbly giant portion so recommended for sharing. Scrambled eggs are fluffy and moist! Very nice. Ham is of good quality and full of flavor and good texture. <br>Chicken and spring onion pancake - great texture to the fried chicken skin and lots of good flavor in the meat, not too dry. Definitely also a dish for sharing. <br>Avocado toast - nice and refreshing dish compared the other two heavier options above. What more can I say about avocado? <br><br>I&#39;ve also tried the cold brew coffee. It&#39;s decent but not something I would go back for, like most other cold brews in Singapore. <br><br>Very good place to go for brunch on weekends, but I would say it&#39;s not great to just stay and chill since there&#39;s always people still in line waiting for seats..

text: The place is nice with great ambience. I ordered wagyu beef grain bowl {$24) with ume tea.<br>While i feel the food is a bit tasteless and not up to my expectation, the tea is amazing. A bit pricey though

text: Came here on a Thursday after office hours (6.00 pm) with a childhood friend of mine. Before being seated down, the waiter asked whether we had reservation and I&#39;m glad we managed to get ourselves seated before the dinner crowd started trickling in. Before being sat down, I could smell the truffle oil from far and the smell lasted about 10 or so minutes and it appeared again after some customers ordered truffle fries. The smell did not bother me as I am into truffle fries.<br><br>We were given a menu each (interesting menu - wooden back with bands to hold the piece of paper). And yes, I noticed the icons for popular dishes and without much hesitation headed for the pulled pork grain bowl and Buckwheat Pancakes. Wanted to order the Black Apple Tea but unfortunately they ran out. We had to go over to the counter to make an order as well as paying for the items.<br><br>While waiting for the food, I was absorbing the ambience in the cafe. The interior design was a combination of modern and rustic from wall decorations to furnitures. My friend and I think that it is a good hangout place for dining in during dinner (good view and more food choices).<br><br>Our mains came within 15 minutes of wait. As both of us enjoy sharing, we decided to share the two mains. <br><br>1) Pulled pork grain bowl - slow cooked pulled pork, quiona, baby corns with furikake sprinkled on top, red cabbage, chargrilled zucchini, roasted butternut squash (which we thought it was pumpkin), sautéed cherry tomatoes and mixed mushrooms. Some of the ingredients listed on the menu I was not able to differentiate hence I would not be including them in this particular review. I do not know how to give a proper review as each of the ingredients have different tastes, textures and shapes and somehow they combined greatly. In this bowl, the ingredients are separated accordingly. I tried the pulled pork first as that was what I was eyeing on when glancing at the menu. The pulled pork was soft as well as chewy and heated up at the right time. It was also moist and you could taste juiciness of it. But there were fats in it too which I had to accustom to. This dish reminds me of the brekkies I had while in Aussie. Flavorful and unique.<br><br>2) Buckwheat Pancakes (Vegan option) - soft fluffy buckwheat pancake with berry fruit compote, passionfruit curd (pretty mild), cornflake crumbs, thyme infused maple syrups, flowers, and fresh slices of strawberry (probably 1 strawberry) and 3-4 blueberries. The pancake tasted more like muffins. It was more dense than I thought. But somehow the cornflakes gave a bit more crunch and somehow the dish was another unique dish with explosions of flavors. For this dish, I would encourage you to share (2-3) as it will be a little too much for you. If you think it is too dry, you could add a little maple syrup on it but avoid splashing on the pancake as the dish is pretty sweet from the berry compote and passionfruit curd. <br><br>For the prices, it changes overtime. Either $0.50 to $1.00 more on the dishes or less. <br><br>Overall, I am glad that I decided to come here for dinner as it has variety of dishes available. The drink list was not too fabulous. I&#39;m not a coffee drinker so I wouldn&#39;t know whether it is good or not. But I overheard the waiter suggested that it&#39;s better to get warm coffee and ice on the side rather than iced coffee. Overall, do stop by this place during non-peak hours and preferably dinner.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=aEUGzkqPWS3SjghraZ5nMw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/vZYpNKbYnhwmbzTsLZzGpA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/vZYpNKbYnhwmbzTsLZzGpA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/vZYpNKbYnhwmbzTsLZzGpA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/vZYpNKbYnhwmbzTsLZzGpA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/vZYpNKbYnhwmbzTsLZzGpA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/vZYpNKbYnhwmbzTsLZzGpA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Bernie L.', 'displayLocation': 'Queenstown, Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Bernie L.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=aEUGzkqPWS3SjghraZ5nMw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 1, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 3, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Let me start by saying that my experience was completely marred by the long wait for my food. We were here at the tail end of the weekend lunch/brunch prime time. Around 45 minutes after placing our order, we were told that we have to wait another 10 minutes for our dish as a fresh batch of batter had to be prepared. Really, it takes you 45 minutes to figure this out? Something&#39;s wrong here guys. <br><br>Now on to the food. The spring pancakes and fried chicken was nothing to shout about. Scrambled eggs looked (and tasted) pretty good. Pulled pork bowl was above average according to my friend who had it. Coffee was good too. <br><br>Will I come back? There are some positives here and I might give it another chance on non-peak hours. And in case you were wondering, I finally got my food 58 minutes after ordering.

text: This place is awesome. Hipster joint with a large food menu and basic but tasty coffee/espresso options. I ordered the buckwheat pancakes (which was the best pancake I&#39;ve ever had in my life, not kidding) with a hazelnut latte and paid about $18 USD ($25 Singaporean dollars), which I think is great for Singapore. The atmosphere is relaxed and chill. This would be my go to spot if I lived in Singapore. Also, free wifi!

Berry smoothie &amp; latte', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Berry smoothie & latte'}]
text: I simply had a berry smoothie here but I like it! Next time I&#39;ll try their food cuz they look so fancy~ The location is nice for less than 5 mins walk from the Outram Park MRT.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/MoBMY5Ezy0d7B56Yn4QsCQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-populus-coffee-and-food-co-singapore?reviewid=NskzMiey_U9dZrHodwB3lg&select=MoBMY5Ezy0d7B56Yn4QsCQ', 'altText': 'Photo of The Populus Coffee & Food Co - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: Populus is really popular. There is a wait for a table. And if you think that is the hard part, try waiting for the food. We waited for an hour for one of the main dishes. That&#39;s being said, I loved my populous scramble and flat white. But I will definitely not come here unless I have time to wait...

The sister of Department of Caffeine is pretty new to the cafe scene but they are already drawing a crowd (do make a reservation to avoid the wait). <br><br>Coffee is actually a focus here and they even have 3 different blends of espresso- Monolith (comforting and reassuring), Caldera (upligting and refreshing), and Duxton Vice (cheeky and adventurous). It&#39;s obvious which i chose! No doubt which i am. Coffee is priced from $4.50. Filter coffee of African origins are available too. My iced mocha was more milky than anything and i couldn&#39;t taste the coffee even though the chocolate wasn&#39;t sweet. <br><br>A brunch hit is the Populus Scrambled ($18) which features eggs with fresh herb melange, marinated feta, and streaky bacon on top of a toasted croissant. The eggs could have been more runny. These were a little more cooked than i like but at least it didn&#39;t soak the flaky and buttery croissant. The bacon could do with more browning though. It&#39;s a decent brunch option however.<br><br>Perfect sweet mornings would begin with the Baked Pistachio French Toast ($19). Well this is actually a candy crusted brioche bread pudding with red wine poached pears, lemon curd, yuzu mascarpone, pistachio crumb, thyme infused pure maple syrup and flowers. Loved the moist fruit chunks (probably apple and pear) in the soggy-ish brioche, complemented with cornflakes bits.<br><br>The Buckwheat Pancake ($20.50) in a skillet could be described as a thick pancake or a flat fluffy cake, which wasn&#39;t too dry but it wasn&#39;t moist either. It was just.. undecided? Likewise, I couldn&#39;t decide if i liked this or not. It was simply a canvas for that tangy berry fruit compote, passionfruit curd, and cornflake crumb. It also felt like they kept reusing the same ingredients in the Pistachio French Toast. In fact, we saw many common elements in our dishes. Share this. I imagine I&#39;d get sick of it after a bit.<br><br>For something more lunchy, go with the grain bowls which use a base of quinoa, Bulgar wheat and pearl barley, like the savory Pulled Pork Grain Bowl ($18). I thought it was a seemingly Asian dish with the pickled cabbage apple slaw and furikake though the preparation and ingredients used were more Mediterranean. <br><br>Our surprise birthday desserts were the Dark Chocolate Sundae ($13) and the Earl Grey Chocolate Cake. I was surprised by the rich flavor of the chocolate ice cream even though it had a very light texture. It&#39;s a return of the common ingredients of curd, berries puree, cornflakes, yada yada yada which got really old by the end of the meal. The cake sponge in the mix was meh at best.<br><br>Give me something no frills like the Earl Grey Chocolate slice anytime. Loved the intense earl grey flavor and it had the dense brownie type of texture. <br><br>The Populus Coffee &amp; Food Co. certainly gives its neighbor, The Lokal, a run for their money. Well more options for us i guess. I think i prefer this.

As per the previous reviews - come at non-peak period. Why? Firstly, they protect themselves by having a fine print of &#39;food may take up to 30 minutes&#39; in their menu. That means you can&#39;t complain until you have waited for at least 30 minutes. Secondly, the tables are arranged packed to the brim of the restaurant. Seriously, is there a maximum capacity for this place or not? There is barely space for you to move back your chair to leave the place. There wasn&#39;t even any waiting area! You will be breathing down the neck of the person sitting closest to the door. <br><br>Okay, if you made it there during non-peak hours, then you are in luck to try above average food. I tried the pulled pork grain bowl and pork collar. They were both really delicious although could improve if they served it slightly warmer. The pulled pork grain bowl is a well-balanced meal with grains (quinoa and barley), vege (mushrooms, zucchini, tomatoes) and of course the pork. The pork collar was tender and served with purple cabbage. According to the menu, it is served with apple salad but really, it was cabbage salad. There was only 10 strips of apple in there. It was still pretty good though.<br><br>As for drinks, I heard that the coffee is exceptional but I went for the hot chocolate. It was one of the best hot chocolate I have had - dark choc base with just enough sugar to be a drink. Lip smacking delicious! The creaminess means you do have to grab that free flow water they provide though!<br><br>Overall, it was a delicious meal but if I were to visit again, it will have to be a non-peak period.

text: Light and creamy Key Lime Pie with a crumbly pastry base. Delish! Coffee tasted great. However, there was no coffee crema to leave a sweet bitterness on the tongue and they take a while to make your coffee on a not busy afternoon and that is the only reason why I haven&#39;t given it 5 stars.

text: Good was really good but waited 40 minutes to get my dish. My friend got his 10 minutes before me and was done by the time I got food! Shame as the food was so tasty, hopefully then can solve this issue

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/OHXVEfQfE4vi8ATkxpQo2w/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-populus-coffee-and-food-co-singapore?reviewid=p5-rO_0kUiwDl4nCQ34ykQ&select=OHXVEfQfE4vi8ATkxpQo2w', 'altText': 'Photo of The Populus Coffee & Food Co - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: So the November YUBE brought us to Populus, a new brunch/coffee place.  At first glance, it has all the right elements for a hot brunch spot - central location, designerish hipster decor, coffee + sale of coffee related gadgets and an interesting brunch menu.  In fact by the time we left the place (around 1 pm on sat), there was a line of people waiting for a table.  The problem though is actually with the food itself.  Having read that their scrambled egg was good, I ordered the populus scramble and the scrambled egg itself is indeed good - just right degree of runny, light creamy smooth but I found the seasoning a bit off.  There was the use of a few middle-eastern seasoning (think I tasted cumin in one of the other dishes) but somehow it didn&#39;t really go with the ingredients.  Also, I found the use of feta cheese AND bacon in the same dish a bit too much, definitely my scrambled egg could be at least 20 - 30% less salty and there should really only be one feature flavor there to go with the lightness of the egg. The coffee is good from my limited tasting of the flat white, very smooth and balanced.  I tried some of the corn pancake someone else ordered but that was a bit dy and bland. Perhaps it is the middle eastern twist they are trying to introduce into their dishes, it reminds me of Ottolenghi in London but precisely, its problem is it lacks the good blending of flavors, spices and ingredients that Ottolenghi stands for.  Hopefully they will improve on the food quality since I did enjoy sitting there in its bright airy interiors.  Service was good and we didn&#39;t experience the delay that some other reviewers experienced so maybe they have improved on that front.

This place has major issues. I made a reservation for 12:30 pm on a Friday. I got multiple texts and calls from the restaurant to confirm my reservation. You&#39;d think by making a reservation online, that&#39;s confirmation enough? I confirmed my reservation a second time, and arrived at 12:30. They didn&#39;t have a table for me, and asked me if I would mind sitting at the counter (I would) before scrambling to clear another table. I was placed elbow to elbow with another group. They have one too many tables shoved in here, and people were constantly bumping into me. Waiters brought the wrong dishes to multiple people, including me. There&#39;s a $50 minimum if paying by visa or MasterCard...unfortunately this was one of few occasions when I didn&#39;t consult yelp first, so I didn&#39;t bring cash. I ordered the burger, coconut smoothie, strawberry sundae, and two tarts to fulfill the $50 quota. The burger was absolute s**t. I hadn&#39;t eaten all day so I figured I&#39;d be happy with whatever I got, and with the first bite was proven wrong. Gooey, messy, falling apart, no intentional flavors...just a train wreck. It was served on a tiny wooden platter. The burger was sopping wet and dripping with juices which quickly slid off the small platter and made a mess of the table. The cheese on it was supposedly gruyere, but had none of the flavors I love in a gruyere. Could&#39;ve been any basic processed garbage. I begrudgingly ate about a quarter of it before giving up and sating my hunger with the cold fries that came as a side. The coconut smoothie was sweet without being too sugary, and had a noticeable but not overpowering mint flavor. Strawberry sundae was disappointing. The jelly cubes didn&#39;t add much, and the bread pieces were hard and unappetizing. I got the tarts to go, so I haven&#39;t tried them yet. There&#39;s no reason to come here. Food is awful, seating is cramped, most patrons are loud hipster types trying to sound impressive (girl next to me wanted to be an American and was trying so hard to put on an accent, making up shit about the US as if she&#39;d been there etc), and prices are stupidly high for the quality. I&#39;m continually disappointed in Singapore. There are so many confused attempts at hipster cafes. Singapore could use its cultural diversity to make something fresh and innovative, but instead I see mediocre restaurants more often than not.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/JeX04Yxxce1zExtm_GDFjA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/haritts-donuts-and-coffee-singapore?reviewid=NdpMm4GtDSspdGaiRnyVaw&select=JeX04Yxxce1zExtm_GDFjA', 'altText': 'Photo of Haritts Donuts & Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: They do only a few things but do them well. The few things being good coffee by local roaster homeground. And donuts in a multitude of flavours.<br><br>The donuts are just like the Haritts when I had the in Tokyo. It has this unique soft chew a bit like tender bread but is not like local airbread. The dough has a nice delicate flavour and the chew is somehow springy and not flatlines.<br><br>Their most popular flavour is the cream cheese and it costs more accordingly. It takes more effort and time to prepare. $3.20. This is my clear favourite. There is a slight saltiness to the cheese.<br><br>Matcha has the bitter kick of matcha powder, fun to share as a side. Chocolate is ok but I not a big chocolate person at all so if you are don&#39;t let me stop you.<br><br>I nearly rated it 4 stars. Because when I sidle up at 915am. Only 2 flavours are ready and cheese is only out earliest 11 plus am I told. Regardless they do sell out most days. The only table is outside where its usually hot. I do want to sit and savour my donut and coffee and not have it on the run.<br><br>If the top item isn&#39;t produced till half the day is gone and you can&#39;t eat it, how to rate for it. Luckily I had it on an earlier visit after lunch. The guy was so kind he did say he would deliver me a few as he would be near my office the next day. In the end the uniqueness of the taste of the dough with cream cheese and the texture, if that doesn&#39;t get the last star what does.<br><br>They are going to open Sundays soon. That makes it a fun day.

text: Awful tasting donuts; it tastes like stale bread and is too dense.

Kopi C and Teh C', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Kopi C and Teh C'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/9e0NsX83b6_vrsy-0JgSpA/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore-63?reviewid=crLX0NbbMuVf6KjukXtiiA&select=9e0NsX83b6_vrsy-0JgSpA', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore. Kaya toast set and ham cheese toast set', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Kaya toast set and ham cheese toast set'}]
text: We were in search of our first traditional Singaporean breakfast so we came here because of their convenient location across from our hotel. I saw a few Toast Box locations during our stay so it seems like this is a popular fast casual chain. I ordered the traditional Kaya toast set which comes with the soft boiled eggs and a drink, so I chose the Teh C. It tasted just like a hot milk tea, so tasty! <br><br>The service was meh. They didn&#39;t have the slightest smile or bit of friendliness in them and they didn&#39;t care that we have never ordered here before or even had &#34;kopi&#34; or &#34;teh&#34; Singaporean style. They just pointed to a sign on the register that had a graphic of what each Kopi or Teh A, B, and C consisted of. <br><br>They don&#39;t have signs on how exactly to eat the toast and soft boiled eggs but luckily I was prepared. I knew Kaya toast was a popular dish so I looked up videos beforehand! So for all the fellow rookies out there... first, crack your soft boiled eggs into the empty dish they give you. Add a drizzle of soy sauce and salt, you can add more later to your liking. Mix it all up together with a spoon. Dip your toast into this egg mixture, and enjoy! The Kaya jam was so yummy. And if you really like it, you can grab a jar at the counter to take home for later. My husband&#39;s ham and cheese toast was also yummy, and much thicker bread, but we both preferred the Kaya toast more.

Laksa', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Laksa'}]
text: I came here to eat towards the end of the night and this place looked interesting. <br><br>They have a variety of meal options to pick from and they also have convenient store hours. I tried the laksa and I wasn&#39;t very impressed. The cake and tea that was included in the meal set was very bland as well<br>What I enjoyed more about more about the Toast Box was the exterior and design. <br><br>The Recommendation:<br>Come here for a drink and relax at the cafe but I would not eat any meals here because it taste like typical mall food.

text: Great cafe inside the Marina Bay Sands Hotel complex and mall. It&#39;s right next to the din tai fong. Wonderful coffee and morning breakfast with their egg and kaya toast. They also have great soup noodles as well. It&#39;s a nice shop to get a snack or a meal. A bit pricey but it is in the high end mall.

Buzzer', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Buzzer'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/RBB6TH2C4oRIwL5ak_GufQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore-63?reviewid=ngXFNUqeB_OHCNtbiXxQVw&select=RBB6TH2C4oRIwL5ak_GufQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore. My breakfast today 06.11.2018', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'My breakfast today 06.11.2018'}]
text: Came here before I went for my routine walk at Gardens by The Bay. <br><br>There was a short line in front. The staff took forever. So it was as if the line was crazy long. <br><br>Decided to change things up a bit and ordered something not the usual. <br><br>FOOD 3/5<br><br>Ordered the butter sugar toast and a hot barley drink. The butter sugar toast was made with multigrain bread and it seemed to be the only kind of bread offered at this location. It was dry and rough :(<br><br>AMBIENCE 4/5<br><br>Plenty of seatings, though the area where there had those bench seatings, the tables were pretty close to each other. I did not understand why these patrons must sit next to me when there were plenty of empty seatings around. I had to inch my way out between my table and theirs when I was done with breakfast :(<br><br>SERVICE 3/5<br><br>Staff needed to speed up the efficiency level. I had seen longer line at Toastbox at Ion Orchard but the wait was not bad at all. The staffs at the Ion Orchard could clear the line fast. <br><br>The hot barley was in a paper cup with no lid :~( It was so hard to consume that super hot barley especially when the cup was not thick and good enough to absorb the heat. <br><br>Note: pricing at this Toastbox is higher than other Toastbox locations. Must be cos this is located at The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands :(

I came here with my grandma and little brother to grab something to drink. The line was a bit long; there were maybe 6 people in front of us. It took longer than I expected for us to reach the front, so we waited for quite a while. We ordered the iced milo, kaya toast, hot barley drink, ice teh melaka and also purchased a jar of the kaya. The Kaya toast was great. We ended up going back to order a second one. My brother enjoyed his iced milo but finished it very quickly because the cup was about 75% ice. If you get it I definitely recommend asking for light ice or none at all, since it already comes out cold. <br><br>Prepare yourself for a wait if you come! The food is definitely worth it though.
I not what it is but the lady up front is super rude. It&#39;s like a bakery slash coffee shop. I don&#39;t even know why I ordered what I did because of her attitude.

While waiting in a medium sized long, I was lucky to have a local turn around and start chatting with me. She informed me that Toast Box is a popular chain in Singapore but one of the more expensive ones. When I asked her what to get, she said the Kaya set with Kopi was the way to go. She explained the Kopi options, with Kopi C being condensed milk, etc. <br><br>The kaya set comes with soft boiled eggs and kopi. I really enjoyed the kaya, which is like a sugary coconut spread unique to Singapore. I wanted to get a jar to take back but alas, we were flying Scoot.<br><br>The cashiers here didn&#39;t understand English, so I resorted to pointing. They take cc. Nice place, good food, fair price, good kopi!

I was told that while in Singapore it was necessary to try Kaya toast. I sample multiple kaya toasts during my visit and toast box was BY FAR the winner. They also have jars of kaya jam available for purchase which provided me with a great souvenir to go home with! I only wish I could eat kaya toast from toast box every day.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=DgQQh4VqBG-9zQhc776a2g', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8tolnerArzGvMr7pKZ0upg/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8tolnerArzGvMr7pKZ0upg/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8tolnerArzGvMr7pKZ0upg/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8tolnerArzGvMr7pKZ0upg/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8tolnerArzGvMr7pKZ0upg/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8tolnerArzGvMr7pKZ0upg/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Michael L.', 'displayLocation': 'Peachtree Corners, GA', 'altText': 'Michael L.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=DgQQh4VqBG-9zQhc776a2g', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 470, 'photoCount': 166, 'reviewCount': 739, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Came by to pick up breakfast to take to my meeting nearby at the MBS conference center.  <br><br>Ordered a Kaya toast and a Milo.  Kaya toast was delectable- I wish I ordered two of them! Milo was not too sweet, and warmed me up amid all the air conditioning and got me going for the day.  <br><br>Prices are reasonable, if not cheap.

Solid 3.5 stars, just for the need to get great-tasting Kopi, but with a heftier price tag than usual.  Instead of the usual $2 at most Food Republics i&#39;ve been to, here they&#39;re charging $3.60, guess someone has to pay for those leather sofa seating at the front.<br><br>Kinda like a lounge patio with the shoppers passing by.<br><br>It sure is the nicest one i&#39;ve seen so far on my trip.

decent local food in the rarefied surroundings at the marina bay sands shopping mall - like the barest extraction of our local food culture into something a little more accessible for both tourists and locals escaping the heat - like me.<br><br>this is one of a few chains in singapore upping the ante on our traditional coffeeshops: serving the same dishes at a more consistent delivery (though therefore imbuing it with more factory-type monotony) amidst the modern comforts of air-conditioning. <br><br>I&#39;m not a huge proponent for local food - it&#39;s usually a little too heavy on the carb and grease; but I do enjoy the simpler things, like dipping toast into a half-boiled eggs darkened with a dash of soy. and while the prices here may be higher than at your neighborhood joint, there&#39;s something to be said about clean tables and surroundings, and much to be said for air-conditioning in singapore&#39;s unforgiving heat.<br><br>we ended up here after a trip to the gardens by the bay - second choice after seeing din tai fung&#39;s infernal queue - and had a filling meal: eggs and plain thick toast (the thicker, the better) for me, nasi lemak (coconut rice served with a fried chicken wing, egg and fried anchovies) as well as a bowl of mee rebus (yellow noodles in a creamy curry-type gravy).<br><br>cheap, decent, filling food - arguably the best value in this extravagant mall. and a great introduction to local food, if you&#39;re so inclined.

text: The Book Cafe<br>20 Martin Road<br><br>There is a diversified range of reading materials available- several hundred local and foreign books, magazines and newspapers are available.<br><br>Several couches indoors. Quite a lot of outdoor seats.<br><br>There is wireless Internet access and also electrical power-points. <br><br>Easy street-side parking right in front of the café.<br><br>All-day breakfast.<br><br>Egg Royale<br>Toasted English muffin + maple bacon (none today so replaced with usual bacon) + grilled tomatoes + baby spinach + poached eggs + hollandaise sauce + rotating potato <br>- good<br><br>Classic Cheese Burger<br>Grilled beef patty + cheese + tomato slices + lettuce + caramelised onions on a toasted burger bun + fries <br>- nice &amp; juicy<br><br>Calamansi <br><br>Ice coffee

text: Book cafe is a wonderful place if you are looking for a pressure free place to read or get some work done. There is free WiFi, good coffee and desserts, as well as substantial food items  (though I personally haven&#39;t tried them).<br><br>I had the iced latte and lemon pie both of which were sizeable and tasty. There is plenty of seating both indoor and outdoor  (with fans) for customers to stay however long.<br><br>I will be back to try the food!

You can spend all day here', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'You can spend all day here'}]
text: Moseyed on into this cafe by chance from walking around the Quay. First impression stepping inside was the quietness of the place for a Sunday evening. One can get some serious work, reading or chill time accomplished in here. Sofa seating seemed cozy and inviting. Did I mention reading? As the cafe&#39;s name eludes to, there is a very large inventory of reading material for one&#39;s perusal. Free and fast WiFi (perhaps I visited when patrons weren&#39;t streaming). <br><br>Order cheese cake slices and a flat white. Cheese cakes had a gummy texture to the surface layer, so maybe it wasn&#39;t as fresh as I expected. The flat white was very good. Double shot from some nice dark roasted beans and some milk ... nice cup of Joe to my liking! <br><br>Average cafe with an extra star for stacks of reading material, less a star for mediocre cheese cakes.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=KEIzksmYRGhGyk6-IZmwYg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/kdKQwKTLYRK63b8RB9O7uA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/kdKQwKTLYRK63b8RB9O7uA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/kdKQwKTLYRK63b8RB9O7uA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/kdKQwKTLYRK63b8RB9O7uA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/kdKQwKTLYRK63b8RB9O7uA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/kdKQwKTLYRK63b8RB9O7uA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Akshata R.', 'displayLocation': 'Portland, OR', 'altText': 'Akshata R.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=KEIzksmYRGhGyk6-IZmwYg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 1, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 73, 'eliteYear': None}
text: This place is spacious, with both tables and sofas to chill out at, whether you&#39;re working or lounging. The walls are stacked with rows of books and there are global newspapers up front. The food and drink are okay, but the ambiance is great to relax. The service is quick and snappy as well. Definite recommend.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/hXsF4jLK9369eRLGzzQkmQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-book-cafe-singapore?reviewid=tz8ilU9x2ETKkv3UZHFMkA&select=hXsF4jLK9369eRLGzzQkmQ', 'altText': 'Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: I visited for brunch on a Saturday morning. The place wasn&#39;t full which was great, if you&#39;re looking for a place where you can have a conversation without shouting. At one side of the restaurant, there are couches that were perfect for relaxing with a good book. And books there were aplenty for you to browse with. <br><br>The service staff were friendly and eager to please. <br><br>Unfortunately, the food though decent, isn&#39;t good enough for me to specially return for it. I had the eggs blackstone (English muffin, spinach, tomatoes, eggs, rosti) and a flat white. The coffee was better than I expected - low in acidity. I was excited about the apple pie based on previous reviews, but it didn&#39;t live up to the hype. I prefer a harder crust; the filling had just the right hint of tartness and sweetness. My friend really enjoyed his chicken sandwich which he ordered based on the recommendation of another reviewer. <br><br>It&#39;s a nice place to hang out with friends but if you&#39;re a picky eater, it may not live up to your expectations. <br><br>Free wifi available. Toilet is very clean and orderly.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/wknHb3WXJWtQLsKIZDPRtQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-book-cafe-singapore?reviewid=QYVrcULPiZAFdGZW1wSgpg&select=wknHb3WXJWtQLsKIZDPRtQ', 'altText': 'Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/TRKmGzIkurzq4rsz0xMXkQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-book-cafe-singapore?reviewid=QYVrcULPiZAFdGZW1wSgpg&select=TRKmGzIkurzq4rsz0xMXkQ', 'altText': 'Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: This isn&#39;t a cafe you come to specially for their food, but to read your book/surf net/work on your computer.<br><br>There are heaps of reading materials in the interior, but we chose to sit outside. There are power outlets but you may have to fight other users for them. We got a pot of tea, coffee, pumpkin soup, and a slice of Oreo cheesecake to while the afternoon away. Wifi was a bit slow because it was crowded and it was a public holiday. On a normal day, it would probably be okay.<br><br>Our food was okay, nothing special, but if you have the munchies while reading, they will be quelled.<br><br>Service was prompt and our water glasses were rarely empty.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/avQyD17iAnj9IRR3V7p8MQ/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-book-cafe-singapore?reviewid=ouKwmQushMJYA-dni9AMzA&select=avQyD17iAnj9IRR3V7p8MQ', 'altText': 'Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/kURR2iFPRrOemRxzm-IvGg/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-book-cafe-singapore?reviewid=ouKwmQushMJYA-dni9AMzA&select=kURR2iFPRrOemRxzm-IvGg', 'altText': 'Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/UgjqztPNvV0A1hBaLot3ow/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-book-cafe-singapore?reviewid=ouKwmQushMJYA-dni9AMzA&select=UgjqztPNvV0A1hBaLot3ow', 'altText': 'Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/qoysQmawtwQMtlJHHPY23Q/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-book-cafe-singapore?reviewid=ouKwmQushMJYA-dni9AMzA&select=qoysQmawtwQMtlJHHPY23Q', 'altText': 'Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}]
text: Unlike those new kids on the block, The Book Cafe situated on the corner of Martin Road is a well-known, well-loved hideout for many book lovers, myself included. Throw in free fast-speed Wi-Fi, more than 10 socket plugs peppered around the place and dozens of foreign/local magazines for your reading pleasure and you have a café that is perpetually teeming with diners/readers every day of the week.<br><br>Take your pick between square tables or lounge sofa seats, put up your feeds and chill-out for a few hours reading, gossiping, sipping a cuppa or whiling the time away people-watching.<br><br>My fourth visit to the café saw me ordering their Traditional Apple Pie which did not disappoint at all; think soft, chewy, sweet apple bits hidden expertly within a thin, crispy, sugary crust with streaks of chocolate sauce on the side. I didn&#39;t order drinks this time as I came on a full stomach but on my previous visits, their Flat White left quite a good impression on me too.<br><br>Packed with weekenders in casual wear during weekends and with businessmen on weekdays, The Book Café comes highly recommended if you&#39;re in the Havelock Road area and looking for a good place to recharge (self and electronics alike).

Eggs Blackstone', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Eggs Blackstone'}]
text: A really nice coworking spot. There&#39;s plenty of tables inside and out, and a living room with couches if you&#39;re feeling more in Kindle mode.<br><br>The coffee is good, but unremarkable given the high quality of Singapore coffee options, including Toby&#39;s Estate nearby.<br><br>The food is pretty fantastic though; the Eggs Blackstone has a wonderful hollandaise and... maple bacon.

Enough magazines to spend time with, not to mention books which are off-camera!', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Enough magazines to spend time with, not to mention books which are off-camera!'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/dfr0y5k5PYD8o7TxuBT2Uw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-book-cafe-singapore?reviewid=M99uJUkiVt0qmy9uZ_dmag&select=dfr0y5k5PYD8o7TxuBT2Uw', 'altText': 'Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. I&#39;m seated in the enclave where the books and sofas are.', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': "I'm seated in the enclave where the books and sofas are."}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/bj57VJNwZn8xZxc00x3qhA/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-book-cafe-singapore?reviewid=M99uJUkiVt0qmy9uZ_dmag&select=bj57VJNwZn8xZxc00x3qhA', 'altText': 'Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Wow, when it&#39;s not crowded and there are actually seats available!', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': "Wow, when it's not crowded and there are actually seats available!"}]
text: Just like any reviewed place, it depends on the time that one makes their visit. <br>I&#39;ve come to The Book Cafe several times before and most of the times in the past, it has been relatively crowded.  However, tonight, on a Wednesday evening at about 6:45pm, it is relatively quiet.  In fact, a lot of the sofas are still unoccupied. But that&#39;s probably about to change as some people come here for dinner, dessert, or drinks. <br><br>This is the kind of cafe to come, relax and chill for awhile.  Half of the cafe space is simply an enclave of comfy sofas and shelves of magazines and books.  This is the kind of place you expect to spend at least an hour or two, or three...<br><br>The prices are mid-range but that is to be expected, given the location.  It&#39;s walking distance from Robertson Quay, with its fancy restaurants and bars.  The Book Cafe offers a nice ambience for personal time; and even if you come with someone, you are able to each do your own thing while sitting comfortably side-by-side. <br><br>This is on the short list of &#34;must-visit&#34; cafes in Singapore.

Cozy couch area', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Cozy couch area'}]
text: Cute, cozy bookstore located in Robertson Quay. I always walk past this cafe on the way to Orangetheory Fitness, with people constantly being seen inside. I was able to try this cafe after seeing it a multitude of times, and the cozy exterior indeed is reflected inside. The cafe offers different types of cafe food like sandwiches, all-day breakfast options, and pasta/asian foods after 11am. I ordered the Emmentaler omelet, which came with eggs, lean bacon, tomatoes, avocado and sour cream, and toast. I got the whole grain toast, and it was a very generous serving with butter and jam. The omelet was very thick and the stronger taste of the cheese accompanied the bacon very nicely. It was a good portion for brunch. The prices were typical of the area, my omelet was $20 SGD and most of the brunch dishes were similarly priced. The desserts and drinks looked really good as well, and I hope to come back to try their pasta. Most of all, the ambience is what makes it really worth coming here, and many people come here to study/read creating a fusion of restaurant/coffeeshop vibes. It gets really busy in the weekend mornings, with people tending to hang out it can be frustrating to get a seat.

text: I must spend way to much time looking at Google Maps because when I discovered this place I knew that I had to check it out (especially being such a book nerd). All I can say is that it&#39;s reputation certainly lives up to its name with large bookshelves inside covered in books, as well as a number of covers of Lolita on one of the walls. I came here for breakfast (I simply wasn&#39;t interested in breakfast at my hotel, even though it was probably included in the price) and I must admit that it was pretty good, and the coffee wasn&#39;t all that bad either. This is one of those places that I could easily spend a few hours in every morning with a hot cup of tea and a nice book. The also have an outdoor section, though a part of that is a smoking area, though why would one want to sit outside when you can sit inside with all the marvellous books.

Needle found in the couch.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Needle found in the couch.'}]
text: This place has a major fruit fly issue. Flies on my food, in my drink, just buzzing around everywhere. Had to go up to the counter to get served even though I was sat at a table with a menu. My avocado sandwich contained no avocado. Found a needle??? In the sofa. I was looking for a comfortable, chill place to study, unfortunately this wasn&#39;t it.

I&#39;ll admit I&#39;m biased because I love anything book related.<br>Let me try to be objective though.<br><br>Came in on a Sunday for brunch (today, actually)<br><br>Had smoked salmon set sans the salmon, because vegetarian. <br>Flat white. Long black. <br><br>My friend had the smoked salmon set and vouched for the edibility of the salmon, hot cocoa, and we shared a French toast set. <br><br>Food was great, waiting time was Long, even though the place was not crowded. Worth the wait though. Price is average for cafes. Decent portion size.<br><br>Music is old fashioned jazz-ish music. Not loud enough for me, but then again, to each their own. <br><br>Service was great. Attentive, friendly, non-judgy even though my half-asleep brain asked weird questions about the menu. <br><br>Bright enough for study/work/reading. <br>They also have a great selection of books to read. <br><br>If you&#39;re so inclined, it&#39;s a great place to transition from coffee to wine/beer. <br><br>All in all, an experience I wouldn&#39;t mind repeating the next time I have an itch to be outside on a Sunday.

text: My favorite local spot in Singapore. On a few occasions I spent about 4 continuous hours here working and studying. The staff is wonderful. I am always greeted with a friendly smile. The lemon pine nut pie (available only on fridays and weekends) is to die for. The flavors compliment each other so well and the presentation is beautiful. <br>The eggs Royale and eggs Blackstone are also solid dishes to try here. The dragonfruit and pear juice is my personal favorite drink here. The iced Carmel latte also delicious on a hot day (which is literally every day in Singapore). Very unpretentious. <br>I definitely recommend this spot.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=TUAiW8Lcdla5Ii53kV6RFw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8THfMDpO-mZIcSkzhJM8fQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8THfMDpO-mZIcSkzhJM8fQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8THfMDpO-mZIcSkzhJM8fQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8THfMDpO-mZIcSkzhJM8fQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8THfMDpO-mZIcSkzhJM8fQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8THfMDpO-mZIcSkzhJM8fQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Eric C.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Eric C.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=TUAiW8Lcdla5Ii53kV6RFw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 534, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 20, 'eliteYear': None}
text: BREAKFAST/LUNCH:<br>- eggs w/ bratwurst (~$15)<br>- turkey, avocado, &amp; egg white sandwich (~$15)<br><br>FOOD: <br>Simple. Consistent. Tasty. There&#39;s no mystery behind the menu here. They serve breakfast, salads, sandwiches, and entrees catered to the cafe crowd. They also have a lengthy tea and coffee selection. I came here for breakfast 3 days straight, and it&#39;s very satisfying. Food is well-seasoned and portions are appropriate. <br><br>AMBIANCE: <br>I like it because they don&#39;t try to hard. The place embodies the calming neighborhood vibe. There&#39;s a section with couches if you want to wind down for you drink/eat, and an outdoor seating area as well. I stayed for a couple hours on Sunday to work, and they were very accommodating. <br><br>PRICE: <br>Very reasonable all things considered. You can get a proper breakfast/meal + coffee for right around $20. <br><br>OVERALL: <br>Highly recommend this place to anyone living in the Robertson Quay area. Singapore in general could use a few more of these neighborhood joints. <br><br>PS: +0.5 stars for doing takeaway

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/-07RXV0OT3oILZSghtATpw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-book-cafe-singapore?reviewid=9zSV0aXzPtS6dmUZ56vAjQ&select=-07RXV0OT3oILZSghtATpw', 'altText': 'Photo of The Book Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. american-style pancakes with fruit and syrup', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'american-style pancakes with fruit and syrup'}]
text: I feel like its name suits this place, as it&#39;s rather fortuitously decked out as a sanctuary to catch up on those eponymous founts of knowledge - or let&#39;s be honest, random laptopping - with the food incidental to the experience.<br><br>not that the food is bad, but I just don&#39;t feel like that&#39;s the raison d&#39;etre of this place. to be fair - it&#39;s all pretty decent. my pancakes were just about fluffy enough, with a dash of powdered sugar and sliced fruit; eggs benedict as you&#39;d expect, with flowy yolks and a rather cute addition of a latke; and an unphotographed order of cereal was a rather out-the-box execution of muesli, generic sweetened vanilla yogurt and milk.<br><br>so it&#39;s all edible, but not exactly travel-worthy.<br><br>the calm of the place is more than worth it though. it&#39;s hidden away in the outskirts of robertson quay (as though our red dot is large enough to quantify for this term), and almost completely rid of any hipsters - money can&#39;t buy that second part these days. it&#39;s not cool so much as cozy, with a smart layout of sofas at the back and traditional table-and-chairs in front, as well as the books and magazines all propped up on shelves everywhere.<br><br>get a coffee, and some food - support these people please - and while away your afternoon. it&#39;s like being home, without actually being home.

text: Nice place. You will feel very relax in here. You can take time to read many books and magazines. The food is normal, not bad. If you want to find a cafe where give you relax feeling and long chart with you love and friends. Here will be your choice...

Here&#39;s my breakfast', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': "Here's my breakfast"}]
text: The Book Cafe, just another one of the lovely neighborhood cafes I will be frequenting in the Robertson quay area. The ambience of this place is very relaxing. They play some nice 50-60&#39;s old swing Motown blues, real soothing and conducive to the relaxing atmosphere.<br>You could sit outside or inside, where I bet it&#39;s perfect to post up and do some work from home stuff. They a little living room library set up just next to the main dining area.<br>Off the shelves are tons of magazines and periodicals for you to peruse during your stay. They even have my favorite, Monocle!<br>As for food, I could only comment on breakfast as that&#39;s all I&#39;ve had here the past two times. A set will set you back S$14 and that&#39;s your standard two eggs, some toast, hash browns and a meat of choice. Add in a coffee and you are looking at a little under S$20 all in.<br>The service is very good at this place, real friendly and and attentive, but not overly.<br>This place makes me want to come back and do some work. I may do that so i could test out the lunch specials.<br>This will be one of my frequent neighborhood haunts!

text: It&#39;s hard to find a place in Singapore that allows you to sit and do some work. This is a very nice cafe and very friendly staff. Good WiFi until it got a bit crowded, then it slowed down a bit. Lots of power outlets. Really great eggs benedict - simple with no frills but very well made hollandaise sauce.  Had a flat white (2 actually!) that did not disappoint!

text: I sort of like this place. It&#39;s very cozy. Tons of magazines/books to peruse. Espresso is ok. That other one nearby is much better. On the dessert, I would stick to the pies which are &#34;baked fresh daily&#34;. The others looked dropped off by some supermarket. Also another perk is the ample patio street space which is very shaded. Overall nice place.

text: &#39;Let&#39;s go to Book Cafe today! Awww yeah I missed that place!&#34; <br>It&#39;s such a cozy hang out, perfect to chill on the couch and catch up on some emails, maybe even do a little bit of work. During the weekends it can be quite packed, but nobody seems to mind sharing a couch. You gotta accept a bit of PDA though, the crowd is a combination of couple&#39;s snuggling up to each other and having brunch or a coffee together, and the other half is couples composed of a person dating a laptop.<br>Easy going vibes with Jack Johson and Enya are playing on the background and dim  lights. The services matches the music and is slow as well. Menu is quiet extensive and there&#39;s always something that can satisfy your needs. 15 dollar for a salad and 8 dollars for a iced mocha is a bit much though, but you are paying for the ambiance and for one of limited spots on the couches.

text: This cafe was located across the street from our hotel so the location was perfect. They have an extensive menu so you can find something for everyone and a ton of books and games to keep you occupied.  <br>The environment is very relaxed the service was great.  A good place for breakfast or a light meal.

I was finding a place in between 2 appointments and had no laptop or books with me. The place is unexpectedly crowded with people hitting my chairs all the time. Nonetheless the traditional lemon cake is really good. I had it with Hot Honey Lemon. Perfect combination.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=tV2_gkppGeXPEdodbwmyBA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/kT-euBBeNGKHz4TEnYEwew/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/kT-euBBeNGKHz4TEnYEwew/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/kT-euBBeNGKHz4TEnYEwew/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/kT-euBBeNGKHz4TEnYEwew/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/kT-euBBeNGKHz4TEnYEwew/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/kT-euBBeNGKHz4TEnYEwew/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'David R.', 'displayLocation': 'Bukit Merah, Singapore', 'altText': 'David R.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=tV2_gkppGeXPEdodbwmyBA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 91, 'photoCount': 1, 'reviewCount': 62, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Probably some of the warmest service I&#39;ve encountered in Singapore. Maybe it&#39;s because I&#39;m almost a regular but I swear there are a few folks who work here who make me ok with paying the Bougieville prices. The cafe is very cute on the inside and has a much more homey, approachable feel than the usual pretentiousness that frequently comes when S&#39;pore establishments try Western fare. The food is pretty solid also making this a definite go to place to get some work done, or just hang out with a cup of coffee and a good book!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=ybZWTmPjyiYp54rN5FOfJg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/bHtfJb8daTRlOZwAlp9NVg/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/bHtfJb8daTRlOZwAlp9NVg/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/bHtfJb8daTRlOZwAlp9NVg/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/bHtfJb8daTRlOZwAlp9NVg/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/bHtfJb8daTRlOZwAlp9NVg/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/bHtfJb8daTRlOZwAlp9NVg/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Juyoung O.', 'displayLocation': 'Los Angeles, CA', 'altText': 'Juyoung O.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=ybZWTmPjyiYp54rN5FOfJg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 185, 'photoCount': 58, 'reviewCount': 41, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Pretty awesome and the vibe is real chill. Not a book fan but they got kickass sofas and it&#39;s just nice.
Great place to hang out and complete assignments.The coffee is all right but I came here for the ambience,and this place is perfect for lounging during the afternoon with a book to read.
Long-standing, well-loved cafe. Great place to read, chill, catch up plus free wifi. Decent coffee n food!
Just a tiny bit out of the way, but worth it.  This is a great place for breakfast when staying in the area.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=k4B4gZFiZscBR9yFFUsc6Q', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/N9odUC2l-kWNjHWp_YyhyA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/N9odUC2l-kWNjHWp_YyhyA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/N9odUC2l-kWNjHWp_YyhyA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/N9odUC2l-kWNjHWp_YyhyA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/N9odUC2l-kWNjHWp_YyhyA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/N9odUC2l-kWNjHWp_YyhyA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Zhi Hao Y.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Zhi Hao Y.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=k4B4gZFiZscBR9yFFUsc6Q', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 2, 'photoCount': 180, 'reviewCount': 178, 'eliteYear': None}
text: A great place to get away from the fast pace of working life. Located near to robertson quay , this restaurant is pretty well hidden and offers customers a serene ambience to laze the afternoon.<br><br>This would be an ideal place for you to chill and read a book, there&#39;s indoor and outdoor and there is a couch area indoor where you can read and dine. The shop also offers a great variety of books and magazines.<br><br>I would recommend to have a set of egg benedict at the couch section, with a book to read through the afternoon, it would simply be sensational and mind refreshing.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=BcsJIPPBET8lJLQXR20t9w', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/IMduXJnmyTynXK0SzLIG5Q/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/IMduXJnmyTynXK0SzLIG5Q/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/IMduXJnmyTynXK0SzLIG5Q/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/IMduXJnmyTynXK0SzLIG5Q/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/IMduXJnmyTynXK0SzLIG5Q/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/IMduXJnmyTynXK0SzLIG5Q/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Dan B.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Dan B.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=BcsJIPPBET8lJLQXR20t9w', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 7, 'eliteYear': None}
text: I give it 2 stars for the free wifi and ambience but the service and food terrible. Took nearly an hour to get my brunch, staff running through the place as so busy. Very understaffed. My &#34;extras&#34; were a joke eg tomato was a single thin slice of uncooked tomato. Poached eggs overlooked and coffee good flavour but served cold, probably because they are too busy again. Use it for the wifi but avoid for anything else.expect a LONG wait.

Full marks for ambience, passing marks for menu, and brownie points for cheap wine. Spent quite a bit of time here one evening, and depending on the CD on repeat of the day, you can get crazies singing to Lady Gaga. Over and over again. Tres annoying. <br><br>There are the studious types hunched over their laptops on the sofa, and the serious dinner crowd that prefers to sit at the proper tables. I was rather pleased with their $40 bottle of house white that was surprisingly drinkable. Would return just for this. Forget everything else edible. It&#39;s just that - forgettable. You&#39;d be better off throwing a rock anywhere along Robertson Quay and scoring better food.

Book Cafe has always been one of my favorite places to hunker down with a book or a magazine with a cuppa, away from the madding crowd. I love that they are also one of the few places which serve breakfast all day.<br><br>Food : Have been for brunch, dinner as well as late night coffee on different occasions, and have never once been disappointed. Have tried the pancakes and the fry up which consisted of hash brown, sausages, bacon, toast and eggs for brunch, cod and sandwiches for dinner, and last but not least, hot cocoa with marshmallows, mango smoothies and a variety of desserts i.e, apple pie, lemon and rosemary cake with Greek yogurt as well as pine nut pie (available only on weekends). Comfort cafe fare ... love it all.<br><br>Service : Friendly and pleasant.<br><br>Ambience : Laidback and cosy. Relaxing music. Love the sofas.<br><br>Remains one of my favorite haunts.
Had a nice salad here &amp; glass of wine. Very chill, free wi-fi, and friendly staff. What&#39;s not to like?

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=7tascuXyr41Yj0la1t1EWQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Don W.', 'displayLocation': 'Rockville, MD', 'altText': 'Don W.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=7tascuXyr41Yj0la1t1EWQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 2, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Hey. Lost in Singapore and looking for something a little bit &#34;western &#34; but not too much. The best grilled chicken sandwich I&#39;ve had in years!!  Great ambiance and great wi-fi connection. Life is good. This place is great!!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=-G1YjYxjDpxOBzFgo36ORA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'T J.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'T J.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=-G1YjYxjDpxOBzFgo36ORA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 24, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Another great standby - consistently great service, personable atmosphere, great food and a place to read or chill out.

Hands down best cafe to work/study in the Tanjong Pagar area. Located in the lobby of a gorgeous Carlton City Hotel but never super noisy, this Cafe offers reasonably priced selection of drinks and food with easily the friendliest staff you&#39;ll ever meet along with free wifi and access to power plugs.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=lytiElrBsItb1NU5RTXaIg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'N T.', 'displayLocation': 'Serangoon, Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'N T.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=lytiElrBsItb1NU5RTXaIg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 2, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Little gem of a coffee stop with people who are genuinely interested in flavour and how to get interesting, tasty coffee. Rashyd roasts weekly and is open and responsive to feedback. All the baristi are warm and hospitable. Make sure to bring cash to &#39;tip&#39; a reasonable amount for your drink so that they can keep up their little operation bringing good coffee to an area suspiciously devoid of high quality specialty coffee!

I have been working out of office for two days straight now to get some quiet time to plan and reflect. Yahava is one top of my list forcomfortable place to sit and do some  work while sipping great coffee. No other coffee place can beat them for the taste and price. Try anything on the list- I&#39;m pretty sure that it will be great. They also supply beans to several others places so you can even buy some of the beans back home. <br><br>The food/dessert offerings are alright. However, with Awfully Chocolate, Ice Cream Chef, and the hawker centre a stone throw away, I would prefer to just order coffee here. <br><br>Since It&#39;s not easy to come here, the place doesn&#39;t get too crowded on most days. They don&#39;t offer free wifi or charging point (that I know of), so come with a fully charged laptop. Alternatively, just sit back, sip on the great coffee and read a book.

text: Settled in an industrial estate right behind around my neighbourhood is this speciality coffee shop. My friends said they tried their coffee in Perth and loved it. I wish there was more food selection but a scone $4 nicely heated up served up as a delicious breakfast with a fragrant cup of coffee!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/ez3tovk6wU-Qd6sIpttj5g/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/yahava-koffeeworks-singapore?reviewid=VL-_J_i6OTzH7e5ZpgWJ2g&select=ez3tovk6wU-Qd6sIpttj5g', 'altText': 'Photo of Yahava KoffeeWorks - Singapore, Singapore. Banana bread and flat white', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Banana bread and flat white'}]
text: Read about this place on a cafe hunter&#39;s blog and hence I sought it out.<br><br>The only cafe I had visited that listed the controversial Flat White right at the top of its coffee offering!!!! The coffee was really really good, in the sense that I did not noticed I had finished off my cup so quickly without realizing it! I was alone. The rain outside just started. Either the cup was smaller than my usual or that the coffee was indeed too good for me to notice my greedy gulps (I swear I thought I was sipping :(). My cuppa break was accompanied by a slice of banana bread, which was tasty and delightfully moist despite its look.<br><br>Alas the service staff were too zoned out to make me feel embraced. The place was relatively big but emotionless.

text: Nice hidden quiet coffee place with stellar coffee! This place which can be a little out of the way, but that&#39;s what makes it a nice place to chill. <br><br>Excellent cappuccino and other regular coffees for a reasonable price with no fancy gimmicks. Would reccomend the chai latte($5/5.50/6)-literally the best I&#39;ve tasted! Nothing like Starbucks/Coffee bean/Cedele. You&#39;ve never tasted chai till you taste this, really. A great place to hang out with family on weekends/weekday afternoons :)

Full stars for my favourite coffee place in Singapore. This is a place which you go strictly for the coffee. I am not vouching for the food which happens to be limited in variety. My favourite beans include X-rated (or was it triple X?), Dark Gold and Romeo. <br><br>Give me a skinny flat white please!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/ARYVOVXCD8_zWCk5_FsP2A/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/yahava-koffeeworks-singapore?reviewid=jiGVfC6rBiUBUH6F2F7qQA&select=ARYVOVXCD8_zWCk5_FsP2A', 'altText': 'Photo of Yahava KoffeeWorks - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: My usual coffee place. Since I work near Yahava, for the past 3 years, my daily dosage and beans all coming from them. While they have 8-10 beans that are always available, Yahava will bring in exotic beans once a month. A side note, it is affliated with the Yahava in Australia. Highly recommended for people who stay in the north-central area of Singapore to give Yahava a visit. Of course, if you are a coffee lover.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/c0UsdMu--jZ4lSAFjq3iyA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/yahava-koffeeworks-singapore?reviewid=yVe8GGtwV8dQyzWCzACv_w&select=c0UsdMu--jZ4lSAFjq3iyA', 'altText': 'Photo of Yahava KoffeeWorks - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: For those coffee lovers this is a must try as they serve excellent coffee made from beans that they got from Bali. This is not your average cafe as from what i heard their aim is actually to distribute the beans to individual folks and companies to promote it and not really to run a cafe business.<br><br>I decided to try the cappuccino as that is what i normally drank elsewhere. It had a nice and strong aroma yet the amount of acidity in that cup was not very high thus not leaving a sour aftertaste which i hate. The milk that they added was really nice too and made the coffee all the more yummy to drink, and it left a nice aroma in my mouth after.<br><br>Service there was average but i would definitely go back for more coffee. They do have some decor on the coffee too using the foam they dash on top of it.

Hearts', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Hearts'}]
text: yeeehaaaa! finally a decent koffee place in my hood. ive been here 5 times and let&#39;s just say ive not been disappointed with their koffee. it has the omph factor and perks me up good. only other thing ive tried was their torte choc tart. it was OK, portion was really small for e price, guess that helped me save some calories.<br><br>ambience is cosy with soft lighting and jazzy background music. perfect place to chill out on a weekday arvo if you want peace away from e hustle and bustle from town. its also good for families with two couches setup near a small play area for kids. not a huge play area, all i see is a wooden house with few boxes of lego blocks. enough to keep your little ones busy while ure having a cuppa  :)<br><br>best part for koffee lovers, they have free koffee tasting everyday from 9am - 5pm, selecting from more than 14 varieties. <br><br>*** barista was especially nice today and made me a bearie cute cappuccino. totally made my day. :D im a sucker for koffee art.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=2j8DcYHJ-WZuMmI02decUg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Luke B.', 'displayLocation': 'London, United Kingdom', 'altText': 'Luke B.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=2j8DcYHJ-WZuMmI02decUg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 2, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Visited Yahava Koffee works on a Sunday morning following  along cycle ride. The coffee shop has a very nice feel. I ordered a strong flat white and a waffle with I cream. The flat white was very good, probably one of the best I&#39;ve had in Singapore. The waffle was very well cooked. Key issue for me is the $1 extra charge for a very small amount of Maple syrup. One would expect the maple syrup to be complimentary given waffles aren&#39;t compete without maple syrup

Along the stretch of the Sembawang Hill shophouses, lies this rather hidden cafe in this quiet estate. Being a franchise of the Australian outlet, you can expect the same services you get from there, here. That means, different types of coffee from all around the world and free coffee tasting! <br><br>The Flat White tasted great. It is rather thick and with the right amount of milk added, produces a coffee taste that is not too overwhelming.<br><br>The Carrot Cake is flavourful and slightly crumbly. Soft on the inside, crumbly on the outside.<br><br>For a quiet place to study and relax or talk about work, this place offers the environment to do so (and with its great coffee and cakes!).

This little gem is hidden in my neighbourhood and I didn&#39;t even know till I chanced upon its banner one day. The coffee is very robust in flavour and texture is full bodied. I tried the latte and the mocha. I am floored by the mocha as this one is the real deal. The chocolately, malty flavour of the mocha comes from the coffee not chocolate syrup. On the downside, the place doesn&#39;t serve any hot or cooked food. It serves mainly sweets like muffins, cakes and pies. They have a limited range of sandwiches which are pre-packed.

Very cool old school coffee bean store on Balestier open since 1959 (since 1960 in current location).  They actually have a very cool website, but everything else is old school, from the way they will pack up the beans to how the old couple will wrote down your purchases for inventory in a notebook.  As the other review noted, the owner has two types of beans here: blends for local coffee and single-origin beans.  I purchased 250g of Guatemala beans for half the price of other places (only $10 SGD!), and the quality is much better than places like SBUX.  I don&#39;t know why I didn&#39;t come here earlier, as I drink a lot of coffee at home.  Will also have to try some of the other  single origin beans from South America, Africa and Asia as well, and perhaps one day, I might even try to learn how to make a proper kopi as well :).

Coffee.  Not for here.  You buy beans and take them away.  He&#39;s got two types here: the local roasts and the non-local roasts.  For the local stuff, it&#39;s the over roasted with sugar and butter that makes the coffee, well, require condensed milk and evaporated powder.  For the non-local stuff, he&#39;s got some pretty interesting single-origin stuff and it&#39;s pretty fresh by look and smell.  And he knows his stuff...he was so happy to talk coffee and the differences between beans and roasts.  I told him he should go sell to the snazzy Wheeler&#39;s Yard around the block.  He chuckled.  So I picked up some Guatemalan beans (which he ran through his mill for me because my apartment doesn&#39;t have a grinder) and it&#39;s fantastic.  He&#39;ll probably hold the spot of my favorite coffee bean purveyor.

Love this place for getting some work done! There&#39;s an array of seating from stools to couches to tables with pillows. There&#39;s also outlets by some of the couches to give you enough juice to keep going for hours. The wifi was no fuss (no re-logging in and very speedy). <br><br>Amazing coffee, including the drip coffee. I tried the Indonesian drip, which had a slightly more bitter flavor and tinge of sour. Lattes and signature coffees can be pretty pricey at S$7-9, but the drip is affordable at S$3.20.<br><br>Gets busy around lunch hour around 11-2pm, but quiets down during the mid-afternoon. Highly recommend for a place to chat with others, chill on your own, or hunker down and get some work done.
