text: Locals favorite and tourist alike. It is situated in the middle of Financial district. So expect heavy foot traffic. It is an upgrade from Whampoa Market or Ballestier Market from ambiance to food quality and selection. It gets pack however crowd will come and go like clockwork so as the kitchen. It is close to Chinatown (10min walk)  and Marina Bay Sands area(15min walk). A must place to visit in Singaporr bucket list.
if you are a tourist , try different shops. if you are unlucky you wont get your money worth.

We came to Lau Pa Sat on a Sunday late morning, but many of the stalls lining the streets weren&#39;t open yet so my review will be a little skewed.  However, the food that we had and the service provided was on point.  Lau Pa Sat is located in the CBD of Singapore and by all accounts full to the brim during weekday lunch hours.  It&#39;s located inside what was an old church building and from what I&#39;ve read the building served numerous other purposes.  There was a level of uniqueness to the space that wasn&#39;t present at the Maxwell Hawker center.  However, with the improved interior design comes a price and the overall cost was a few dollars more, but let&#39;s be honest here...we&#39;re talking a dollar or two difference for a four course meal and we&#39;re talking $4 to $5 dollars per dish at the max.  That&#39;s not a bad deal.  This is a much cleaner space as well with more seating than expected.  The restrooms were located on the street side and were well kept.  Overall, it was a good experience for what we had.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=X2uF3C3YBD24xcgKA104Sw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/-m8beeWbNcN0BUcsi8mEnQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/-m8beeWbNcN0BUcsi8mEnQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/-m8beeWbNcN0BUcsi8mEnQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/-m8beeWbNcN0BUcsi8mEnQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/-m8beeWbNcN0BUcsi8mEnQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/-m8beeWbNcN0BUcsi8mEnQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Catriona C.', 'displayLocation': 'Penicuik, United Kingdom', 'altText': 'Catriona C.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=X2uF3C3YBD24xcgKA104Sw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 158, 'photoCount': 81, 'reviewCount': 783, 'eliteYear': None}
text: One of the best recommendations about visiting Singapore is to check out the food markets, or hawker markets for some cheap (reasonably priced) food, local styling, but you know, for tourists such as Lau Pa Sat (Telok Ayer). One thing to warn you though, if you are not good at making a decision, these places may not be for you, as it pretty much has everything under one roof. <br><br>The SR opted to check out one of Singapore&#39;s finest, chicken rice, while I went in search for vegetarian food, and ended up with kimchee rice (without the chicken that was supposed to lurk in it). My rice was served sizzling away, was delicious and went down without a second thought. The SR was less impressed with his chicken rice, but I guess, that&#39;s the chance you take when picking from the horn of plenty. <br><br>A worthy mention is the drinks counter, separate from the food counters, where you can purchase fresh fruit juice, so fresh it&#39;s prepared right in front of you. For a European, that&#39;s just some kind of awesome. A definite must-visit in SG.

Street food is easily one of the best things Singapore can offer and Lau Pa Sat is a travelers must have for a true Singapore dining experience. <br><br>It&#39;s very easy. Follow the guide:<br>1 - Go to the Satay street<br>2 - Take a seat in the most crowed section<br>3 - Order your satays (I really love the prawn ones)<br>4 - Order your sides (no recommendations here)<br>5 - Buy some tissues as you&#39;ll eat with your hands (believe me you will need them)<br>6 - Order Tiger beer to the ladies in yellow and blue<br>7 - enjoy your meal !<br><br>Oh yes, it&#39;s also an architectural gem worth a visit even if you&#39;re not hungry.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=C7KRfB4PvY601xBOjUV7ng', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Christine K.', 'displayLocation': 'Alpharetta, GA', 'altText': 'Christine K.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=C7KRfB4PvY601xBOjUV7ng', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 3, 'photoCount': 819, 'reviewCount': 95, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Awesome place for delicious and a huge variety of food. Specially in the evening very crowded and the back street full of roasting satay stands that you can smell from a distance. You just don&#39;t know what to order because everything is prepared fresh and looks and smells delicious. Everytime I visit Singapore this is a must go place!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/gLJLTxY8DqsvECrHvozaFw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/lau-pa-sat-singapore-2?reviewid=95AL7hJ61MCypuEfr2AKhA&select=gLJLTxY8DqsvECrHvozaFw', 'altText': 'Photo of Lau Pa Sat - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: I was hungry for Satay so my friends and I headed to Stall 8 at Lau Pa Sat.   Honestly, I was disappointed.  It&#39;s not as good as it used to be.   They&#39;ve added prawns to the menu and frankly I could have done without them.  The beef, mutton and pork sticks were cooked well and the condiments of cucumber and onion were sparce.  Like many things in Singapore, they are cheap with the ingredients.  We also didn&#39;t get enough peanut sauce for all the satay we ordered.  And since they already had our money the stall owners didn&#39;t care.   Which means we won&#39;t go back to their stall again.   Bad service had penalties.

Loved it!!!  Best satay ever and so many places to choose from. As soon as you get in you are bombarded by various vendors with their menus. There was so many different selection of food. I could come here for a few weeks and try something different. Unfortunately we had the one night. The place is very clean and in an amazing building.  Definitely one of the places to visit when in Singapore.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/_QEVW4Ol_FFZ83rRjEVZmw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/lau-pa-sat-singapore-2?reviewid=_VagiUxu0THpHNii9W0rXw&select=_QEVW4Ol_FFZ83rRjEVZmw', 'altText': 'Photo of Lau Pa Sat - Singapore, Singapore. Satay chicken and Tiger beer at night hawker market', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Satay chicken and Tiger beer at night hawker market'}]
text: Fight off the touters as you enter the satay-arena and make a beeline for Satay 6-7 <br><br>Good value to be had in the combo 6 x prawn/10 x chicken/10 x beef satay @ $S24 and washed down with a jug of Tiger draft beer @ $S19<br><br>If still hungry  go the spicy fried rice @ $s4 or Banana Murtabak @ $S8

This is the best place to savor all of South East Asian Cuisine. A wide variety of choices of fresh food. I had Satay Chicken with some fresh Peanut Sauce. Washed it down with a pitcher of Tiger Beer!

Lots of choices here, it&#39;s clean, I enjoyed pad thai at one of the booths and prices are not bad. There are fans inside, but can still get a little warm. Make sure to bring your own napkins. However, this place was a little touristy, so if you are looking for somewhere more for the &#34;locals&#34; and authentic food, then I recommend the second floor of a building on Smith Street in Chinatown. It has many many options and excellent food.

I visited my friend who is from Singapore, and Lau Pa Sat was on her list of food courts to take me to. There are a lot of good food courts in Singapore, but this is a particular favorite of mine. It&#39;s not the cleanest or most well organized, but it did feel very authentic to me and not just a gleaming set of stalls like in Takashimaya mall, for instance.<br><br>You can see from the pictures here on TripAdvisor that it&#39;s a big pavilion filled with local people. It&#39;s kind of amazing that such an old, classic food court stood the test of time even thought it&#39;s surrounded by huge skyscrapers. It&#39;s still around, and for good reason!<br><br>There are myriad food choices at Lau Pa Sat and I definitely would recommend a visit to this foodcourt both for his charm and simplicity. It&#39;s food at a low cost in a local setting that isn&#39;t typical &#34;moneyed&#34; Singapore.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/atcpXo777hn4I3wQ44bn0w/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/lau-pa-sat-singapore-2?reviewid=CMXf_kpcoGf4jZdGjpzFMQ&select=atcpXo777hn4I3wQ44bn0w', 'altText': 'Photo of Lau Pa Sat - Singapore, Singapore. Laksa I had at traditional food vendor', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Laksa I had at traditional food vendor'}]
text: Amazing place and great prices. I wish I knew the name of the place I went to, but it featured local Singaporean cuisine. It is around the middle of the market. I had the Laksa and for $5 it was delicious. I would definitely come again.

I absolutely LOVE this place! If only I discovered it earlier. This place has a variety of foods ranging from Chinese, Indian, Thai, Korean, and Japanese. There is also a 24-hr dimsum food stand that offers various seafood dishes. They&#39;re egg tart is decent: the filling is soft but the crust is not as crispy or buttery as it looks. The wife cake is also not as good as it looks. <br><br>I ordered a bowl of hot and spicy noodles. The noodles were great, big, and flat. I absolutely loved it. The fish and shrimp were deliciously spicy and fresh. The BEST thing about this entire market is that the food is SO CHEAP. Almost everything can be ordered for under $5 SGD. Cash only. Fast service. Clean eating environment. Love the local atmosphere. There are a lot of local Singaporeans and foreign visitors who come here to eat so it really is quite an interesting environment to eat.<br><br>I ordered a cold dessert (ice jelly cocktail) from one of the dessert stands located in the middle of the market. It was fantastic. Perfect amount of juice, ice, and jelly. Not too sweet and not to watered down. It was the best choice of dessert for the hot and humid weather. If I weren&#39;t so full I would&#39;ve ordered a drink just to try it.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=MgIHAK1Z5PGd81MoQAhRow', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Lit9nHWb_Lsa-9yVzQR1mA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Lit9nHWb_Lsa-9yVzQR1mA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Lit9nHWb_Lsa-9yVzQR1mA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Lit9nHWb_Lsa-9yVzQR1mA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Lit9nHWb_Lsa-9yVzQR1mA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/Lit9nHWb_Lsa-9yVzQR1mA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Francesca C.', 'displayLocation': 'Amsterdam, The Netherlands', 'altText': 'Francesca C.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=MgIHAK1Z5PGd81MoQAhRow', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 299, 'photoCount': 84, 'reviewCount': 219, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Admittedly more pricey than other hawker centers, Lau Pa Sat has a great selection of pan-asian selection. <br><br>Its new and shiny. But my goodness its hot; no fans and tightly sat crowds. The building itself is beautiful.<br><br>Get pho. Make it spicy. Sweat. Assimilate. Boom.

Lau Pa Sat is supposedly a 24hr hawker center, but I once came here around 2AM looking for satay (late flight into SG, and was starving), and the place was an absolute ghost town.  So disappointing!<br><br>It&#39;s better during the day when all of the stalls are open, but in my opinion, nothing worth going out of your way for, especially if in town for a few days.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=gMvTe2Vm4-l79jH3apmbog', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2b3vsH8D0b-6GRxeR1AK_g/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2b3vsH8D0b-6GRxeR1AK_g/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2b3vsH8D0b-6GRxeR1AK_g/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2b3vsH8D0b-6GRxeR1AK_g/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2b3vsH8D0b-6GRxeR1AK_g/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2b3vsH8D0b-6GRxeR1AK_g/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Jay R.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'altText': 'Jay R.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=gMvTe2Vm4-l79jH3apmbog', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 223, 'photoCount': 69, 'reviewCount': 398, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Lau Pa Sat is a great hawker center, but Singapore has so many better options that I always feel a bit underwhelmed by coming here. I always recommend going to the stalls that have a long line and skipping the ones that are actively trying to get you to eat there. If their food was that good, then they wouldn&#39;t have to sell you on it :)

text: many different choices chinese japanese malaysian indian korean thai vietnamese etc. can always look for rated stalls as well as long queue to know which ones are good. char kway teow ok

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=OilpEvC9-SYrTwLy2IAfUw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/4dVBg_eEjsUCKhhz1ESEaQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Ling C.', 'displayLocation': '天后, Hong Kong', 'altText': 'Ling C.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=OilpEvC9-SYrTwLy2IAfUw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 3, 'photoCount': 52, 'reviewCount': 71, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Came here 5 years ago and was unimpressed, and upon my return also found it underwhelming. We came just before the lunch crowd and found that the selection and quality was a far cry from the other hawker centres that we went to. And it also seemed to lack some authenticity to the dishes - felt like it was a tourist haunt, tourist prices and dishes catered to the tourist palate. If you&#39;re looking for satays, they aren&#39;t served at lunch time. I&#39;m surprised by all the high ratings for this place, I think you would fare better at a food court than here. Maybe it&#39;s the post drinking measuring stick?

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/9RK1Fk4q6EDEbAFZUQzjvg/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/lau-pa-sat-singapore-2?reviewid=TXgOh0tHCJ_I6e6uTvwV_w&select=9RK1Fk4q6EDEbAFZUQzjvg', 'altText': 'Photo of Lau Pa Sat - Singapore, Singapore. char kway teow', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'char kway teow'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/p1WU5Td61bp8fNZPfRW4Ow/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/lau-pa-sat-singapore-2?reviewid=TXgOh0tHCJ_I6e6uTvwV_w&select=p1WU5Td61bp8fNZPfRW4Ow', 'altText': 'Photo of Lau Pa Sat - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': ''}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/S9omuhHswxQ4KZRjeL8-KQ/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/lau-pa-sat-singapore-2?reviewid=TXgOh0tHCJ_I6e6uTvwV_w&select=S9omuhHswxQ4KZRjeL8-KQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Lau Pa Sat - Singapore, Singapore. inside', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'inside'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/PxBN6eRrQyNJcOG6wP8xvg/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/lau-pa-sat-singapore-2?reviewid=TXgOh0tHCJ_I6e6uTvwV_w&select=PxBN6eRrQyNJcOG6wP8xvg', 'altText': 'Photo of Lau Pa Sat - Singapore, Singapore. inside', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'inside'}]
text: The most famous hawker centre in Singapore. I was told by my friend that Singaporean government cleaned up the streets from street vendors and placed all the street food in the hawker centres, Lau pa sat being the tourist trap as the representation of hawker centres for tourists.<br><br>Boasting of being opened 24 hours, the octagonal giant building is filled with various food vendors that serve more international food than actually local foods. It&#39;s also not the 24h that people tend to think. Sure, the building is opened for you to walk in 24 hours, but there are no rules as to which vendors are opened and which ones are closed. I had wanted to come here at noon, but a tour guide told me to go in the evening because nothing is opened until dinner. | went in the late afternoon on a sunday, just before dinner time with a coworker and only a few vendors were opened for business. Apparently, as Jennifer K from the first review had said, this place also does not have much in the wee hours of past midnight. <br><br>The food? Although I only bought the char kway teow from one of the vendors here, I was not impressed and I was told by fellow singaporeans that the food here actually really isn&#39;t all that great. There are many other local hawker centres that are better representations of local singaporean food.<br><br>So, in summary, some tips<br>- come during dinner time, between 7pm and 12am<br>- be prepared for crowd but not be wow&#39;ed by the food<br><br>Come here if you don&#39;t have a lot of time in Singapore and want to check out at least one hawker centre.

The renovation&#39;s to this one are quite appealing, and I could easily spend an afternoon munching my way from stall to stall. I know everyone raves about the satay in this place, but my heat still rest with the little guy serving up roasted pig&#39;s feet and pig organ soup, clearly one of the best meals that I&#39;ve had in Singapore.

text: Great place to enjoy a variety of Asian dishes in a food court type of atmosphere. Pick what you want from a huge selection of food stalls. During lunch time on weekdays it gets very packed and it might be difficult to find a table.

text: Beautiful Victorian ironwork lace building housing dozens of food vendors.  Aesthetically, perhaps my favorite Hawker Center.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/YO7QxzJaVpHCs5H9Gb_P9w/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/lau-pa-sat-singapore-2?reviewid=i51pT8hqLQNBgSqtWVrwJA&select=YO7QxzJaVpHCs5H9Gb_P9w', 'altText': 'Photo of Lau Pa Sat - Singapore, Singapore. very mediocre western food', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'very mediocre western food'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/bIximHtSFjDgPtsw2Cfphg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/lau-pa-sat-singapore-2?reviewid=i51pT8hqLQNBgSqtWVrwJA&select=bIximHtSFjDgPtsw2Cfphg', 'altText': 'Photo of Lau Pa Sat - Singapore, Singapore. the newly-updated interior', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'the newly-updated interior'}]
text: it&#39;s refurbished and very pretty - but it&#39;s now pretty much officially a tourist trap. and by that, I mean the food is bad, the food is expensive, service is pretty much non-existent, though I suppose at least it&#39;s clean and gorgeous.<br><br>I&#39;m not impressed, at all.<br><br>at the top of my list of why-I&#39;m-so-irritated-with-this-place (besides the mediocre food):<br><br>no table numbers. that means everything is self-service, and you can&#39;t order at hawkers that offer to bring the food, since you can&#39;t describe how to get it delivered to you.<br>little variety. the hawker centre stores are all tenanted out, sure - but the apparent choice doesn&#39;t translate to any real choice at all (they mostly sell the same things, and it doesn&#39;t look very good either).<br>expensive. I already expected this, but the (lack of) quality made this really annoying.<br> <br>enough said, I&#39;d think. I suggest paying more and hitting up a restaurant, or going to chomp chomp if you must have some local hawker.

I&#39;ve tried a few vendors at Lau Pa Sat, and it has all just been OK. You can&#39;t really go wrong with fish ball soup if you&#39;re looking for something light. Besides that, there hasn&#39;t been any vendor that particularly stick out at me. Considering everything here is relatively cheap, I guess the best bet is to look at where there is the longest line, crowdsourcing on the spot will be your best bet in finding some good food.<br><br>There a tons of noodle stalls, and a few Korean and Japanese foods, there&#39;s also Hong Kong food, Malaysian, Indian, Vietnamese etc. Basically you&#39;ll find any Asian food you wish here--pretty representative of all of Singapore. However, most of the dishes offered are carb-heavy and it was very difficult to find a vegetable-based meal. If noodles and rice are your thing, come here.<br><br>The environment is interesting in that it is a octagonal, cast-iron structure with tons of seating area scattered around. It&#39;s super packed during the lunch hours when all the Financial Center workers come out here for a quick lunch. <br><br>I personally thought the Maxwell Hawker Food Court was a bit better food quality and more manageable than this one (it&#39;s much smaller, and newly renovated). But if you&#39;re looking for a huge selection and you&#39;re in the area anyways, it&#39;s worth checking out.

I can&#39;t even tell you how delicious this Laksa was. My Malaysian friend made me promise to get some malay food and so we stopped in specifically to try some. The Laksa was so good I don&#39;t ever need to eat another thing in my life. I&#39;m going to have to find a recipe when we get home.

text: Lau Pa Sat has long been the haunt of weary office workers zipping in for a quick lunch,  or chilling out with an icy sugarcane after work. As egalitarian as it gets,  with suited bankers sitting cheek by jowl with t-shirt clad locals and rowdy tourists. Since it&#39;s been renovated,  the prices are higher on average compared to hawker centres in other parts of Singapore,  but the satay (grilled chicken, beef, seafood) on skewers,  fried seafood and novelty ethnic cuisine from the Philippines,  Mexico and other places makes it worth a drop in. The French Japanese bakery there is a little misplaced but serves up excellent fresh baked treats.

text: I&#39;m an American and I visited Lau Pa Sat for the first time a few weeks ago. I was in love with this place, I kept coming back. Lau Pa Sat is truely a foodie&#39;s paradise. They offer everything anyone can crave under one roof. Behind this hawker center is a strip designated for satay stalls in the middle of the modern financial district. On the weekend this place is packed with expats, tourists and locals. The expats are beautiful so come to people watch! The food is great. I didn&#39;t eat anything I didn&#39;t like. It may be a little pricey but totally worth it. You have to try the chili crab, butter prawns, morning glory with sambal, satay of all kinds and for some reason, I just love the guava juice at the beverage stall. The people are friendly and the place is clean. <br><br>TIPS:<br>Some of the stalls are open 24 hours. BYON (Bring Your Own Napkin) or purchase wet naps for 3 for $1.

text: Lau Pa Sat is one of the places I can never leave Singapore without visiting. Well known for its satay and hawker type eateries, you can find plenty of traditional local food and it will be hard to choose what to have! This time around I had chicken hor fun, a pork bun (which hubby said was the best he&#39;d ever eaten) and a shark fin dumpling. Loved loved loved my chicken hor fun. <br>We then ventured outside for satay and prawns, and managed to negotiate for only a 5 sticks instead of the minimum 10 since we were already full from noodles and dumplings. It was the first time hubby had been and he loved the atmosphere there, and enjoyed the food there more so than the food courts we&#39;d been to on touristy Orchard Rd.

text: This time tried the store at the end, which is not as good as the one in the middle... I think last time I tried Best Satay which is much better. The oyster omlette I bot inside is good tho.

I absolutely LOVE this place! If only I discovered it earlier. This place has a variety of foods ranging from Chinese, Indian, Thai, Korean, and Japanese. There is also a 24-hr dimsum food stand that offers various seafood dishes. They&#39;re egg tart is decent: the filling is soft but the crust is not as crispy or buttery as it looks. The wife cake is also not as good as it looks. <br><br>I ordered a bowl of hot and spicy noodles. The noodles were great, big, and flat. I absolutely loved it. The fish and shrimp were deliciously spicy and fresh. The BEST thing about this entire market is that the food is SO CHEAP. Almost everything can be ordered for under $5 SGD. Cash only. Fast service. Clean eating environment. Love the local atmosphere. There are a lot of local Singaporeans and foreign visitors who come here to eat so it really is quite an interesting environment to eat.<br><br>I ordered a cold dessert (ice jelly cocktail) from one of the dessert stands located in the middle of the market. It was fantastic. Perfect amount of juice, ice, and jelly. Not too sweet and not to watered down. It was the best choice of dessert for the hot and humid weather. If I weren&#39;t so full I would&#39;ve ordered a drink just to try it.

text: Admittedly more pricey than other hawker centers, Lau Pa Sat has a great selection of pan-asian selection. <br><br>Its new and shiny. But my goodness its hot; no fans and tightly sat crowds. The building itself is beautiful.<br><br>Get pho. Make it spicy. Sweat. Assimilate. Boom.

text: So i read that this is a tourist trap.... i disagree with that. Then again, I&#39;m a tourist so what do I know? From my prespective, its a decent place to eat. Thank god I came here at 1130 am cos it got really packed fast the moment it turned noon. I think its from all the office workers from the nearby offices complex. I had fishball here.. its bouncy so do be careful with eating it :)

text: This is a great place.  Street food, but without the cramped and smelly atmosphere oaf underground food courts. I really loved the Indonesian food, but many other options that did look just as good.<br><br>Beautiful outdoor setting under a historic cast iron roof makes it a nice place to even stay for an extensive evening meal.

text: Lau Pa Sat has long been the haunt of weary office workers zipping in for a quick lunch,  or chilling out with an icy sugarcane after work. As egalitarian as it gets,  with suited bankers sitting cheek by jowl with t-shirt clad locals and rowdy tourists. Since it&#39;s been renovated,  the prices are higher on average compared to hawker centres in other parts of Singapore,  but the satay (grilled chicken, beef, seafood) on skewers,  fried seafood and novelty ethnic cuisine from the Philippines,  Mexico and other places makes it worth a drop in. The French Japanese bakery there is a little misplaced but serves up excellent fresh baked treats.
The refurbished Lau Pat Sat is great. A good place to sit and have beers with friends while having a ton of selection. My favourite might be the black carrot cake, and of course the satay.

Recent renovated and always popular CBD oasis. Good selection of stalls. Nice Indian and Filipino selections and one of the better Kway Teow stalls in town. Nighttime becomes a touristy, but still good, satay Mecca.

I don&#39;t know about many of the vendors here and things may have changed since I last come a long time ago but this place had some really good satay.<br><br>All my rellies live here and this was the place that was suggested for good satay and loving satay, it was a no brainer.<br><br>The place was huge with loads of stalls and seating. Coming a little later at night meant it wasn&#39;t quite as busy and as others have mentioned, there were quite a few stalls closed. Makes sense, they want to go home at a reasonable time too.<br><br>The satay was excellent, such tender meats on sticks with peanut sauce. I miss good satay.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=ph3acFWNkbp7HzrCEsVwiA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/GbO7sWfNXbXWeCeGPfcArw/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/GbO7sWfNXbXWeCeGPfcArw/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/GbO7sWfNXbXWeCeGPfcArw/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/GbO7sWfNXbXWeCeGPfcArw/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/GbO7sWfNXbXWeCeGPfcArw/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/GbO7sWfNXbXWeCeGPfcArw/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Christoff F.', 'displayLocation': 'New York, NY', 'altText': 'Christoff F.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=ph3acFWNkbp7HzrCEsVwiA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 10, 'photoCount': 17, 'reviewCount': 130, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Lau Pa Sat was great before the renovation, now it is an over rated tourist trap or cash raping zone. There are way better hawker cernters in SG.

Cliché, overrated, yet hands down an extremely convenient location in the CBD. For those looking to enjoy Singaporean fare (as well as some less genuine options, like Wendy&#39;s or a kebab stall) Lau Pa Sat does provide a recently renovated spot to sit, eat, drink and be merry. Right behind is satay street, known for its pushy sellers, and overpriced mediocre quality satay sticks. Again, a nice location to enjoy beer, but whatever you do, don&#39;t let yourself be pushed to be ripped off into buying $2 shrimp satay sticks.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=hRMpQlJQDObCpNSJ1qd_fA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/KBdaO8VXLPe1UqSkzRUNgA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/KBdaO8VXLPe1UqSkzRUNgA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/KBdaO8VXLPe1UqSkzRUNgA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/KBdaO8VXLPe1UqSkzRUNgA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/KBdaO8VXLPe1UqSkzRUNgA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/KBdaO8VXLPe1UqSkzRUNgA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Ricky S.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'altText': 'Ricky S.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=hRMpQlJQDObCpNSJ1qd_fA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 77, 'photoCount': 537, 'reviewCount': 393, 'eliteYear': None}
text: The food here generally tends to taste better than your average hawker fare.<br><br>So much so that we&#39;ll brave the crowds and come here for lunch during work when it&#39;s just straight up madness. Good luck trying to find a table. Most times you&#39;ll share with friendly strangers.<br><br>The noodle stall in the middle of Lau Pa Sat is very good. I&#39;d come back just for the noodles there. We had chili crab here too and it&#39;s not as good as what you can get at Long Beach or Jumbo, I should have known better. The satays here are quite good also.<br><br>Took a friend visiting Singapore for the first time to give him the authentic Singaporean food experience. Told him this is the fanciest and most touristy hawker joint in Singapore.

LPS Hawker was one of the first few places I ate at when I first visited SG as a tourist (I know live in SG perm) and I believe the newly renovated LPS still holds that touristy status, which perhaps is why the food is mediocre. Having said that I work across the street and come here still most days for cheap quick grub. The variety is endless and satay street in the evening is fantastic for beer drinkers.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=q_HisOXRiJIvJMq4NTTAHA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/GNikkMTz7ZpsiP2_44goCQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/GNikkMTz7ZpsiP2_44goCQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/GNikkMTz7ZpsiP2_44goCQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/GNikkMTz7ZpsiP2_44goCQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/GNikkMTz7ZpsiP2_44goCQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/GNikkMTz7ZpsiP2_44goCQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Jomar E.', 'displayLocation': 'Tanjong Pagar, Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Jomar E.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=q_HisOXRiJIvJMq4NTTAHA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 16, 'photoCount': 75, 'reviewCount': 62, 'eliteYear': None}
text: If you visit Singapore and want to try some street-food - literally - try the satay in Boon Tat street. The  street (on the front doorstep of the Singapore Exchange) closes from 7PM to 3AM and the satay stales opens up. The merchants will pester you to choose their stalls - my favorite is 3/4 at the Robinson Road end of the street.  Just sit down. The menus and beer lady will arrive promptly and enjoy some great satay.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=690cxERsi3FBEoBOb2MOoQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/ioIcQYFrO-Fiku3KNNn5vg/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/ioIcQYFrO-Fiku3KNNn5vg/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/ioIcQYFrO-Fiku3KNNn5vg/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/ioIcQYFrO-Fiku3KNNn5vg/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/ioIcQYFrO-Fiku3KNNn5vg/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/ioIcQYFrO-Fiku3KNNn5vg/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Ryan M.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Ryan M.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=690cxERsi3FBEoBOb2MOoQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 17, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 10, 'eliteYear': None}
text: This market is great for lunchtime eats, as it has all different fares from Thai to Turkish to Costa Rican, but what it is really famous for is the satay vendors that set up after work hours. All different flavors and varieties of meats and seafood. Only downside is that the vendors have runners that can be a bit pushy to get you to order from their stall, so be prepared to ignore them or just settle and let them find you a seat and take your order for a few extra dollars.

This place have changed a lot over the years. Food are overpriced and didn&#39;t have the same feel it used to. I would rather go to a small food center after this visit. Don&#39;t think I&#39;m coming back!!

I can&#39;t even tell you how delicious this Laksa was. My Malaysian friend made me promise to get some malay food and so we stopped in specifically to try some. The Laksa was so good I don&#39;t ever need to eat another thing in my life. I&#39;m going to have to find a recipe when we get home.

I was a little surprised to find a hawker stand in the middle of the financial district, but I guess that&#39;s one of the things that make Singapore such a cool humble place.  And wow, I wished I could have tried everything there.  It is outdoor eating in the Singapore heat and there are giant fans that help make things a little better, but no, it doesn&#39;t quite make it the most enjoyable dining experience ever.  We arrived a little later, around 3pm so the lunch rush was long past but most places were still brimming with customers, though no place had a particular long wait.  I didn&#39;t know where to begin honestly, they all looked sooo good.  Eventually we just picked a place that had the best pictures and somewhat of a line (that&#39;s usually a good sign no?).  We had the laksa and the beef noodles and both were incredibly good and flavorful.  You can taste the heat from the wok as my something my parents would say...  The food was all served on plastic ware and foam plates, not the best for the environment or if you&#39;re looking for a fancy night out, but it does offer a quick, casual and delicious meal.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=InOoHsNe5XDyIsTK_zEong', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/vLF35Ijf8GInoKq96meWAw/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/vLF35Ijf8GInoKq96meWAw/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/vLF35Ijf8GInoKq96meWAw/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/vLF35Ijf8GInoKq96meWAw/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/vLF35Ijf8GInoKq96meWAw/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/vLF35Ijf8GInoKq96meWAw/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Alice M.', 'displayLocation': 'New York, NY', 'altText': 'Alice M.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=InOoHsNe5XDyIsTK_zEong', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 111, 'photoCount': 175, 'reviewCount': 159, 'eliteYear': None}
text: So i read that this is a tourist trap.... i disagree with that. Then again, I&#39;m a tourist so what do I know? From my prespective, its a decent place to eat. Thank god I came here at 1130 am cos it got really packed fast the moment it turned noon. I think its from all the office workers from the nearby offices complex. I had fishball here.. its bouncy so do be careful with eating it :)

This place is amazing. I give it 5 stars and is always a favorite spot when I&#39;m in Singapore. There are so many hawker stands to choose from, but we always go outside to sit on the open aired beer tables and eat satays. Such a cool experience!  Here you&#39;ll find Malaysian, Chinese, Indian, everything!! And this is why I love Singapore. Such a cool place and the food is never disappointing.

gonzo! temporarily for now, while going under renovations, as my local friend says, it&#39;s about time...yes, an average-to-good hawker centre in CBD area, but was getting old and dirty...<br><br>think the Wendy&#39;s is still open though, thankfully....

The choices here are endless!  It didn&#39;t get as much hype in the tourist guides as Maxwell but the selection here is way better.  Much busier for sure, but more stands to eat from.  It was sort of challenging to get a table but we found some by the street.  I tried an Indonesian stand and the food was good.  Lots of dessert options also.  Many business people eating here for lunch.  If only we had these type of eateries where I lived!  Food courts I&#39;ve been to just don&#39;t compare!!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=yrWJ4YZWvFj_NDOvTRaAqA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2U-WP7qaqtSu9hWW59lBbA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2U-WP7qaqtSu9hWW59lBbA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2U-WP7qaqtSu9hWW59lBbA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2U-WP7qaqtSu9hWW59lBbA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2U-WP7qaqtSu9hWW59lBbA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2U-WP7qaqtSu9hWW59lBbA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Jessie M.', 'displayLocation': 'Los Angeles, CA', 'altText': 'Jessie M.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=yrWJ4YZWvFj_NDOvTRaAqA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 579, 'photoCount': 182, 'reviewCount': 1642, 'eliteYear': None}
text: All I have tried here is the fried carrot cake and pork buns. The carrot cake was awesome and the pork buns were completely standard (which means delicious). The interior is pretty cool, too.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=Adzb5v6YpltZ7HmeOzQARg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Richard Z.', 'displayLocation': 'Elk Grove, CA', 'altText': 'Richard Z.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=Adzb5v6YpltZ7HmeOzQARg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 148, 'photoCount': 501, 'reviewCount': 349, 'eliteYear': None}
text: My top 3 food centers to visit in Singapore. This is more of an international food center in town. Instead of local cuisines, it also includes other ethic food such as Japanese, Korea, and etc. It is certainly cleaner than some of the food center I&#39;ve been to. Love it!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=WuNGBp5u5nZnTOj5ZuMAtQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Allen T.', 'displayLocation': 'Trabuco Canyon, CA', 'altText': 'Allen T.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=WuNGBp5u5nZnTOj5ZuMAtQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 2, 'photoCount': 142, 'reviewCount': 109, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Still good satay on the street. But along with the renovation is a bit of lost old Singapore street food adventure and seemingly much higher prices. The indoor food court seems much more bustling than last year when it seemed to me like a good portion of the vendors had moved out or gone out of business. I&#39;d still call it a must visit Singapore food experience. Just remember that there a few other hawker stand areas you should visit while here.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=IKDi-XHJJ-bCR28yDBZOnA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/dAVehJCHDgi2jVELieQBKQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/dAVehJCHDgi2jVELieQBKQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/dAVehJCHDgi2jVELieQBKQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/dAVehJCHDgi2jVELieQBKQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/dAVehJCHDgi2jVELieQBKQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/dAVehJCHDgi2jVELieQBKQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Angie L.', 'displayLocation': 'New York, NY', 'altText': 'Angie L.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=IKDi-XHJJ-bCR28yDBZOnA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 10, 'photoCount': 9, 'reviewCount': 19, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Seng Kee&#39;s Hokkien Mee and Black/White Carrot cake combo were of a respectable Singaporean standard that we enjoyed. The Rojak from some malay stall was soggy and dismal. Satay from Stall 7&amp;8 put up a good show of flames and quantity, but after tasting, I realize what they were doing was they put out more than they are actually selling so the meat stays on the flame for a longer time then gets served overcooked and tough instead of the tenderness I could have got at any other satay store from some local less-famous hawker. Looking around at the dried satay produced from other stores, guess they all taste good but juiciness and tenderness of meat was lacking. The &#34;Zhi Char&#34; stall with the orange shirts and orange plates did a substandard job that was disappointing because I&#39;ve tasted way better at other tourist traps like east coast, chinatown and newton. The sambal on top of the overcooked stingray was not &#34;cooked-through&#34; long enough so it used alot of flavouring without the depth that comes with cooking sambal longer. I try enough to know. Crispy baby squid was so dry (overcooked) and dismal for the price, we were not sure why we were chewing through after a while.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=AWPy2uveUH8ZLgNF9toO7g', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/0b1qnbFF17L9zXA27gMh6g/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/0b1qnbFF17L9zXA27gMh6g/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/0b1qnbFF17L9zXA27gMh6g/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/0b1qnbFF17L9zXA27gMh6g/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/0b1qnbFF17L9zXA27gMh6g/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/0b1qnbFF17L9zXA27gMh6g/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Nyssa Kristine B.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Nyssa Kristine B.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=AWPy2uveUH8ZLgNF9toO7g', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 1, 'photoCount': 208, 'reviewCount': 200, 'eliteYear': None}
photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/OXRrfGeSM_9hLaybgVBoTA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/o-coffee-club-singapore-4?reviewid=EzZIghdqSo1ZXy1lxdkEsw&select=OXRrfGeSM_9hLaybgVBoTA', 'altText': "Photo of O' Coffee Club - Singapore, Singapore", 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: Orchard is a happening place for a both locals and foreigners alike. So it&#39;s just fitting that there&#39;s a coffee shop that&#39;s open 24 hours to cap off our night out. O&#39; Coffee Club is located perfectly where people are bound to see them without even trying. <br><br>With OCC, I usually go for the drinks and not the food. Well, mainly it&#39;s because I&#39;m quite full already before ending up here so a hot beverage to aid digestion is key. They also have this cozy ambiance-despite being located outdoors-that&#39;s fit for a group to relax and enjoy their cuppa. My friends and I go here after a late night movie because we wanted to veer away from the usual Starbucks or Coffeebean. And we did not regret that move. We did not want to feel that our night out was a cliche.Hence, OCC was there to provide that.<br><br>Aside from their beverages, they have sandwiches that you might enjoy. Like I said, not a big foodie here at OCC, but maybe you are.

An excellent coffee place in the east coast stretch that definitely hits the right spot in terms of density of cafes and bakeries. You will be be spoilt for choice of you come to this &#39;hood and you generally can&#39;t go wrong. Homeground has an excel selection of beans for you to choose from and an appetizing array of pastries to go With your coffee or drink.

This is a much smaller location than Chevron House that&#39;s best people on-the-go. Instead chai, I decided to get a nice refreshing citrus-y iced tea for morning strolls around the MB area. The gal is very pleasant and the shop is quite nice, despite its size. I can definitely see this in folks&#39; regular morning shop rotations for their drink fixes.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/iXD3wqT8xIuju4cfEBSpWA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore?reviewid=KB7Pn0AoZEcrKPyButPePg&select=iXD3wqT8xIuju4cfEBSpWA', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore. thick toast with kaya jam', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'thick toast with kaya jam'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/_znwuOYXM0lALRBQNVUt9Q/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore?reviewid=KB7Pn0AoZEcrKPyButPePg&select=_znwuOYXM0lALRBQNVUt9Q', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: Kaya toast at Toast Box is the best (Yes, I said it! Better than Ya Kun Kaya Toast)! Now, this is how I imagined the true local favorite to be! I enjoyed a thick toast with kaya jam! They cut the toast into 9 sections and provide a little pick, making it very easy to eat your toast. They have a menu with quite a few breakfast and lunch selections! I was able to order just one toast and not any &#34;combo special&#34; scheme.<br><br>At this Toast Box store, the interior looks clean and new! They have indoor and outdoor seating! Don&#39;t let the long line intimidate you. It goes by fast! They give you a little buzzer when your order is ready for pick-up! By the way, did you see that HUGE mound of yellow butter at the counter? O_O haha I forgot to take a picture of that!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/LIVko3bEtmMM0ewSYxfNgw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore?reviewid=FXNBmJCKvZc33UEt8Xcyeg&select=LIVko3bEtmMM0ewSYxfNgw', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore. Top: mee sian; Bottom: ham and cheese sandwich with boiled eggs.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Top: mee sian; Bottom: ham and cheese sandwich with boiled eggs.'}]
text: Great spot for a quick breakfast/brunch. Very clean and the food was delicious. Cost was reasonable for the quality and amount of food we ordered.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=3WgkYQ4MHJApdOVWiwvhuQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/6IckfAmc3NMZgo6BaL89mQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/6IckfAmc3NMZgo6BaL89mQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/6IckfAmc3NMZgo6BaL89mQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/6IckfAmc3NMZgo6BaL89mQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/6IckfAmc3NMZgo6BaL89mQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/6IckfAmc3NMZgo6BaL89mQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Eddie C.', 'displayLocation': 'American Canyon, CA', 'altText': 'Eddie C.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=3WgkYQ4MHJApdOVWiwvhuQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 220, 'photoCount': 51, 'reviewCount': 4, 'eliteYear': None}
text: I love the set meal of the classic kaya butter toast, coffee and soft boiled eggs. But the cashier was giving me his attitude by rolling his eyes. I was telling him what I wanted The toast set and to him I was not fast enough to order the drinks and size that I wanted. That&#39;s really the first time I encountered Singapore bad service. Bitch!

Total breakfast which is thick toast with natural peanut butter, two par boiled eggs and strong coffee!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Total breakfast which is thick toast with natural peanut butter, two par boiled eggs and strong coffee!'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/1esEbIA7kk4b1ig4UrHlSw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore?reviewid=DGv5A5yYzC4v8EyUdcsKFg&select=1esEbIA7kk4b1ig4UrHlSw', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore. Par boiled eggs', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Par boiled eggs'}]
text: Great fresh breakfast and exekkent coffee! I decided to treat myself on my last day in Singapore and glad I did. I got the toast breakfast which consisted of bread with all natural peanut butter, two par boiled eggs (whixh my husband gobbled up), and coffee which gets poured in a theatrical manner. Very strong and great pairings on the breakfast not to mention super clean establishment! Wish we had one in the states

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/apIi4wVUrD6wnwjDG82TWw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore?reviewid=LU1fb234dGpbpXZMyjtQLw&select=apIi4wVUrD6wnwjDG82TWw', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: First time having kaya toast and pineapple butter bun. Kaya toast was delicious. I would skip the pineapple butter bun.

The ambiance was cool and country like. Selections for breakfast were basic toast with different toppings available locally. Also they have different drinks both hot and cold.<br>I had the toast with pork floss and a lemon grass tea. It was ok.

text: There are a few of these in Singapore. The staff is always friendly, the food is a decent portion to get you between meals and the coffee is good. Would recommend!

The Coffee is good (great actually) but the choice for breakfast is limited. Typically two eggs (hard boiled), toast with varied toppings, and coffee. Fine. How hard could it be to make it? Only took about 20 minutes wait for this. By the time we got our toast and eggs, we were done with our coffee and ready to go. The toast was good, with peanut butter, but definitely not worth the 20 min wait. With so many places to eat in Singapore, i would like to next time give my money to a place that isn&#39;t a chain restaurant or cafe, and explore a little more. meh...

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/wqd8Bw7m3jQFpuBT5RMbvQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore?reviewid=eKxDebhe-HIYOGdJO0APeg&select=wqd8Bw7m3jQFpuBT5RMbvQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: With a name like toast box it seems like there is only one thing that obviously needs to be ordered right? Apparently the options are more...where by they have a pretty awsome chicken curry set. Just plain rice and a lovely chicken gravy with chicken wings. Big portion. However i love this place for the toasts. I must warn you though that you should go to this place with a friend or 2. Because consuming too much of the same toast can be a bit overwhelming to the taste buds. My favorite toasts are the butter sugar toast and the French toast. They cut the toasts up in small quadrants making it about 16 squares for a thick toast set. It&#39;s a great breakfast, mid day snack sort of place in my opinion. They even have other local delights like laksa, mee siam and mee rebus.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=22xNbqa0WEnHhQrgQ_CJoQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/JRg7a5g5VSwwLP-CwVa1_Q/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/JRg7a5g5VSwwLP-CwVa1_Q/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/JRg7a5g5VSwwLP-CwVa1_Q/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/JRg7a5g5VSwwLP-CwVa1_Q/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/JRg7a5g5VSwwLP-CwVa1_Q/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/JRg7a5g5VSwwLP-CwVa1_Q/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'LB L.', 'displayLocation': 'Eden Prairie, MN', 'altText': 'LB L.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=22xNbqa0WEnHhQrgQ_CJoQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 66, 'photoCount': 346, 'reviewCount': 154, 'eliteYear': None}
text: I love this place! The kaya toast is unbelievable and should be a must visit location for anyone spending time in Singapore as a tourist. Their coffee is also fantastic with very traditional additions of condensed milk to stay true to the area.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=wiJhecgQfm1wA-Q6vONbFA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'My P.', 'displayLocation': 'Bay Area', 'altText': 'My P.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=wiJhecgQfm1wA-Q6vONbFA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 29, 'photoCount': 6, 'reviewCount': 112, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Great place for a snack - and now kicking myself for not having a kaya toast. I had Laksa and a jelly lime tea. Laksa was delicious and I didn&#39;t expect it to be so tasty here. It had an unusual decor - some modern, some traditional, some country, some eclectic pieces - very interesting vibe. The service was friendly. An employee saw me walking to my table without a straw for my drink and brought it to me before I realized I needed it. <br><br>The coffee drinks were very good. Go here and trust you will have a yummy and reasonably priced meal.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/sgJ1ndxuO7ycgpib96U0ZA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore?reviewid=1Pro0FHD6elSGrIyQFPByw&select=sgJ1ndxuO7ycgpib96U0ZA', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: I love Toast Box! This is a great place to go for a quick snack or even a full meal.<br>They have traditional toast or thick toast which is super yummy. I personally love the thick toast with butter and sugar, washed down with iced tea or barley. <br><br>One of my favorite quick meals here is the mee siam, which is really tasty and a fast meal. If you dont like your drinks too sweet, just tell them and they can make it to your liking. One of my favorite snack spots in singapore, and at a great price too.

Kaya toast was delicious. The butter and sugar thick toast was also good. The only complaint we had was it was extremely buttery. We scraped off 3/4 of the butter and it was still too much butter. The eggs were half boiled and not really our style but we are tourists. The coffee was strong and similar to vietnamese coffee.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/HiofFuXcd6zNyPt5UV9ylw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/my-awesome-cafe-singapore?reviewid=yzkYfisFqiBT-6TWFlYByA&select=HiofFuXcd6zNyPt5UV9ylw', 'altText': 'Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/BgLtsPdzpXHjfZd1dXqhCQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/my-awesome-cafe-singapore?reviewid=yzkYfisFqiBT-6TWFlYByA&select=BgLtsPdzpXHjfZd1dXqhCQ', 'altText': 'Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: This is a really great cafe/ restaurant in Telok AyerThe food here is delicious but kind of pricey. However they do give decently large portion sizes so that makes up for it. I shared the bruschetta board with all three kinds on there. They really loaded on the lox and other toppings. I ordered their watermelon orange juice and while it was nice I probably wouldn&#39;t order it again. The Amoy food center is just around the corner and has the same drink for a fraction of the cost. They do have self serve water which was nice and cool. It really helped to combat the hot weather. My friend ordered the idea bulb which was super cute and really went well with the decor. It was expensive but you can keep the bulb as a souvenir. <br><br>They do have an extensive menu that ranges from bruschetta to protein shakes and a full bar so make sure you take a thorough look at everything. <br><br>The inside looks as if a hoarder decorated it but in a very chic retro way. I loved the clusters of interns and lights hanging from the ceiling. We ended up sharing a long table with another group but it was completely comfortable. The tables were a little too close to each other but they do have storage space underneath each table so that bags don&#39;t block the way. It was really busy here during the lunch rush but after 12:45 it started clearing up.

text: What an adorable cafe/bar. Stumbled upon this while walking about Chinatown. Friendly staff, creative drinks. You get to keep the idea bulb when you order the Drinkable Idea, which has coconut water, some sort of jelly(?) and goji berries. They also first place the drink on top of a light making it super fun! The place is retro and funky and used to be a clinic, of which they&#39;ve kept the original signs in Chinese as the storefront.

text: Excellent cafe in the Telok Ayer area. It&#39;s hard to spot as there is no sign but look for a buddy place with staff wearing awesome TShirts and you will know you have arrived. I&#39;ve had the my awesome salad and sandwich and both are amazing. Also have tried the upside down cake which was delicious too. Will be back to try more stuff.

text: This is one of our favorite lunch places. Great atmosphere, great good. Friendly service. Always busy. We had the awesome sandwich, which is like a tasting platter af smaller sandwiches. Highly recommend. The vegeterian awesome salad was very good. We had the drinkable idea. We are not a huge fan of coconut water but you get to keep the the light bulb. Go here. You won&#39;t be disappointed.

text: This is a great casual bar-cafe/restaurant near the Telok Ayer MRT station.  <br><br>Two friends/coworkers and I stopped by here for an afternoon beer and snack.  Despite a robust food, beverage and dessert menu, the beer selection was limited, and we didn&#39;t try the food.  However, the staff and service were amazingly fun and friendly.  The entire cafe has a positive fun energy.  Perhaps it&#39;s the name, the decorative interior (with the paper mache balloon, antique Chinese herbal medicine cabinets, fun signage, etc), the outdoor seating, or the friendly staff but whatever the magic, My Awesome Cafe is an awesome place to check out.
Laid back spot to chat with friends or just people watch.  You can get a nice ice cream and espresso for $7, which isn&#39;t too bad considering the neighborhood!

text: If your in the CBD looking for some breakfast or brunch it&#39;s well worth the visit. Tasty western/local fare in a quaint setting. Friendly customer service at pretty affordable prices!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/eolc1JW-FjNqQI_JdRJOSQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/my-awesome-cafe-singapore?reviewid=X-2p-AjBCFzZEulxPLS1fA&select=eolc1JW-FjNqQI_JdRJOSQ', 'altText': 'Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. front of the restaurant', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'front of the restaurant'}]
text: The Good:<br>  :: it&#39;s a local business<br>  :: great ambiance. very casual and fun without being obnoxiously, overly trendy. love it that they kept the original outside clinic markings and signage!<br>  :: service is friendly, fast, and efficient<br>  :: lots of seating. i recommend, though, that you sit closest to the street to allow you for some fun people-watching<br>  :: they take multiple forms of payment<br>  :: food is very very delicious and healthy. i can&#39;t recommend the smoked duck breast enough! perfectly done, so tender, and so flavorful. if duck isn&#39;t your thing, they have plenty of other offerings that will satisfy your palette. <br>  :: cannot recommend enough any of their fresh-squeezed juices. the watermelon juice, for example, is extremely refreshing and has no added sugar. my personal favorite!<br><br>The Bad:<br>  :: none<br><br>The Ugly:<br>  :: none<br><br>Would I go back? Most certainly yes! It&#39;s now one of my go-to&#39;s while I&#39;m out here in Singapore. <br><br>This place is IN.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/VRDlGCZxqnhJ-S7WPhDsRQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/my-awesome-cafe-singapore?reviewid=-AKooqqm4XRWq1we2-kRkA&select=VRDlGCZxqnhJ-S7WPhDsRQ', 'altText': 'Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/iIy3a0iTIVsnWaXF0XG-yA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/my-awesome-cafe-singapore?reviewid=-AKooqqm4XRWq1we2-kRkA&select=iIy3a0iTIVsnWaXF0XG-yA', 'altText': 'Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: This cafe is very cool! Food is better than I expected, My Awesome Salad is very impressive, delicious indeed! Beef burger is also good, large portion, full of cheese. Juice is better than coffee. Decor and the service are also nice! Will definitely come back again!

Not so awesome experience for me and my friend. In fact it was awful. Their menu is ridiculously complicated, it&#39;s almost as if you&#39;d have to solve a puzzle to get a meal, but not even a fun one because the food was terrible. My friend got a cold salad instead of the sandwich form he asked for. When he asked the waiter to change it, their suggestion was to put the salad inside some bread and call it a day! My acai icecream tasted like dirt. The beer was ok but I had better. What was worse, when we asked for the manager, he came and didn&#39;t even know what was in the menu. I&#39;m surprised people come here, it&#39;s a hot mess.

text: Nothing beats a good ol&#39; fashion American burger...with the exception of the duck confít burger. Visiting from the US and I had no clue what to choose. The staff was super helpful and easily helped me decide from drink to meal. Glad I made the decision to stop and eat here. Great staff! Great food! Great ambience! Even grabbed a t-shirt and magnet as a souvenir of Singapore

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/eolc1JW-FjNqQI_JdRJOSQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/my-awesome-cafe-singapore?reviewid=X-2p-AjBCFzZEulxPLS1fA&select=eolc1JW-FjNqQI_JdRJOSQ', 'altText': 'Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. front of the restaurant', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'front of the restaurant'}]
text: The Good:<br>  :: it&#39;s a local business<br>  :: great ambiance. very casual and fun without being obnoxiously, overly trendy. love it that they kept the original outside clinic markings and signage!<br>  :: service is friendly, fast, and efficient<br>  :: lots of seating. i recommend, though, that you sit closest to the street to allow you for some fun people-watching<br>  :: they take multiple forms of payment<br>  :: food is very very delicious and healthy. i can&#39;t recommend the smoked duck breast enough! perfectly done, so tender, and so flavorful. if duck isn&#39;t your thing, they have plenty of other offerings that will satisfy your palette. <br>  :: cannot recommend enough any of their fresh-squeezed juices. the watermelon juice, for example, is extremely refreshing and has no added sugar. my personal favorite!<br><br>The Bad:<br>  :: none<br><br>The Ugly:<br>  :: none<br><br>Would I go back? Most certainly yes! It&#39;s now one of my go-to&#39;s while I&#39;m out here in Singapore. <br><br>This place is IN.

text: So many wonderful options on the menu!<br><br>Really enjoyed the salad with avocado, almonds, salmon and capers. Everything is really fresh, healthy and delicious. <br><br>Excited to come back and try something else before I leave Singapore!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/EHPu_50hov6aJh7XfQVXFA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/my-awesome-cafe-singapore?reviewid=iq_DFn66p2dPvbGu4Uvrbg&select=EHPu_50hov6aJh7XfQVXFA', 'altText': 'Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. My Awesome Salad', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'My Awesome Salad'}]
text: I had what was probably the greatest salad ever here. My Awesome Salad is packed with proteins (smoked salmon, chicken, ham) and it comes with half an avocado and a bread with pesto. It was so good because it had everything I love on a salad (meat)! The price would be a bit steep for a salad, but since it has that much meat on it I was willing to pay the price. I went on a Sunday evening and it wasn&#39;t crowded at all and I didn&#39;t feel too awkward because there were other solo diners there besides me. It&#39;s a nice casual spot to get something good to eat.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/51K3lKFCAvmBvYQ9fHM_Eg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/my-awesome-cafe-singapore?reviewid=56FshHFl474PXyTwE_pYKw&select=51K3lKFCAvmBvYQ9fHM_Eg', 'altText': 'Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/_uwze3CJm1mHKW1X3mw6vg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/my-awesome-cafe-singapore?reviewid=56FshHFl474PXyTwE_pYKw&select=_uwze3CJm1mHKW1X3mw6vg', 'altText': 'Photo of My Awesome Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: There are many awesome things to point out, from the excellent customer service to the fresh, delicious dishes. We tried the awesome breakfast, and awesome sandwich, and both were equally yummy and satisfying! Freshly squeezed juices and coffees were also on point! By day it&#39;s a cool cafe inside an old Chinese medical hall, and by night it becomes a chilled bar with reasonably priced drinks (by sgp standards anyway) <br>I see why they have regulars coming back!

The food was 3 out of 5. We went for breakfast and the the options were very limited. Toast with cheese and bacon was tasty. Unfortunately the service was brutal. It wasn&#39;t very busy, maybe 50% full. Took forever to order, they forgot to bring out entire our order and brought the bill before complete meal was brought to us. The server dropped food off at the table and bolted, couldn&#39;t ask her for anything. Such a bummer because it is a cute spot.

text: Atmosphere is pretty cool with a good vibe. I was there after work hours and definitely pretty chill and lots of expats just hanging out.<br><br>Good beer and drink selection and the food was okay and not bad. <br><br>I do appreciate their salads which are a decent size and have a whole half avocado which is pretty good. <br><br>Duck confit roulettes was okay. <br><br>Chicken lasagna was ground chicken and a lot of cheese. Still decent though. <br><br>Service was okay but could&#39;ve been improved since it seemed like the waitress was very frazzled because it was a little busy and didn&#39;t seem very attentive. <br><br>Tip: make reservations if you&#39;re looking for a larger party size <br>Tip 2: you can grab your own water cups

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=q_HisOXRiJIvJMq4NTTAHA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/GNikkMTz7ZpsiP2_44goCQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/GNikkMTz7ZpsiP2_44goCQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/GNikkMTz7ZpsiP2_44goCQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/GNikkMTz7ZpsiP2_44goCQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/GNikkMTz7ZpsiP2_44goCQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/GNikkMTz7ZpsiP2_44goCQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Jomar E.', 'displayLocation': 'Tanjong Pagar, Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Jomar E.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=q_HisOXRiJIvJMq4NTTAHA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 16, 'photoCount': 75, 'reviewCount': 62, 'eliteYear': None}
text: I guess three times is the charm. My two previous visits were two to forget, but the place is outside my front door and one of few in the neighbourhood open on Sundays; out of convenience Ihad to give it one more try. <br><br>Service was prompt and the food was good.  The ambiance is excellent and the popularity of the place,  and the fact that it was in a startup phase,  might have something to do with my previous poor experiences of the place. The proprietor seems to have managed to get a stable and properly trained staff.  I&#39;ll be back again.

Had walked past this place a few times and read about it online but had never had the chance to visit. Actually, my first thought when I heard about this place was &#34;what a corny name for a cafe&#34;. The Chinese name is a literal translation, which doesn&#39;t really help... But maybe they are trying to be ironic in a hipster way that I&#39;ll never understand? <br><br>But corny name aside, the food was good, so I shan&#39;t harp on it.<br><br>We had the My Awesome Salad and the Parma Ham Sandwich (with brie added on). I loved the sandwich, the bread was soft and warm, yet crispy on the sides. They were generous with their ingredients and it was very tasty. Same for the salad, it came with a large serving of smoked salmon, roasted chicken and tuna mayonnaise. My only gripe was that the avocado was a bit raw. We were here after spin class down the road so it was a good thing that their food portions were huge- we were starving! It was a good deal and really unexpected as each dish is only about $15-20 on average.<br><br>Decor is... Interesting. Red paper lanterns galore, high stools made of pipes, desks turned into dining tables. The air conditioning (either that or the very powerful fans) was adequate, but just barely. <br><br>SUMMARY: quirky decor, very good bread, portions are huge for the price ($15-20). Would visit again!

Came here on a Monday night, and this place was bathed in red light, from the red lanterns on top. Felt like I was in a bad Hong Kong movie circa 1980s. <br><br>So, the food. I didn&#39;t have any drinks &#39;cept water here. I had an Awesome vegetarian salad, which wasn&#39;t super awesome in terms of taste, but awesome in terms of size. It was HUGE! On a bed of mesclun greens, was half an avocado, a boiled egg, some grilled eggplant (which they substituted my hated bell peppers out with), tomatoes, and brie cheese. I found the salad impossible to eat alone, and my companion had to help me out. The salad was also bathed in a very oily dressing, which I quickly tired of.<br><br>After my very huge salad, I wanted something sweet, so bread and butter pudding it was. Nothing to shout about, 3/5. <br><br>I did like the ambience here, with the remodelled school desks, retro yet industrial feel, but the red <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Flights.have.got.to&amp;s=794fc9c33c8f27fee3fdd8dd2d298d000e80b2cc6b9797c362f79e28c00cd040" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">lights.have.got.to</a>.stop.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=tcBFf_fucBXrD08s3FqtRg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8aCKFmytYMvDZQxsfS9-eg/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8aCKFmytYMvDZQxsfS9-eg/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8aCKFmytYMvDZQxsfS9-eg/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8aCKFmytYMvDZQxsfS9-eg/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8aCKFmytYMvDZQxsfS9-eg/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/8aCKFmytYMvDZQxsfS9-eg/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Tommy W.', 'displayLocation': 'San Francisco, CA', 'altText': 'Tommy W.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=tcBFf_fucBXrD08s3FqtRg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 50, 'photoCount': 55, 'reviewCount': 36, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Okay, I love the bread here so much I&#39;m writing this review as I chow down.  This place just opened last week and they bake their own bread fresh every day!!  My chicken breast sandwich was as fresh as can be, tasty, and very reasonably priced.<br><br>Besides their soft breads, this place has damn good service.  Just getting one of these two things at a cafe is rare in Singapore, so having both in the same place makes this place truly AWESOME.

The passion of several entrepreneurs, who has worked in various sectors including F&amp;B, advertising, hotels and even in fitness lead to the formation of an industrial-chic cafe called My Awesome Cafe. Most of them, including the owner Franck Hardy, has brought their expertise in working in restaurants, cafés and hotels over (and yes some even worked in Michelin-star restaurants / cafés before!).<br><br>Located below the creative agency Mangham Gaxiola, it occupies the what previously is Chung Hwa Free Clinic and specializes in all-day breakfast, salads, sandwiches, coffees, teas, beers and liquor. They are also the only place in Singapore to sell Mexican Coca-Cola for the long term (read: Coca-Cola with Cane Sugar! The first being Omakase Burger but was only available for a limited time)<br><br>The food menu is rather diverse!<br><br>And the drinks menu! (they have Mexican Coca-Cola here!)<br><br>The Croissant with Scrambled Eggs and Smoked Salmon ($8++) is easily one of the better tasting breakfast food out there. The croissant is filled with strips of cheese and the smoked salmon, which was smoked to the right texture and taste. The scrambled eggs, however, tasted slightly more like an omelette instead but still maintains its moist texture.<br><br>The coffee served here are blends made from Columbian, Brazilian and Sumatran beans. The Latte ($4.50++) is full bodied and maintains the strong taste of the roasting process. Anyone who does not like bitterness may not like this even as the right amount of milk is added into the coffee.<br><br>In overall, this place will surely attract the crowds with their passion and patriotism to the food and service served here. If you are around the CBD / Tanjong Pagar / Telok Ayer area, why not pop by this place? I know I would, and will try the Mexican Coca-Cola the next time round!

I like this place. It definitely has its kinks to be worked out - every single [3] visit something on mine or my friends&#39; orders has been wrong. But when pointed out the issue is always quickly resolved. People make mistakes - it&#39;s all in how you handle them, I say. <br><br>The salads are great for lunch or a light dinner, though on the pricey side ($15++, addt&#39;l $3 for cheese on the My Awesome Salad making it $18++). Still tasty enough for me to order the salad on every visit, I just can&#39;t make this a regular weekly stop for lunch.<br><br>The happy hour specials are good for the CBD in my opinion (somewhere ~$35 for a bottle of wine, if memory serves, and something for beer and bubbly too). <br><br>I wish you didn&#39;t have to queue up by the kitchen in order to pay at the end, as I feel massively in the way of the staff running back and forth with dishes of food which I could knock into. Not sure I can think of a more efficient process given the layout (and it does cut down on the time to pay as there&#39;s no need to flag down a server to get your bill) - just something for the cafe to consider.

The food was 3 out of 5. We went for breakfast and the the options were very limited. Toast with cheese and bacon was tasty. Unfortunately the service was brutal. It wasn&#39;t very busy, maybe 50% full. Took forever to order, they forgot to bring out entire our order and brought the bill before complete meal was brought to us. The server dropped food off at the table and bolted, couldn&#39;t ask her for anything. Such a bummer because it is a cute spot.

text: This place has cool lights and figurines resembling Ultraman. <br><br>That&#39;s about it.  Their sandwiches for lunch are bland, at 13 a pop -- stingy with meat or salmon and are dry. Drinks are overpriced. They price a $5 can of boddington ale from coldstorage at $18. They forgot orders. Same experience as prior reviewer that the proprietor does a good job but the other waiters were a disaster. <br><br>They could do so much better if they improved the food quality, expanded the menu, added better beers and wines to their selection, and dropped their current crop of waiters. <br><br>2 out of 5 for food, 4 out of 5 for atmosphere, 1 for service.

text: Not to sure if it could be considered value for money apart from the cute decor. The food quality is decent but nothing to rave about. Service is good and friendly.

text: Amazing cafe!! The staff was great, super accommodating for a vegan and the frozen acai was delicious
Good lasagna, meatballs and salad. The cheese plate was a big disappointment though. Lots of bread but not much else. Great atmosphere though. Food 3*, atmosphere 5*.

text: Went to My Awesome Cafe with my BFF on our monthly cafe hopping trip. Was abit disappointed by their food and drink selections. The people were really nice though. Made a good recommendation for the food and manage to cater to our request of no breast meat. We ordered My Awesome Salad and My Awesome Sandwich to share. The serving was really huge for 2 ladies!! It was really worth every penny we spent. I really like the interior deco of this cafe. Will be back again if I am in Telok Ayer area to try the desserts.

text: Ordered a croissant + scrambled eggs + ham &amp; cheese.<br>Partner had the same with smoked salmon.<br><br>So bad. Scrambled eggs were so watery that it made the croissant soggy... Will not be returning

A phenomenal Telok Ayer Neighborhood Cafe where the food is fresh, healthy, and excellent.  Frank, the managing owner, is always around to great customers with his warm and sincere demeanor. Places like this are rare and special.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=c1MlVimAp5QjP1GU75zXvA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'C T.', 'displayLocation': 'Houston, TX', 'altText': 'C T.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=c1MlVimAp5QjP1GU75zXvA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': 5, 'reviewCount': 45, 'eliteYear': None}
text: I was on my way to Chinatown and needed food and to escape some pending rain so I stopped in. I thought the food was a little bit expensive, but it was a great lunch. The meal had a very light European feel to it. <br><br>I had the ham sandwich which was served open face on baguette with a piece of very good ham on each slice of bread. The side salad was very nice and the yogurt &amp; granola with pin alp slices seemed odd, but really was a nice side / ending to the meal. I had a great cup of tea as well.<br><br>If I would have realized how close I was to Chinatown, I might have passed this place up for some cheaper fare, but I&#39;m glad that I didn&#39;t.

text: Lovely place at haji lane and they print your picture on your latte it&#39;s super cool. I chose the vanilla flavor and it was super. It&#39;s located in my favorite street in Singapore which is a must visit. <br><br>The coffee shop is cute and small with 2 floors and outdoor seating. The prices are fair and good value for money. I&#39;ll for sure come back with my friends
